Chapter 3: Subclasses.name: 第 3 章：子职
Chapter 3: Subclasses.text:
第2章：

子职

德鲁斯肯瓦尔德 (Druskenvald) 蕴藏着巨大的力量，供那些渴望掌握之人取用。这股力量常与古老、诡秘、不可思议之物息息相关。虽然这个国度中不乏邪恶扭曲的居民，他们借助永夜之力与魔法，施展骇人的阴谋、带来死亡与毁灭，但同样也有许多渴望成为英雄之人，愿意掌握这些力量，守护自己的家园与亲人。然而，在德鲁斯肯瓦尔德所掌握的那些诡异而阴沉的力量面前，道德界线从来都不分明。即使初衷纯粹，也难保不会一步踏入黑暗的深渊。

德鲁斯肯的原住民天生更容易与这些力量产生共鸣，但即便是通过幽幕 (Shroud) 来到此地的外来者，也同样能发现并驾驭这些力量。由此，遍布整个国度乃至生者之地的形形色色之人，都能获取并释放这些令人畏惧的能力。

民俗恐怖子职

该部分介绍了12个核心职业各自的民俗恐怖子职，将相关主题与灵感编织为你自己的民俗恐怖故事主角。你可以在下表中找到这些子职以及相应的简短介绍。

民俗恐怖子职

职业 (Class)子职 (Subclass)描述 (Description)
野蛮人实验道途对躯体进行怪异改造
吟游诗人灵哨学院吹哨召唤幽灵同伴
牧师丰收领域通过丰收循环引导神圣力量
德鲁伊旧途结社具现原始森林之力*(注：原文表格有此项但正文未列出，可能为原文遗漏或由柳艺结社替代)*
德鲁伊柳艺结社通过柳条人偶编织原始魔法
战士陵墓守卫源自墓穴之上的指挥造诣
武僧疫瘴武者用触碰传播致命瘟疫
圣武士惩戒之誓以正义之火焚灭罪恶
游侠噩兆先驱让灾厄猎犬标记敌人
游荡者罪人以不祥骗术扭曲命运
术士猩红术法操纵盟友与敌人的血液与活力
魔契师愚神宗主用混乱的笑声迷惑敌人
魔契师角之王宗主练习施加诅咒与祝福的巫术
法师神秘学者从禁忌知识中汲取力量
法师贤者通过炼金术掌握造物的基本真理

民俗恐怖职业主题

如果你不想在上述子职中选择，也可以利用民俗恐怖的诸多主题为其他子职增添风味，以确保你的角色能够融入歪曲之月 (Crooked Moon) 的背景和故事。以下是将民俗恐怖主题应用于12个核心职业时可以考虑的选项。

民俗恐怖职业主题

职业主题
野蛮人你爆发出的原始怒火，源自幽暗森林中一位古老存在的蛮荒意志
吟游诗人你以民谣吟唱、民舞演绎或传颂乡野传说的方式施展魔法
牧师你供奉的神祇是一位古老而几乎被遗忘的存在，其祭坛深藏于自然圣所之中
德鲁伊你的结社会在荒野最偏远、与世隔绝的角落进行仪式
战士你所修习的战斗风格，源自一个几近灭绝的远古教派
武僧你所掌握的武艺来自一个潜伏于黑暗、行踪神秘的隐秘社团
圣武士你所立下的誓言与遵循的信条，源自古老的民间传说与迷信
游侠你是孤独的游者，能在世界最荒僻野蛮之地独自求生
游荡者你依靠潜行与诡计，为一个神秘而隐秘的教团推进目标
术士你获得魔力的事件无法解释、异乎寻常，令你至今难以释怀
魔契师你通过古老的仪式与献祭，施展你的契约宗主所赐予的魔法
法师你的奥术源自你所发掘的失落与禁忌知识

Barbarian: Path of the Experiment.name: 野蛮人：实验道途
Barbarian: Path of the Experiment.description:
野蛮人：实验道途

以不稳定血清强化身躯

踏上实验道途的野蛮人会以炼金合剂为怒火添薪，任由这些混合物通过铜、钢和玻璃制成的注射器和导管注入他们的身体。这些配方增强了他们引导原始力量的能力，或者说——也许正是因为他们的狂暴——使得他们成为唯一能承受化学物质涌入血管的人。野蛮人可能通过自己的实验创造了这些植入物和血清，也可能曾遭受他人的险恶改造。无论源头如何，这样的实验或许是出于善意，旨在延续野蛮人的生命或提升其力量；也可能仅是一场疯狂的炼金探索。

实验植入物

实验植入物表格提供了你的植入物可以呈现的不同形态的示例。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.ijtCHhP5PBk6laJT]{实验植入物}

Bard: College of Whistles.name: 吟游诗人：灵哨学院
Bard: College of Whistles.description:
吟游诗人：灵哨学院

与任性精魂同游

古老的传说告诫着吹哨的危险性：那空灵缥缈的音调会引来亡魂，使逝者回到生者的世界。灵哨学院的吟游诗人会将这些传说融入自身婉转的曲调，以口哨吹奏出吟游魔法，并召唤精魂协助他们的旅途。这些吟游诗人比大多数同行更偏爱游历四方，他们被旅行所吸引，如同收集破旧衣裳上的补丁一般，四处搜集着故事和亡魂。

漫游观览

漫游观览表为你提供了旅途中曾造访之地的建议，在那里，你邂逅了被你口哨声吸引的各色精魂。你可以直接使用这些示例，或将地点与精魂自由组合，亦或自行创造。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.m5j5GbmGWPfYqJ3C]{漫游观览}

Cleric: Harvest Domain.name: 牧师：丰收领域
Cleric: Harvest Domain.description:
牧师：丰收领域

在丰收循环中播种、生长与收获

丰收领域的神圣力量源自一种循环：始于播种创造，盛于蓬勃丰盈，终于收割肃清，而后再度轮回不息。司掌农耕与作物的神祇可能会专注于丰收循环中的某一阶段，但大多数都会从整个循环中汲取力量。该领域的牧师被自然的循环本质所吸引，经常扮演不同循环的牧者角色。

丰收仪式

丰收仪式表为你提供了基于丰收循环各阶段仪式的灵感。

丰收仪式

播种仪式
把祭品埋在新犁过的田里，比如干玉米壳、死鱼、知更鸟蛋或野兔脚
酿造受祝福的药水，用于饮用或灌溉，以提高作物、牲畜或人类的生育能力
在旅程开始时赠予旅行者一小袋种子，以确保他们顺利抵达目的地
生长仪式
以自然疗法照料病人或伤者，使用纯净水源、沃土、肥灰或果泥敷料以加速恢复
为农作物或牲畜祈福，祈求风调雨顺，使作物茁壮、牲畜繁盛
主持婚礼，以编织的谷杆或亚麻绳将新婚夫妇系结在一起
收割仪式
举行葬礼，将逝者的遗体或骨灰归葬田野，混入其家乡的泥土和腐烂的作物以肥沃土壤
在战斗前或收获前，打磨经由丰收之神祝福的刀刃，以确保所有收获皆归献于神圣
屠宰成年牲畜或收割成熟作物，以庆祝大自然的恩赐

Druid: Circle of the Old Ways.name: 德鲁伊：旧途结社
Druid: Circle of the Old Ways.description:
德鲁伊：旧途结社

与古老森林合而为一

偏爱幽暗森林核心地带的旧途结社德鲁伊，与潜藏其中的古老、被遗忘的存在交流，唤起真正的原始力量，以守护最古老、最蛮荒之地。

他们驾驭着长老木的力量，那些树木是早已逝去的妖精灵魂的家园，在被召唤时，会分享其原始的智慧与力量。

旧途圣地

旧途圣地表提供了示例，你可以从中选择或用作灵感，来创造那些充满旧途气息的地方，你的结社可能会在那里聚集，或与原始力量进行交流。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.utB0i9RV5ZYGIPfz]{旧途圣地}

Druid: Circle of Wicker.name: 德鲁伊：柳艺结社
Druid: Circle of Wicker.description:
德鲁伊：柳艺结社

编织祭献与守护的草偶

柳艺结社的的德鲁伊们深谙古老技艺，他们编织树枝人偶和塑像，将魔法束缚进这些粗糙的形体中。这些制品通常形似动物、符文图案、自然符号或人类。护佑符咒和针对入侵者的惩戒誓言，是这些德鲁伊的看家本领。你能将大地魔法编织进你的柳条造物中，将其化作赐予友军的恩惠和降临敌人的灾祸。

柳条塑像

你所编织的塑像、护符与符咒可呈现多种形态，每种都意在达成仪式效果。柳条塑像表为你的柳条符咒外观提供了灵感。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.hXq4v7SwMurU43DK]{柳条塑像}

Fighter: Barrow Guard.name: 战士：陵墓守卫
Fighter: Barrow Guard.description:
战士：陵墓守卫

驾驭幽冥之力

陵墓守卫是驾驭死者力量的战士，他们承载着通常为生者所禁忌的亡者能量。一些陵墓守卫是死而复生之人，这或是通过魔法奇迹，又或是源于神明的反复无常。另一些则矗立在神圣墓穴的入口，随时准备击退任何妄图亵渎亡者之人。无论其起源如何，这些坚忍的哨兵皆不关心生者事务。他们是异于常人的超然存在，恪守着墓穴守护者的职责，确保亡者——无论生前是英雄还是恶棍——皆能安息。

Monk: Way of the Pestilent Haze.name: 武僧：疫瘴武者
Monk: Way of the Pestilent Haze.description:
武僧：疫瘴武者

用触碰传播致命瘟疫

疫瘴武者将瘟疫引入自身，与之共融，使疾病成为自我的一部分。秉承此道的武僧四处游历，时常伴随甚至先于疫病浪潮而行。一些武僧行事谨慎，所触碰之处皆有分寸，只在人口稠密且必须扑杀之地释放疫病。另一些则沉浸于毒瘴，尽其所能地迅速扩散。

疫病症状

你的毒瘴疫病是一种独特的魔法疫病，你可以通过与疫病的深度联系，将其塑造成多种形态。疫病症状表提供了你的标志性疾病在传播时可能呈现的魔法形态及其典型症状的建议。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.K5H2Pz6iIt9zxFv9]{疫病症状}

Paladin: Oath of Castigation.name: 圣武士：惩戒之誓
Paladin: Oath of Castigation.description:
圣武士：惩戒之誓

寻觅邪恶，焚为灰烬

邪恶与罪孽虽然广布久存，却也并非无穷无尽。立下惩戒之誓的圣武士，将邪恶连根拔起，彻底焚尽，只为照亮一切无辜与良善。无论是受凡人法律、所侍神明还是自身信条的约束，他们都会无情追寻邪恶滋生之所。立下这一誓言的圣武士知道，邪恶一旦燃起便无所遁形。

邪恶宿敌

邪恶宿敌表提供了你过去曾根除并清除的作恶者、反派和其他邪恶存在的示例，或者也许是你仍在追捕的对象。正是面对这些宿敌的经历，让你走上了无论邪恶潜藏何处都要将其清除的道路。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.Z7iS66hDCFbRQWDP]{邪恶宿敌}

Ranger: Grim Harbinger.name: 游侠：噩兆先驱
Ranger: Grim Harbinger.description:
游侠：噩兆先驱

以死兆之名，封定命运

噩兆先驱游走于死亡曾触及之地，既是死者的守望者，也是生命将尽之人的末日预兆。他们身边的精魂守卫名为噩兆 (Grim)，其出现预示着死亡，是他们冷酷而永恒的同伴，协助履行他们共同的庄严职责。

```

Rogue: Sinner.name: 游荡者：罪人
Rogue: Sinner.description:
游荡者：罪人

以罪恶交易咒敌窃运

罪恶像第二层皮肤一样粘在罪人的身上——欺骗、酗酒和赌博是他们的食粮与血液。他们生来就是无赖，罪恶呼唤着他们的名字，当他们听到邪恶力量在低语时，他们会听之任之。这些存在提供的不仅仅是诱惑——它们赋予罪人行骗、盗窃乃至杀戮的工具，其精确程度是罪人梦中也难以想象的。

也许它始于在肮脏酒馆中的会面，沙漠天空下的仪式，或者在丛林深处发现的受诅神殿。无论过程如何，结局总是一样的——厄运伎俩。通过咒语、诅咒和厄运魔法，你将自己与罪恶绑定，抛弃公义。人与神的律法对你来说什么都不是，只有邪恶之道能够带来冰冷的安慰。

厄运武器形式

罪人们通过各式各样的厄运物品来施展他们的厄运伎俩，这些物品充当着魔法武器。厄运武器形式表为你的厄运武器可能呈现的形态提供了建议。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.Gvpi43fUavXxvx00]{厄运武器形式}

Sorcerer: Crimson Dynasty.name: 术士：猩红术法
Sorcerer: Crimson Dynasty.description:
术士：猩红术法

控制鲜血中的活力

猩红术士利用古老的魔法操纵血液和生命精华。随着饥饿在他们的内心深处滋长，他们扭曲并引导这股本源能量的流动。他们操纵自己的力量为他人注入活力，又或者将他人的生机占为己有。

猩红术法可以通过多种方式获得。有些人天生就拥有这种力量，而另一些人则通过黑暗的仪式或残酷的事件被注入了这种力量。有些人则通过失落的秘密发现了它。

请参考猩红起源表，以了解你力量的可能来源。

变体：无血猩红术士

如果你所扮演的角色来自一个传统意义上没有血液的物种，你仍然可以选择猩红术法子职。猩红术法的本质是生命力，或者说是近似于生命的活化能量。

猩红起源

你可能通过多种方式获得了驾驭猩红术法以操纵活力与生命精粹的能力。猩红起源表为你的力量来源提供了建议。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.W47d1Wl4XRdJGYcZ]{猩红起源}

Warlock: The Great Fool.name: 魔契师：愚神宗主
Warlock: The Great Fool.description:
魔契师：愚神宗主

以愚乐之举笑对危难

还有什么恐怖或悲伤，是一场癫狂大笑不能消解的呢？与愚神签订契约的魔契师们，其神秘莫测的力量源自一位以愉悦狂欢为本的异界强大存在——祂的扭曲幽默常令凡人无法理解。他们是一面嘲弄之镜，专为羞辱傲慢与强大者，尽管愚神的最终意图往往毫无逻辑、荒谬至极。

愚者形象

许多与愚神签订契约的魔契师都会采用一种标志性的审美和表演风格，以最好地代表他们的愚行。愚者形象表为愚人原型提供了建议，包括相应的服装和表演套路。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.De3AYRxmIiFRDsXl]{愚者形象}

Warlock: The Horned King.name: 魔契师：角之王宗主
Warlock: The Horned King.description:
魔契师：角之王宗主

尽享妖魅之力，活出甘美人生

无论是出于绝望还是狡诈，那些在角王之书上签名的魔契师，都选择以鲜血与堕落灵魂订立契约，尽享甘美生活。他们从潜伏于最深邃林地与最黑暗内心深处的野兽那里获授巫术之力，他们精进古老仪式，编织恶咒，追寻唯有他们知晓的隐秘目的。随着越来越多的受害者在他们的恶毒法术下腐烂、憎恨与痛苦，他们变得愈发接近自己的宗主，直到轻而易举地驾驭其王者之威。

巫术器具

与角之王签订契约的魔契师在施展魔法时，偏好使用特定的器具。巫术器具表为你的偏好试剂提供了选项。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.XdBkNGDqzepB4FRO]{巫术器具}

Wizard: Occultism.name: 法师：神秘学者
Wizard: Occultism.description:
法师：神秘学者

于星辰之外，觅禁忌之识

魔法一道，鼓励不断挑战知识的边界，追求更深的理解与更强的力量——但有些界限，原本就不该被跨越。神秘学者却全然无视这些限制，他们窥探宇宙帷幕，吞噬禁忌秘闻，并将对施法技艺的理解推向极限，直至现实本身为之撕裂。正是在这些被揭示的异星奇境中，他们汲取到更强大的力量，粉碎一切桎梏，无论这诡异的后果如何。

Wizard: Philosophy.name: 法师：贤者
Wizard: Philosophy.description:
法师：贤者

提炼万象之本质

贤者们将他们的奥术研究重心放在存在与现实的根本性质上。他们追寻万物最本源的真理，并通过炼金术实践来操控这些力量和物质。通过理解、解构与重建，他们掌控周遭世界的自然能量，并依其意愿加以改变。

贤者探求

每位踏上贤者之路的法师，都是为了解决某个特定的问题——哪怕起初只是如此。贤者探求表提供了那些引领你踏上炼金魔法研究之路的挑战或目标。

Chapter 11: Wickermoor Village.name: 第11章：柳沼村
Chapter 11: Wickermoor Village.text:
第11章：

柳沼村

“我们这些卑微的民众，唯有与绿荫女王携手并肩，方能在这片黑暗之地得以生存。我们传承着旧途的歌谣与仪式。我们热爱自然，敬畏自然，依赖自然，也安抚自然。”

—— 温德尔·索默顿镇长 (Mayor Wendel Somerton) ——

在名为柳沼的村镇中，居住着一群与世隔绝且迷信深重的村民。他们依靠着顺应自然，无论是其恩赐还是其怒火，生活了数百年。尽管身边常有诡异、超自然，甚至暴力的事件发生，这些质朴的村民依旧对自己的信仰深信不疑，并坚信一切终将安好。角色们将在这里学会生存，并寻找属于自己的一席之地。

章节背景

柳沼村是柳沼幽谷中最古老的聚落，山谷的名字正是因这座村镇而来。它的建立过程早已被遗忘，就连建村之人也无人记得。但村民们依旧恪守代代相传的旧途之道，并从中获得慰藉。尽管村庄简朴而古旧，但这里同样不乏许多其他小镇具备的便利与服务。即便偶有死亡与惊惧发生，这片土地上的人们依然过着相对富足安稳的生活。

尽管与德鲁斯肯瓦尔德其他地区相当隔绝，柳沼村的居民却对外来者颇为友善，只是他们私下总试图劝说新来者加入村庄，并信奉那套旧途之道。

对毫无戒心的访客而言，这座村庄平静得近乎无趣。然而，这里藏着一个不为人知的秘密。一个邪恶的教团在暗处活动，他们与名为歪曲者的恶灵，以及由三位令人作呕的鬼婆组成的秽鸣集会暗通款曲。他们企图释放「歪曲女王」凯琳 (Kehlenn, the Crooked Queen)，并促成她的配偶——角之王 (Horned King) 的降临。若无人阻止，这场阴谋最终将导致整个德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的分崩离析。

章节概述

在《歪曲之月》战役中，柳沼村将作为主要据点，角色们会从这里出发，频繁前往柳沼幽谷中的各个定居点。菲利普和阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德在冒险的大部分时间里都将居住于此。

村镇内包含多个对冒险主线剧情至关重要的NPC和地点，同时还提供了多种支线任务的建议。许多其他NPC与冒险的主线叙事没有直接关联，但你可以利用他们来扩展自己的支线剧情和遭遇。大多数NPC可以通过命运编织（见第九章）与角色的故事和目标交织在一起。

Going to Town.name: Going to Town
Going to Town.text:
前往小镇

当角色们处理完他们与幽灯火车头的暴力冲突以及随后与菲利普和阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德一同被困在柳沼幽谷荒野中的后续事宜后，朗读或转述以下内容：

菲利普摇了摇头，向东望去，嘴角挂着一丝笑意。“好了，咱们这就把这鬼地方抛在脑后吧！柳沼村离这儿不远——我想那儿甚至还有一座庄园在等着咱们呢。很久以前镇长就来信说那是份礼物。我一直没顾上回信，不过嘿，没准它还在那儿呢！”

阿黛拉轻轻挽住他的手臂，笑逐颜开。“噢，菲利，这岂不正是机缘巧合？我敢打赌，村民们见到你一定会乐坏的！”

菲利普点点头，调皮地捏了捏她的手。“没错，亲爱的！就把这点小插曲当成是好运降临吧——咱们正好借机看看新风景！”他潇洒地转了一下手杖，然后朝你们眨了下眼：“既然你们把火车那档子事处理得那么漂亮，不如就由你们护送我们去柳沼村如何？”

前往村庄的跋涉需要耗时四个小时，途中要穿过阴暗的森林与萧瑟的高沼，最终角色们才看到远处闪烁的城镇灯火。

然而当他们抵达镇上时，街道却显得异常空旷。村中正在进行一场献祭仪式——据说这是为了拯救村庄于即将到来的灾厄之中。

第一次献祭

当角色们抵达柳沼村时，朗读或转述以下内容：

你们终于抵达柳沼村，映入眼帘的是一座古朴的村镇，到处都是屋顶铺着木瓦、结构简陋的木骨架建筑。你们穿行于空荡的街道，耳边传来镇中心大楼上钟塔的阵阵钟声。你们步入圆形的市集广场，只见一座风化剥蚀严重的无面男子雕像矗立其中，与它遥遥相对的，是一棵盘根错节的巨型橡树，树干上密密麻麻地刻着数百张人脸。

忽然，一声凄厉的尖叫划破了寂静，你们这才注意到树脚下有个正在挣扎的人影，正被绳索绑缚并钉在地上。紧接着，广场另一头传来了低沉而粗哑的咆哮声。一群野狼在一头体型庞大、毛发蓬乱的狼王带领下，正逼近那个拼命扭动的身影，它们口中垂涎欲滴，眼中凶光毕露。

这群野兽从小镇东边进入，由六只 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.yawTeS8u2FCfzzZH]{狼} 和一头 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.EYiQZ3rFL25fEJY5]{恐狼} 组成。它们是被那名被捆绑的受献祭者的尖叫声吸引而来的。这些野兽被歪曲女王的憎恨所充斥，因此具有超乎寻常的攻击性，无法通过非魔法手段安抚或驯服。

角色们在从橡树以西120尺处开始这场遭遇，而狼群则位于橡树以东120尺的位置。那位受害者被绳索牢牢钉绑在 **众面之橡 (区域V10)** 树根的北侧地面上，如无人协助，将无法自救脱困。本次遭遇使用地图11.1。

小羊快跑

当角色们靠近至那被绑的身影30尺以内时，若他们成功进行一次 [[/check INV DC 15]] 检定，便会发现那其实并不是一个人。如果他们靠近至5尺之内，则会自动成功。

那是一个被钉在地上的布偶，做成了真人大小的人类模样，但布偶内部却有一个小小的隆起物正在挣扎着想要逃脱。

角色可以使用操作动作剪断、撕裂或扯开绳索或布偶本身，以解救里面的生物。当他们这样做时，一只 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.y8sRU8Ks2lcrGsaf]{幼山羊}（微型，无冲撞攻击）会从布偶中挣脱出来，并朝随机方向跑开以逃离该区域。角色可以使用一个动作进行一次成功的 DC 10 力量（运动）或感知（驯兽） 检定来抓住这只幼山羊，或者通过一次徒手打击来擒抱住山羊。如果山羊逃脱而狼群仍构成威胁，则有50%的几率狼群会攻击山羊或角色们。

若角色们未加干预，狼群会吞食布偶内的幼山羊，然后离去。菲利普和阿黛拉目睹这一幕时惊恐万分，却并不会强迫角色们出手介入。

柳沼式欢迎

当狼群攻击被处理后，朗读或转述以下内容：

那栋面对市集广场的宏伟建筑大门缓缓敞开，一位身材矮胖的中年男子走了出来。他身穿一套剪裁考究的三件套西装，头戴一顶配套的圆顶硬礼帽；在他走近时，他恭敬地摘下了帽子以示敬意。

“对于眼前的混乱，我要致以万分的歉意，菲利普领主大人！我们没想到您今晚会到，刚好让您撞上了我们正在举行一项神圣的传统仪式。”

“请接受我最诚挚、最衷心的欢迎，欢迎您莅临柳沼村。我是镇长温德尔·索默顿。您终于接受了我们这个不起眼小地方的邀请，这真是令我喜出望外。”

索默顿镇长以得体而热情的态度，欢迎了角色们与德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇，他解释道，他们无意中撞见的那场献祭其实是每年一次的仪式，其目的在于以鲜血供养森林中的野兽以及那棵巨橡的根系。这种为了纪念绿荫女王（详见第八章「歪曲女王」凯琳）的祭祀，能确保来年狩猎丰收和牲畜兴旺。

小羊被献祭了？

如果角色们任由狼群吞食那只幼山羊，索默顿镇长会向他们表示感谢，感谢他们尊重村庄的传统。他保证说，绿荫女王已经见证了他们对旧途的敬意，并赐予了她的生机之力。角色们获得 [[/damage 1d12 healing]]{6 (1d12) 临时生命值}。

小羊被救下了？

如果角色们出手救下山羊，索默顿镇长会轻描淡写地将仪式中断一事带过，并说道：“那棵橡树仍旧饮了潜行野兽之血。”不过，若有角色成功进行一次 [[/check INS DC 17]] 检定，便能看出他其实对仪式被破坏感到不安，只是为了讨好菲利普与阿黛拉，才故作轻松。

温德尔知道什么

索默顿镇长态度亲切、待人热情，但举止克制有度。以下细节可用于引导与他的对话：

  • 他向菲利普与阿黛拉保证，德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园（区域V24）状况良好，仆人们也已准备好满足他们的一切所需。

  • 他会介绍村庄的历史，并简要说明旧途的行事方式（详见第八章）。

  • 他会建议角色们造访本地几处值得一看的场所（详见本章稍后“柳沼村”一节），并推荐绿荫女王旅馆作为落脚之处。

  • 他将柳沼村描绘为一个繁荣幸福的小镇，但若有角色成功进行一次 [[/check PER DC 15]] 或 [[/check ITM DC 15]] 检定，便会坦承最近失踪、疾病与死亡的事件确实比往年要频繁得多。

踏访小镇

当与索默顿镇长的交谈告一段落后，菲利普向角色们告别。

“这一路咱们可真是经历了不少，是吧？阿黛拉和我都累坏了，而且我也得去确认一下，这镇长嘴里那座据说归我所有的庄园，到底是个什么光景。我们这就去安顿下来，不过明天你可一定要来共进晚餐！”

如果角色们表示希望与德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇一同留宿，菲利普会礼貌地婉拒。他会解释说，自己也不确定庄园的现状，而各位已经帮了他们太多。若有角色成功进行一次 [[/check INS DC 15]] 检定，便可察觉到，经历了那段令人惊心动魄的旅程后，他身上明显流露出不安的情绪，或许还有更多隐情。

分别之际。 菲利普会给每位角色各 [[/award 10gp]]，告诉他们今晚去旅馆订房，费用由他来承担。随后，他与阿黛拉沿着小路朝山上的德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园走去。

窥视之眼。 许多镇民透过紧闭的窗户和虚掩的门，目睹了那场未遂的祭祀。若角色们打断了仪式，一些虔诚的旧途信众（见第八章）可能会感到被冒犯，并对角色们表示敌对。另一些人则可能更宽容，并将其视为一个说服他们皈依旧途的契机。

一些镇民认出了菲利普和阿黛拉，但大多数人对柳沼幽谷之外的生活一无所知。效忠于歪曲女王的邪恶邪教徒能够强烈地感知到他们的存在，而那些见过世面的新来者（见第八章）则了解并钦佩菲利普作为德鲁斯肯瓦尔德领主的身份。

入镇第一夜。 若角色们是在晚间时分抵达镇上，大多数商铺都已打烊。不过，角色们仍然可以漫步街头，了解小镇风貌——他们可以在第二夜，即与德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇共进晚餐之前，参观许多地点并拜访NPC（详见第十二章）。

安排住宿。 柳沼村中唯一能提供舒适客房的地方是绿荫女王旅馆。旅馆东主兼老板艾达·法纳姆提供单人间，每晚 [[/award -1gp]]，三人间则为 [[/award -2gp]] 一晚，价格包含热水澡和在暮光时分供应的热早餐。角色们在此度过了平静无事的第一夜。

接下来呢？ 从此刻起，你可以根据自己的倾向和偏好，以及角色们的行动与目标，自由地推进故事。如果你在冒险中融入了命运编织（见第九章），可寻找契机让角色们遇到他们的“邂逅NPC”（见下文“柳沼村”）。

一旦角色准备好赴德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇的晚宴邀约时，他们可以前往小镇西北侧的山坡，抵达那座即将歪曲异变的德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园（详见第十二章）。

Wickermoor Village.name: 柳沼村
Wickermoor Village.text:
柳沼村

以下是柳沼村的居民、地点与剧情梗概。你可以根据自身喜好及角色兴趣，灵活选择要纳入冒险的章节，从而定制游戏体验。

人物与地点

以下是柳沼村的主要地点（与 地图11.2 相对应）及重要NPC的详细介绍。那些与特定NPC无关的地点，或在任何单一地点之外活动的NPC，将在本节末尾详述。

V1: Green Queen Inn.name: V1: Green Queen Inn
V1: Green Queen Inn.text:
V1：绿荫女王旅馆

作为村镇内规模最大的建筑之一，旅馆设有可供租住的客房、酒馆与餐厅、一间小型剧场，以及一座附属马厩。

绿荫女王旅馆是村民与外来访客的主要社交场所。酒馆提供种类繁多的饮品，以满足不同品味和经济条件的顾客——毕竟，相较于清醒面对德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的种种恐怖，烈酒浇愁才是更佳选择。尽管来自柳沼幽谷之外的旅人极为罕见，但对于任何来自山谷内其他城镇和定居点的旅人来说，这家旅馆都是他们的主要落脚点。

旅馆剧场还提供各类额外的娱乐节目，可谓“面包与马戏”的完美结合。它可能这周上演粗俗滑稽的节目，下周则带来颇具思辨意味的演出。演出并不常见，但途经此地的巡回艺人总能在此找到热情的观众。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.uf6Q6GG0yhoF8DkN]{旅店老板艾达·法纳姆}。艾达 (中立邪恶 人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.GlaCGcgIP6YjBjGc]{贵族 Noble}) 是绿荫女王旅馆的东主兼经营者。她看似友善，但对她而言，世间万物皆可交易，无论交易的筹码是金币、宝石、艺术品、技艺还是人情。哪怕是最迟钝的人，在与她相处片刻之后，也能看穿那副彬彬有礼的伪装。

年轻时，艾达便对旧途感到幻灭，转而青睐现代所带来的繁荣与舒适。然而，当她偶然发现一本记载着能掌控凯琳本源的原初仪式的古老典籍时，她很快便意识到，自己可以借此力量来积累财富，提升社会地位。此后，她便加入了歪曲女王的邪教，以此作为她不断追求财富与权势的手段。

V2: Stables.name: V2: Stables
V2: Stables.text:
V2：马厩

几间木制马厩用于安置旅店客人的马匹和骡子。此外，艾达自己也养有两匹马和两头骡子，平时出租给有需求的客人使用。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.2R72VZh4ueVqSYbl]{马厩女主管玛丽安娜·格蕾}。马厩由玛丽安娜·格蕾 (中立善良 人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.O3ABqI55Ir1du1Xa]{斥候 Scout}) 负责管理。她住在马厩楼上的一间简陋杂乱的小屋里。她不善与人交际，性情腼腆，但心地善良。她是极少数会受到艾达·法纳姆无礼对待的人之一。

玛丽安娜深爱四足动物，因此加入了恒心女士圣修会。常年与马匹和重型设备打交道，使得她肌肉发达，身手矫捷。

V3: Constable’s Station and Jail.name: V3: Constable’s Station and Jail
V3: Constable’s Station and Jail.text:
V3：治安官办公室与监牢

治安官多莉丝·斯奎尔与副官霍伊·巴特曼在此工作并居住。一楼设有办公区与监牢，二楼则是两间独立公寓。

监牢内设有三间带栅栏的囚室，结构坚固。任何时候，囚室内都可能关押着一两名囚犯，他们通常是在酒后闹事或暴力冲突后，被暂时监禁在此醒酒或冷静。

若涉及更严重的罪行，镇长将兼任法官和陪审团。最严厉的惩罚包括：谋杀罪行将被判处死刑，而重大窃盗罪等则会采取流放。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.uyjPNzuK18oBAz4M]{治安官多莉丝·斯奎尔}。治安官多莉丝 (守序中立 人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.D5UqYD1EnTrJaMTO]{骑士 Knight}) 为人务实，寡言少语，衣着朴素。她身材高大魁梧，灰白的头发束在帽子下。她那双钢铁般的灰色眼睛警惕有神，仿佛能洞穿人心。

她习惯于只在必要时才开口。她将社区关系的客套事宜交给了她那更为和蔼可亲的副官。

多莉丝表面上严格执行旧途的戒律，然而在心底，她其实是恒心女士圣修会的一员。尽管表面上冷峻克己，但她其实有一颗敏感细腻的灵魂，私下里常以写诗来抒发情感。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.bfXP2rijPr6FElml]{副官霍伊·巴特曼}。霍伊·巴特曼 (中立邪恶 人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.13K3XK2A3wwxVKLD]{间谍 Spy}) 身材矮小但精瘦结实。他看起来并不威严，但在战斗中却迅捷而致命。

霍伊副官显得更为和蔼可亲，在面对不法分子时，他扮演“好警察”。

实际上，霍伊副官是一名狂热的邪教成员，他暗中谋划着歪曲女王的归来。他利用自己的职权，极其巧妙地引导事态朝着女王回归的方向发展。菲利普和阿黛拉的到来，促使他和其他歪曲女王的仆从们将他们的计划付诸行动（见第八章）。

V4: Mayor’s Home and Office.name: V4: Mayor’s Home and Office
V4: Mayor’s Home and Office.text:
V4：镇长官邸及办公室

柳沼村的镇长官邸是一栋朴素的庄园宅邸，附带着一处宽敞的办公室。除受镇长邀请者外，起居室不对外开放，但办公室从暮光时分到夜临时分都会对外办公。镇长温德尔·索默顿与他的妻子默特尔和女儿罗斯居住于此。

镇长办公室的大部分空间都用于存放记录和其他官方文书。现任镇长温德尔·索默顿很享受他的职位及其带来的权力；因此，镇上发生的大小事务都会被记录和归档。如果没有对应的表格，索默顿镇长就会创造一种表格，以确保一切井然有序，并在他的掌控之下。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.FonUCs7tziB0Kc8X]{镇长温德尔·索默顿}。索默顿镇长 (守序中立 人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.PVD5wRdyO7iCJPs1]{祭司 Priest}) 是一位五十来岁、好官架子又自视甚高的男人。他矮胖的身躯总是穿着剪裁考究的西装，几乎包不住他日益增长的腰围。他光秃的脑袋上戴着一顶配套的圆顶礼帽，浓密的灰眉和八字胡都上了蜡以保持形状。他的领巾上装饰着一枚橡树叶形状的宝石别针。他随身携带着一根杖柄镶嵌着翡翠的桃花心木手杖，尽管他并不需要它。

尽管他对持有各种意识形态的人都表现出宽容甚至欢迎，但索默顿镇长和他的家人都坚定地信仰着旧途。然而，他对歪曲女王教派的险恶图谋一无所知，只知道凯琳是绿荫女王，并对她深怀敬意。他作为旧途信众的领袖，领导着对绿荫女王的崇拜，并主持仪式以驾驭她的力量。

这使得他成了歪曲女王邪恶教派的一个有用棋子，在不知情的情况下执行着她仆从们的计划。其中最具影响力的决定，便是将洛克伍드庄园赠予菲利普·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德，并为他可能的到来做准备。尽管大多数镇民，甚至温德尔自己，都将此举视为一种政治手腕，但这个想法是由兰道尔·格雷厄姆（见V7区域）植入他脑中的，他知道菲利普是释放歪曲女王和解开角之王束缚的最终仪式中的关键一环。

V5: Tolliver’s Trading Post.name: V5: Tolliver’s Trading Post
V5: Tolliver’s Trading Post.text:
V5：托利弗贸易站

尽管柳沼幽谷与德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的其他行省之间没有太多的旅行和贸易，但在贸易站里，几乎可以找到对柳沼村善良居民有价值的任何东西。巴尔图斯·托利弗雇佣了一对名为 威尔玛 (Wilma) 与 罗纳德·温赖特 (Ronald Wainwright) 的守卫 (守序中立 人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.E9CvDPDg5dFEpVjS]{警卫 Guard})，他们在地下室有一个起居区，供非值班时使用。这对已婚夫妇虔诚地信奉旧途，但对其雇主的险恶意图一无所知。

威尔玛和罗纳德照顾着三个收养的孩子，每个孩子都来自柳沼幽谷的另一个社区——维多利亚来自拂晓之门，埃迪来自浊水湾，最近的是撒迦利亚来自狐柳镇（中立善良，人类非战斗 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{平民 Commoners}）。三个孩子都在上学，并在店里帮忙做家务。三个孩子的亲生父母都失踪了，只有威尔玛和罗纳德知道失踪事件是由各自恐吓他们家乡社区的堕落者造成的。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.v2BY6TWKFSVSA0nv]{商人巴尔图斯·托利弗}。 巴尔图斯·托利弗 (中立邪恶 人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.tYfQIxCJT0WaaKmc]{邪教狂信者 Cult Fanatic}) 年轻时离开了柳沼村，游历德鲁斯肯瓦尔德。十年后，他带着一些财富、大量奢侈品以及能找到领地内任何奇特物品的联系方式回来了。巴尔图斯利用魅力和恐吓的混合手段，建立了山谷中最大的贸易站。他出售从基本商品到稀有小饰品的一切东西。

他是一个身材瘦削的男人，每晚都穿着同样的灰色西装。他刮得干干净净，稀疏的黑发暴露了他的中上年纪。他戴着朴素的银戒指，抽着一根装饰华丽的桃花心木烟斗。

尽管他年轻时离开了柳沼幽谷，但巴尔图斯是旧途信众的一员，效力于歪曲女王的邪教。他被凯琳日益增长的力量召唤回家，他的财富和贸易影响力帮助资助和协调释放她的努力。他的守卫尊敬旧途和绿荫女王，但他们不知道巴尔图斯对邪恶邪教的效忠。

V6: Apothecary Shop.name: V6: Apothecary Shop
V6: Apothecary Shop.text:
V6：药剂铺

摩根药剂铺的前厅设有一个小型区域，用于提供炼金服务的咨询，而建筑的其余部分则是一个大型作坊，配备了进行专业炼制所需的一切材料与设备。

摩根所用的试剂、油膏与软膏本身并无真正的药用价值，但柳沼村的居民们却对摩根的秘药深信不疑。其也出售常见的魔法药剂，例如 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.ytlsBjYsZ7OBSEBs]{治疗药水}，以及任何超自然药水*。

药剂铺内没有起居室，看到摩根用调制奇特秘药的同一套设备做饭也并非稀罕事。奇怪的是，摩根不在工作时使用的私人房间里并没有床。他们睡在哪里，无人知晓。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.8W2SXEs4el1xZXvt]{药剂师摩根}。摩根 (绝对中立 人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.K15Yl8JmB5iPircc]{德鲁伊 Druid}) 对自己的童年毫无记忆。他们在某夜于柳沼村醒来，当时还是个孩子，后来被一位牧羊人收养并由其家人抚养长大。摩根在成长过程中发现了自己在炼金术方面的天赋，如今担任着村庄的药剂师。其友善且仁慈，但同时伴有短暂性失忆和偶尔的时间空白。

摩根身形瘦削，一头赤金色发丝垂在清瘦的脸庞上，绿色的眼睛总是带着一丝遥远与缥缈，即便是在专注于某项任务时也是如此。

摩根之谜

摩根神秘的过去与偶尔的时间空白，可由你根据需要加以利用。摩根可能是山谷中某股力量的仆从，是某个强大NPC或生物的转世，是一个忘记了真实形态的变形怪物，或者仅仅是一位普通的药剂师。请根据你的故事，将摩根作为一个万能牌来使用。若你采纳此建议，摩根描述中所述的阵营与数据仅为其表面伪装。

V7: Randall’s Barber Shop.name: V7: Randall’s Barber Shop
V7: Randall’s Barber Shop.text:
V7：兰道尔的理发店

兰道尔·格雷厄姆把店面打理得一尘不染。他在店内用自制蒸馏器酿造的私酒，既能充当消毒剂，亦是绝佳的社交润滑剂。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.FhM50yCQ3EKulcwA]{理发师兼外科医生兰道尔·格雷厄姆}。兰道尔·格雷厄姆 (中立邪恶 人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.tYfQIxCJT0WaaKmc]{邪教狂信者}) 是柳沼村最受信任的人之一。他那帅气的微笑、沙棕色的头发与胡须已成为镇上一道熟悉的风景线。

兰道尔友善的面容构成了绝佳的伪装，掩盖了他作为小镇里歪曲女王教派领袖的真实身份。

他从顾客那里取来的头发、牙齿和血液，都被保存在理发店地下室的一个秘密房间里，以供日后进行仪式。隶属于害兽集会的鸽子、蜈蚣和黄鼠狼经常在商店周围徘徊。

V8: Wickermoor Schoolhouse.name: V8: Wickermoor Schoolhouse
V8: Wickermoor Schoolhouse.text:
V8: 柳沼村校舍

这所名副其实的“一间教室的校舍”里摆放着课桌、讲桌、书籍、地图，以及老师授课所需的其他各种教具。侧院里则是一些简陋的游乐设施，包括秋千、攀爬架、跷跷板和钻爬隧道等。这些奇特而摇摇欲坠的游乐设施看起来过于危险，难以带来多少乐趣。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.BYhPWjycngYDfjNQ]{芬尼亚斯·特劳特}，授课教师。 芬尼亚斯·特劳特（守序善良人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{平民}）满怀热情地教导村中孩童认字与算数，对于那些父母重视教育的孩子，他还会教授一些更为高深的科目。他是一位书卷气十足的年轻人，蓬乱的棕发下戴着一副眼镜，外貌并不出众。芬尼亚斯对“书本知识”怀有近乎敬畏的态度，这在一些人看来值得钦佩，在另一些人看来则有些迂腐可笑。

他不久前从巴斯科廷（详见第一章）来到柳沼村，在绿荫女王旅店租住了一个房间，房费由小镇及几位家境优渥的学生家长共同承担——这些孩子还能获得他的额外辅导。

芬尼亚斯属于新来者一派，他希望理性的纯粹之光能够驱散迷信的黑暗。他也在与制烛匠奥斯威克·弗雷（详见区域V17）的浪漫恋情中找到了光明的源泉。

V9: The Founder’s Round.name: V9: The Founder’s Round
V9: The Founder’s Round.text:
V9：奠基者广场

位于村庄中央的一片公园广场，尽管形状为圆形，这里仍是镇上“矩形”定居点活动的枢纽。除却成排的花坛，这里最引人注目的两处景观是众面之橡（区域V10）与奠基者雕像（区域V11）。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.43dFOOLB5ibIxogV]{老锈}，广场管理员。 老锈（绝对中立人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.kz1t6xeXVwODpYb2]{狂战士}，不穿护甲、不携武器）是一位年迈的男子，有着一头蓬乱的红灰色头发和一把杂乱的胡须。他在这里的时间久到让人记不清了，作为村庄为他提供食宿的回报，他负责打理奠基者广场和镇上其他公共区域。老锈很少说话，即便开口，也总是用些难以解读、语义隐晦的措辞。

老锈——甚至连他自己都不知道——其实是弗朗西斯·帕特里尼，多年前在歪屋（详见第十二章）尤斯塔斯·洛克伍德屠杀事件中唯一的幸存者。由于他与歪屋超自然事件的深刻联系，他的动机、目标和立场可能会根据角色的行动而剧烈变化，以服务于你的剧情目的。

V10: Oak of Many Faces.name: V10: Oak of Many Faces
V10: Oak of Many Faces.text:
V10：众面之橡

众面之橡自柳沼村建立之初便矗立在村庄中心，大多数居民都将之视为受绿荫女王珍视的圣地。每当需要对重罪施以极刑时，便会在橡树前进行斩首之刑，好让它的根系饮尽被处决者的生命之血。

每一次行刑后，旧途信众都会将死者的面容刻入树皮之上。久而久之，橡树身披百态人面，既令人着迷，又令人心惊，成为村中独一无二的可怖地标。事实上，这棵树不仅吸食鲜血，还会吞噬所有在其面前被屠戮者的灵魂，并且在歪曲女王力量的作用下，甚至获得了自己的意志。

如果有任何角色在晚上独自逗留在奠基者广场，@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.ZUztx32G1KunUdOf]{众面之橡} 可能会作为一棵速度为0尺的混乱邪恶 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.NB6wUgVqeOQtsQKu]{树人} 发起攻击，企图吞噬新的灵魂，并为自己的树干增添一张新面孔。任何在众面之橡前被斩首或被其杀死的生物，除法术@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz]{祈愿术}外，无法通过任何方式复活，直至这棵树被摧毁为止。

V11: Founder’s Statue.name: V11: Founder’s Statue
V11: Founder’s Statue.text:
V11：奠基者雕像

在奠基者广场（区域V9）的正中央，矗立着一尊10尺高的花岗岩雕像，该小镇广场也因此得名。雕像基座上镌刻着一块铭牌，写着：“吾村奠基者。”，然而却未留下姓名。仿佛其面部和身体的所有细节都已被风化殆尽。镇上无人知晓这位奠基者是谁，也无人了解柳沼村建立时的具体情况。

V12: Roderick Masonry.name: V12: Roderick Masonry
V12: Roderick Masonry.text:
V12：罗德里克石匠坊

这座由木材与石块粗略搭建而成的建筑，是所罗门·罗德里克经营的石匠工坊兼经营场所。屋内堆满了各种石材雕凿工具，以及花岗岩、大理石和其他石材的碎块。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.VX2SKCv73BbPH60J]{所罗门·罗德里克}，石匠。 所罗门·罗德里克（守序中立人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.E9CvDPDg5dFEpVjS]{警卫}）是一位体型魁梧、满身伤痕的四十岁男子。他的皮肤正如他加工的石头一般，光秃无毛且粗糙；那双棕色的眼睛在面对陌生人或顾客时，同样冷峻如岩。

罗德里克和八岁的女儿索菲亚住在工坊楼上。她母亲在索菲亚出生后不久便离开了村庄，留下所罗门独自将女儿抚养长大。她不在芬尼亚斯·特劳特那里上课时，便会在店里协助父亲。

作为这个幽谷里技艺最为精湛的石匠，所罗门深谙自己的手艺及其带来的优势。他手下有数名助手负责监督当地采石场的石料开采，这使得所罗门得以专注于管理柳沼村所有石质建筑的施工和维护工作。

尽管他给人的印象是冷酷、精于算计且严格，但所罗门在私下里与他在乎的人相处时，却是少有的心软之人。他对女儿极为宠爱，将她的幸福与安康视为自己最重要的追求。所罗门最近皈依了光明歌者，他的新信仰十分坚定，经常向教会和有需要的人提供大笔捐赠。

V13: Carpentry Workshop.name: V13: Carpentry Workshop
V13: Carpentry Workshop.text:
V13：木匠工坊

碧翠丝·威尔斯在此进行木工活，根据需要在柳沼村各处营造和修缮各种建筑。她也接手一些较小的项目，例如家具、橱柜和农具。木材、板材和其他建筑材料被妥善地存放在工坊内，而更多的则堆放在屋外，靠在建筑物的两侧。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.LG4F2bn7a4z7So1e]{碧翠丝·威尔斯}，木匠。 碧翠丝·威尔斯（绝对中立人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{平民}）是一位技艺精湛的木匠，也是柳沼村不可或缺的人才。从马车到家具、再到房屋，她精通一切与木头相关的工艺，她的作品以精湛的技艺和坚固耐用而闻名。她具有独到的眼光，使得她能够创作出独特而令人惊叹的作品。她对歪屋（详见第十二章）的扭曲建筑风格有着近乎痴迷的兴趣。

碧翠丝与她的丈夫 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.3ham961UFU8uF2ui]{布兰登} （混乱善良人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{平民}）以及他们的四个年幼的孩子——@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.kQy6FWWzlBJSYPz9]{罗宾}、@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.kIrnJhCseP80WLMt]{拉克}、@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.krqjdEVpPkIi6xOB]{杰伊}和@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Hr8ElrqX4pQXsXoZ]{雷恩} （中立善良人类非战斗 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{平民}）——一同住在二楼的生活区里。

威尔斯一家虔诚地遵循着光明歌者的教义。在闲暇时，碧翠丝已开始在废弃教堂旧址（区域V19）为韦斯顿·默多克建造一座小礼拜堂。威尔斯一家总穿着明亮的衣服，即使在工作时也会互相唱歌。

V14: Bread by Holly.name: V14: Bread by Holly
V14: Bread by Holly.text:
V14：霍莉面包铺

从暮光时分初至到夜临时分之前，这栋建筑一直飘荡着烘焙面包和各种甜点的诱人香味。建筑东侧设有一个小小的铺面，陈列着各式新鲜出炉的烘焙点心。

铺子后方摆满了工作台和置物架，四座燃木烤炉从不熄火，整日翻腾。霍莉的两个女儿——薇尔莉特和拉文德——在不上学的时候，便会帮母亲打理店铺。至于她们的父亲是谁，除了霍莉本人无人知晓；绯闻爱好者们也早就放弃了深挖的念头。这栋建筑本身并无生活区，霍莉和她的孩子们现与屠夫希芙·哈尔加同住，两人正处于交往关系。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.LZm8yirHBoff1MaD]{霍莉·艾丝特}，面包师。 霍莉·艾丝特（中立善良人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{平民}）的大部分时间都在厨房里度过，不是在为每夜的烘焙准备原料，就是围着烤炉忙前忙后。烤炉的炙热让她原本就泛红的脸颊更添一分红润，而她那浅色的直发在工作时总是用发夹固定在脑后。

霍莉出身于柳沼幽谷一个传承至今的面包师世家，她的母亲与外祖母都曾是镇上的面包师。然而，她们二人都在35岁生日那天因不明原因去世，而霍莉距离这个“里程碑”也只剩几周时间了。

霍莉是旧途信众的忠实成员，她与母亲和外祖母身上背负着相同的诅咒：在歪曲女王归来之前，她与她的后代都注定将在三十五岁生日前死去。霍莉深知这一点，也明白自己正走到命运的分岔路口——她要么加入歪曲女王教派，协助迎来凯琳的回归；要么拒绝并静候死亡。至于她将如何抉择，全由你来决定。

V15: Harga’s Meats.name: V15: Harga’s Meats
V15: Harga’s Meats.text:
V15：哈尔加肉铺

这间肉铺由希芙·哈尔加经营，她是一位身材高大结实的女性，精通各种肉类的挑选与处理技艺。店铺一楼被均匀地划分为加工区和陈列区。店后设有畜栏，希芙从农户手中买来准备屠宰的动物就在那里等待它们的命运。

希芙雇佣了一位名叫奥克姆夫人的奇特女性，来协助她处理工作的方方面面。奥克姆夫人每天晚间时分都会离开镇子，并在次夜暮光时分返回。没人知道她夜间身在何处，也不清楚她如何解决食宿问题。真相是，奥克姆夫人是一名混乱善良的 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.7tRhrxuknTpHpYcA]{狼人}。她挣扎于自身的诅咒，努力压制嗜血本性——靠从肉铺偷取的碎肉残骨维生，夜晚则躲得远远的，以免伤及无辜。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.H7bieSd1LTxtZNSq]{希芙·哈尔加}，屠夫。 希芙·哈尔加（混乱善良人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.O3ABqI55Ir1du1Xa]{斥候}）是一位身材高大、体格结实的女性，留着一头编成辫子的金发。从小，她一家便在柳沼幽谷中四处迁徙，以放牧牲畜为生。希芙最终在柳沼村定居下来，成为镇上屠夫的学徒。当那位屠夫去世后，她接管了生意，并证明自己完全能胜任。希芙与她的伴侣霍莉·艾丝特、霍莉的两个女儿，以及她的弟弟乌尔夫（中立善良人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{平民}）共同居住在附近的一所房子里，乌尔夫在不上学时会在店里帮忙。

她对动物的了解不仅令她的屠夫事业如鱼得水，也为本地农户带来了不少帮助。有些人认为她与自己宰杀的动物之间存在超自然联系，而希芙对此的态度不置可否。

她与自然世界的深切理解促使希芙加入了恒心女士圣修会。她相信，只要信徒尊重体恤大自然，并深思熟虑如何回馈大自然，自然就会给予馈赠。即使在为顾客宰杀动物时，她也会向恒心女士祷告致谢，绝不允许虐待她所照料的动物。

V16: The Smithy.name: V16: The Smithy
V16: The Smithy.text:
V16：铁匠铺

让·米里哀经营着这家铁匠铺，他在此处理各种金属，尽其所能地满足村庄及周边居民的需求。他既擅长打造马蹄铁、农具和简易武器，也精于制作精美的金饰与银烛台。铁匠铺的二楼是让的储藏室和起居室。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.KrBgEaqheQlNWgGF]{铁匠让·米里哀}。 让·米里哀 (守序善良 人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.kz1t6xeXVwODpYb2]{狂战士 Berserker}) 数年前从拂晓之门移居到柳沼村。他个头不高，但体格强健。在拂晓之门抛弃血焰蔷薇的信仰后，他一直保持无信仰状态，并支持拥护新来者的理念。

V17: The Wickery.name: V17: The Wickery
V17: The Wickery.text:
V17：烛芯坊

这座制烛坊由奥斯威克·弗雷经营。该建筑兼作工坊、储藏区和起居室。它邻近肉铺，便于获取制烛所用的脂肪。

这座两层楼的建筑以坡道代替楼梯，以方便小烛的轮椅通行。屋顶的瞭望台是俯瞰村庄及周边地区的最佳位置之一，仅次于钟楼（V25区域）。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.f13Yn8OHLa191mt4]{制烛匠奥斯威克·弗雷}。镇上的大多数蜡烛都由奥斯威克（混乱善良，人类@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{平民 Commoner}）制作，他是一位热爱自己工作的年轻人。自幼腿部残疾，奥斯威克依靠一把由他自己和镇上其他工匠设计并完善的特殊轮椅行动。他因红发与肤色得到了“小烛 Wick”这个绰号。

奥斯威克疯狂地爱着教师芬尼亚斯·特劳特（见V8区域），但他一直把这份感情藏在心里。奥斯威克性格开朗，喜欢分享故事，但在芬尼亚斯面前却会变得语无伦次。

奥斯威克是旧途信众的一员，向镇上信徒免费提供蜡烛，以便他们用于举行敬奉绿荫女王的各种仪式。

V18: A Stitch in Time.name: V18: A Stitch in Time
V18: A Stitch in Time.text:
V18：针锋时刻

一个巨大的橱窗展示着色彩缤纷、富有想象力的服装，表明这家店是一家服装店兼裁缝铺。店外悬挂的招牌上写着“针锋时刻”，证实了这一点。

店主兼经营者托马辛·阿朵设计着奇特而美丽的服装。不幸的是，她的顾客大多只对朴素实用的服装感兴趣。托马辛也兼营修鞋业务。

店铺的主楼层是陈列室和工作区。楼上是起居室和储藏区，后者存放着成匹的布料和其他裁缝用品。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Ycr1yX1qatcv1VwG]{裁缝托马辛·阿朵}。托马辛·阿朵 (中立 人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{平民 Commoner}) 是村里最熟练的裁缝。在童年时，她曾不慎跌穿一块大玻璃，幸而通过兰道尔·格雷厄姆的手术才得以保住性命。这段经历，加上她安静冷淡的性格，使她常沦为毫无根据的谣言与闲话的对象。

她常常与人保持距离，镇上唯一与她亲近的人是兰道尔·格雷厄姆（见V7区域），正是他在她童年事故后为她缝合了伤口。

尽管托马辛是旧途信众中一位虔诚且心地善良的成员，并敬奉着绿荫女王，但兰道尔·格雷厄姆正试图利用他们的关系，引导她加入歪曲女王教派。至于她会堕入邪道，还是发现兰道尔的阴谋并加以拒绝，则由你来决定。

V19: Abandoned Church.name: V19: Abandoned Church
V19: Abandoned Church.text:
V19：废弃教堂

此地保留着一座教堂的地基与部分墙壁，它最初由大理石与花岗岩建造。建筑主体尚算完整，但内部陈设已荡然无存，木窗木门都是新近重装的，原本装有玻璃窗的地方则用防水布遮盖着破洞。新的木质结构表明，此地正处于修复的初期阶段。

祭坛上方矗立着一尊高8尺的祈祷骑士雕像，脸上带着讥讽神情。村民们称他为“大理石之人”，并将其描述为来自一个更美好时代的、柳沼村的神话守护者，他们认为他脸上的讥讽神情，源于他对时过境迁的厌恶。

镇上无人知晓这座教堂最初是供奉何人何物的，但最近一位名叫韦斯顿·默多克的朝圣者来到了镇上。在他抵达后，他将废弃教堂改造成了光明歌者的礼拜场所，并将栖息在残破椽木上的鸣禽视为其神祇赐福的象征。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.G5INzQ5G3flm96zv]{朝圣者韦斯顿·默多克}。韦斯顿 (守序善良 人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.PVD5wRdyO7iCJPs1]{祭司 Priest}) 是一位极具魅力的男子。韦斯顿是柳沼村光明歌者们的领袖。他家附近总有成群的美丽鸣禽聚集，与占据鸽舍（V21区域）的鸽群之间常有摩擦。

V20: Post Office.name: V20: Post Office
V20: Post Office.text:
V20：邮局

邮局由西奥多拉·梅维尔负责管理，她利用一群训练有素的信鸽，维持着柳沼村与山谷中其他城镇，乃至其他地区更大城镇之间的信息服务。

邮局内存放着大量信件、消息、小卷轴和小型包裹。部分包裹通过马车运送，但许多消息和信件都小到足以通过信鸽发送。她的助手吉娜瓦·费尔柴尔德负责这些投递工作，因此在柳沼村鲜少露面。西奥多拉不在时，吉娜瓦便会在她不在镇上旅行时处理业务。

西奥多拉在镇郊另有居所，她大部分的闲暇时间都与鸽舍（V21区域）里的信鸽们待在一起。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.VaNLO4tFRFQteCtV]{邮局长西奥多拉·梅维尔}。西奥多拉·梅维尔是一位三十出头的女性，身材高挑纤细。她有一头白金色头发，总是扎成一束马尾，但在棕色皮帽下常常显得凌乱。她那双紫色的眼睛锐利而友善。她身穿朴素的棕色衣物，佩戴着鸽子形状的金耳环。她将钟爱的信鸽视如己出，其中一只鸟儿常栖息在她的肩头。

西奥多拉的真实身份是葛洛柏·灰喉，即@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Xcn9r6lnzzE4O85V]{信鸽鬼婆}*，也是秽鸣集会的领袖。她会修改或篡改每封进出柳沼村的信件，确保镇上的信息和人们的心智一样受到控制。当角色们发现她的真实身份时，将触发第二十章的事件。她会毫不犹豫地暗中协助角色们找出并杀死她的姐妹维斯拉（见第十二章）和斯托诺佳（见第十六章），以推进歪曲女王的阴谋。

V21: Dovecote.name: V21: Dovecote
V21: Dovecote.text:
V21：鸽舍

这座出奇之大的鸽舍，是用于投递邮件的信鸽的安居之所。鸽子的咕咕声与振翅声并不如想象中那般嘈杂。除了安置鸟儿的鸽棚与鸟笼外，这里还为邮局（V20区域）提供了额外的储藏空间。

这座鸽舍的宁静外表仅仅是一种幻象；它实际上是秽鸣集会的信鸽鬼婆葛洛柏·灰喉的可怕巢穴。这座鸽舍被施了魔法，能生出巨大的鸽子腿，使其可以从地面升起并在柳沼幽谷中行走。这只会在第二十章西奥多拉·梅维尔的真实身份被揭露后发生。

偷窥者阿尔伯特。 阿尔伯特 (@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.MCDX9BSPgJ1hfANf]{害兽魔宠（信鸽）}*) 是一只怪诞的鸽子，长着类人耳朵和人手般的爪子，是鬼婆葛洛柏·灰喉的魔宠。阿尔伯特在镇上和整个柳沼幽谷充当着鬼婆的耳目。在韦斯顿·默多克和其他光明歌者信徒抵达后不久出现的鸣禽，让偷窥者阿尔伯特格外恼火。

V22: Shade Funeral Home.name: V22: Shade Funeral Home
V22: Shade Funeral Home.text:
V22：谢德殡仪馆

作为柳沼村最引人注目的建筑之一，这座黑色大理石建筑便是殡葬师莫莉·谢德的家。建筑的地下室设有用以准备遗体的工作间，以便将其送往镇东南的梅德尼斯特公墓（见第十九章）安息，此外还有一个用于存放新近逝者遗体的冷藏室。主楼层设有会客区和举行仪式的场所。二楼则设有存放设备和棺材的储藏区，以及莫莉的起居室。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.qW1ISZTWxIFXukFA]{殡葬师莫莉·谢德}。 莫莉·谢德 (中立 人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.O3ABqI55Ir1du1Xa]{斥候 Scout}) 以死亡为业。这并未让她成为镇上的异类，反而赢得了人们的尊敬。人们信任她能以庄重与敬意处理他们的遗体。她对镇民的各种信仰颇感兴趣，因而也成了民间传说的良好来源。

莫莉身形娇小，年龄不详，举止庄重而又带着几分阴郁。她醒目的白发与一身黑色衣着形成鲜明对比。

莫莉不信奉柳沼幽谷的任何信仰。而是奉行陌行客（见第一章“幽幕”）的灵性信条，他们是亡者的摆渡人。她从掘墓人尤格瑞姆（见第十九章）那里学到了许多这些信条，并与他密切合作，为逝者举行恰当的葬礼。

V23: Antique Bookstore.name: V23: Antique Bookstore
V23: Antique Bookstore.text:
V23：古籍书屋

这座建筑的一层陈列着各种形制、主题、流派和种类的书籍。店里也出售纸张、羊皮纸、墨水、墨水笔，以及其他书写所需的文具用品。

二楼设有装帧书籍、制作墨水、纸张与羊皮纸的工具间，同时也是店主埃莉诺·海灵的住所。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.f6BBwhixYq98LXMV]{埃莉诺·海灵}，古籍学家。 埃莉诺·海灵（守序中立人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.GlaCGcgIP6YjBjGc]{贵族}）对珍本书籍的热爱一目了然——只要一踏进她的店里，就能看到她埋首于最新入手的书本之中。她从不出售一本自己未读过的书。有些人说她因阅读某些书籍而被诅咒，也有人说她从严谨的钻研中获得了魔法力量。

尽管埃莉诺才四十出头，但她看上去却比实际年龄大。长期的睡眠不足和用眼过度，使她患上了远视，身体也变得虚弱。她收养了妹妹的三个孩子：玛嘉丽、阿尔杰农与谢里登（中立善良人类非战斗平民 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{Commoners}）。他们大多数每夜都去上学，但除此之外，古怪的姨妈对他们基本放任自流。事实上，他们照顾姨妈的时间，往往比姨妈照顾他们的时间更多。

尽管埃莉诺一生都住在柳沼村，但她却坚定地属于新来者阵营。她尊重所有知识，也深信自己藏书带来的智慧，对镇上其他派系的奇怪仪式和信仰则持怀疑态度。

V24: Druskenvald Estate.name: V24: Druskenvald Estate
V24: Druskenvald Estate.text:
V24：德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园

这座新近更名为“德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园”的宅邸，坐落在俯瞰柳沼村的一座小丘上，就像一株疯长的野草，静候有人将其连根拔除。庄园中最引人注目的就是宅邸本身，因其奇特的歪斜结构，镇民们称之为“歪屋”。

这座宅邸曾被称为洛克伍德庄园，在被废弃多年之后，才于近期重新启用。索默顿镇长决定将庄园赠予菲利普·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德，他怀着渺茫的希望，盼望这位领主终于肯莅临他这简朴的村庄。他甚至动用公共资金来维护它，并派詹金一家搬进去，随时准备担任德鲁斯肯瓦尔德家的仆人。有关“歪屋”和詹金一家的更多信息，请参阅第十二章。

V25: Haunted Clocktower.name: V25: Haunted Clocktower
V25: Haunted Clocktower.text:
V25：闹鬼钟楼

附属于镇长住所兼办公室的高塔中，装着镇上的大钟。它一直走时精准，但钟声偶尔会在随机时刻敲响——每逢此时，奇异之事便随之而来。

如果你想随机决定钟楼何时发生闹鬼的钟声，可在角色们完成一次长休后掷一次[[/r d12]]。当夜，从晚间时分直到女巫时分，随机的钟声将会在掷出的那个小时响起。钟声一响起，一个不安的灵魂就会让角色们察觉到它的存在，无论是通过奇怪的声响、移动物件、在他们面前显形，还是完全显现并以 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.qoFEjfrANBdrCP6m]{幽魂}的形态发起攻击。

V26: The Old Pyethymer Place.name: V26: The Old Pyethymer Place
V26: The Old Pyethymer Place.text:
V26：老派泰默之屋

在柳沼村最古老的居民区，有一条狭窄的小巷，巷内有许多废弃的房屋。巷子的尽头便是老派泰默之屋，是其中最为破败的一栋。

镇上的孩子们宣称它被其前任住户的鬼魂所缠绕，有时还会怂恿彼此去亲自探索一番。这些孩子从未回来过，因为老派泰默之屋根本就不是一栋真正的房子，而是一座@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.gZG3Lxd820zA03iF]{恐怖屋}*。

V27: Homes.name: V27: Homes
V27: Homes.text:
V27：民居

零星的私人住宅散布在柳沼村的其余区域。其中一些住宅住着在村庄周边劳作的人们：农场工人、牧民、矿工、采石工、猎人、工匠或商人。

V28: Pavilion.name: V28: Pavilion
V28: Pavilion.text:
V28：凉亭

这座露天凉亭为村民提供了一个可以小憩片刻、在户外用餐、举行会议、售卖商品或进行其他公共活动的场所。

Other NPCs.name: Other NPCs
Other NPCs.text:
其他NPC

这些NPC不属于柳沼村任何一处具体地点。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.wQmCU77SNKfNPufu]{甘霖修女}，布道者。 甘霖修女（中立善良人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.PVD5wRdyO7iCJPs1]{祭司}）行走于幽谷之间，传扬那位恒心女士赐予世人的丰盛恩泽。她在村中没有正式居所，而是栖居于镇外的自然之地。她有时也会与她的会众同住，并在奠基者广场（区域V9）传道布教。甘霖修女的情绪与言行如她所崇敬的风雨自然一般变幻莫测。她常年过着游牧般的生活，穿梭于点缀柳沼幽谷的各个致力于恒心女士的公社之间。

甘霖修女是位身材苗条的女子，年约三十五六。她常穿一袭绿色花纹长裙，衬得那头火焰般的赤红长发格外亮眼。她的碧绿色眼眸闪烁着信仰的光芒，面部表情可以在喜悦与愤怒之间瞬间转换。她佩戴一条朴素的银项链，坠饰是盛开的向日葵造型。

甘霖修女是恒心女士圣修会的领袖，她倡导接纳并守护自然的馈赠。她的存在本身就令歪曲女王最狂热和邪恶的追随者深恶痛绝。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.dQ2pQrGGF1MwJSxs]{耶利米·斯托弗}，农民代表。 生活在柳沼村周边的农民们，为了供养村民，常年辛勤劳作，付出艰巨的体力。他们成立了一个初级工会，以确保自己的劳动能获得公平的报酬。他们选出的代表是耶利米·斯托弗（守序中立人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.Cy3A0rsNMPLZozam]{打手}），他是一位块茎作物农夫，虔诚信仰旧途，忠于土地，也忠于为土地付出的每一个劳动者，使他成为这项职责的理想人选。他在田间劳作的辛勤程度，丝毫不亚于他为同伴奔走呼吁的努力。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.FoEXbGf6JFGoRB3a]{加斯顿·多雷}，艺术家。 加斯顿·多雷（中立邪恶人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.tYfQIxCJT0WaaKmc]{邪教狂信者}）是一位画家，他的所有作品都带有一种超凡脱俗的缥缈气质。几年前，他在一个雾气弥漫之夜来到镇上，无人能查清他的来历。他年纪尚轻，下巴和脸颊上刚开始长出胡须。

阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德对加斯顿和他梦幻般的画作非常着迷，成为了他的赞助人。他对朋友和陌生人同样坦率真诚，有些人觉得他这份坦率令人耳目一新，也有人觉得难以接受。他的一切行为都带着一种沉思冥想的哲学意味，有时甚至对柳沼村的朴实村民而言显得荒谬不经。

加斯顿是凯琳表达幻象的媒介，这些幻象促使他在最近才开始加入歪曲女王的邪教仪式。随着冒险的推进，加斯顿的画作将变得愈发怪诞扭曲、令人不安。到冒险结束时，加斯顿会完全精神失常，听命于歪曲女王最邪恶的追随者。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.IITskk58xQ3Fu6DJ]{希尔达·布罗姆}，女猎人。尽管幽谷各处的农场供养着人们，但在庄稼歉收之时，野外狩猎依然是不可或缺的补充——甚至是一种获利颇丰的手段。希尔达·布罗姆（中立善良人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.O3ABqI55Ir1du1Xa]{斥候}）被誉为最熟练的猎人与捕兽者之一。初见时，她总给人一种狂野且不合群的印象，但对于她熟识和信任之人，她会展现自己的真性情。如果有罪犯逍遥法外，镇长和治安官便会求助于她，去追捕不同寻常的“猎物”。

希尔达是一位旧途信众，她对绿荫女王有着特殊的亲近感和崇敬之心。在那些阴森甚至鬼魅徘徊的荒野中，她所目睹的一切早已使她明白，灵界对这片土地的影响不可忽视。如果角色们在柳沼幽谷其他地方遇到麻烦，希尔达或许会现身并伸出援手。

Creating Your Own Adventures.name: Creating Your Own Adventures
Creating Your Own Adventures.text:
构建你的专属冒险

《歪曲之月》战役的总体叙事聚焦于歪曲女王爪牙的秘密图谋：他们企图将凯琳从歪曲之树中释放，并赋予角之王血肉之躯，从而开启一个瓦解、毁灭和歪曲重生的时代（见第八章）。这个阴谋贯穿本次冒险的各个章节，而每击败一个敌人，反而使他们的计划愈发逼近完成之时。请参阅后续章节中“重返柳沼村”的部分，以了解故事的发展将如何影响小镇。

然而，本章前文所提供的信息，仅涵盖了柳沼村可能存在的一小部分人物、地点和剧情。这个小镇应该被视为一个框架，让你能够构建自己的冒险，并将其穿插融入《歪曲之月》的整个事件中。你可以将以下细节作为灵感来源，充实冒险内容，使其真正成为你独一无二的创作。

支线剧情

如果你希望给角色们一些脱离主线剧情的休闲时间，并引导他们进行一些风险较低的支线任务，可以使用以下这些支线剧情。你需要自行设计剧情钩子，将角色们的注意力引导至这些事件上，并视自身故事需要来调整细节。这些支线剧情可以安插在任何冒险章节之间，当角色们返回柳沼村时使用。

血腥格斯归来

一年前，冷酷无情的杀手格斯·斯特朗——被民众称为“血肠”——因其罪行在众面之橡（区域V10）前受审并被斩首。在他被斩首的周年日，一位镇民以格斯杀害受害者的方式被谋杀。证据指向其中一名角色是凶手。通过寻找和追踪线索，可以为角色洗脱罪名，揭示血腥格斯的学徒继承了她师父的血腥勾当。

一个坏种

在一场庆祝近期水果、蜂蜜和奶制品丰收的特别野餐中，村民们开始在神秘情况下接连生病。野餐现场的线索指向被诅咒的苹果是罪魁祸首。角色们可以调查苹果园，在那里，一位镇民为了换取财富和力量，与邪魔订立了契约。必须杀死这名恶魔崇拜者和邪魔，才能打破正在影响野餐参与者的毁灭性诅咒。

浴血杯

村庄每年都会举办一次体育与游艺结合的庆典，柳沼幽谷各地的队伍齐聚一堂，展开角逐。今年，随着比赛连连发生“意外”，赛事变得血腥起来——或者说，比往常更加血腥。角色们可以代表柳沼村参赛，也可以旁观，但若无他们介入，这场比赛将演变为一场屠杀。

戏剧乃致命之物

由华丽的乔治·希科克率领的旅行剧团“希科克与同仁”应艾达·法纳姆之邀来到镇上，在绿荫女王旅店剧院上演一出戏剧。一名剧团成员在神秘情况下死亡。角色们能否侦破这起谋杀案？更重要的是，他们能否完成这部名为《黄金王子》的戏剧？

大乐透

一名陌生人来到镇上，承诺凡自愿参与抽签者，皆可赢得大奖。然而，陌生人并未透露，获胜者固然能获得丰厚奖品，但也会有人——也许不止一个人——会输掉抽签，并为此付出可怕的代价。角色们可以介入，但自身也可能面临付出代价的风险。

藏有秘密邪教的村庄

柳沼村暗藏着一个秘密邪教，每张友善笑脸背后，都可能是它潜伏的成员。你可以直接使用本章前文展示的NPC，但鼓励你调整他们的阵营、效忠对象和目标，使其最能提升你《歪曲之月》战役的独特冒险体验。

由于侍奉歪曲女王的邪教组织具有神秘性和欺骗性，并且与重要的旧途信众信仰有直接关联，任何NPC都可能暗中成为反派，供角色在令人震惊的转折中揭露其真面目。或者，那些被角色视为阴险狡诈的NPC，也可能被揭示出他们一直暗中与凯琳的爪牙作对。

为便于查阅，下文列出了为基础冒险而设定的柳沼村各类人群。你可以随意调整这些列表，以最契合你的需求，同时也要考虑到对命运编织（见第九章）以及未来任务引子的影响。建议你为与歪曲女王教派在罗温高丘（见第二十三章）的最终高潮对决做好准备，确保已埋下伏笔，并仔细思考角色们在整个冒险中与NPC建立的联系。

Chapter 25: Epilogue.name: Chapter 25: Epilogue
Chapter 25: Epilogue.text:
第25章：

尾声

“你知道吗，我从来不喜欢皆大欢喜的结局。这是在撒谎，可爱的谎言。当然，尽管每个人都知道这并非真相，即使是讲故事的人也一样。而一个结局苦乐参半的故事才是真的值得听的故事。如果不先品尝一堆苦涩的味道，你怎么能真正欣赏生活中为数不多的短暂甜蜜时刻呢？”

——漂泊客

菲利普·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德已死，而凯琳最终被击败。这两个灵魂的道路自亘古以前就被命运交织，如今终于走到了尽头。当他们走向无可避免的命运之后，身后留下来难以计量的死亡、毁灭和绝望。而幸存者当收拾残局。

在角之王和歪曲女王血腥而炽烈的陨落后，“歪曲之月”的故事便引来终结。等待着角色们的尾声取决于你和你的玩家们。

对史诗幻想感兴趣的玩家们可能会继续进行冒险，进入更高级别的游戏，你可以使用26章中提供的工具引导角色们一路在威克摩尔山谷中抵达20级。然而，在歪曲之树事件后结束冒险能提供最忠于民俗恐怖的精神的主题的体验。这篇尾声便是根据此写的。

What's Become of Wickermoor?.name: What's Become of Wickermoor?
What's Become of Wickermoor?.text:
威克摩尔变成了什么样？

在击败角之王和歪曲女王之后，角色们离开了女巫林，他们发现威克摩尔山谷因他们在谷中度过的这段时间彻底天翻地覆。尽管居住在这里的人民们已经习惯了充满苦难和恐怖的艰苦生活，但最近几周发生的事情让这里最坚强的居民也会深受震撼。

自角色们从幽幕之外抵达此地，在山谷中的所有地方中，威克摩尔村遭受的损害最为严重。在歪曲女王的爪牙们引发的混乱之后，一些居民希望找到能加以指责和报复的替罪羊，而另一些人则希望利用这混乱的局势来攫取权力。然而，大多数的居民都只想恢复旧日的生活，恢复到某种形式的日常之中。

具体到每个NPC受到什么样的影响很大程度上取决于角色们和他们的联系和做出的选择，以及你在整个冒险过程中选择如何将它们融入冒险，尤其是在罗温之丘上焚烧柳条人的过程中。

当角色们在威克摩尔村花时间完成未竟之事时，一定要注意将之前的情节联系起来，并为幸存下来并且对角色们变得重要起来的NPC们提供一个结局。村里不同信仰和群体的人民对最近的恐怖事件有以下反应。

旧途信徒

随着对歪曲女王的崇拜被揭露并几乎消灭殆尽，那些崇拜着“绿荫女王”并从未堕落至邪恶的旧途信徒们的迷信和信念会更加根深蒂固，他们将同胞的腐化归结于多年以来山谷中新来的邪恶理念的影响。他们变得更加不信任非信徒和不属于他们社区的人，甚至把其他群体的成员也赶了出去。威克摩尔山谷和其中的定居点退回到了旧途的理念和舒适圈中。

耐心女士圣修会

许多耐心女士的信徒认为魔法和古怪的超自然力量必将带来末日，并得出结论：他们必须逃离这种末日，并相信荒野会为他们提供力量。他们赶走了自己拥有魔法力量的成员，离开了威克摩尔山谷的定居点，在他们认为是乐园的自然世界中重新安家——即便他们并没有生存技能来承受等待着他们的恶劣环境。

明光歌者

和耐心女士修会不同，明光歌者们并未对社区失去希望，他们认为最近的灾难证明了山谷中古怪的迷信和残酷的信仰是异端行径，正是它几乎导致德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的毁灭。他们热忱地希望将民众持有的过时信仰的转化为充满光明、爱和真理的新宗教，于是他们召集了耕读传教士来到山谷，开始积极传播他们的信仰。

新来者

菲利普·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的死代表他曾经象征的一切的崩溃。他所有的远见、前瞻性思维、进步和启蒙都未能从旧日的憎恶之中拯救他的生命。山谷中新来者们看到他们已经所剩无几，抱有的希望也十分渺茫。这些人中的大部分将离开威克摩尔山谷，去寻找和他们有共同理念的文明，他们甚至会去搭乘幽灯列车，去探索德鲁斯肯瓦尔德以外的新世界。

Foxwillow.name: Foxwillow
Foxwillow.text:
福克斯柳

尽管过去快乐而勤劳的福克斯柳居民之间有着深厚的友谊，但他们被困在群鸦之田中的时间让他们付出了代价。在重建福克斯柳的过程中，被发掘和暴露出的秘密薄纱下了怀疑、不信任和羞愧的种子。耐心女士被人民抛弃，冲突慢慢渗入。然而，在最为黯淡无光之时，一个来自山谷之外的独腿陌生人来到了这里，将社区围绕着一位四风之神团结在一起。在这个名叫维吉尔的人的带领下，福克斯柳的友谊再度得以延续。

Dawn’s Gate.name: Dawn’s Gate
Dawn’s Gate.text:
黎明之门

如果角色们没有公开“血焰蔷薇”的邪魔身份，权力真空和随后的控制权争夺也会不可避免地暴露维菈克西丝的真相。这一宗教在暴力冲突之后被弃如敝履，从前的信徒们和黎明之门的信徒们因为曾长期恐吓和操控他们的信仰而团结在一起。任何的信仰崇拜现在都是非法的，骑手们定期巡逻，对传教士和布道者带去判决和复仇。

Murkwater Bend.name: Murkwater Bend
Murkwater Bend.text:
浊水弯

随着蹒跚的死者带来的威胁不再，浊水弯的人民能够回归到自己的平静生活之中，直到沉沦岔路的沼泽树上开始绽放蛇眼木兰，这是一种巨大而有多重功能的花，能够用于治疗、娱乐施法等。浊水弯引来了巨大的繁荣，范德尔·布恩甚至和新月王庭联系，希望能实现他们最疯狂的梦想，包括让其中不守规矩的家伙屈服和提议将威克摩尔山谷合法化成为一个官方认可的省份。

The Last Ride.name: The Last Ride
The Last Ride.text:
最后一程

当角色们处理完他们在威克摩尔山谷最后的剩下的事情，而你也为故事画上了最后的句号，幽灯特快列车会抵达，并把角色们载去他们希望去的地方。他们可能会希望重返家乡，把德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的恐怖给抛到脑后，他们可能会希望去探索在这片永夜之地的其他行省有什么等待着他们，或者他们去幽幕之中其他古怪世界浪迹天涯。可能性无穷无尽，但最重要的是，他们在这个故事中的部分已经迎来了终结。

漆黑的老火车来了

午夜时分，在角色们做好离开威克摩尔山谷的准备时，请读出或转述以下内容：

午夜时分的黑暗笼罩着你们，而浓雾笼罩着整座山谷，令人毛骨悚然。一把小提琴微弱而渺远的音乐在空中飘荡。随后，一声尖锐的哨音穿透夜晚的宁静，火车头的轰隆、嘎吱和刮擦声响接踵而至。随着幽灯特快列车的车头乘着雾轨道从黑暗中轰鸣而出，一圈幽幽的蓝绿色灯光在雾气中越来越大…它先是减速，然后在你们面前尖啸着停了下来。

乘客车厢昏暗的窗户边，车门吱嘎作响地开启。漂泊客跳出车门，他的嘴里叼着一根麦子，破旧的裤子后兜里塞着那把可靠的令人安心的小提琴。蛙人露出一个狡黠的微笑，会意地眨了眨眼，“里们该不会以为我把你们都忘了吧！来，都上车咯！”

角色们再次想起，他们每个人都有一张幽灯特快列车的单程票，但这一次，票上写的是“目的地：未知”。漂泊客漫不经心地为自个儿花了许多时间才修好火车头道歉，声称自己遇到了一些他“不会详细说明”的情况。他告诉角色们，他还欠他们一程，并询问他们要去何方。

如果提起菲利普和阿黛拉，他会摘下帽子，短暂默哀片刻，然后表示对听到他们发生的事情十分遗憾，但他也会耸耸肩，说死亡会降临到每个人身上——即使是那些永生不朽者。他分享了些流言，说新月王庭的权力真空导致了宫中的领主和夫人们之前的权力斗争，最近子夜月影女巫会的邪恶活动则加剧了这场斗争。

当角色们把票交给漂泊客，并告诉他他们希望去的地方时，他会欣然答应，并欢迎他们登车。这次旅行中车上没有幽灵旅客。当角色们都上车后，蛙人跳进驾驶室，准备继续前行。

当这次团、整场冒险和战役结束时，读出或转述以下内容：

火车头奏响一阵幽幽的汽笛，幽光特快列车缓慢起步，驶入雾中。透过车厢的窗户，你们最后看了一眼威克摩尔山谷，看到山谷上方扭曲的月亮，它正嘲笑着下方的土地。随着月亮缓缓远去，你们几乎能感受到它满溢仇恨的目光落到你们的身上，最后，窗外只剩下匆匆掠过的雾气。

漂泊客的声音在车厢中呱呱响起的时候，你们正坐在一起，思考你们在这趟旅途中经历的恐怖、悲伤和英勇之举。

“启程了，朋友们！前路漫漫，但当其时至，终有竟时。现在，暂且安心，雾轨伶仃，夜风渺渺，而我们且乘一车，共赴此行！”

故事便在此落幕。

Chapter 9: Running the Adventure.name: Chapter 9:  Running the Adventure
Chapter 9: Running the Adventure.text:
Chapter 9:

Running the Adventure

Now You are about to weave your own dreadful tale that will terrify and delight your friends. This adventure, The Crooked Moon, is a folk horror story applied to 5E, a game of heroic fantasy. Interweaving these themes is no small challenge, but this chapter and the stories ahead are written to provide you with the tools you need to achieve a thrilling and haunting campaign.

As the Game Master (GM), it is your role to play as the world of Druskenvald itself and everything else within it. You are the deep woods, the shadows between the trees, and the monsters that stalk the eternal night. You are the folk, both sinister and sincere, that inhabit the sleepy villages and remote homesteads on the fringes of civilization.

You are also guiding your friends, who take the role of Player Characters (referred to as “characters” in this adventure). They are the protagonists of this horror story, and you are responsible for being their senses; they cannot fully experience the terror of Druskenvald without knowing what they see, hear, smell, and touch—and sometimes taste. To refresh yourself on how to run folk horror and instill dread and tension, refer to the Introduction of this book.

While the previous chapter overviewed the story of The Crooked Moon, this chapter highlights the relevant features and mechanical details of the campaign, as well as tips and tricks for reading the book. Most of the features and systems below are entirely optional, and the adventure is written so that none are required. It is up to you to determine what to implement to run a game that is best suited for your table.

Adventure Features

Each chapter in the adventure includes background information, general guidance, and location features, as well as how encounters, NPCs, and monsters should be presented and where their treasure might be found.

Pay close attention to the formatting and cross-references throughout each chapter. When a creature’s name is bolded and marked with a * symbol (for example, the @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.zCFEcKc4a46mHGjB]{Hypnovulfen}*), the creature’s stat block can be found in Appendix A: Bestiary. When a magic item’s name is italicized and marked with a * symbol (for example, the Scythe of the Harvest Terror*), the magic item’s details can be found in Appendix B: Treasury. Backgrounds, spells, and other options from within this book are also marked in this way.

Boxed text that appears like this is meant to be read or paraphrased aloud.

 

 

GM Sidebar

Text that looks like this is for advice or other helpful information that will help you run the adventure.

Lost in Isolation

The Crooked Moon assumes that the only means of traveling in and out of Druskenvald is through the Shroud with the guidance of entities like The Vagrant—soul shepherds called “Strangers” (see chapter 1). Additionally, once the characters arrive in Wickermoor Hollow with Phillip and Adela Druskenvald, the ancient power of Kehlenn, the Crooked Queen, ensnares them and prevents them from leaving the province. Wickermoor Hollow has the following features if you wish to keep the characters trapped and alone:

In the Mist. No magic, such as @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.J6Jpw5XzB5aTeqnz]{Plane Shift} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsterfeatures.Item.PPzVD90vab60FqCt]{Teleport}, can transport a creature beyond the borders of Druskenvald without being shepherded by a Stranger.

Crooked Grasp. Physical and magical travel out of Wickermoor Hollow is made impossible by ancient wards. When a creature tries to exit, it gets lost and ends up being teleported to a forest within the valley.

Cut Off. Any attempts to communicate magically with creatures outside of Wickermoor Hollow automatically fail.

Fear of the Dark

In a horror campaign, requiring all characters to deal with the aspects of night that instill fear in humanity can increase the tension and dread. You can use the following optional rules to limit certain characters’ features to make the sleeping hours more horrifying. If you wish to implement them, be sure to discuss the details with your players ahead of the campaign to ensure it enhances the fun for your table.

All Must Sleep. While in Druskenvald, characters who don’t need to sleep during long rests in other realms must sleep to stave off exhaustion, though they can still resist magic that might put them to sleep, if able.

Creeping Dark. Characters who benefit from darkvision find this trait suppressed, though magic that grants darkvision such as from a spell or magic item still functions. This does not affect monsters or NPCs.

Time in Druskenvald

As a realm of eternal night, Druskenvald’s unusual time cycle (see chapter 1) is an essential part of the setting’s atmosphere. While a sun never rises above the horizon, the amount of light and the color of the sky change throughout each night, from the purple of Twilight Hour, through the orange glow Dusk Hour, to the blues of Nightfall Hour and Evening Hour, and finally the pitch black of Midnight Hour and Witching Hour.

Note the time when describing the land’s natural light and weather, and reflect it through the dialogue of NPCs who have an intuitive sense of Druskenvald’s unique night cycle. While it can be tricky to enforce this language throughout the game, and it’s fine to refer to real-world time periods for clarity, using cues like “We leave at the Twilight Hour” or “Let’s settle in before the Witching Hour” makes for a more immersive experience.

Time in Druskenvald

Period NameEquivalent Time Range
Twilight HourMorning (7 to 11 a.m.)
Dusk HourMidday (11 a.m. to 3 p.m.)
Nightfall HourAfternoon (3 to 7 p.m.)
Evening HourEvening (7 to 11 p.m.)
Midnight HourLate Night (11 p.m. to 3 a.m.)
Witching HourEarly Morning (3 to 7 a.m.)

Overland Travel

Wickermoor Village serves as the hub of the adventure, and most chapters involve the characters traveling from what little safety is offered there to another remote location within Wickermoor Hollow. Though travel in the valley is rarely straightforward, you may pick up each chapter where it begins and convey the characters back to town after each chapter by briefly narrating the travel in between.

If you choose to simulate overland travel between each location, the following options can help your players get a better sense of Wickermoor Hollow’s size:

  • Use the map of Wickermoor Hollow to estimate travel distances. The map of this province is deliberately not to scale, and the details on it are not precise, which allows for flexibility in this folktale adventure. However, an easy shorthand in determining travel distances is that most of the areas throughout the valley are a three-to-five night trek from Wickermoor Village, depending on how treacherous and overgrown the terrain is. Exceptions to this include Foxwillow and Maidenmist Cemetery, which are a one-to-two night walk on foot.

  • No journey is a direct route, and there are few well-traveled roads in the valley. It is up to your discretion how many nights it takes to follow the valley’s winding paths to the characters’ destinations.

  • Change the weather and vary terrain to create a feeling of distance. Successful Nature, Perception, and Survival checks can aid travel and avoid dangers.

  • You can add combat encounters with creatures featured in Appendix A or other sources to reinforce the coming chapter’s themes and make the valley feel dangerous. These encounters should serve the narrative and not feel random.

Overland travel can give characters time to reflect, interact, and plan. Strategically allot moments for travel when the story has an opportunity to slow down; it can make the valley feel alive and hint at the horrors that await. But, do not dally when precious game time is limited—jump to the next step with a brief description.

Mortality

Death is never far in Druskenvald. When a character dies, their spirit lingers in Druskenvald until the Crooked Queen is defeated. At your discretion, if there is little chance for resurrection, you may offer players a chance to deny their character's death by accepting a Dark Bargain of your choice (see chapter 6), which restores the character to life with all of their hit points. This is a great narrative opportunity to add additional consequences aside from what is included in the features of the Dark Bargain.

Deaths of the Druskenvalds. Phillip and Adela Druskenvald are two key NPCs whose fates play a pivotal role in the climax of the adventure. Their deaths are fated to occur in chapters 24 and 23, respectively. Any attempts by the characters to kill Phillip and Adela fail, and the ancient power of Kehlenn teleports them to safety so they can be sacrificed at the right moment.

Character Advancement

The Crooked Moon takes characters from 1st level to 14th level. The campaign is designed with specific story moments for character advancement instead of awarding XP. Nearly every chapter advances the characters’ level at its conclusion. Use the table below to guide level advancement throughout the adventure.

If you and your players wish to continue the dreadful folktale past the primary storyline of The Crooked Moon, refer to the rules and guidance in Chapter 26: Moonfall.

 

 

Campaign Overview

Fated Tarot Reading

 

When the characters first meet Phillip and Adela Druskenvald aboard the Ghostlight Express in chapter 10, Adela offers to give the characters a tarot reading. Simplified guidance for performing this reading is provided in the chapter, but below are rules to enhance the experience in a way that affects the adventure and foreshadows what’s to come.

Fabled Rewards

Many Fabled Heirlooms—magic items that level up with the characters—are presented in this book and can be found throughout the adventure of The Crooked Moon. However, provisioning the characters with a veritable treasure trove of powerful items could quickly trivialize the threats that await them.

Therefore, the Fated Tarot Reading provides a method to determine which of the Fabled Heirlooms the characters can acquire. When Adela performs the reading aboard the Ghostlight Express, she uses only a portion of a full 78-card tarot deck. Instead, she shuffles the 22 most important cards, known as the Major Arcana, and pulls one for each character. Each card corresponds to a Fabled Heirloom or a powerful boon that can be found at specific points throughout the adventure (see “Major Arcana” below).

When the reading is complete, make note of which cards were pulled. Then, as you run the adventure, keep an eye out for sections titled “Fated Tarot Reading,” each of which features a Major Arcana card, its corresponding item or boon, and the location it can be found or the circumstance needed to achieve it. Only implement the features of these sections that include the cards that were drawn during the reading. Ignore all other instances of these chapter sections.

To determine these randomly, you can use your own tarot deck, shuffling the 22 Major Arcana cards and pulling them at the table. Alternatively, you can roll on the Fated Tarot table below. If you wish to equip the characters with items that are fitting for their abilities or story, you can simply choose a card for each character instead of drawing randomly. If you want to provide the characters with additional power throughout the adventure, you can have each character receive a two-card reading.

 

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.PgDCRgyABMbAxork]{Fated Tarot Table}

 

Major Arcana

Below are all 22 Major Arcana cards that can be pulled in the Fated Tarot Reading, along with Adela Druskenvald’s interpretation of the cards, who always pulls the cards in the upright position. You’ll also find the Fabled Heirloom or boon that each card corresponds to, as well as where it can be found in The Crooked Moon adventure. For all Fabled Heirlooms, see appendix B.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-cards.Cards.hE6QSAetov5iFigA.Card.bua4Ly31V79Ge0SA]{0 - The Fool}

“Ooooo! The Fool! I love this card! New adventures, new beginnings, new opportunities; who could say no to that? It’s almost like it’s telling you that a new journey awaits you the moment you step off this train, don’t you think?”

If The Fool is pulled, the @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.pRwxN131RskdKA0Y]{Whistle of the Vagrant}* is left in the grass after the defeat of the Ghostlight Locomotive (see chapter 10).

Fateweaving

Fateweaving provides an optional framework to intertwine the characters’ individual stories throughout the adventure of The Crooked Moon, allowing for a more personalized experience that does not require heavy alterations to the broader narrative. You can implement this system to provide each character with a call to action, rewards tied to narrative progression, and the opportunity to experience a full personal arc.

These character arcs all end with the climax and conclusion of the main adventure of The Crooked Moon, and the narrative results that the characters achieve are often immense and intended to come with the end of a protagonist’s story as a player character. Fateweaving is written with the intention that your campaign concludes in the Epilogue and does not proceed into the events of Moonfall (see chapter 26), though you can adjust to allow for play beyond the scope of the adventure.

How to Use Fateweaving

You can incorporate Fateweaving into your adventure by taking the following steps, each of which is expanded upon later in this section:

Select a Goal. Have each player pick a Thread of Fate from the list of thirteen presented below, which provides a specific goal for their character. Each character should follow a different Thread so they can experience their own unique story.

Personalize. Work with each player to incorporate the Thread of Fate into their character’s backstory and motivation. They (or you) will need to make one major choice to customize the Thread to the specific character.

Review Touchpoints. Once the Threads of Fate are selected and personalized, review the six major Narrative Touchpoints for each Thread that you will weave into your adventure. These are the key story moments that provide each character with a complete arc.

Follow Symbols. Each Thread of Fate has a unique symbol associated with it. As you read through the adventure, keep an eye out for the symbols connected to the characters’ Threads, each instance of which marks a location or moment when and where a Narrative Touchpoint occurs.

Implement Touchpoints. As you run the adventure, incorporate each character’s Narrative Touchpoint at the appropriate place, and make it clear that the relevant character has the spotlight when this occurs.

Distribute Rewards. Each time a character completes a Narrative Touchpoint, reward them with its respective boon listed in the following section.

Finish the Story. Continue this process until the adventure concludes, where you can deliver the final emotional Catharsis of each character’s arc.

Narrative Touchpoints

Fateweaving provides a full narrative arc for each character’s personal journey that unfolds in six major moments throughout the adventure called Narrative Touchpoints. These take each character from the Incitement of their quest all the way through the Catharsis at the end of their story. The location of each Narrative Touchpoint within the adventure differs depending on a character’s Thread of Fate.

Each of the Narrative Touchpoints are written to be open ended and not prescriptive so that they are easily customizable for a wide variety of backstories. It is up to you how to tailor each one to the specific character. Each Touchpoint should be accessible without ability checks and should not be easily missed.

Familiarizing yourself with the six types of Narrative Touchpoints and their associated rewards will help you interweave each progressive step along every character’s journey.

Incitement

The first Narrative Touchpoint connects a character’s Thread of Fate with the story of The Crooked Moon and affirms that the goal of their personal quest lies ahead in Druskenvald.

Chapter Placement. This inciting moment can occur either aboard the Ghostlight Express (chapter 10) or in the Crooked House (chapter 12).

Reward. A character who encounters their Incitement receives inspiration.

Connection

The second Narrative Touchpoint takes the form of meeting a villager from Wickermoor Village who bears a particular connection with a character’s Thread of Fate and offers clues, aid, and guidance. Make note of how this Connection NPC's partnership with the character might affect their allegiances and potential involvement in future plot developments, particularly during the events of Wicker’s Vigil (see chapter 23).

Chapter Placement. This NPC can be found in Wickermoor Village (chapter 11) and should only be encountered after the character has completed their Incitement Touchpoint but before they follow a quest hook that leads to their Discovery Touchpoint.

Reward. In addition to gaining an ally whose attitude becomes friendly, a character who meets their Connection gains the effects of the Bless spell for 24 hours.

Discovery

The third Narrative Touchpoint involves the character achieving the first key victory of their quest and learning a shocking truth or obtaining hidden knowledge about their Thread of Fate that points them toward the major Confrontation of their arc.

Chapter Placement. This moment of Discovery occurs while the characters explore one of the following locations during chapters 13–17: the Fields of the Crow, the Crimson Monastery, the Drowned Crossroads, Skitterdeep Mine, or Memory’s Rest Sanatorium.

Reward. A character who uncovers their Discovery gains a Twist of Fate that lasts until it is expended. Once per turn, when a creature the character can see makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, the character can expend one Twist of Fate to replace the d20 roll with a 1 or a 20.

Confrontation

The fourth Narrative Touchpoint involves confronting a major challenge, threat, or dilemma that was pointed to in the knowledge gained from the Discovery Touchpoint. This allows the character to achieve a victory crucial to their Thread of Fate and to learn of one final objective they must complete in order to finish their personal quest.

Chapter Placement. This momentous Confrontation can occur during chapters 18–22 when the characters face the horrors of Hartsblight Forest, Maidenmist Cemetery, the Roving Rookery, Fool’s Day, or the Crooked Nightmare.

Reward. A character who prevails after their Confrontation increases one ability score of their choice by 2. This increase can’t raise a score above 24.

Climax

The fifth Narrative Touchpoint is the grand finale of the character’s story arc, where they complete the final objective of their Thread of Fate and fully realize the goal they sought to achieve in Druskenvald.

Chapter Placement. This epic Climax occurs during chapter 24, with the character’s ultimate objective intertwined with the defeat of the Horned King and the Crooked Queen.

Reward. In addition to finally accomplishing the goal of their personal quest, a character who resolves their Climax gains a feat of their choice.

Catharsis

The sixth and final Narrative Touchpoint is the conclusion of the character’s personal story arc, resolving their Thread of Fate and providing the outcome that results from achieving their goal.

Chapter Placement. This final Catharsis occurs at the end of the adventure during the Epilogue.

Reward. The emotional Catharsis achieved through the resolution of a character’s story arc.

Threads of Fate

Threads of Fate are thirteen possible personal story arcs that can be woven into the adventure of The Crooked Moon. Each Thread provides a goal for a character to pursue, plot elements to incorporate into their backstory, player choices that personalize the experience, the call of adventure that sets the character on the path to Druskenvald, and six Narrative Touchpoints throughout the adventure that provide a full character arc and rewards for resolving each step.

For ease of use, each Thread of Fate has thematic and narrative connections to one of the thirteen new backgrounds included in this book (see chapter 4). However, any character can select any Thread regardless of their background. Share these Thread options, their initial story elements, and any starting questions with your players, but keep the details of the Threads’ Narrative Touchpoints (presented in the following pages) a secret. You can also use these as inspiration to create your own Threads of Fate.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.sItP7SvfJmsxzfP7]{Thread of Apocalypse}

A character bound by the Thread of Apocalypse has lost their memories and forgotten a large portion of their past. Stranger still, the tune of an unknown yet familiar song triggers terrible visions of an impending apocalypse that only the character can prevent.

Goal. The character must discover who they are and the meaning of their apocalyptic visions to stop the doom coming to Druskenvald.

Personalization. Determine the nature of the song that heralds the visions of doom. Which genre of music is it? What are the lyrics about? How does the song relate narratively or thematically to the character? What hints about a past life are in the song?

Call to Adventure. The character inadvertently hears the triggering song, which is unknown to them but sounds strangely familiar. They are stricken with a vision of an entire world and the countless souls within being disintegrated and reformed into twisted abominations, followed by the premonition of a ghost train emerging from the fog wherever the adventure begins.

Associated Background. @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.eXiYn1EUZb40Xbbs]{Amnesiac}*

Narrative Touchpoints

Incitement. While in the Sleeper Car aboard the Ghostlight Express (area G2), the phonograph suddenly plays a new yet eerily familiar rendition of the prophetic song. This initiates another apocalyptic vision that ends with a scene of a porch with a group of masked nurses surrounding a stranger in a rocking chair, muttering the character’s name.

Connection. While visiting the Apothecary Shop (area V6), Morgan is quick to share that they have also lost their memories, finding kinship with the character. They mention that they had received a pamphlet for Memory’s Rest Sanatorium, which claimed that the hospital could help with finding one’s identity, but Morgan never made the trip.

Discovery. On the Moon Porch of Memory’s Rest Sanatorium (area L3), a patient sways in a rocking chair with wild eyes, muttering the character’s name. When they see the character, they recognize them and repeatedly say, “The calliope! The hidden moon! The last mistake!” but cannot be shaken from their stupor.

Confrontation. While in the Festival Square of the Festival of Fools (area C2), the character is drawn to a strange calliope. They discover a moon-shaped button hidden behind a panel and words etched in their own handwriting: “The Goat Lies.” When pressed, a discordant but familiar version of the song plays, provoking a vision that ends with a large goat’s skull and someone screaming “Sacrifice it!”

Climax. Following the triumph over the Horned King and the sacrifice to burn the Crooked Tree, the character’s original memories return. Remembering endless variations of the Crooked Queen’s victory, the character realizes that in their past, they unlocked the ability to manipulate time. Through time travel, they worked through several timelines to guide this version of the character to succeed. With this newly remembered power, they have the opportunity to create a new timeline that avoids all the previous deaths.

Catharsis. If the character decides to attempt an even greater victory with less bloodshed, they disappear in a flash of light, and their companions never see them again in the current timeline as they travel through time to prevent as many deaths as possible. If they decide to remain in this timeline, they believe they can use their temporal powers to help those beyond Wickermoor Hollow.

A character bound by the Thread of Ascendancy strives to rise to greatness and become an otherworldly monarch. They are guided by the inane ramblings of the spectral head of a fool, imperceivable to anyone else, whose cryptic rhymes contain surprising wisdom and even a prophecy of an ascendant rebirth.

Goal. The character must decipher the ramblings of their fool and discover what must be done to ascend beyond mortality and be reborn into a powerful supernatural entity.

Personalization. Determine the otherworldly nature of the desired ascension. Does the character wish to become a lord of the heavens, the hells, the Fey lands, or the deathly realms? Did they seek this type of ascension before encountering their fool or was it instigated by the spirit? Why does the character pursue such a transformational rebirth?

Call to Adventure. The character is present during or even accidentally causes the beheading of a fool, whose bodiless spirit haunts them. They soon realize there is truth and prescience woven through the specter’s often incoherent ramblings, and a single strange rhyme of fools, monarchs, rebirth, and ascension points to a particular gloomy time and place where the adventure begins.

Associated Background. @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.nhHq0RtlwSi7KbIP]{Reveler}*

Narrative Touchpoints

Incitement. In the Circus Car of the Ghostlight Express (area G7), a large poster showcasing the Festival of Fools draws the character’s attention. Their spectral fool looks at it wildly and babbles: “In paradise, the angels hang upside down and the fire shoots right side up, but the bells still ring in silver!”

Connection. While in the Green Queen Inn (area V1), Innkeeper Alda Farnum can sense the haunting fool and is drawn to the character. She herself seeks to ascend to a great green Fey queen to ensure immense wealth and power for eternity. Throughout the adventure, she can point out sources of interplanar meddling, hoping to hear secrets she can use.

Discovery. While in the Watchful Belfry of the Crimson Monastery (area M14), the character’s spectral fool’s head dives into a hellfire brazier and gains a ghostly body before proclaiming: “In paradise, the fools are lords and the lords are fools, but all must die for a dream of kings and queens!”

Confrontation. After the death of Chuckles during the Festival of Fools, the character’s fool claims the remnants of the wooden puppet and is reborn into a new otherworldly body. Its new form takes on the visage of the same type of entity that the character seeks to ascend to. It bows before them and exclaims: “In paradise, a herald needs some good shoulders under their head to usher in the monarch, but there can only be one, and goats are for supper!”

Climax. Following the death of the Horned King and the burning of the Crooked Tree, the character’s fool appears and presents a crown-like jester’s cap made of ash and horn. The fool bellows: “In paradise, a fool for a day is a monarch for all time, but who shall wear the bells and leave their friends behind?” The character must choose to ascend to transcendent power or remain mortal and crown the fool instead.

Catharsis. If the character is crowned, they undergo a transformation into a powerful, otherworldly monarch exactly how they envisioned. As the character ascends to their desired “paradise,” they leave behind their former companions and the fool. If they reject the crown, the fool undergoes this ascension instead, and the character can bring the wisdom from their strange journey to lands beyond Wickermoor Hollow.

They follow a soul-powered compass that they hope will lead to the artifact’s pieces and the truth behind its fateful purpose once made whole.

Goal. The character must find all three of the pieces of the fractured artifact and restore it to discover its origin, true power, and how to harness it for themselves.

Personalization. Determine what type of item the family heirloom is and why it’s special to the character. Who was the family member they inherited it from, and what was their relationship like? Which Druskenvald province was it retrieved from and how did they first find it?

Call to Adventure. After the character retrieved the inherited heirloom from Druskenvald, their return trip aboard the Ghostlight Express was interrupted by a hooded, lantern-bearing figure that stole the artifact, split it into three pieces, and ejected the character from the train into the Shroud. The character miraculously survived and emerged somewhere in the mortal realms with a strange, broken compass in their possession. Time has since passed, but one night, the compass glows with ghastly energy, its needle pointing toward wherever the adventure begins.

Associated Background. @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.yXDj2J5izzGu6Xtm]{Ghostlight Passenger}*

Narrative Touchpoints

Incitement. While in the Passenger Car of the Ghostlight Express (area G1) after the attack of the Phantom Trainhopper, the wisps of the Shroud cause the compass to whirr to life. Its needle points toward the spectral firebox in the Tender (area G8), directly at the name stamped in the metal: Stranger Ferryworks.

Connection. While visiting Tolliver’s Trading Post (area V5), Baltus Tolliver shows a keen interest in strange artifacts from across Druskenvald and beyond the Shroud. He knows of another engine in the valley from Stranger Ferryworks, aboard the Dead Man’s Hand riverboat. Throughout the adventure, he suggests where strange items might be found.

Discovery. In the Boiler Room of the Dead Man’s Hand riverboat (area B4), the first piece of the character’s family heirloom can be found tucked behind or beneath the boiler. Retrieving it causes the compass to pulse with soulfire and point toward Maidenmist Cemetery.

Confrontation. While in the Shadestone Sanctuary of Maidenmist Cemetery (area Y9), the compass points toward a statue of a hooded figure with a lantern, exactly like the one who attacked the character. The second piece of the artifact is held in its stone grasp. When the character takes the piece, their name suddenly etches itself in the base of the statue, and the compass spins wildly.

Climax. If the characters are victorious over the Crooked Queen in the Wytchwood, the compass vibrates and points into the barrow. Within, entangled in roots, is the final piece of the character’s artifact. When all three pieces are assembled, a fog rolls in and the hooded figure emerges, revealing themselves as the relative who left them the artifact. They have become a Stranger (see chapter 1) and offer the character the same opportunity.

Catharsis. If the character accepts the offer, they become a ferryman of dead souls, and the artifact becomes the primary instrument of calling their vehicle or warding against the Shroud. They leave into the mist with their family member to continue their duty. If they do not accept, the character can use their artifact to help lost souls outside of Wickermoor Hollow.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.ok2mzY0o9A4PP619]{Thread of Duality}

A character bound by the Thread of Duality has a soul that they severed in two in the hopes of expunging their mortal sins, vices, and flaws. A near-exact duplicate born of sin itself commits increasingly wicked acts under the guise of the character, working toward a nefarious goal that only the character can stop as they communicate with their doppelganger through mirrors and other reflections.

Goal. The character must track down their sinful duplicate, uncover the nature of the copy’s wicked plot, and find a way to mend their severed soul to bring an end to their counterpart’s vile and catastrophic machinations.

Personalization. Determine how the duplicate both mirrors and differs from the character in appearance and behavior. What sin most defines the doppelganger, what is their greatest moral flaw, and why did the character so drastically act to purge them? What did the soul severing process require? How does the character now behave differently?

Call to Adventure. The character receives news of or discovers heinous acts allegedly committed by them. Following the trail of sin, they eventually see a reflection of themselves, but something is off, and the eyes are full of menace. The doppelganger speaks to the character with taunts and threats, mentioning catching a train and leaving clues that point toward where the adventure begins.

Associated Background. @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.FD6ZGAVnJJAURzdg]{Reflected Wanderer}*

Narrative Touchpoints

Incitement. While in the Music Room of the Crooked House (area H5), the character’s reflection in the oval mirror flashes a wicked grin and hefts a bloody axe. Behind them lies a field of butchered corpses. The doppelganger states that, as a being born of sin, they can consume sin itself to grow stronger, and Druskenvald is filled with it. They claim murder alone is insufficient; sin must also include vices and base pleasures. The reflection then returns to normal.

Connection. Near Wickermoor Schoolhouse (area V8), Finneas Trout approaches the character, noting their resemblance to a stranger who passed through weeks before a string of grisly murders, after which they headed northeast. Fascinated by the character and their double, Finneas, who studied “The Grey” curse of his home province of Edwardia (see chapter 1), offers insights on instances of duality throughout the adventure.

Discovery. In the Gambling Hall of the Dead Man’s Hand (area B3), the riverboat’s tall windows reflect the character’s doppelganger, who is surrounded by mountains of gold, food, drink, game pieces, and other tokens of indulgence. The copy claims to be nearly ready to become a god of sin and mocks the character’s ignorance of souls. They flash a grin of razor-sharp teeth before vanishing.

Confrontation. After arriving at the Great Sepulcher in Maidenmist Cemetery (area Y2), Yorgrim sees the severed soul and explains that the character must reunite both souls to stop the doppelganger’s actions. He shares that, just like his Fallen friends, every soul must be accepted with both the good and bad. The process of reigniting the Balefire Beacons grants the character a sufficient understanding of soul magic to defy their copy and rejoin the souls.

Climax. After destroying the Horned King and burning the Crooked Tree, the duplicate emerges from the tree line, visible to all for the first time, with a maw of crooked sharp teeth. The copy sucks in the black ash from the Horned King’s remains, turns into smoke, and declares that sin never ends and that the Horned King will return one day more devastating than before. This presents an opportunity for the character to fuse the souls together or let the duplicate go.

Catharsis. If the character fuses the souls, all the wickedness and sin that was purged returns through tendrils of smoke. While the character retains control, they are never the same. If the character rejects the use of soul magic, the doppelganger laughs and dissipates. In twenty years, a new Horned King will return to Druskenvald. Until then, the character can bring their virtue and positive traits to help the lands beyond Wickermoor Hollow.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.sIN94qlGh8qBsSYN]{Thread of Evolution}

A character bound by the Thread of Evolution believes themself to be the next stage of evolution for mortal species, having undergone a transformational experiment to become closer to “perfection.” However, they are still not satisfied and follow the notes of a renowned researcher to transcend the limitations of natural biology.

Goal. The character must unlock the potential of the experiments conducted on them, discover how to blend science and magic to achieve the final stage of evolution, and become the ultimate lifeform.

Personalization. Determine the nature of the experiments conducted on the character. Did they experiment on themselves, or did an external figure do it? What sort of physical limitations were they seeking to transcend? Who is the researcher they idolize, and what were they seeking?

Call to Adventure. The character has hit a dead end in unlocking the next stage of their personal evolution and has sought out the researcher who inspired their pursuit. When they finally discover the laboratory or place of study, it is mostly destroyed. Piecing together a fragmented collection of notes that still remain, the character determines that the researcher sought out the location where the adventure begins.

Associated Background. @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.mM6dSK7zROZYlX1t]{Experiment}*

Narrative Touchpoints

Incitement. In the Baggage Car of the Ghostlight Express (area G6), a discarded medical bag that once belonged to the researcher can be found. Among several empty medicine vials, a few crumpled notes reveal they were losing a battle with an ailment after the “enemies of progress” destroyed their lab. The only option left was to seek experimental medicine at an “unorthodox hospital.”

Connection. While visiting A Stitch in Time (area V18), Thomasin Ardor is drawn to the character, recognizing the results of the experiments done to them. Having gained similar results from the procedure that saved her life as a child, her curiosity of how new and advanced techniques and materials can be used to improve quality of life is unbound. Throughout the adventure, she never misses an opportunity to point out any such developments.

Discovery. In the Crematorium of Memory’s Rest Sanatorium (area L18), the character finds the ashes and last effects of the researcher. Their notes reveal that combining magic and science showed great promise, but the critical missing ingredient is a powerful inorganic material to replace the “weakness of flesh.” Although they knew death was imminent, they were overjoyed to have deduced this missing material: stardust from a fallen star.

Confrontation. At the Smoking Crater in the Crooked Nightmare (area N4), the character realizes their medically altered nature allows them to deconstruct the meteor with the union of magic and science. They can replace biological parts with this stardust, which can be greatly duplicated. However, to grant this evolution to others, the lingering crooked corruption over Wickermoor Hollow must be eliminated.

Climax. After Kehlenn’s banishment following the burning of the Crooked Tree, the haze of corruption is removed, and the character gains full control of their discovered evolution. They can replace the organic bodies of anyone who wishes to escape the weakness of flesh by fully evolving themselves and becoming entirely made of stardust. To retain any original biology would be to not claim full mastery of the stardust and interrupt their personal evolution.

Catharsis. If the character fully evolves into a being of inorganic matter, the stardust spreads across Wickermoor Hollow, enabling the sick and dissatisfied to abandon their humanity to join the character’s evolution. If the character rejects the final stage of evolution, they can make a difference on a smaller, targeted scale in places beyond Wickermoor Hollow.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.PMWLA9rJem82lQgg]{Thread of Immortality}

A character bound by the Thread of Immortality seeks a remedy for an incurable, magical disease through the lost arts of blood, vital energy, and the soul-stuff of anima. Aided by an enigmatic, alchemical being in a flask, they seek the truth, and with each new discovery of strange alchemy, they come closer to perfecting a grand elixir and unlocking the secrets of immortality, eternal youth, and invulnerability.

Goal. The character must master the alchemical arts of life essence, discover the recipe for a grand remedy of immense power, concoct a cure for their magical malady, and unlock the secrets of immortality.

Personalization. Determine the nature of the incurable disease. What are its symptoms and how was it caused? Does the character have the affliction themselves or does one of their loved ones? Does the researched remedy take the form of a potion, a stone, or something else entirely? What is the appearance and personality of the oddity in the flask?

Call to Adventure. The effects of the magical disease that the character contends with continue to worsen, and all attempts at remedying it have failed. Their study of alchemical practices leads them to the ruins of an ancient city said to have once conquered death. There, they uncover a strange entity in a flask that claims to know the truth of immortality. The being is not openly forthcoming with many details but speaks of the time and place where the adventure begins.

Associated Background. @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.Y4TYLJllVMRrAYOX]{Crimson Aspirant}*

Narrative Touchpoints

Incitement. In the Cauldron Room of the Crooked House (area H17), the character is drawn to symbols etched by Vessla that the entity in the flask recognizes as soul magic. The thing guides the character to etch the glyphs on the entity's vessel to prepare it for the grand remedy's alchemical purpose, whispering that the next step is infusing it with blood magic.

Connection. While visiting the Smithy (area V16), the thing in the flask is drawn to Jean Myriel, who reveals that, during his time in Dawn’s Gate, he had witnessed acts of blood magic from the faithful of the Crimson Monastery. There, he learned techniques to infuse his metallurgy with blood before he fled, cautioning much worse uses are conducted within the monastery.

Discovery. In Jaeger’s Cabin at the Crimson Monastery (area M3), the character is drawn to a plethora of notes on blood magic rituals. The oddity in the flask finds hidden discoveries and secrets, guiding the character to infuse the vessel with the power of blood, anima, and vitality, stating the next step is the implementation of extremely rare alchemical reagents.

Confrontation. While at the Highborn Crypts in Maidenmist Cemetery (area Y4), the thing in the flask reveals that it was once a mortal alchemist millennia prior. It guides the character to a crypt that holds its former apprentice, who had prepared for the creation of the grand remedy by being buried alongside pure gold, celestial water, quicksilver, rare herbs, and other reagents to be infused into it. The final step requires a massive transmutation circle at a place of power.

Climax. Once the Crooked Queen is defeated, the oddity emerges from the flask and creates a transmutation circle where Kehlenn’s primal magic ring had been. The entity then bursts into a swarm of souls, stating that it has sacrificed thousands of lives for this purpose. It urges the character to use the circle to finish the remedy and achieve true immortality. Otherwise, it will only serve as a single-use cure for the disease the character sought to alleviate.
