Catharsis. If the character sacrifices the thousands of souls, including the thing in the flask, the grand remedy is completed, which grants immortality, eternal youth, and invulnerability. If they reject such a weighty sacrifice, the souls destroy the entity before flying off to find peace. The character has a cure for the disease and knows they can use the alchemy they’ve learned to help people beyond Wickermoor Hollow.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.CkdQ8UCcAEpDaXLc]{Thread of Kindred}

A character bound by the Thread of Kindred searches for a family member who went missing in Druskenvald after experiencing a series of worsening nightmares. Following clues in a dream journal left behind by their loved one, the character knows that a terrible, crooked fate awaits their kin and only they can bring salvation.

Goal. The character must track down their loved one’s location, uncover the malign forces they’ve been mixed up with, and rescue them before they suffer a terrible fate.

Personalization. Determine which family member the character seeks. Are they from one of the thirteen primary provinces of Druskenvald or from the mortal realms? How was the relationship between them, and how did the worsening nightmares affect their bond?

Call to Adventure. The character’s family member had confided in them about terrifying nightmares of a man with a crooked grin that continued to get worse, causing loss of sleep and fraying sanity. One night, the character arrives at their loved one’s home and finds them gone. There are clear signs of a struggle. Left behind is a dream journal, which paints a terrifying picture of the nightmares and clearly depicts where the adventure begins.

Associated Background. @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.MN7lhnHCOakU9Uk1]{Druskenvald Dweller}*

Narrative Touchpoints

Incitement. In the Master Bedroom of the Crooked House (area H12), the character is drawn to the bed and finds some personal effects of their family member. There are also etchings on the wall that imply they had been kept prisoner in the room before the Druskenvalds arrived and forced to experience horrific nightmares seemingly focused on the Crooked Man. The final etching references being covered by centipedes in the deep.

Connection. While visiting Roderick Masonry (area V12), the character is drawn to strange statues behind the counter that match descriptions in the dream journal. Solomon Roderick reveals he’s had nightmares of a Crooked Man since childhood, and his account is similar to what the character’s family member experienced. Throughout the adventure, he can help guide the character toward the operations of the servants of the Crooked Man and the Vermintoll Coven.

Discovery. While in Stonoga’s Laboratory within Skitterdeep Mine (area S7) after the death of Stonoga Blackstinger, the character finds a cage with more effects belonging to their family member. Among them is a log revealing the relative was kept there and experimented on, with notes stating they are an “ideal vessel” and are “prime for crookedness.” It mentions preparations are underway for the “final nightmare.”

Confrontation. While in the Dark Wood of the Crooked Nightmare (area N2), the character hears their family member crying out in the darkness. Drawn to the voice, the character finds them wandering the woods with a crooked neck and crooked gait. Terrified, the family member says they are being prepared for something at a crooked tree. Suddenly, they shriek and are dragged off into the darkness.

Climax. After the Crooked Queen is vanquished, the character’s family member screams from the barrow below, trapped where Kehlenn’s bones once were. The family member sobs that their blood has marked them as a replacement for the Crooked Man and that they must work to restore Kehlenn. The character can only save them by taking their place as the successor of the Crooked Man themselves. However, because they were not warped by the coven, they retain their morality and free will.

Catharsis. If the character offers to take their family member’s place, they change places in the roots, are fully consumed, and transform into a powerful crooked spirit bound to Druskenvald. The family member returns home with any other surviving characters. If the character allows their family member to be consumed, they witness the transformation and they know they must work against this new spirit outside of Wickermoor Hollow.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.KNmsLbPSpc0Rj6RN]{Thread of Liberation}

A character bound by the Thread of Liberation has made a deal with a powerful entity that now owns their soul, and what awaits them in death is not pretty. Their only hope to escape their fate seems to be in the hands of their shadow, which seemingly has a mind of its own but can be persuaded to help through games of chance.

Goal. The character must seek help in outwitting the entity they made a deal with, find a way to break the supernatural chains that bind them, and reclaim the mastery of their own fate once more.

Personalization. Determine the nature of the entity that has claimed the character’s soul. Are they fiendish, fey, deathly, or something else? What is their personality, and what relationship do they have with the character? How does their influence affect the appearance and behavior of the character’s shadow? What deal was made, and what did the character receive in exchange for their soul?

Call to Adventure. The character’s luck is running out as the deal they’ve made with the entity has gone bad, and they’ve been reminded of the terrible fate that awaits them. Seeking a way to get out of the bargain, they return to the place where the deal was made, and the character’s shadow suddenly springs to life and wordlessly challenges them to a game of chance. The character is victorious, and the shadow guides them to where the adventure begins.

Associated Background. @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.MTw370B4un0KTNd4]{Crossroads Gambler}*

Narrative Touchpoints

Incitement. In the Mail Car of the Ghostlight Express (area G5), the character’s shadow finds a letter from a famous gambler addressed to a relative of the character who also doesn’t own their soul. The gambler explains that to gamble with a higher power and win, one needs a magically suited deck of cards, an infallible lucky charm, and a wager grand enough to entice a being that might have it all.

Connection. While visiting Bread by Holly (area V14), Holly Aster is drawn to the character and recognizes from the look in their eye that their soul is not their own. She confides that her soul is owned by a higher power but refuses to say which. Holly mentions that some seek salvation in the Drowned Crossroads, and she even heard stories of gambling for souls there. Her commitment to her children has prevented her own trip there.

Discovery. In the Gambling Hall of the Dead Man’s Hand (area B3), the character is drawn to a special table that offers a prize of a uniquely hexed set of cards that can be played with otherworldly beings. When they play, their shadow may cheat in the game so that the character wins. The dealer tells them the best lucky charm is to find a “Wild Joker” and add it to the deck.

Confrontation. While at the Prize Counter during the Festival of Fools (area C3), the character sees a gleaming joker card that costs “infinity tickets.” Their shadow may steal the card, and when it is placed in the deck, the Wild Joker speaks. It exclaims how the deck is now lucky and the character cannot lose, but the wager better be a huge one, like the rulership of an entire realm of death.

Climax. After the encounter with the Horned King, the death of Phillip has left a vacancy for lordship of Druskenvald. The shadow draws the Wild Joker from the lucky deck and gestures that it can be used to kill the owner of the character’s soul. When the character announces a challenge and wagers the lordship of Druskenvald, the entity appears for a card game. The character can win their freedom using the rigged deck or take revenge by destroying the being.

Catharsis. If the character pierces the entity with the Wild Joker, whether thrown or stabbed, the being is destroyed and the character’s soul is free. If they play and win the game, the entity honors the deal, dissolves the bargain, and frees their soul, allowing them to pursue other gambles outside Wickermoor Hollow. Either way, the shadow transforms into a person. Now freed, they reveal that they were cursed to spy on the character after a deal with the same entity.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.obrABbdcAckdiMNh]{Thread of Malediction}

A character bound by the Thread of Malediction is truly cursed, as is their entire family line. The curse that hangs over their bloodline spells doom and a fate worse than death for all whom they hold dear. Only through delving into ancient secrets and forbidden, profane knowledge of strange origin can they hope to break the curse that afflicts them.

Goal. The character must seek the forgotten secrets that whisper of their curse, obtain the occult knowledge of how to break it, and take the necessary steps to free themselves from the malediction that afflicts them and their line.

Personalization. Determine the nature of the curse that afflicts the character. Were they cursed themselves, or was it inherited from an ancestor? What sort of otherworldly force originated the curse, whether it be fiendish, cosmic, fey, or other eldritch forces? To which fate is the character and their line doomed by this curse?

Call to Adventure. The looming threat of the curse has driven the character to constant research, seeking any knowledge that might lead toward a solution. After numerous dead ends, the character discovers a secret society with access to an esoteric library. After gaining access, the character steals a mysterious page before escaping and follows it to wherever the adventure begins.

Associated Background. @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.zi71V5foJSuOQe2X]{Scholar of the Forbidden}*

Narrative Touchpoints

Incitement. In the Library of the Crooked House (area H14), the character finds an ancient tome that has writings similar to their stolen page. It tells of a curse that matches theirs and illustrates parts of an incantation, though there are many blank pages. A note is scribbled in the margin that mentions secrets collected by demons and includes symbols of eyes and wings.

Connection. While visiting the Antique Bookstore (area V23), Eleanor Heyling senses the character’s inquisitive nature and confides her interest in strange, occult, and forbidden knowledge, especially in the eyes of the Old Ways. She offers to help research for the character, and throughout the adventure, she can offer locations where hidden knowledge might be found.

Discovery. While navigating the Fields of the Crow (see chapter 13), the eyes between the stalks watch the character intently and whispers call them over, telling them that the knowledge they seek exists only beyond the stars. Some of the tome’s empty pages fill with demonic script, continuing the incantation. The symbol of a shooting star appears.

Confrontation. At the Smoking Crater in the Crooked Nightmare (area N4), the gibbering voices call to the character. When they look up, their consciousness is transported beyond space and time, and they gain the missing knowledge of how to break the curse. Their tome fills with the remaining incantation, detailing how the final step requires that character to breathe the “Ashes of a God” before reciting it.

Climax. Once the Crooked Queen is defeated and the Crooked Tree is burned, the character inhales the ashes and surges with eldritch power. By reciting the full incantation from the tome, their curse is broken, and unlocked cosmic power allows them the chance to seek more knowledge beyond this reality. They have a moment to decide if they will leave this dimension behind.

Catharsis. If the character decides to travel beyond the stars, they blink away in a burst of stardust and spend millennia navigating strange new cosmic worlds, gaining knowledge unthinkable to mortal minds. If they decide to stay, they know that more knowledge of strange curses and forbidden magic awaits beyond Wickermoor Hollow.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.oSG70rMovgrdTgpS]{Thread of Pilgrimage}

A character bound by the Thread of Pilgrimage holds a strong, mystical connection to the spirits of the dead and can feel their emotions innately. Guided by augury, which grants divination, the character is drawn to places of great spiritual unrest, where they erect sacred monuments to bring a final peace to the tormented dead.

Goal. The character must make a pilgrimage to locations of great spiritual significance, erect cleansing monuments at each one, and complete the sacred formation to soothe and put to rest the countless tortured spirits of the realm.

Personalization. Determine the nature of the character’s duty to the spirits. Is it motivated by religious, primal, occult, or other ends? What is the character’s relationship with the dead, and how has the emotional connection shaped them? How does the character practice augury, whether it be through stone, bone, antler, or other methods? What do their sacred monuments look like?

Call to Adventure. While performing sacred rites to honor the dead, the character is overwhelmed by the tortured agony of countless souls somewhere beyond the mortal realms. Believing that such a profane affront to the departed cannot stand, they perform their spiritual augury, which points to the time and place where the adventure begins.

Associated Background. @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.RuF5XjgAxU4lvhCV]{Rest Warden}*

Narrative Touchpoints

Incitement. While in the Parlor of the Crooked House (area H3), a crystal ball on a shelf fills with spectral light, independent of Patrini’s influence. The character is invited to use their augury to commune with the spirits of the house, who tell them there are places of great soul corruption throughout the valley. The loci of corruption must be cleansed to allow for the countless crooked souls to find rest.

Connection. After the events of the Crooked House, but before Fields of the Crow (chapter 13), Mori Shade approaches them, sensing their connection to spirits. She shares her sacred charge of the dead bodies and spirits, and she is curious about the character’s practices for performing rites. Throughout the adventure, she brings attention to areas of corrupted and tormented souls.

Discovery. Following the defeat of Raum and the banishing of the Fields of the Crow from the farmland around Foxwillow (see chapter 13), the souls corrupted by the demonic influence still linger in the fields. The character must erect their first monument to cleanse the demonic spirits. The following augury shows signs of a tide of shrieking souls erupting from a crumbling ruin.

Confrontation. After defeating the Vermintoll Abomination in the Crooked Nightmare, the surge of shrieking souls that erupts from the ruins of the Crooked House beg for peace from the character. To cleanse the spirits, they must erect the second spiritual monument on the site of the Crooked House. The subsequent augury shows the true source of that site’s corruption: a gnarled and twisted tree in the darkest forest.

Climax. Once the Crooked Queen is bested, the character can feel the torment of countless souls across Wickermoor Hollow that have been twisted by Kehlenn. The third monument must be erected to initiate the final cleansing. The connection of the three monuments is so strong that the character gains the option to rebirth every soul and give them another chance at life.

Catharsis. If the character decides to initiate this rebirth, countless once-human souls across Wickermoor Hollow are born again into a variety of the thirteen reborn species of Druskenvald. All manner of people emerge from the haunted places of the valley, settling there or deciding to move to other provinces. If the character chooses not to offer the rebirth, the souls are cleansed and fade peacefully. The character knows they can help put spirits to rest outside Wickermoor Hollow.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.ox2eVrdCItdDPbFT]{Thread of Rapture}

A character bound by the Thread of Rapture zealously serves a deity or other greater power as their chosen prophet. They hear the voice of their god, who wishes to gain a foothold in a godless realm by enacting a great feat of divine intervention in the hopes of leaving their mark upon the land and its people, who must be converted into the fold.

Goal. The character must spread the word of their deity throughout the land, convert a following of devotees, break the barriers to the divine’s influence, and bring about an act of their godly intervention.

Personalization. Determine the nature of the character’s deity. What is their godly domain, and what are their tenets? What do they demand of their followers, and how does the character showcase their commitment to them? What divine intervention do they seek to enact in Druskenvald and why?

Call to Adventure. While the character is spreading the word of their god, they have a near-death experience but are brought back from the brink by their deity. The character hears their god speak directly to them, telling them of the holy quest they must undertake to gather the faithful in the land of death and establish a foothold for their divine will. The deity guides the character to where the adventure begins.

Associated Background. @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.cFcFHNzp4p3ZdW0d]{Cultist}*

Narrative Touchpoints

Incitement. In the Gallery of the Crooked House (area H4), the character is drawn to a bust of a religious figure. A plaque beneath it describes how the individual brought a deity’s influence to Wickermoor Hollow many years prior by first amassing a large gathering of followers, whose worship allowed for the god’s power to grow in the province. The character’s deity confirms this is the next step.

Connection. While traveling near the Abandoned Church in Wickermoor Village (area V19), Weston Murdoch approaches the character, recognizing them as a missionary. While he encourages them to worship the Brightsinger, he simply appreciates “new godliness” coming to Wickermoor Hollow. Throughout the adventure, he can direct the character to worshipers of a variety of faiths.

Discovery. After the defeat of the Crimson Abbot at the Crimson Monastery (see chapter 14), many followers of the Crimson Faith become disenfranchised or emboldened to escape the faith. Many approach the character and quickly convert to their deity. They agree to spread word of the new faith throughout the valley. This grants more power to the character’s deity, who tells them that the Shroud repels the divine, and this barrier must be addressed.

Confrontation. Following the defeat on the Chained Reaper in the Tomb of the Shrouded of Maidenmist Cemetery (area Y15), the character feels a connection to their deity, who commands them to sanctify this original source of the Shroud in the valley to allow their god to pierce through. Following a blessing by the character, their god tells them that a complete antithesis to godliness stalks the realm and must be destroyed.

Climax. Following the destruction of the Horned King and the burning of the Crooked Tree, their deity confirms that the primary enemy of the gods has been destroyed and, with the character’s invocation, the divine intervention will begin. Additionally, the god offers to shepherd anyone in the valley to the afterlife of the deity. This rapture must be initiated and led by the character.

Catharsis. If the character invokes the salvation to whisk away souls in a rapture, they and many willing people throughout Wickermoor Hollow rise into the air and fade in divine light. The intervention of the deity’s choice occurs in the valley. If the character does not initiate the rapture, only the intervention occurs, and they are called to spread the word of their god beyond Wickermoor Hollow.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.SLSbmuaD4KGHJiBP]{Thread of Rejuvenation}

A character bound by the Thread of Rejuvenation upholds the sanctity of the natural world and the cycle of life, death, and rebirth. Through communion with the green world and following the wisdom of the trees, they seek to purge the land of rot and corruption to usher in a new age of flourishing.

Goal. The character must find the areas of the natural world that are suffering, discover the extent of the corruption that afflicts the land, learn how to bring about the necessary healing, and fully purge the corruption to initiate a great regrowth.

Personalization. Determine the nature of the character’s guardianship of the wilds. How did they first favor the natural world over civilization? What relationship do they have with the trees and the green places? Do they serve the cycle individually or as part of a group? Which season do they favor and uphold as their ultimate charge?

Call to Adventure. While walking through the woods during their favored season, the character stumbles upon an ancient hollow, and the trees of the deepest wood communicate with them. They learn of a landscape corrupted, rotten, and crooked in a realm devoid of the cycle of the seasons, pleading for the salvation of these wilds. After the character accepts the mantle of warden, they hear the wisdom of the trees and are guided to where the adventure begins.

Associated Background. @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.4qbJWw5LaS2jeTmO]{Wicker Weaver}*

Narrative Touchpoints

Incitement. In the Conservatory of the Crooked House (area H8), the bergamot tree communes with the character, giving a vision of its own rotten core before showing the corrupted landscapes and the perversion of nature throughout Wickermoor Hollow. It ends with a vision of a diseased hilltop crawling with thousands of centipedes.

Connection. Sister Rain approaches the character, sensing they share the same gift of “Tree Seeing,” which allows the land to communicate with people through the trees. She feels nature’s pain but rejects supernatural means to cleanse corruption, refusing to “fight fire with fire.” Throughout the adventure, she can sense where corrupted landscapes are in the valley.

Discovery. After the death of Stonoga Blackstinger in Skitterdeep Mine, notes found in Stonoga’s Laboratory (area S7) tell that her corruptive magic was created after studying a virulent disease known as Hartsblight. When the character leaves the mine, a nearby tree now cleansed of Skitter Plague sends a vision of a fungus-choked forest, and within it lies the rotting corpse of a deer.

Confrontation. When exiting the Den of the Blighted One (area F11) after the destruction of Gorthos, the character is communed with by countless trees that have been cleansed of Hartsblight. A vision of the beautiful Green Queen twists into a crooked tree that serves as the heart of corruption throughout Wickermoor Hollow and must be purged.

Climax. After the burning of the Crooked Tree, the character’s full connection to the green magic of Druskenvald is achieved. The Wytchwood communes with them, showing a vision of a burning forest, and from it, the source of a brilliant new age of rejuvenation for Druskenvald—perhaps one day returning the cycle of the seasons. They must simply spread the embers to ignite a single tree.

Catharsis. If the character spreads the embers of the Crooked Tree, the wildfire spreads throughout the Wytchwood, quickly burning the forest to ash. From it, new life will grow how the character decides and spreads throughout the valley, showing signs of the character’s favored season. If they refuse, the character receives a vision of corrupted landscapes beyond Wickermoor Hollow.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.31Sr2TCbFhxFE0py]{Thread of Slaughter}

A character bound by the Thread of Slaughter is a consummate hunter and holds a reverence for the art of killing. Called forward by the appearances of a great spiritual beast, they leave the hunting grounds of the mortal realms to seek the deadliest prey, seeking to become the ultimate predator.

Goal. The character must hunt and kill the foulest creatures of the eternal night, discover what it means to be an apex predator, and undergo the transformation to become the most feared beast that stalks the dark wood.

Personalization. Determine which great beast the character embodies and follows. Are they a predator of land, sky, or water, and how does its spiritual form appear to the character? What about this beast does the character find kinship with, and which of its traits do they strive for? What set the character on their path of bloodshed?

Call to Adventure. Following the success of the greatest hunt the character had experienced, they are still left unsatisfied by the kill. In that moment, the spectral form of the spiritual beast they have kinship with appears before them, and with a look, the character understands that they must seek deadlier hunting grounds. The character instinctively knows where and when the adventure begins.

Associated Background. @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.uNpq2K1IcPNDMC30]{Night Stalker}*

Narrative Touchpoints

Incitement. In the Trophy Room of the Crooked House (area H15), one of the stuffed trophies perfectly resembles the spiritual beast the character follows. When the character locks eyes with it, the beast comes to life and gestures to another slain trophy: a monstrous crow with demonic eyes.

Connection. Hilda Brom approaches the character, sensing their connection to the spiritual beast. She also wants to become an ultimate hunter, following a great spirit bear, but fears the change and sacrifice it may require, given her attachment to the comforts of civilization in Wickermoor Hollow. Throughout the adventure, she updates the character on attacks she hears of by a monster that matches the description of the character’s next quarry.

Discovery. After Raum is slain in the Fields of the Crow (see chapter 13), the spiritual beast appears and feasts upon the demon’s flesh, growing in size, power, and ferocity. It locks eyes with the character and gestures to a murder of crows in the sky above that temporarily takes the form of a rotting stag.

Confrontation. Once Gorthos is slain in the Den of the Blighted One (area F11), the spiritual beast appears and devours its remains, growing with strength and fury. The cave’s fungus shifts to depict a three-eyed goat with features of a dragon, lion, and serpent. When the beast raises its head from the meal, its head displays the character’s face. It then disappears.

Climax. After the death of the Horned King and the burning of the Crooked Tree, the spiritual beast appears, expanding to colossal proportions after consuming the essence of this king of monsters. It bows before the character, who has proven themselves to be the consummate hunter, offering them the opportunity to become the ultimate predator by transforming into what the spirit beast has become.

Catharsis. If the character accepts their spirit guide’s final offer, they and their spiritual beast become one and transform into an apex predator to stalk the wilds of Druskenvald and be the monster that even monsters fear. If they reject it, the spiritual beast calls for them to find new, even more fearsome prey in hunting grounds beyond Wickermoor Hollow.

G1: Passenger Car.name: G1: Passenger Car
G1: Passenger Car.text:
G1：乘客车厢

车厢内排满了朝前的、皮面龟裂的座椅。曾经色彩鲜艳的天鹅绒窗帘如今已褪色。幽灯特快猛地向前一冲，伴随着两声短促的汽笛轰鸣，紧接着是车轮摩擦发出如小提琴高音般的尖啸，随后便是机车那富有节奏的咔哒声。片刻之后，车厢两侧窗外的景色变得模糊不清。变幻莫测的绿色烟雾在玻璃外游动，将外界的领域完全遮蔽。

幽灵乘客们平静地坐在曾经奢华如今却残破不堪的坐垫上。它们只是用空洞的眼神注视着前方或窗外，准备迎接接下来的命运。似乎没人携带任何行李。

车厢内设有14排乘客座椅，每侧2座，车厢两端各设有合计4个私人包厢。

当漂泊客首次接待他们时，他会欢迎角色登车，并希望他们享受这段穿越帷幕前往德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的旅程。他乐意抽出片刻时间回答角色们的任何问题（见本章前面的“漂泊客”部分），并提供以下信息：

  • 他警告角色某些车厢内存在祟魂，并承认——虽然他希望自己能为它们的解脱多做点什么——但他并不介意它们的存在。

  • 他告诉角色不要打开外门或窗户，以阻挡外面危险的灵魂迷雾。

  • 他向他们推荐了车上另外两位更有活力的旅伴：菲利普和阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德，认为与他们相处会是一件乐事。

随后他便告辞前往幽灯火车头的驾驶室，那里连接着煤水车（区域G8）。这是一个供列车司炉工使用的特殊驾驶室，只有漂泊客能够化作幽魂迷雾，通过遍布列车的管道进入其中。

乘客幽灵Passenger Spirits。乍一看，车厢里空无一人，但一些幽灵般的身影时隐时现——那是前往德鲁斯肯瓦尔德重生的乘客灵魂。作为一个搜索动作，角色可以仔细观察这些幽灵并进行一次 [[/check PRC DC 15]] 的感知（察觉）检定，检定成功便会注意到其中一个身影格外阴暗，且其头部诡异地向一侧倾斜。这便是幻影跳车客。

宝藏Treasure。角色若对乘客车厢进行搜查，每搜查1分钟可进行一次 [[/check PRC DC 13]] 感知（察觉）或 [[/check INV DC 13]] 智力（调查）检定，检定成功便会在座椅下发现一小罐装有12颗玻璃弹珠的罐子。这个罐子可用于囚禁祟魂（见 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{迷途祟魂}* 数据卡中的瓶子陷阱特质）。瓶中被囚禁的祟魂将被视为魂罐（见本章稍后的“当其时至”）。

幻影突袭The Phantom Strikes。角色们可以自由讨论他们在幽灵列车上这段奇异的新旅程。如果有角色试图离开乘客车厢，或试图近距离检查、攻击幻影跳车客，亦或是谈话逐渐冷场时，朗读或转述以下内容：

在那些眼神空洞的幽灵中，有一位乘客动了起来。它瞬间化作一团漆黑的阴影冲入过道，那高瘦的人形轮廓显得枯槁，头部以不自然的角度向一侧倾斜。

扭曲的触须如多节的树枝般从它体内射出，击碎了车厢的窗户。恐怖的迷雾在你周围涌入。其中一个乘客幽灵发出一声痛苦的哀嚎，随即化作狰狞的形态：它生着一张布满块状牙齿的巨口，头顶一只独眼，两只细长手掌的掌心中各长着一只小眼睛。

尖锐的汽笛声在你耳边回荡，窗户突然自动修复如初。漂泊客的声音从天花板上传来，听起来沉闷且伴有杂音。“你们能搞定那个吗？这以前可没发生过，而且我只是个拉琴的，又不是打架的！”

那个倒霉的乘客被幽幕腐化成了一个敌对的 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.PuPo4H4Dcxigf0fY]{恶灵}，它会攻击角色们直到被消灭。幻影跳车客（@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.QGcQYZbVl4bWzi4E]{幽影}）也会加入战斗，它心满意足，知道即便自己被消灭，任务也已完成，歪曲女王的计划已然启动。

 

 

遭遇战调整Scaling the Encounter: 幻影突袭The Phantom Strikes

如果角色等级高于1级，你可以增加这场遭遇战的挑战性；随着幽幕侵入车厢，会有额外的乘客被腐化并发生异变。

如果角色为2级，在战斗中增加一个额外的 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.PuPo4H4Dcxigf0fY]{恶灵}；如果角色为3级，则增加两个额外的恶灵。

当这些亡灵被消灭后，漂泊客的声音在车厢内回荡，告知他们刚刚发生的事件有多么严重。

漂泊客所知道的What the Vagrant Knows。漂泊客明白角色们身处的险境，但他故作镇定，以免惊吓到他们。他简单而冷静地解释了情况，并请求他们的帮助。尽管他的声音来自车厢本身，但他实际上是在机车的驾驶室里与角色对话。使用以下信息来引导与漂泊客的对话：

  • 他们刚刚击败的那个阴影偷渡客将迷雾般的幽幕放进了列车，这会腐化灵魂。

  • 车上有六个祟魂更容易受到腐化，这很危险，因为它们是幽灵列车燃料的基础来源。

  • 必须在这些祟魂被腐化之前将其从列车上释放，方法可以是解决它们生前束缚自己的未竟之事，必要时也可以直接将其消灭（见上文“解脱祟魂”）。

  • 无论用哪种方式释放了祟魂，角色们之后都应该去检查煤水车（区域G8）是否有腐化迹象，因为那里存放着列车的燃料储备。

  • 漂泊客必须待在他的驾驶室里，防止任何残留的幽幕迷雾侵入火车头。

  • 漂泊客请求角色们如果在车上遇到菲利普和阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德，不要惊扰他们。“没必要为了这点小打小闹去惊动领主和夫人。”

伴随着最后一声杂音，漂泊客的声音从乘客车厢中消逝，角色们要等到稍后（见本章后续“脱离幽轨”）才能再次与他互动。角色们可以开始他们在幽灯特快列车上的旅程了。

残留诅咒Lingering Curse。战斗结束后，在 [[/check PRC DC 13]] 的感知（察觉）检定中成功的角色会注意到，空气中残留着几缕惨淡的蓝绿色薄雾，其中交织着黑色的根状纹路——这是此前涌入云雾的残余。这股薄雾像蛇一样缓慢前行，溜进了前方连廊门的门缝底下。它无法被驱散或以任何方式受到影响，一旦溜走便消失在视野中。这就是幻影跳车客留下的残留诅咒，它的目标是抵达煤水车（见区域G8），以腐化幽魂火车头的燃料。

Chapter 10: The Ghostlight Express.name: Chapter 10:  The Ghostlight Express
Chapter 10: The Ghostlight Express.text:
第十章

THE GHOSTLIGHT EXPRESS

幽灯特快列车

「幽灯才懒得理你以为自己要去哪。它只会把你送到你该去的地方。一旦上了车，就没回头路；不到终点，谁都下不去。」

——漂泊客The Vagrant

听到了吗？那孤独的提琴的最后一个音符落下，紧接着火车汽笛的呼啸声，意味着你手握一张通往未知的单程票。这些声音预示着幽灯特快的到来。它只会在须臾间停歇寂静，随即再次猛冲向前，踏上那往返于生死之间的永恒旅程，所以，快上车吧。

章节背景

幽灯特快列车不仅仅只是一辆交通工具，它是一个会呼吸、有生命的存在，载着那些已故的乘客踏上前往死后世界的最后一段旅程。对许多人来说，这趟旅程是他们对文明世界的最后一丝回味，随后便会坠入那神圣与亵渎皆无法触及的恐怖深渊。

本章是《歪曲之月》战役的开篇冒险，但也完全可以作为独立的单次冒险one-shot来游玩。幽灯特快列车可以出现在任何需要他的地方，总是在夜晚出现，且最常出没于墓地或立石附近。本章那惊心动魄的结局可以发生在任何森林之中，届时火车将在那里坠毁并发生异变，将角色们孤立无援地抛在原地。

章节概要

幽灯特快轰鸣着发出召唤，将迷途的灵魂穿过死亡的幽幕，摆渡至彼岸的生活。然而，在前往德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的幽灵乘客和被困在幽灵列车上的不安亡灵之中，有一个邪恶的阴影正密谋破坏这次命运之旅。

那些因任务引子而发现自己身处幽灵列车上的角色们，起初可能只是想抵达目的地，但他们很快就会面临额外的目标：

  • 解救祟魂——那些被困在车上的迷失灵魂——方法包括了结它们的未竟之事、将其关入魂罐，或将其消灭。

  • 会见菲利普和阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德，并可能让他们为你卜上一次

  • 追踪幻影跳车客直至煤水车。

  • 在与堕落的幽灯火车头的战斗中幸存。

在运行本章之前，请熟悉本章以及第一章和第8章中出现的关键NPC、地点和概念，以便你能呈现精彩的故事时刻并建立关键的世界观。粗略通读幽魂快车的每个区域，将有助于你在游戏中即兴处理互动环节。最后，回顾高潮战斗——当其时至，以确保能带来一场恐怖且为全篇奠定基调的最终遭遇战。

本章节为四名1级角色设计。在本章结束时，角色将提升至3级。由你自行决定，角色也可以从2级或3级开始这场冒险。如果角色以较高等级开始本次冒险（见下文“任务引子”），本章的某些区域已包含了一些相应的调整内容。

The Ghostlight Locomotive.name: The Ghostlight Locomotive
The Ghostlight Locomotive.text:
幽灯火车头

幽魂火车头是一台古老的黑色蒸汽机车引擎，它行驶在迷雾构成的铁轨之上，牵引着幽灯特快前行。这列幽灵列车只有一个主要目的：将亡者的灵魂摆渡至德鲁斯肯瓦尔德，使他们得以重生，获得第二次生命的机会。在极少数情况下，它也会允许那些希冀穿梭于生死界域之间的活人搭乘。

为了完成这趟旅程，列车必须穿越幽幕，那是一片充满尖啸声的怪异迷雾，笼罩着无数的来世之地与死亡国度。这段路途总是危机四伏，因为那可怕的迷雾有着吞噬一切的特性，无论是活人还是死人，它都能将其灵魂吞噬殆尽。

机械中的游魂

为了维持运转，这列火车以燃烧灵魂作为燃料。虽然这听起来残酷至极，但在被摆渡的亡魂与被消耗的亡魂之间，其实维持着某种平衡。那些不幸沦为幽灵列车炉膛薪柴的灵魂，曾是迷途祟魂——即因生前未竟之事而无法安息或往生的躁动亡魂——但在被困于列车上多年之后，它们已退化成了魂煤（详见下文“祟魂”）。正是这份沉重的代价，确保了幽灯特快能够继续履行摆渡亡者的使命，护送他们穿越幽幕那吞噬一切的毁灭之力，安全抵达彼岸。

 

 

GM边栏

在推进本章剧情时，请引导紧张的氛围缓慢积聚。角色们可能是初次相识。每节车厢中的模块遭遇，不仅是为了挑战角色，更是为了在树林中的结局到来之前，逐渐铺垫这种不安感。

如果你正在主持完整的《歪曲之月》战役，请至少通读每一章节一次，以便对各种潜在的剧情走向了然于胸。菲利普和阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德会贯穿多个章节；而此处是角色们了解他们并建立第一印象的首个契机。他们之间的互动将影响角色们在后续事件中的人际关系与决策。

如果你将本章作为独立的单次冒险来游玩，那么你可以允许角色们在列车上与漂泊客汇合，前往下一场冒险——无论目的地在何方。你也可以忽略那些将角色与《歪曲之月》宏大主线战役相关联的命运编织的指引。

NPCs of the Ghostlight Express.name: NPCs of the Ghostlight Express
NPCs of the Ghostlight Express.text:
幽灯特快列车中的NPC们

除了下文列出的NPC外，这列火车上还挤满了逝者那虚幻的灵魂。其中一些正踏上前往德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的重生之路，而另一些则是因前世未了之事而被困在车上的迷途祟魂（见下文“祟魂”部分）。

菲利普与阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德

菲利普和阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德正在回家的路上。他们搭乘幽灯特快列车返回德鲁斯肯瓦尔德，那个他们以夫妻身份共同统治的死亡领域。哪怕只是初见，两人之间那份深情厚爱也已显而易见。

菲利普是一位富有远见的人，他坚信只要保持前瞻性的态度就能解决任何难题，他推崇“现代”理念，并致力于追求“进步”。他风度翩翩、魅力十足且极其自信。尽管他对子民当下的困苦通常表现得漠不关心，却依然深受爱戴。他身形高瘦，留着一头向后梳得油光锃亮的黑发，蓄着两撇极细的小胡子。他手持一根华丽的黑色手杖，杖头镶嵌着一颗银质的山羊头骨。

阿黛拉性格开朗、热情且充满爱心，总是善于从灵性的角度去审视一切。然而，她无需费力寻觅，因为即便身处这个充斥着魔法的世界，她依然与灵界有着独特的连接，并拥有强大的占卜之力，能通过灵视窥探未来。她全力支持自己的丈夫，并坚信自己的乐观心态能帮助他更好地欣赏那个由他亲手打造的奇妙世界。她身材娇小玲珑，留着棕色波浪卷发，几乎总是身着一袭华丽的长裙，颈间佩戴着一条闪闪发光的项链，吊坠是一枚占卜板上的乩板。

当角色们初次遇到菲利普和阿黛拉时（见区域G3），这对夫妇会带着热情与好奇向新来者致意。他们或许愿意分享关于德鲁斯肯瓦尔德领域以及他们自身的一些细节（见第一章），但出于真诚的兴趣，他们经常会将问题抛回给角色们。

德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇的首要目标是：让不论生死，都成为一段美好的时光。这里的死后生活甜蜜惬意，而他们竭尽所能确保这种状态得以延续。许多来世之地会剥离大部分“凡人”的特质，但德鲁斯肯瓦尔德却反其道而行之。尤其是菲利普，他从凡人那纷杂、残缺乃至时常充满罪孽的本性中发现了美感，并致力于在他统治的领域中维系这种特质。

关于菲利普和阿黛拉在凡世处理何种事务——以及他们是否愿意透露——将留给你自行决定。无论如何，当他们在本故事中登场时，那段经历已愉快地成为了过去。在列车上除了消磨时间别无他事，此时往事已如烟云消散，他们欢迎任何能为这段通往终点的最后旅程增添乐趣的消遣。他们的目的地便是那座庞大的宅邸——新月王庭Chateau Clair de Lune。

请利用这个机会建立角色与菲利普和阿黛拉之间的联系，因为这两位NPC将在整个《歪曲之月》战役中与角色们持续互动。

漂泊客

漂泊客是一位和善的蛙人，皮肤呈斑驳的绿色，作为一名陌行客（见第一章），他的职责是将亡者的灵魂摆渡至“彼岸”。幽灯特快列车是他履行这一神圣职责所选用的载具，而他身兼这列幽灵火车的列车长与司炉工之职。他身穿破旧的流浪者衣衫，头戴一顶宽檐帽，帽子上总是插着三根道钉。

受永恒职责的束缚，漂泊客为那些将在德鲁斯肯瓦尔德重生的亡魂提供安全的通行。作为一名绝佳的说书人，他坚信每一位登上幽灵列车的乘客都有一段值得讲述的故事，而他乐于在那把磨损陈旧的小提琴伴奏下，将这些故事吟唱成歌。

作为幽灯特快唯一的看护者，漂泊客与这列火车之间有着某种奇特的缘分。无尽岁月以来，少数结识这位摆渡人的人不禁怀疑，漂泊客本人是否也像那些无法下车的祟魂一样，被束缚在了这列火车上。但从未有人知晓这位蛙人身世的真相，他的故事至今仍是一个谜。

一段故事一首歌Story and a Song

遇见漂泊客是一次超凡脱俗的经历，早在火车抵达之前，他那悠扬的小提琴声便已传来。漂泊客对他引导的所有灵魂都心怀喜爱，因此当他突然现身带来的震惊消退后，无论是死者还是生者，都会发现自己面对的是一位热诚微笑的蛙人，时刻准备着为你献上一段故事、一首歌曲和一个调皮的眨眼。

尽管他看起来随和、无拘无束，但他对待摆渡人这一职责的态度却极为严肃认真。牵引幽灵列车车厢的火车头无法言语，因此漂泊客便代其发声。在与角色交谈时，无论面对何种问题或话题，他始终保持着友好的态度。他可能会说的一些话包括：

你是谁？ “嗨，现在嘛，你就叫我‘漂泊客’吧。也不过是个谦卑的摆渡人，带着迷途的灵魂渡向彼岸。”

幽灯火车头是什么？ “啊，那是这列车的心脏。可不仅仅是普通的引擎——不，它有自己的意志，你瞧。只有它，能带着咱们驶向该去的地方。”

我们要去哪里？ “当然是去德鲁斯肯瓦尔德啦！准确点儿说，是那位领主和夫人的庄园。这趟线暂时就开到那儿。不过这铁轨嘛……它们可不总是通往同一个地方。”

这些灵魂是什么？ “跟你一样的乘客，简单得很。”

如果我们停下列车会怎样？ “嘿，让它停下？那可是阻挡命运本身呐。从这儿到庄园一路上，都不会再有持票人了。让命运脱轨可没什么好下场——你们呀，还是乖乖留在车上吧。”

祟魂

祟魂是被束缚的幻影，它们那瘦长而虚无的身形闪烁着阴森的蓝绿色光芒，微微悬浮在车厢地板之上。它们衣衫褴褛，仿佛置身于永恒的微风之中，鼓荡飘摇。有些祟魂受困于执念的循环中，不断重复着生前的动作与只言片语；而另一些则可能反复重温着某种喜悦、悲伤或恐惧的时刻。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{迷途祟魂}* 是一种被困在生者世界与死者世界之间的灵魂。它们并非自由的灵魂，通常是因为某种挥之不去的负罪感，或与凡世仍存有未了的羁绊。并非所有的祟魂都是天生邪恶的，但它们无法跨越到下一形态存在的自由，会逐渐侵蚀着它们的心智与性情。身为祟魂，它们将被永远束缚在列车上，直到其重担被卸下，或者退化为魂煤，成为列车的燃料。

受缚灵魂Bound Spirits

如果在列车异变为腐化的幽灯火车头之前，祟魂未能获得解脱，那些仍被束缚在车上的祟魂将沦为它的爪牙。

空容器Vacant Vessels

祟魂惧怕空瓶子和罐子——这些容器可在乘客车厢（区域G1）或休闲车厢（区域G3）找到——因为若使用得当，它们会被囚禁其中。作为一个研究动作，角色对祟魂进行观察思考并进行一次 [[/check HIS DC 16]] 或 [[/check REL DC 16]] 的检定，检定成功便能回忆起 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{迷途祟魂}* 数据卡中的瓶子陷阱特质。装有祟魂的瓶子将被视为魂罐Soul Can（见本冒险后续部分“当其时至”）。

幻影跳车客

列车上有一个灵魂没有乘车票：幻影跳车客（@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.QGcQYZbVl4bWzi4E]{幽影}）。生前，他是现世中一个秘密邪教的成员，崇拜着歪曲女王凯琳。今夜，他们通过仪式献祭了自己，以便灵魂能在菲利普和阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德搭乘列车的这个罕见夜晚，潜入幽灯特快列车。

这个恶毒的阴魂被凯琳的首席爪牙歪曲者赋予了死后的非凡力量，它将诅咒带上了列车，意图腐化幽灯火车头所使用的灵魂燃料。在吞噬一切的幽幕的协助下，幻影跳车客策反了幽灵列车以对抗漂泊客，并将德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇——以及恰巧在场的角色们——困在了柳沼幽谷。

一旦这个阴魂释放了凯琳的诅咒，诅咒蔓延至煤水车（区域G8）并最终吞没火车头，就只是时间问题了。角色们可能会在不知情的情况下，通过开启最后一道门并将诅咒引入，而在实现歪曲女王的目标中扮演关键角色。

Quest Hooks.name: Quest Hooks
Quest Hooks.text:
任务引子

在幽灯特快列车到来之前，你需要引导角色们登车。他们可以一起被接走，也可以分别被接走，但如果你将本章作为独立冒险运行，角色们应当作为一个团队集体登车。

虽然幽灵列车本身可能足以吸引某些人一见便登车，但其他人可能需要某种目标或理由，才会接受漂泊客的邀请。如果是运行长篇战役，请与你的玩家沟通，确立当列车抵达时促使他们角色登车的具体情境，哪怕是勉强为之。

你可以选择你觉得最能吸引玩家的任意任务引子。以下是几个示例：

命运Fate。角色们收到了一份搭乘幽灯特快列车的专属邀请函，这是一个罕见而神秘的机会，因为这是他们的宿命。每个角色都在不知情的情况下，发现自己口袋里有一张车票，并且每个人都有自己登车的理由。

阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德通过她的塔罗牌预见到了角色们的到来，并相信这些旅者是来协助他们完成旅程的，尽管她看不透具体缘由。漂泊客可能会故作高深地说些隐晦的话，但拒绝详细解释。如果被问及，他会用一种循环逻辑来搪塞：漂泊客来接旅者是因为他们有票，而他们有票是因为德鲁斯肯瓦尔德就是他们的目的地。

死亡Death。角色们已经死亡。他们可能是一起死亡的，也可能是在不同的时间和地点分别死亡的。当冒险拉开帷幕时，漂泊客做出了一个罕见的决定：将角色们立即转生进新的活体驱壳中，这通常会采用德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的重生种族形态（见第二章）。或者，他们也可以在原先的身体中重生，或是转生为非德鲁斯肯瓦尔德原生的其他种族。无论何种方式，他们都会发现自己并肩站在一座幽灵火车站的月台上，等待着接下来的命运。

这个独特的钩子可以接续现有的战役，适用于所有角色都已阵亡，但玩家仍希望以现有角色的新版本继续游戏的情况。如果此情况中的角色等级高于3级，你应该调整本章及战役后续事件的难度；或者，你也可以和玩家达成共识，设定死亡经历使所有角色的等级降回1级、2级或3级。

归心似箭Homeward Bound。角色们原籍德鲁斯肯瓦尔德，但因种种离奇境遇，他们跌出了帷幕，流落到了凡世。他们只想回到故土，如今终于找到了一个他们相信幽灯特快列车将会抵达的地点，以便最终踏上归途。

All Aboard.name: All Aboard
All Aboard.text:
全 体 登 车

一曲孤寂的提琴声穿透了笼罩着你的迷雾，昭示着幽灵火车头的来临。一列漆黑色的钢铁列车，沐浴在诡异的光芒中，顺着迷雾构成的铁轨从幽暗处显现。它的烟囱喷出一团团幽灵般的蓝绿色烟雾，烟雾中浮现出受诅咒者的面孔，伴随着凄厉的哀嚎。火车头轰隆作响、尖啸摩擦、吱嘎呻吟，缓缓停了下来，一节客车厢赫然停驻在你们正前方。

当幽灵列车在角色面前停稳后，手持小提琴的漂泊客穿过乘客车厢（区域G1）的滑动门走了出来。这位蛙人亲切地向他们致意，介绍了他自己以及幽灯特快列车。

在 [[/check PRC DC 13]] 的感知（察觉）检定中成功的角色，会感觉到自己口袋里或身上多了一张陌生的车票。若无人察觉，漂泊客会选中他认为最可能上车的角色，并指出他们其实已经拥有了乘车票。一旦有角色找到了自己的车票，朗读或转述以下内容：

一张纸质火车票在你的指间微微颤动。“一名乘客。仅限发票当晚有效”这几个字以凸起的银色字体闪闪发光。漂泊客伸出手，示意你把票递给他。

“最好抓紧时间，”他眨了眨眼，“火车可不会一直等下去。”

幽灯特快列车特征

除非另有说明，否则幽灯特快列车的车厢区域具有以下通用特征：

天花板Ceilings。所有车厢的天花板高9尺，并由钢制支撑梁加固。

照明Lighting。闪烁的黄铜灯具照亮着每节车厢，使各处充满明亮光照。

门Doors。列车的每节车厢都设有两个内部连廊门，前后各一，但有两处例外：乘客车厢（区域G1）在其右侧有一个额外的登车门，且其后门是一个通向列车尾部外部的外门。这两扇门都被施展了法术 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8cse7rit0oswRPUP]{秘法锁Arcane Lock}，只有漂泊客可以绕过。煤水车（区域G8）的前端没有门。

幽灵乘客Spectral Passengers。乘客的幽灵形态在车厢内随机出现和消失。它们正在前往来世，以免沦为祟魂。虽然它们有时似乎在注视着角色，但对任何互动尝试都不会做出反应。

窗户Windows。列车的窗户无法打开，其AC 18，HP 30，伤害阈值为15。如果窗户破碎，幽幕将涌入车厢，并按照下文幽幕之外所述影响幽灵乘客。

幽幕之外

在列车内部暴露于幽幕这一极少见的情况下，掷先攻！只要门、窗或缺口保持开启，每一轮，翻涌的幽幕迷雾就会吞噬一名幽灵乘客，并将其转化为充满恨意的 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.cwvrnt9tD9YI4vQX]{恶灵}。这些生物嗜血成性，会攻击角色直到被消灭为止。

在缺口出现 [[/r 1d4]] 轮后，漂泊客会在先攻轮到20（先攻相同则视为后手）时吹出一声尖锐的哨响。被破坏的门或窗会关闭或复原，不再会有乘客受到腐化。

祟魂作祟

虽然大多数乘客来到这里是为了穿越德鲁斯肯瓦尔德并获得新生，但有些乘客却因前世未了的心结而无法脱身，只能一直留在列车上，直到他们放下执念（见上文“祟魂”）。

解脱祟魂Unfettering a Haint

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{迷途祟魂}* 无法离开它们所在的车厢。每个受缚之灵都有一段可讲的故事，尽管它们可能只记得模糊的细节。为了推进冒险，角色们必须将这些祟魂从列车上解救出来，通常有两种方法可以达成。

毁灭Destruction。消灭祟魂可以打破它与列车的连接，但这会留下一道痛苦的回响，并在稍后回来纠缠角色（见区域G8）。

了结Resolution。或者，角色们可以帮助祟魂化解其因未竟之事所积压的负面情绪。解除祟魂束缚的方法有两种：一是帮助它理解自身的情感纠葛（见下文“帮助祟魂”）；二是为它带来能补全这种理解缺失部分的信物，详见幽灯特快列车各地点中关于每个祟魂的描述。当祟魂放下执念并从列车上解脱时，每位角色恢复 [[/damage 1d6 healing]]{1d6} 生命值，超过生命值上限的部分将转化为临时生命值。

帮助祟魂Helping a Haint。为祟魂找回遗失的信物是达成“了结”最安全的方式，但也有一种风险较高的替代方案。作为一个影响动作，角色可以尝试以某种方式与祟魂互动并进行属性检定，试图帮助它释怀未竟之事。每个祟魂都列有一组建议的“了结之熟练”，使用这些技能最有机会帮助其达成和解。使用这些技能进行的属性检定DC为12。你可以自行判断其他检定是否有效，但除非你认为理由特别充分，否则这些检定的DC均为15。

每次使用特定的技能或工具熟练检定成功后，再次使用该熟练帮助同一祟魂的DC将增加2。因此，角色们最好尝试多种不同的方法。

每一次成功的属性检定都有助于祟魂达成和解，在积累三次成功后，祟魂即获解脱。然而，每失败一次，祟魂就会变得更加不耐烦和躁动。三次失败后，它将陷入愤怒与绝望之中，变为敌对状态并攻击角色。此时，角色们别无选择，只能将其消灭。

大挪移！

当角色们首次穿过位于车厢前端的内部连廊门时，它会通往一节他们尚未访问过的随机车厢。此时，穿过连廊门的角色会消失在漩涡般的迷雾传送门中，并在虚无之境中等待。一旦所有角色都跟进，门会在他们身后关闭，并将他们带到由随机车厢表中掷骰决定的一节随机车厢中。

一旦进入某节车厢，其位置便被锁定，而其后方的列车结构将保持一致，直到列车坠毁（见本章稍后的“脱离幽轨”）。此外，已经通过的连廊门可以像往常一样通行，无需在迷雾漩涡中集合。

在随机车厢表中掷骰来确定角色所进入的下一节车厢。若掷出的结果是已访问过的车厢，则在该次及后续掷骰中重骰。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.n17REsHJpkanK7iV]{随机车厢}

随机车厢表不包括乘客车厢（区域G1），该车厢始终位于列车尾部；也不包括煤水车（区域G8），该车厢始终位于列车最前端，且只有在所有六个 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{迷途祟魂}* 被拯救或消灭后方可进入。

等级提升Level Up。当角色们拯救或消灭了三个迷途祟魂后，若他们仍为1级，则将提升至2级。

Ghostlight Express Locations.name: Ghostlight Express Locations
Ghostlight Express Locations.text:
幽灯特快列车各地点

以下区域对应地图10.1至10.8。当角色们首次登车时，他们会抵达乘客车厢（区域G1）。

G2: Sleeper Car.name: G2: Sleeper Car
G2: Sleeper Car.text:
G2：卧铺车厢Sleeper Car

这节车厢静得出奇，只有当列车轻轻摇晃时，才会传来轻微的嘎吱声。一条长长的走廊沿着车厢延伸。沿途有三扇滑动门，表明这里设有供列车头等舱乘客使用的豪华私人包厢。

卧铺车厢内有一条狭长的走廊，可以通往三个卧铺包厢。菲利普和阿黛拉的私人住处就在这里。

私人包厢Private Cabins。每个包厢内都摆放着整理得整整齐齐的宽敞床铺，旁边是抛光的红木家具，映衬着厚实的天鹅绒窗帘，遮蔽了窗外那片帷幕。

一号包厢Cabin One。最靠近车厢尾部的包厢是菲利普和阿黛拉的寝房，里面可以找到六套各式各样的服装和睡衣（高档服装）。

二号包厢Cabin Two。这个包厢里唯一值得注意的是放在茶几上的一台黄铜和木头材质的留声机。打开后，它会播放舒缓浪漫的爵士乐。这台留声机可用于解脱休闲车厢（区域G3）中的歌女Songstress祟魂。

三号包厢Cabin Three。在这扇滑动门周边15尺范围内可以听到微弱的哭泣声。

甜心The Sweetheart。在第三个包厢里有一个 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{迷途祟魂}*，是一位哭泣的年轻女子，她神情哀怨，深情地注视着一个挂坠盒，里面是一位留着小胡子的英俊男子画像，肖像下方刻着首字母“J.B.”。 她只知道自己是他的“甜心”。

她相思成疾，倍感孤独，几乎没有注意到角色们的存在，只是在那儿悲叹自己不得不独自前往来世。没有挚爱相伴，她便不完整，她不愿在没有他的情况下度过永恒。

把在邮政车厢（区域G5）找到的雅各布·布劳恩Jakob Braun的情书交给她，会让她意识到她的爱人已经身在彼岸，并正在来世等待着她。她喜极而泣，紧紧抱住那封泪迹斑斑的信和她的挂坠盒，随后便获得了自由，渐渐消逝在视野中。

替代的了结之熟练包括：

  • 书法工具或表演Calligrapher’s Supplies or Performance：帮助她创作一首关于她爱人的诗或歌，让她有所寄托以抚慰相思之苦。

  • 历史或游说History or Persuasion：通过讲述失而复得的亲身爱情经历，或吟诵类似的传说故事来表达对她的同情。

  • 调查或宗教Investigation or Religion：引导她以现实和务实的方式回忆她爱人的品质细节，并暗示当她到达目的地时，他们将会重逢。

G3: Lounge Car.name: G3: Lounge Car
G3: Lounge Car.text:
G3：休闲车厢Lounge Car

这间休息室透着一种低调的奢华。乌木墙面上镶嵌着金色的几何图案。厚实舒适的酒红色天鹅绒座椅被布置得适宜安静交谈。柔和的光线透过磨砂壁灯洒下，将淡淡的光晕投射在墙上悬挂的各式令人难以忘怀的风景画上。

休闲车厢作为公共休息室，供乘客在乘客车厢或餐车之外进行社交，这也是角色们遇见菲利普和阿黛拉的地方。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.zNiVYhiWTWLDa90x]{菲利普} 和 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.HqiY4IpNeDF6OcpB]{阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德}。德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的领主和夫人（皆为守序中立，人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.GlaCGcgIP6YjBjGc]{贵族}）刚在别处处理完事务，正在回家的路上。他们惊喜地发现还有其他充满活力的乘客，并渴望结交朋友，了解更多关于角色们的事情。当角色们初次遇到他们时，朗读或转述以下内容：

一位身材高瘦的男士倚在吧台旁，手里端着一杯威士忌。他那向后梳得一丝不苟的黑发光亮整洁，衬托出棱角分明的面部轮廓，两撇极细的小胡子更为其增添几分气质。他身穿一套剪裁合体的条纹西装，手握一根镶有银质山羊头骨的华丽手杖。

坐在他身旁的是一位身材娇小的女士，留着棕色卷发，身穿一件闪闪发光的复古流苏裙。她手持香槟杯，发出轻柔的笑声。

菲利普和阿黛拉会进行自我介绍并与角色攀谈，对于能与其他活人交往感到兴奋。

阿黛拉性格开朗，大部分时间都是她在说话。她对这群人表示欢迎，并热衷于交流故事和才艺。菲利普和阿黛拉之间的爱意从一开始就显而易见，他们经常转向对方，分享对角色们言论和问题的看法，且大多是正面的评价。

当被问及要去哪里时，他们会向角色描述他们那座美妙绝伦的宅邸——新月王庭Chateau Clair de Lune（见第一章）。很明显，他们更偏爱“文明”的生活方式，且倾向于造访城市和其他更繁华的大都会地区。

菲利普比阿黛拉稍显内敛，但这并不意味着他不好相处，他对角色们相当友善。他会主动提议为角色们拿取任何他们喜欢的饮料，而且起初对自己情况的透露也很爽快。如果他感觉到角色们在窥探隐私、举止无礼或有欺骗行为，他就会闭口不言，不再分享。

如果角色们提到幻影跳车客，菲利普和阿黛拉会表现得漠不关心，并完全信任漂泊客能处理好可能出现的任何麻烦。

塔罗占卜Tarot Reading。阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德是一位热衷于神秘学的通灵师。她将这次偶遇视为一个通过塔罗占卜帮助新朋友预见未来的机会。她渴望向任何愿意尝试的人展示她的才华。很难劝阻她，哪怕只是占卜一次也好。阿黛拉偏好的占卜方式是为每位角色从大阿卡纳中抽取一张牌。

若要进行完整的占卜以确定《歪曲之月》冒险中将发现的强大神器和恩赐，请参阅第九章的命运塔罗占卜。 否则，请在下方的塔罗占卜表上为每位接受阿黛拉占卜的角色掷骰，以确定他们抽到了哪张牌（均为正位），若掷出重复数字则重投。每位参与占卜的角色将获得 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8dzaICjGy6mTUaUr]{祝福术Bless} 效应，持续1小时。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.PgDCRgyABMbAxork]{命运塔罗占卜}

画作Paintings。墙上挂着许多画作，描绘了各种风景场景，从雾蒙蒙的山谷到热带的山脉，不一而足。作为一个搜索动作，角色可以检查这些画作并进行一次 [[/check PRC DC 13]] 的感知（察觉）检定，检定成功便会注意到一幅描绘着岩石海岸线的画，画中翻腾的大海在日落下延伸至地平线。这幅画栩栩如生，甚至当人不直视它时，海浪似乎真的在翻滚。这幅画很容易从墙上取下，可用于解救邮政车厢（区域G5）中的水手祟魂。

宝藏Treasure。角色若对休闲车厢进行搜查，每搜查1分钟可进行一次 [[/check PRC DC 13]] 感知（察觉）或 [[/check INV DC 13]] 智力（调查）检定，检定成功便会在吧台后面发现一个空威士忌酒瓶。这个酒瓶可以用来捕捉祟魂（见 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{迷途祟魂}* 数据卡中的瓶子陷阱特质）。首位检定成功且差值为 5或以上的角色，会在吧台后发现那瓶 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.nun45MIODBEA5bUH]{祟魂烈酒}*。

歌女The Songstress。坐在其中一张天鹅绒椅子上的是一个 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{迷途祟魂}*，她是一位身着丝绸长裙的美丽女子，一边抽着烟，一边忧郁地望向窗外。她整个人的存在似乎都显得空虚。她只知道自己曾是一名歌女，生前渴望成为著名的歌手。

当遇到她时，她感到内心空洞，因为她从未找到那首完美的歌曲，能激发她为真正欣赏其才华的观众献上一生中最精彩的演出。她的品味偏向爵士与浪漫风格，她希望能献上最后一场触动灵魂的表演。

将卧铺车厢（区域G2）中找到的留声机带给她并播放，会激发她唱出那首完美的终曲。她站在休息室中央，低吟浅唱起一首情歌，这歌声促使菲利普和阿黛拉相拥，伴着她的表演缓缓起舞。曲终之时，她获得了自由，心满意足地闭上双眼，在安宁中消逝。歌词如下：

若思绪里没了你我，那我便不知该如何思想。

一切都会陨落，再无什么能将星河与沧海阻挡。

何其荒唐，这世间竟曾有没有“你我”的过往。

若连“你”都不再忆起，万物便将轰然崩塌。

凌驾于风暴之上，爱如云朵般柔软轻扬。

多么不可思议，哪怕历经这一切，
那破碎飘零的星尘依然洒落，
最终沉淀成了“你和我”，
凝结成我们所需的……地久天长。

此外，以下是建议的替代了结之熟练：

  • 乐器或表演Musical Instrument or Performance：与歌女进行二重奏，共同演绎一首充满情感的绝唱。

  • 奥秘或洞悉Arcana or Insight：探讨关于灵感与创造力的宇宙或哲学话题。

  • 历史或调查History or Investigation：探索能够激发歌女灵感的艺术作品范例。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.M9wdb1sObnJHpTFG]{塔 罗 占 卜}

G4: Dining Car.name: G4: Dining Car
G4: Dining Car.text:
G4：餐车Dining Car

这节餐车装饰得既奢华又带着一种诡异的优雅，配有厚实舒适的天鹅绒卡座、华丽的黄铜饰件，以及蜡烛投下的昏暗而神秘的光晕。空气中弥漫着美食的香气，尽管卡座大多空置，仅有已故食客的微弱痕迹在此徘徊。

餐车两侧设有六个方形小卡座，每个可容纳四人；车厢尽头还有一个较大的半开放式卡座及配套椅子，可容纳八人。虽然车厢大多时候空空荡荡，但偶尔会有乘车的灵魂幻影出现在空盘前，凝视着窗外的迷雾。那个大卡座始终是空的。

幻影美食Phantasmal Food。如果一个生物坐在卡座里说出某种食物或饮料的名字，该物品会瞬间出现在其面前，新鲜且可即刻享用。每一份点单都极其美味。如果角色点了牛排和鸡蛋，他们可以将这盘食物带走，并用它来协助解救行李车厢（区域G6）中的囚徒祟魂。

白日梦想家The Daydreamer。坐在餐车角落卡座里的是一个 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{迷途祟魂}*，那是一个身穿背带裤的小男孩，正饥肠辘辘地吞食着各种被他不断召唤出来的食物，从长串的香肠到整只的火鸡，应有尽有。他脸上始终都写满了内疚，试图借由进食来排解这种情绪。

当遇到他时，他是个憨傻的空想家，经常说些孩子气的胡话，对问题的回答也总是答非所问。他唯一愿意公开坦露的，是他离世前从邻居花园里偷走了一块画成蟾蜍模样的石头，为此他感到巨大的负罪感。因为他在火车上弄丢了那块石头，便永远无法将其归还给邻居了。

将那块可在马戏车厢（区域G7）找到的石头带给他，会让他充满决心去纠正自己犯下的错误。此刻他要奔赴下一个任务，只见他举起石头，宣布自己已准备好面对“如顽石般冷酷的真相”，随即消失不见。

此外，以下是建议的替代了结之熟练：

  • 画家工具或文书伪造工具Painter’s Supplies or Forgery Kit：传授制作替代小玩意的技巧和指引。

  • 洞悉或游说Insight or Persuasion：引导他说出关于邻居的快乐回忆，并暗示当她在追忆往事时，甚至都不会记得那块石头。

  • 历史或调查History or Investigation：谈论年少时的反复无常，以及单纯的过失是多么容易被原谅。

G5: Mail Car.name: G5: Mail Car
G5: Mail Car.text:
G5：邮政车厢Mail Car

车厢内摆满了装着沉重邮袋的两排货架，以及塞满包裹和信件的箱子。

邮政车厢里存放着由生死两界亲友们的思念所具象化而成的邮件。

穿越帷幕的信件Letters Through the Veil。车厢右侧的邮件包含着在世亲友对逝者的思念、祈祷、诗歌以及其他追忆，希望能以某种方式传达给他们。车厢左侧的邮件则包含着已故灵魂试图传达给在世亲友的信息。

这里的信封大多呈风化般的泛黄色。作为一个搜索动作，角色可以扫视邮件并进行一次 [[/check INV DC 13]] 的智力（调查）检定，检定成功便会在寄自亡者的信件中发现一封亮粉色的信封，寄件人是雅各布·布劳恩Jakob Braun，收件人是“我的甜心”。 这封情书可用于解脱卧铺车厢（区域G2）中的甜心祟魂。

水手The Mariner。在车厢里拖着步子徘徊的是一个 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{迷途祟魂}*，那是一个身穿水手大衣、叼着陶制烟斗的老人。他一边嘟囔着，一边漫无目的地将邮袋从车厢一端搬到另一端，仿佛是在船上装卸货物。他在劳作时，眼神中流露出一丝遥远的悔意。

当你遇到他时，他只愿谈论大海，以及他作为水手、船长和灯塔看守人的漫长职业生涯，并对自己死于内陆而悲叹不已。他总是带着忧郁的渴望，反复提到希望能在最后看一眼大海。

将那幅可在休闲车厢（区域G3）找到的海岸风景画带给水手，会让他充满敬畏与虔诚。他流下一滴眼泪，感叹着大海的美丽，随后发出一声释然的长叹，渐渐消逝。

此外，以下是建议的替代了结之熟练：

领航工具或求生Navigator’s Tools or Survival：与水手一同追忆穿越险恶水域的时光。

表演或乐器Performance or Musical Instrument：演唱或演奏一首欢快的水手号子，让他振作起来。

欺瞒或医药Deception or Medicine：大谈航海中最糟糕的部分，包括坏血病、溺水以及其他悲惨状况，以此帮助他放下执念。

G6: Baggage Car.name: G6: Baggage Car
G6: Baggage Car.text:
G6：行李车厢Baggage Car

行李车厢内弥漫着一股挥之不去的霉味，与其那褪色的优雅形成了奇异的对比。墙壁上镶嵌着抛光的木板和黄铜饰件，虽历经岁月磨损而失去了光泽，却依然可见往日的考究。成堆布满灰尘的旧帆布袋和木箱杂乱地堆积在空间里，但在它们中间，矗立着几口崭新的精致皮革旅行箱，上面压印着字母“D”。

行李车厢里塞满了箱子、包裹和私人物品，是列车上专门用于存放乘客行李和私人物品的隔间，以确保主要乘客区域保持整洁。这里的大部分行李都是被遗弃的，其主人要么是在列车上去世的曾经的生者，要么是因恐惧而逃离列车的人。尽管积满灰尘，但它们大体上仍完好无损。

德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇的行李The Druskenvalds’ Luggage。这里最新的皮革行李属于菲利普和阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德。一口大衣箱里装满了阿黛拉的衣物和几件艺术品。较小的镀金箱子里装着菲利普收藏的西装、魔法物品和其他私人物品（见本章稍后的“结局：终点站”）。这些箱子都受到 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8cse7rit0oswRPUP]{秘法锁Arcane Lock} 的保护。菲利普能本能地随时感知到他箱子的位置，一旦箱子被动过手脚或移动，他就会前来查看。

沉睡的老虎Sleeping Tiger。一只由幽灵绿焰构成的 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.wPch5z2x4VlD7Kd5]{野焰兽灵}*，化作老虎形态沉睡在一堆行李后面，它的野兽般咕噜作响的鼾声充斥着整个车厢。这只幽灵老虎的尾巴上套着一个炽热的铁环，该铁环可用于解救马戏车厢（区域G7）中的小丑祟魂。作为一个操作动作，角色可以通过进行一次成功的 [[/check SLT DC 15]] 敏捷（巧手）检定来将铁环悄悄取下。如果检定失败，野焰兽灵会被惊动并猛然反击，对角色造成 [[/damage 2d6 fire]]{7 (2d6) 火焰伤害}。对野焰兽灵造成伤害会将其惊醒，它会发动攻击，直至角色离开车厢，或者直至伤害它的生物生命值降至0，随后它会回到临时巢穴继续睡觉。

一旦取下铁环，或者野焰兽灵生命值降至0，它就会化作一团余烬旋风涌入铁环之中消失。寄宿着灵体的铁环触感依然烫手。

囚徒The Jailbird。瘫坐在一个破旧手提箱旁的是一个 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{迷途祟魂}*，那是一个身穿条纹囚服、满头灰白头发的男子，左脚踝上拴着铁球和锁链。他的肚子发出响亮的咕噜声，嘴里发出疲惫的呻吟，脸上因饥饿的剧痛而扭曲成一团。

当遇到他时，他因饥饿而心神不宁，梦呓般地列举着各种美味的食物。若被追问，他会说自己在享用承诺的“牛排配鸡蛋”这顿断头饭之前就被处决了，从那以后他满脑子想的都是这顿饭。

给他带去一份可在餐车（区域G4）召唤出的牛排配鸡蛋，会让他精神一振，随即狼吞虎咽地吃光食物。心满意足后，他擦了擦嘴，拍着肚皮发出一声满足的叹息，随后消失不见。

此外，以下是建议的替代了结之熟练：

  • 厨师工具或历史Cook’s Utensils or History：绘声绘色地描述各种美味佳肴，帮他意识到自己其实已经品尝过许多美食。

  • 欺瞒或求生Deception or Survival：编造一些关于某些食物其实索然无味的故事，以减轻他的失望感。

  • 调查或游说Investigation or Persuasion：引导囚徒去回忆其他快乐的往事，帮他看到生命中除了食物之外还有更多美好的东西。

宝藏Treasure。这里的行李大多布满灰尘、受潮、腐烂或被虫蛀。作为一个搜索动作，角色可以翻找行李并进行一次 [[/check PRC DC 15]] 感知（察觉）或 [[/check INV DC 13]] 智力（调查）检定，检定成功便可发现以下物品之一（每项只能被发现一次）：

  • [[/award 75sp]]

  • 一枚镶嵌红宝石的精致银戒指，价值 [[/award 20gp]]

  • 10套各式各样的 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.SsAmWV6YBqeOFihT]{旅行服装}

  • 一副 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.XGAWqtmhK6SYBL6A]{夜视镜Goggles of Night}

若角色花费10分钟进行搜查，则无需进行属性检定即可发现所有宝藏。

G7: Circus Car.name: G7: Circus Car
G7: Circus Car.text:
G7：马戏车厢Circus Car

这节车厢看起来像是马戏团专用的，空气中弥漫着腐烂的干草、发霉的水和陈旧血迹的气味。生锈的笼子沿着墙壁排列，混杂在漆着刺眼红白相间条纹的木箱之中。车厢内的装饰是一场充满扭曲怪诞感的恐怖奇观，挂着宣传各式嘉年华的褪色破烂横幅。每一面横幅上都描绘着令人不安的小丑和骇人的野兽，营造出一种恐怖狂欢的氛围，让人骨子里感到一阵寒意。

马戏车厢里装满了似乎曾属于某个巡回马戏团的货物。

笼子Cages。这里的笼子都是空的，每个都上着锁，一串对应的钥匙挂在墙上的钩子上。

提线木偶Marionettes。一堆令人毛骨悚然的提线木偶被塞在车厢角落一个敞开的箱子里。作为一个研究动作，角色可以进行一次 [[/check INV DC 13]] 的智力（调查）检定，检定成功便会发现其中一个木偶的头是一块画着蟾蜍脸的石头。它可以轻易地从木偶身上取下，并可用于解救餐车（区域G4）中的白日梦想家祟魂。

丑角The Harlequin。倒挂在固定于天花板的摇晃秋千杆上的，是一个 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{迷途祟魂}*，那是一个打扮成弄臣模样的女子，戴着缀满铃铛的丑角帽。她脸上满是羞愧，戏剧性地拉扯着帽子，表演着杂技般的翻滚和跌倒，看起来十分痛苦。

当遇到她时，她大多在哀叹自己的愚蠢，后悔犯下如此可怕的错误，伤害了那么多人。若被追问，她会解释说自己不小心打开了一只凶猛老虎的笼子，老虎发狂并杀死了嘉年华里的几十个人，包括她自己。她希望能确定那只老虎再也不会伤害任何人。

将那个曾套在行李车厢（区域G6）野焰兽灵尾巴上的铁环交给她，会让她感到无比的释然。羞愧从她的羞愧从她脸上褪去，她跃过房间，做了一个侧手翻，随即获得解脱并消逝。

此外，以下是建议的替代了结之熟练：

  • 驯兽或求生Animal Handling or Survival：探讨野兽危险的本质，以及用于关押它的安全措施之不足。

  • 欺瞒或自然Deception or Nature：暗示那只老虎现在肯定已经老死或自然死亡了，所以再也不可能造成伤害。

  • 调查或游说Investigation or Persuasion：帮助她接受这起事故，并让她认识到还有其他不可控的因素。

G8: Tender.name: G8: Tender
G8: Tender.text:
G8：煤水车Tender

通往煤水车的门被魔法封印，在列车上全部六个 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{迷途祟魂}* 被解救、消灭或关入魂罐之前无法打开。在门被封印期间，虚体或以太生物无法穿过煤水车的结构。当幽灯特快上不再有祟魂时，封印解除，门锁自动打开。

这是一节装甲车厢，沐浴在炽热、摇曳的光芒中。一个巨大的焦黑燃料罐矗立在中央，透过一个小小的强化玻璃视窗，可以看到里面透出病态的蓝绿色光芒。空气因不自然的能量而震颤，燃料罐深处传出微弱的低语——那是萦绕不散的虚空之声。头顶上方盘绕着铁管，像蛇一样从燃料罐蜿蜒延伸至车厢尽头那座阴森的熔炉。

这节特制的煤水车长30尺，用于收集并运输幽灵列车所需的关键燃料。它还包含为火车头提供动力的燃烧室。

燃料罐Fuel Tank。燃料罐由铸铁制成，用黄铜配件加固，并设有一个强化玻璃视窗。罐内漂浮着几十块魂煤，四处游荡。检查罐内物品的角色会回忆起漂泊客的解释：魂煤是那些无法解脱的祟魂在列车上的最终归宿。

这些灵魂通过沿着墙壁和天花板铺设的管道，被缓慢地输送进燃烧室。幽灵燃料在燃烧室内燃尽，提供驱动火车头所需的灵魂动力。车上的祟魂对此一无所知，若告知它们真相，它们会变为敌对态度，其效果等同于在尝试解决祟魂未竟之事时失败了三次。当祟魂退化到足以转化为燃料的程度时，它会被从车厢中抽出，作为魂煤吸入储存罐。

燃烧室Firebox。车厢尽头坐落着一座铁制熔炉，它由一个 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.MpKdd5Ma6eTYH4TG]{魂焰司炉}* 负责加热。熔炉厚重的铁门无法打开，除非使用只有漂泊客才拥有的特殊钥匙。

蔓延的诅咒Creeping Curse。既然角色们已经打开了门，幻影跳车客释放的诅咒便悄然潜入了煤水车。在角色们有机会在车厢里探索一番后，朗读或转述以下内容：

树枝般的阴影触须从天花板上蜿蜒的管道中猛然抽出，击碎了储存罐上的圆形视窗，涌入铁囊之中！

发光的魂煤瞬间暗淡成惨厉的墨绿黑色，随即猛烈地穿过管道射入燃烧室，燃料储存罐瞬间被清空。燃烧室内的火焰因同样的腐化而狂暴，煤水车前方的幽灯火车头发出机械般的痛苦呻吟。紧接着，燃烧室厚重的铁门扭曲变形，从铰链上崩飞而出。

烈焰激战Blazing Battle。魂焰司炉从燃烧室的烈火中现身，它被幻影跳车客的诅咒所腐化，并发起攻击；与此同时，幽灯火车头发出令人担忧的、紧绷的吼叫声，回荡在整列火车中。这个司炉拥有30HP，且在使用其多重攻击Multiattack动作时只能进行一次魂焰灼烧Sear攻击。它会穷追不舍，即便角色们为了躲避煤水车内如今致命的环境而将其引至其他车厢。

 

 

遭遇战调整Scaling the Encounter: 烈焰激战Blazing Battle

如果角色等级高于2级，你可以增加这场遭遇战的挑战性；幻影跳车客从蔓延的腐化中重组归来，再次发动袭击！在战斗中增加一个 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.QGcQYZbVl4bWzi4E]{幽影}。

腐化燃料Corrupted Fuel。被腐化的燃烧室内那狂暴的阴森火焰会变得更加压抑，其程度取决于有多少祟魂是被消灭而非被解脱的。在先攻轮到20（先攻相同则视为后手）时，没有火焰伤害抗性或免疫的角色必须进行一次体质豁免，豁免失败则获得1级 &reference[exhaustion apply=false]。DC为5加上列车上每一个被消灭的祟魂所带来的+2加值。

坠毁！Crash! 当腐化的魂焰司炉被消灭后，幽灯特快列车意外冲出帷幕，并在柳沼幽谷坠毁。

Off the Spectral Rails.name: Off the Spectral Rails
Off the Spectral Rails.text:
脱离幽轨

当幽灯特快列车抵达柳沼幽谷时，它坠毁在了一片森林中。作为一辆能够安全穿越各存在位面和幽幕的幽灵机车，这可是极不寻常的事件。

当列车坠毁时，朗读或转述以下内容：

突然间，列车在剧烈的颠簸中震颤，一声震耳欲聋的鸣响随之爆发。刹那之后，伴随着猛烈的冲击，列车猝然急停。木材碎裂与钢铁呻吟的声音充斥着车厢，远处的墙壁被撕裂，你们从煤水车中被甩入漆黑的夜色里。幽灯特快列车坠毁了！

在撞击发生的瞬间，列车上所有活着的生物都必须进行一次 [[/save DEX DC 13]] 的敏捷豁免，失败者将受到 [[/damage 1d6 bludgeoning]]{3 (1d6) 钝击} 伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇和漂泊客自动成功。

当角色们仰望夜空，终于目睹那弯歪曲之月时，朗读或转述以下内容：

悬挂在你们头顶的那轮新月巨大无比，向四周的森林洒下病态的乳白色光芒。但除了巨大的尺寸外，真正让你感到不安的是它的形状。那是一个老巫婆憔悴的面容，透过长长的弯钩鼻和那张永远咧着嘴、露出参差獠牙的笑容，用疯狂的眼神不怀好意地俯视着你们。歪曲之月正注视着。

等级提升Level Up。当角色们坠毁在柳沼幽谷的荒野中时，若他们仍为2级，则将提升至3级。

轨道尽头

角色们发现自己身处一片森林之中。这片树林阴暗幽深，具有以下特征：

森林Woods。古老而多节的橡树拔地而起，高达60至80尺。

照明Lighting。在上方澄澈的夜空中，一轮静止的新月透过树冠洒下光芒，带着邪恶的笑容怒视下方，这对初次造访德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的角色来说无疑是一次惊吓。这轮歪曲之月（见第一章“歪曲之月的夜晚”）将微光光照洒满整个区域

残骸The Wreckage

残骸显而易见，车厢一片狼藉，像散落的扑克牌一样散布在树林各处。可以看到深深的平行沟壑切开松软的泥土，清晰地勾勒出幽灯火车头在树林中横冲直撞的路径。

车头最终停在森林中的一小片空地边缘。靠近后可以明显看出，坠毁后，扭曲的树根令人费解地缠绕并纠缠在列车车轮中，将其牢牢固定。

重回正轨Back on Track

漂泊客那原本冷静、亲切的态度已被不断升温的恐慌所取代。虽然他为了那些受他护送之人的安危，显然正竭力保持理智，但这绝对不是漂泊客经常遇到的情况。他知道，只有强大的邪恶力量才能干扰幽灯火车头的通行。

当所有人都来到外面，且漂泊客已经勘察过损毁情况后，他恳求角色们伸出援手。出于敬意，他没有立即去打扰菲利普。漂泊客解释了他的三个目标：

  • 如果能将火车头从缠绕车轮的树根中解救出来，它就能重新组装完整的幽灯特快，连带所有车厢一起。

  • 熔炉已熄灭。要复活列车需要燃料，而只有亡者的灵魂才能胜任。

  • 寻找任何幻影跳车客破坏的痕迹，其破坏程度远超最初的预料。

魂罐Soul Cans。漂泊客随身带着在附近散落的三个魂罐。这些罐子原本存放在他的驾驶室里以备不时之需，每一个里面都装着一个灵魂。然而，还有三个魂罐不见了，它们飞到了更远的地方。他推测需要全部六个罐子才能让幽灯火车头重新启动运行，于是请求角色们帮忙寻找，而他自己则去摆弄控制面板。如果角色们拥有任何装有祟魂的瓶子（见上文“祟魂”），这些瓶子也可以作为魂罐使用。

如果角色拒绝帮忙或离开怎么办？

如果角色们甚至拒绝尝试寻找幽灵燃料，菲利普和阿黛拉会代替他们去寻找。如果角色们决定抛弃列车，菲利普、阿黛拉和漂泊客会选择留下。随后，在经历了15分钟的陆路跋涉后，角色们将遭遇已获自由的幽灯火车头，被迫与这只怪物般的构装生物正面对决。如果他们幸存下来，漂泊客和德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇很快会找到他们，对此感到困惑和不满。

英勇的良机！A CHANCE FOR VALOR!

菲利普和阿黛拉在坠毁中毫发无伤，并加入了角色们的行列。一旦菲利普弄清了问题的本质，他便立即行动起来。他举起那根优雅的手杖，首先尝试用魔法将幽灯火车头从缠绕的树根中解救出来。他失败了，惊呼道：“也许刚才那一跤暂时摔晕了我身为领主的力量！别担心，我会卷起袖子，尽我所能帮忙的！” 一次成功的 [[/check INS DC 13]] 的感知（洞悉）检定会揭示他说的都是实话。菲利普、漂泊客或角色们试图将列车从树根中松绑的所有尝试也都以失败告终。

When It’s Time.name: When It’s Time
When It’s Time.text:
当其时至

如果角色们去搜寻魂罐，他们不会费多大力气就能找到；这些容器并没有被甩出多远，且它们发出的空灵光芒使其在阴暗的林地中很容易被发现。在附近区域进行搜索的角色，每探索10分钟可进行一次 [[/check PRC DC 10]] 的感知（察觉）检定，成功后可发现一个被甩出的魂罐。无论角色们做什么，他们都找不到幻影跳车客的任何踪迹。这场风暴前短暂的平静，是角色们进行短休的绝佳时机。

幽灯残骸

如果角色们花时间去寻找燃料，当他们返回时，会发现漂泊客正在检查黯淡的燃烧室，准备让它再次熊熊燃烧起来。机车的车轮静止不动，幽灵般的灯具闪烁着微弱的蓝绿色光芒。巨大的、多节的树根依然紧紧缠绕着它黑色的金属框架。

光照Lighting。天空中那轮渐亏的歪曲之月照亮了这片空地，它似乎莫名地离得更近了，此刻正洒下明亮光照。

地形Terrain。地面松软且覆盖着苔藓。橡树和巨石环绕着这片开阔的空地，如果角色躲藏在那里，可以获得掩护。

一旦将收集到的魂罐交给漂泊客，他便尝试将列车重新运行所需的灵魂喂入燃烧室。然而，意外发生了。当漂泊客将三个魂罐倒入燃烧室后，幽魂火车头突然爆发出恐怖的力量并挣脱束缚，将其余三个魂罐震飞。掷先攻！本次战斗使用地图10.9。

Phase 1: Thundering Call.name: Phase 1: Thundering Call
Phase 1: Thundering Call.text:
第一阶段：如雷鸣般之呼唤

当树根最终断裂，腐化的幽灯火车头挣脱而出时，朗读或转述以下内容：

一声雷鸣般的咆哮打破了寂静，大地颤抖，幽灯火车头撕裂了枝叶植被。你们发现得太晚了，幻影跳车客那最后残留的树枝状阴影触须，已经滑进了巨大引擎那阴森的烟囱里。

伴随着刺耳的呻吟和吱嘎声，机车在你们眼前发生异变，生出了一张充满恶意的脸孔，燃烧着阴森且邪恶的双眼。此刻，它变成了一个真正如怪物般的鬼祟构装，猛地调转方向，轰鸣着向你们冲来。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.phL4pDn8A6V5RDN2]{幽灯火车头}* 展现出诅咒形态并发起攻击！

寻找掩护！Run for Cover! 菲利普、阿黛拉和漂泊客一看到幽魂火车头攻击，便立即跑向林木线寻找掩护，不参与战斗。

魂罐Soul Cans。三个装满魂煤的发光罐子散落在幽谷中，位于地图10.9上标有X的位置。当火车头在距离某个魂罐10尺范围内开始其回合时，它会吞噬罐中的魂煤，这将使其恢复20生命值，并使其攻击检定获得优势，直至其下一回合开始。

角色们可以通过摧毁魂罐来阻止此事，魂罐为微型物件，AC 11，HP 1，免疫闪电、毒素和心灵伤害。这样做可以防止火车头吞噬燃料。

每当一个魂罐被摧毁或被吞噬，幽灯火车头的腐化力量都会将释放出的魂煤重组为一个虚弱的 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{迷途祟魂}*。这些祟魂残响只有正常生命值上限的一半，并会加入火车头攻击角色。当祟魂残响生命值降至0时，它会伴随着一声尖叫消失。当幽魂火车头生命值降至0时，所有剩余的残响也会同样消失。

Phase 2: Phantom in the Machine.name: Phase 2: Phantom in the Machine
Phase 2: Phantom in the Machine.text:
第二阶段：幻影于机械之中

一旦幽灯火车头进入浴血，扭曲的腐化力量会更牢固地控制机车，其扭曲道闸Crooked Switch特质激活。朗读或转述以下内容：

幽灯火车头在一阵超自然的光芒爆发中低吼并颤抖。它的脸变得如噩梦般夸张，露出一张扭曲的钢铁笑容，巨大的黑色灵魂烟柱从烟囱中喷涌而出，每一缕都扭曲成蠕动的阴影，宛如多节的树枝。

一旦其被击败，朗读或转述以下内容：

幽灯火车头那张充满恶意的脸孔消失了，真身随之恢复，在一团刺鼻的黑云中将扭曲的腐化力量喷吐殆尽。幻影跳车客的残渣在最终的毁灭前疯狂蠕动、怒吼，但在柳沼幽谷的迷雾消散之前，它便迅速被翻涌的帷幕迷雾彻底湮灭。

Conclusion: The Last Stop.name: Conclusion: The Last Stop
Conclusion: The Last Stop.text:
结局：终点站

当幽灯火车头恢复正常形态几分钟后，菲利普、阿黛拉和漂泊客带着既着迷又感激的神情从林木线后走了出来。

紧接着，奇迹发生了：经历了战斗造成的严重损毁后，火车头的钢铁外壳竟然飘离了地面。损毁处开始自我修复和复位，散落的车厢飞向前去，再次重新挂接在火车头后方。重组的车轮开始转动，重新挺直的烟囱开始缓慢地喷气，列车启动了。

漂泊客毫不犹豫地向前一跃跳进驾驶室，试图弄清发生了什么。

“抱歉啦，各位朋友！”漂泊客大声喊道，“看来幽灯特快列车又要继续上路喽。以它现在的状态，恐怕载不了活人乘客。等我把它修好，一定回来接你们，但现在，这儿就是终点站了！咱们几周后再见……大概吧！

漂泊客露出一丝歉意的微笑，挥了挥帽子，随即连人带车被幽魂快车卷入天际。最后一声轰鸣的汽笛声在森林间回荡，直至最终只剩下树木轻柔的风声。

命运塔罗占卜Fated Tarot Reading。如果在第九章的命运塔罗占卜中抽到了愚者牌，那么 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.pRwxN131RskdKA0Y]{漂泊客哨笛}* 会被遗留下来，躺在泥泞的草丛中。

最诚挚的感谢

菲利普和阿黛拉对角色们从怪物列车手中救下他们的性命感激涕零，并拿出了奇迹般在坠毁中幸存的行李作为奖励。阿黛拉赠予每位角色25GP的钱币或等值的珠宝（由他们挑选），而菲利普则让每位角色从他个人收藏的宝物中挑选一件礼物。每位角色可以从以下列表中选择一件物品：

  • +1 武器（与玩家协商确定武器类型）

  • +1 盾牌

  • @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.9Ifr8fGvJ1bArzOW]{魔术袋（灰色）}

  • 装有 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.cGUPm15mLfhGDz2b]{无踪粉} 的鼻烟盒

  • 两端饰有山羊头的 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.eQNXan0zp279jDtk]{不动权杖}

  • @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.skoUe223EvRYGPL6]{读心勋章}

接下来呢？

真正的恐怖还在后头——随着列车离去，角色们现在发现自己和德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇一同被困在了柳沼幽谷的某处。柳沼村就近在咫尺，但那不祥的死寂和逼近的幽暗，使得迈向它的每一步都仿佛是在踏入某种……歪曲的事物之中。

Chapter 17: Memory's Rest.name: Chapter 17: Memory's Rest
Chapter 17: Memory's Rest.text:
Chapter 17:

Memory's Rest

“Do not tremble. Do not recoil. You are caught between fear and agony. The world has been so unkind, hasn’t it? I know. I know exactly how to take care of you. I can take your pain away, and when I am finished, you will be...better...”

- Matron Lethica -

Memory’s Rest Sanatorium stands as a monument to grief. To outsiders, it promises solace and a retreat from life’s troubles. But behind its iron doors lurks a nightmare. Beneath the polished facade and soft-spoken promises, Matron Lethica pursues her sinister ambition: the Lethic Serum. The concoction claims to cure all ailments—but at a terrible cost. Those who undergo its treatment lose more than their pain; their bodies mutate, their memories fade, and they become hollow vessels for Lethica’s cruel vision of salvation.

Chapter Background

Memory’s Rest Sanatorium rises from the mists of Moonsong Lake, a sanctuary for those seeking relief from their troubles. Its founder, Matron Lethica, has transformed the Isle of Mourn into a place of healing—or so its reputation would suggest. In truth, the sanatorium’s wards are filled with pained silence and the anguished cries of those seduced by this mask.

To perfect her serum, Lethica and her staff—the corrupted nurses, surgeons, and horrors born of her failures—have turned the sanatorium into a prison. Patients vanish often. Those who do not return have succumbed to the mutagenic effects of the Lethic Serum and have transformed into abominations in the image of the true source of the serum.

An eldritch horror known as the White Worm has been imprisoned by the matron in the caverns beneath the sanatorium. This otherworldly being’s ichor serves as the base of the Lethic Serum, and its alien mind gives endless inspiration for Lethica’s abominable experiments, treatments, and goal of twisting the bodies and minds of everyone. Only through the death of the widow can the people be spared this sickening evolution.

Chapter Summary

Memory’s Rest Sanatorium is a place of suffering, alchemy, and unspeakable transformation. The characters are tasked with uncovering its secrets and ending Lethica’s sinister dreams. To prevail, they must navigate the halls of the sanatorium, confront its many horrors, and face the Weeping Widow herself. Characters drawn to the sanatorium by the Quest Hook later in this chapter have several goals:

  • Learn what is happening to patients in Memory’s Rest Sanatorium.

  • Create an antidote to the Lethic Serum

  • Find Lethica’s secret Laboratory (area L27) and the cavern below.

  • Slay Matron Lethica, the Weeping Widow.

Before running this chapter, study its most important NPC, the Weeping Widow, to understand her motivations and methods. Familiarize yourself with the sanatorium’s layout, key areas, and inhabitants so you are prepared to run encounters in whatever order the characters explore. Finally, review the climactic battle, “The Chemical Evolution,” to ensure a satisfying and epic finale.

This chapter is designed for four level 7 characters.

The Weeping Widow.name: 悲泣寡妇
The Weeping Widow.text:
The Weeping Widow

Matron Lethica, the Weeping Widow, was once a priestess of night but forsook her faith to pursue twisted science infused with otherworldly power. She seeks to “free” all people from their pain and sorrow, believing that erasing suffering is the only path to peace. She holds all she meets in contempt and disgust, using her seemingly noble purpose to manipulate and recruit a staff that is both loyal and adoring.

Tragedy of the Widow

Long ago, a white-haired elf named Lethica Nightborne was a high priestess of a goddess of evening, peace, and healing who takes the form of a barn owl. Her duty was to heal those sick in body or mind, which she achieved through blessings from her goddess, as well as the brewing of natural remedies. She found joy bringing peace to countless souls, but her life would be made complicated when she encountered her husband-to-be.

After meeting the traveling knight Sir Marius Renathyr, Lethica discovered a happiness greater than she ever thought possible. Their romance was passionate, and their marriage filled Lethica with purpose. Lethica believed she and her chivalrous love would make the world a better place.

Fate had another plan. After her husband bared his vampire fangs and attempted to feed upon her (see chapter 14), he fled in shame. She followed him and uncovered the extent of his wickedness, shocked to learn his soul was damned and pledged to a devil. The knight she knew and loved was dead, and her new life as a widow was one of endless grief.

To ease her suffering, she redoubled her commitment to the restorative pursuit that had once brought her such comfort. She found the Isle of Mourn, drawn by stories of crystalline pools in the caverns beneath the earth said to have miraculous healing powers. The legends were true, and after she verified the water’s potency, she began construction of a hospital on that very site, where she vowed she would bring an end to all pain.

Lethica used the waters of the pools to heal the sickly, but her joy did not return. She was hollow and bitter, and she grew resentful of her goddess for failing to prevent her tragedy. Disavowing her goddess and the Nightborne name, she turned toward scientific practices that allowed her to develop more potent medicines as the hospital continued its construction.

Eater of Memory

Lethica discovered she was a natural scientist and that her brilliance was unmatched. However, despite numerous breakthroughs, she could not cure every affliction. In particular, she found that several of her patients suffered from painful memories just as she did. This scientific dead-end troubled her until inspiration struck while she walked the endless caverns beneath the fledgling hospital.

She came across the ruins of a dead civilization that worshiped an eldritch being from beyond the stars who endlessly hungers for memories. For years, she studied the etchings of a forgotten language, learning how to make contact with a being known only as the White Worm. Lethica had finally found the secret that would allow her to unlock the full potential of her medicine.

In the cavern beneath the hospital, she performed a ritual that summoned forth the White Worm. By accepting its parasitic offspring within her form, Lethica appeased the creature and formed a psychic bond with it. Her skin turned pallid, her blood violet, and her tears an inky black that forever ran down her face and stained her cheeks. Then, Lethica activated the trap she had set, using her potent science to imprison the weakened grub and constantly drain its alien gore. This ichor, infused with the water of the enchanted pools, formed the base of the Lethic Serum, her greatest work.

When injected, the serum removed a subject’s memories, feeding them to the White Worm to keep it alive. While it remedied physical afflictions, it also warped the body into something wholly alien. Lethica saw this transformation as a cure to suffering and committed to spreading it to everyone, whether they sought it or not. This became the sole purpose of the completed hospital, which she dubbed Memory’s Rest Sanatorium.

Despite her proclaimed noble goal of freeing her patients from their pain, Lethica is equally motivated by a hatred that others should enjoy a blissful life when she cannot. Her foul experiments seek to perfect the serum and produce it at such a scale that the waters of Wickermoor Hollow would transform all living things within. She has even created a variety of apparatuses to pump the serum into the pools below the sanatorium.

Parley with the Widow

Matron Lethica spends her waking hours immersed in her alchemy and overseeing the operations of Memory’s Rest Sanatorium. She meets with visitors to offer reassurances, veiled in kindness and empathy, while quietly assessing whether they can be swayed, used, or eliminated. She is most commonly met in the Matron’s Office (area L4), presenting herself as a visionary who carries the burden of humanity’s pain. She spends the remainder of her time in her quarters (area L19) or her Laboratory (area L27).

Any challenge to her authority or questioning of her methods is met with unwavering confidence. She maintains a calm and composed demeanor, speaking with the precision of a scholar and the gentleness of a healer. Do not be fooled, however; she is cold and ruthless, convinced her work will liberate the world from suffering—no matter the cost.

If the characters meet Lethica and speak with her, these are her answers to some common topics:

Who Are You? “I am Matron Lethica, steward of this hospital. You may think of me as a healer—one who is unafraid to confront the hardships others dare not face.”

Why Do You Operate this Place? “To salve the sorrows of this senseless world. I brew the antidote to pain itself.”

What Set You on this Path? “My own loss drives me. My own sorrow. All the memories which I long to forget but mustn’t. I cannot be idle until I have erased the pain from others.”

Why Do You Cry? “A side effect of my work. Nothing more.” A successful DC 16 Wisdom (Insight) check determines this to be a lie.

Have You Tried Lethic Serum Yourself? “I must not. I endure so others may heal.”

What is the Lethic Serum? “An alchemical distillation of my own design. It has yet to fail to erase the pain of those who accept its tranquility. It is the key to salvation.”

NPCs of the Sanatorium.name: NPCs of the Sanatorium
NPCs of the Sanatorium.text:
NPCs of the Sanatorium

The sanatorium’s staff and inhabitants form a tortuous hierarchy under Matron Lethica’s control. Unquestioningly loyal orderlies carry out their duties under the watchful eyes of Nurse Godlee. Doctor Belkin’s surgeons operate as a well-oiled machine of experimental horrors. Even Hugo, Lethica’s hulking enforcer, bears the scars of her cruel obsession.

Hugo, the First Experiment

Hugo is Matron Lethica’s ward, bodyguard, and the ultimate proof of her alchemical ambitions. Born of a cursed fomorian bloodline, Hugo’s immense strength was overwhelmed by debilitating pain and horrific visions so severe that they harmed those around him and threatened to end his own life. His suffering drove him to Lethica during the earliest days of the hospital, where she promised comfort and relief through her alchemy. She kept her word—quieting the agony of his curse—but at the cost of turning him into a mutated servant entirely dependent on her.

The first step in silencing Hugo’s torment was to close his three eyes with needle and thread. In a short time, Hugo’s body became riddled with scars from countless surgeries. Metal tubes and implanted reservoirs ensure constant delivery of the alchemical cocktail that suppresses Hugo’s pain and emotions, though this was no mercy. Viewing Hugo as the perfect test subject due to his rapidly healing biology and seeming unwillingness to die, Lethica pushed his physical and emotional limits to advance her alchemical mastery. Despite this, Hugo’s devotion to Lethica is absolute—she soothed his pain and, in his eyes, everything she does is justified.

Meeting Hugo. Accustomed to his own form of veil, Hugo relies on his other senses to navigate the world. He is attuned to the sanatorium and immediately rushes to pacify any commotion within its walls, though he mostly stalks the Second Floor to avoid disturbing new arrivals.

Hugo’s Fate. Despite his near-death experience and agonizing transformation, fragments of Hugo’s sympathy and kindness survive. If he still lives when Matron Lethica is destroyed, Hugo is left adrift, overwhelmed by the loss. If approached with compassion and empathy, Hugo might abandon his violent ways and seek peace beyond the borders of Wickermoor Hollow, learning to forget the horrors he witnessed and discovering that he no longer needs Lethica to be free.

Sarah Godlee and the Orderlies

Nurse Sarah Godlee was one of the first to accept the Lethic Serum and serves as the second-in-command to Matron Lethica. Unlike the other orderlies, she wears no mask, as her form was only mildly contorted by the serum. Freed of the troubles that hindered her former life, she now runs the sanatorium’s night-to-night operations as its undisputed enforcer. While Matron Lethica cloaks her methods in gentleness, Godlee prefers intimidation, control, and cruelty.

Godlee thrives on power, both over the orderlies under her command and the patients she claims to care for. She sometimes pilfers valuables from the patients to indulge her sense of authority.

Nurse Godlee deeply admires Matron Lethica to the point of obsession, finding her employer’s decades-long grief over her husband a constant source of pain. She wishes for Lethica to let go of her past and forget Marius Renathyr just like the patients of the hospital. She believes removing collected mementos to be the right step, but would never dare cross her matron. However, she will find common cause with the characters if they can convince her they wish to help.

Meeting Nurse Godlee. When the characters first enter the hospital, Nurse Godlee is overseeing the patients’ mealtime in the Common Room (area L9) on the First Floor. During waking hours, she retires to her quarters (area L17) to watch over the Airing Grounds (area L10) or tour the sanatorium to instruct Hugo and the other orderlies.

The Veiled Orderlies. All fifteen of the orderlies who now preside over the sanatorium were formerly patients. Each of them wears the same, matching uniform. They also don stark white porcelain masks to conceal the unsightly deformities left by the Lethic Serum. While they are still capable of reasoning, the orderlies obey the commands of Matron Lethica and Nurse Godlee without question.

Doctor Belkin and the Surgeons

Doctor Belkin is the architect of Memory’s Rest’s most horrifying experiments. When Belkin was first exposed to the Lethic Serum, its effects on him were unique. His mind opened to the White Worm’s influence, and he was found the following night in the caverns below the hospital having removed the top of his own skull—a colony of pale, writhing larvae now burrow within, driving his every thought. The White Worm had revealed the “truth”: salvation lies not in erasing trauma but in perfect symbiosis with the worm’s parasitic gifts.

Belkin is a fierce disciple of Matron Lethica, and he believes in spreading the White Worm’s influence to elevate all beings to a higher state of existence. His experiments focus on creating mutated hosts for more worms, ensuring their spread to the wider world. His reverence for his alien deity is immense, and Belkin is always looking for new converts to worship the worm. He will find common cause with the characters if made to believe they are genuinely interested in serving the eldritch entity.

When operating on the first floor of the sanatorium, the doctor hides his exposed brain with a surgery cap, bringing a calming demeanor to his nervous patients. He will treat the characters with kindness, but if he perceives the characters as a threat to the White Worm, he will unleash his experiments and surgeons to eliminate them.

Meeting Doctor Belkin. Doctor Belkin spends most of his time in the Experimental Wing of the Second Floor monitoring his trials and testing subjects he thinks are strong enough to survive his extreme procedures. To maintain appearances, Belkin also conducts medical examinations for new admissions, using these moments to evaluate potential candidates for his operations.

The Wormhost Surgeons. Belkin’s six acolytes have survived similar procedures under his scalpel. They are now extensions of his will, hosting their own colonies of parasites. To conceal their deformities, they wear bloodied surgical smocks, masks, and caps, though the faint squish of the larvae beneath their flesh often betrays them.

The surgeons work in chilling synchronization, communicating in low, guttural gurgles. While outwardly loyal to Belkin, their true allegiance lies with the White Worm.

Patients of Memory’s Rest

The patients (Neutral, human noncombatant @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmCommoner000000]{Commoners}) of Memory’s Rest Sanatorium represent a wide spectrum of suffering from every corner of Wickermoor Hollow. Each has been admitted seeking relief, only to become unwitting subjects in Matron Lethica’s experimental pursuits. All patients within Memory’s Rest are under the effects of the Lethic Serum, which relieves whatever malady brought them here but erases their memories and identity. The patients in the Patient Register table could be met by the characters during their stay in Memory’s Rest, though it is not comprehensive.

You choose where a patient is within Memory’s Rest at any given time, whether they are alone or escorted, and what their condition is. Consider also incorporating NPCs the characters already know to raise the stakes, making their presence in Memory’s Rest a personal and urgent surprise. You can plan the patients schedules in advance or improvise their behavior in response to the characters’ choices and actions.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.pPsG9KcIQx7QmS6H]{Patient Register}

Quest Hook.name: Quest Hook
Quest Hook.text:
Quest Hook

The characters are alerted to the existence of Memory’s Rest Sanatorium by a farmer whose relative went to seek treatment and seemingly has become a different person.

All Is Well

While the characters are in Wickermoor Village, they are approached by Amos Dority, a farmer from the outskirts of the town who is drawn to them due to their deeds in Skitterdeep Mine. He tells the story of his cousin, who had long suffered a chronic affliction and sought care at a hospital on the western side of Wickermoor Hollow. This cousin can be any of the patients listed in the Patient Register table (see “Patients of Memory’s Rest” above).

Amos became concerned after receiving a letter allegedly penned by his cousin despite it sounding nothing like them and having completely different handwriting. In this correspondence, the cousin said, “Matron Lethica has healed me and given me purpose,” claiming they would not be returning home to the farm before assuring Amos that “All is well.”

Not trusting this sudden change, he implores the characters to find his cousin to discover the truth. Before parting ways, he hands them a brief pamphlet for “Memory’s Rest Sanatorium,” which features a peaceful hospital on the beautiful Moonsong Lake that specializes in finding treatments for all known and unknown ailments of body and mind.

Memory’s Rest Sanatorium.name: Memory’s Rest Sanatorium
Memory’s Rest Sanatorium.text:
Memory's Rest Sanatorium

With the pamphlet for Memory’s Rest, the characters have the information they need to set off for the hospital. With this document and the letter from Amos’s cousin, by all accounts the place sounds quite peaceful and pleasant.

Across Moonsong Lake

The journey from Wickermoor Village to Moonsong Lake is neither quick nor easy. Though the lake is well marked on maps, it takes about three nights to reach from the village due to the boggy terrain. Eventually, the road vanishes, and the characters find an abandoned trail.

On the side of the road, an overgrown and long-forgotten trail beckons. You press through the thicket of briars, the mud beneath sucking at your feet, dragging you down with each step as you struggle deeper into the mire.

After an hour of fighting through mosquito-ridden marshland, you reach the rocky shores of Moonsong Lake. The fading light on the surface of the water illuminates two things: a rowboat on the shore and a large structure on an island in the center of the lake.

The boat is moored to a simple wooden stake, fits six Medium creatures, and has a pair of oars. It is sturdy and can make the three-mile trip to the island without leaking.

If the characters spend too long on the lake’s surface, jump into the water, or throw anything overboard, they draw the attention of a @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.AOoXC7NvOZy8bztM]{Lake Dredger}*, which attacks if provoked in any way. Should they evade its jaws, the characters arrive, cold and wet, on the banks of the Isle of Mourn.

The shore that surrounds the Isle of Mourn is a tangle of overgrown reeds, black irises, and algae that gently ripples with the shallows. The grounds themselves are a neglected garden of overgrown willow trees and hedges.

You emerge from your boat onto a small, weathered dock. Four other rowboats rock against the slick pier, making sporadic hollow thuds.

Soft purple light beams from the somber windows of the two-storied brick structure. A fountain lies dormant in the center of a small courtyard, featuring a weathered barn owl statue at its center.

“Memory’s Rest: Sanatorium for the Afflicted” is etched in bold, serifed letters above two heavy iron doors at the entrance.

Searching the broken fountain yields a single silver coin.

Memory’s Rest Sanatorium Features.name: Memory’s Rest Sanatorium Features
Memory’s Rest Sanatorium Features.text:
Memory's Rest Sanatorium Features

Areas within Memory’s Rest Sanatorium have the following features unless its description says otherwise:

Ceilings. Rooms and hallways have 12-foot-high ceilings, though doors and entryways are just 10 feet high with transom windows for ventilation.

Lighting. Rooms and hallways are bathed in violet Bright Light that seeps from narrow glass tubes running along the ceilings and walls.

Locks. Some doors within the sanatorium are locked and can only be opened with a ward key or picked using @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbtulThievesToo]{Thieves' Tools} with a successful [[/check DEX DC 15]] check. Lethica and her staff all possess ward keys.

Reinforced Glass. Windows and glass within the sanatorium have AC 15, HP 15, a damage threshold of 10, and sound can't pass through them.

Exploring the Sanatorium.name: Exploring the Sanatorium
Exploring the Sanatorium.text:
Exploring the Sanatorium

Memory’s Rest Sanatorium operates with strict protocols designed to maintain control and secrecy. Newcomers are always escorted by orderlies (@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.xn8fdH3xobiXuf10]{Mutant Nurses}*) or other staff and are directed to specific areas on the First Floor only. Patients who have been admitted are permitted to move unaccompanied, but they may not enter Restricted areas like the Nurse Stations (area L5), Elevators (area L6), or the Pharmacy (area L8). Access to the Second Floor is strictly prohibited without being escorted by staff.

Characters who want to explore the sanatorium freely must rely on diplomacy (such as gaining the trust of Nurse Godlee or Doctor Belkin) or avoid detection (through stealth or by donning disguises). Use the guidelines and staff schedules provided in this section to track the staff’s attitudes toward the characters as they explore and to inform how encounters unfold.

Hospital Staff. There are sixteen @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.xn8fdH3xobiXuf10]{Mutant Nurses}*, including Nurse Sarah Godlee, who support the sanatorium’s night-to-night needs. They take shifts every 8 hours. Five orderlies remain stationary in their apartments (areas L14) on the Second Floor at any given time, resting and awaiting their duties. The remaining ten orderlies attend patients on the First Floor in pairs, wait for visitors in Reception (area L1), or assist Lethica when a patient is being treated with Lethic Serum in the Restraining Room (area L15).

There are seven @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.WqgtgXOTMpVi5JIj]{Wormhost Surgeons}*, including Doctor Belkin, who live and work at Memory’s Rest. They visit the First Floor to examine new patients and perform surgeries only when necessary, spending most of their nights in the Experiment Lab (area L26).

Visiting Hours. Visitors are welcome from the Twilight Hour through the Nightfall Hour. Sanatorium staff are indifferent toward guests that don’t disturb the placid atmosphere of the hospital. The first time a visitor performs an action that violates the Code of Conduct for Visitors causes staff to issue a stern warning.
