Olmarsh.name: Olmarsh
Olmarsh.text:
奥尔马什

「听呀，利维坦！ 听呀，信天翁！ 于黑海与赤穹之间， 我们追逐罗盘， 航向水手乐土， 永远领先那渡魂灵一里格！ 咆哮吧！将那臃肿不堪、行将爆裂的可怖海妖，送入万劫不复的深渊！ 愿咸涩的泡沫与舱底的污水，忘却溺亡者之名！」

—— 埃弗莱姆·韦克船长 ——

德鲁斯肯瓦尔德那翻腾的漆黑之海，是如此怪异、莫测、危机四伏。而外界看待这片行省的眼光，亦是如此——它与这片大海，以及其中潜藏之物，联系紧密，赖以为生。奥尔马什（发音为OAL‑marsh）沿着数里长的嶙峋海岸以及被淹没的盐沼延伸，其领地更囊括了近海之上星罗棋布的诸多岛屿。一抹阴影笼罩着这片行省，自深渊之下蜿蜒而上，让其人民深陷于对未知的偏执恐惧之中。

此地的生活简朴，全仰仗大海所赐的丰饶渔产为继，让此地的人民得以摆脱陆上贫瘠资源所限的窘迫生计。但水面之下，恒久的威胁从未消散。就连半水生的深潜种也因恐惧他们诞生的深渊而逃往海面。更糟的是，头顶夜空中，总有某种东西在窥伺的感觉，如影随形。浪涛之上，冰冷咸腥的空气厚重而粘稠，一股怪异的鱼腥味则在此地的每个角落里挥之不去。

行省逸闻

溺亡者之光

一种无休无止的邪异威胁盛行在奥尔马什的黑暗水域之中。那是会发出阵阵呓语的风暴，他们凭空掀起，能将船只整个吞噬，并使得任何幸存者都陷入语无伦次的癫狂之中。要抵御这些风暴以及其他来自宇宙的侵扰，唯一的屏障便是那些遍布该行省海岸线与岛屿的众多灯塔，每一座都闪耀着幽灵般的诡异光芒。只要船员们有本事在这些灯塔信标之间航行，并始终停留在其魔法光芒的笼罩范围之内，就能免受这些怪异现象的侵害。

然而，如此庇护之恩需要付出巨大的代价，因为灯塔的燃料，正是在海中迷失的灵魂。每座孤寂的灯塔都由一名守塔人独自看守与操作，他亦是灵魂的看守者，在溺亡者永不停歇的哀嚎冲击下，维持着火焰的燃烧。这样的职位被视为至高的荣誉与崇高的牺牲，因为每一位掌光者，在为他人的心智提供安全航路的同时，注定会让自己的心智走向分崩离析。

饥饿者

对船只与沿海聚落而言，最具灾难性的威胁莫过于栖息在德鲁斯肯瓦尔德漆黑之海的无尽深渊中的各种巨型海怪。它们形态万千，有身披巨壳的克拉肯、幽灵般的白色巨齿鲨、状如邪魔的鲸形利维坦，以及泰坦般的凶猛螃蟹。这些饥饿者既受人畏惧，又被奉为神明。人们向祂们献上食物、财宝与祭品来满足其胃口，只为求得一丝渺茫的希望，让船只或城镇能免遭祂们传说中的雷霆之怒。

然而，对于那些胆大，或许该说是愚蠢到敢于屠戮这些庞然大物的人来说，他们能凭此发一笔横财。他们可以从巨兽的尸骸中，收获一种名为潮汐灰烬的珍贵致幻物质——无论巨兽形态为何，这种物质都能在其心脏中找到。更令人渴求的，则是一种神话般的螺壳，一旦像号角般吹响，便能束缚一头饥饿者的意志。

名流志士

埃弗莱姆·韦克船长

埃弗莱姆·韦克船长（发音为EFF‑rum WAIK）是一位久负盛名的深潜种水手，也是首批看守溺亡者之光的灯塔守护者之一。他坚守的时间，超过了此前此后的任何一位守护者，但他最终还是屈服于灯中魔法所带来的幻象。他听到了海上传来的海妖之歌，便游向歌声的源头，结果被一头饥饿者所吞噬。无人知晓是何物将他带回，但在次夜，他以一道幽魂之姿重返海岸，身上承载着深海的秘密，眼中洞见了星空彼岸的景象。

作为奥尔马什的领主，韦克船长以一道魁梧的绿色幽魂之姿现身，长着由触手与海草构成的大胡子。他通常身着那套历经风霜的船长服，大部分时间神志清醒，尽管偶尔也会被癫狂的呓语所淹没，胡乱说着种种迷信、诅咒与未来的凶险——所有这些全都蕴含着真理，并为他的人民所重视。这份邪异的、或许源自宇宙的知识，让此地的人民得以安然度过无数来自凡世与超自然的危险，而他的领导对他们的生存而言，至今仍是不可或缺的。

量渊姊妹

量渊姊妹的悲伤，映照着德鲁斯肯瓦尔德人民的哀愁。当他们哭泣时，她便流下咸涩而漆黑如墨的泪水，汇入大海之中。她皮肤黏滑，发如海带，身长鳞鳍，是海洋的造物，却又因自身的苦难而被囚禁于此。当她浮出水面，渴望陆地之时，她的泪水便会如巨浪般涌出，将她重新压回深海。

她那诡异的巫术能召唤出酸性超乎想象的软泥，在片刻之间便能腐蚀掉一艘大帆船。从她额前垂下的一颗肉瘤会投射出迷人的光芒，能催眠毫无防备的水手，将他们引诱到她的魔爪之中。她试图将溺亡者之光盗入她额前的诱饵之中，以便她能号令奥尔马什所有的海怪，用她泪水化作的滔天巨浪淹没陆地，让陆上的居民也承受她所受的苦难。她的苦难永远渴望着同伴。

胜景名迹

伊布茅斯

伊布茅斯（发音为IBZ‑mith）是奥尔马什那雾气弥漫的沿海首府，也是德鲁斯肯瓦尔德最大的港口城市。歪斜而单调的街道蜿蜒穿行于一片片被风雨侵蚀的灰色建筑之间，其间的居民看上去都有些古怪。尽管外观阴沉，水手、商人、渔夫与猎人仍会从各地前来，在此入港停泊，再去近海的诡异潮汐中，寻觅那些超自然的奇珍异宝。

在咸腥的集市与遍染着小型海怪鲜血的码头之间，邪异而神秘的遗物，正于紧闭的门后进行着交易，以避开窥探的目光——这些遗物大多是从本地沼泽中的无数沉没废墟里收集而来。此地还能找到一些令人不安的破败小教堂，它们供奉着各路饥饿者，其中往往挤满了出人意料之多的信徒，驱使他们前来的，是同等分量的崇拜与恐惧。城里最臭名昭著的地方是七姐妹酒馆，它以其海鲜杂烩浓汤，以及由老练的水手、杀人不眨眼的凶徒和各式各样的坏蛋组成的喧闹客群而闻名。

黑潮庄园

在伊布茅斯以南的远方，沿着一段尤为险峻、狂风呼啸的悬崖，有一处名为海鸟之殒的被诅咒之地。传说一位水手曾在此射落一只信天翁——这一愚蠢行径给他自己、他的船员乃至他整个家族都招来了厄运。黑潮庄园便坐落于此，这是一座高耸而阴森的宅邸，其构造违背了建筑学的常理。防护法术、 缠魂诅咒、沼泽险境以及突兀狂风的交织，使得抵达此地困难重重，但那些敲响其厚重橡木门的人会发现，这里便是鹦鹉螺会的总部。

这个秘密结社以螺旋贝壳为徽记，致力于推动对奇异、神秘与禁忌之物的研究，兼顾魔法与科学两方面的探索。它也充当着一座博物馆，馆中满是从德鲁斯肯瓦尔德内外收集而来的奇珍异物；同时，它也是一所小型大学，唯有最坚定之人方能在此学有所成并得以幸存。加入鹦鹉螺会的入会仪式，要求成员在附近黑色礁石浮出海面的一夜前往其上，并献祭珍视之物或之人，以此证明你的旧日人生已然终结。

奥尔马什的冒险

在奥尔马什那为浓雾所浸染的海岸与鬼影幢幢的水域之间，隐藏的恐怖与古怪的谜案正等待着来者。

Pholsense.name: Pholsense
Pholsense.text:
费尔森

「正义者的银辉路途，四周尽是罪人的邪恶与女巫的妖言。 凡能以虔诚、节制、勤勉、团结之名， 牺牲其所有、奉献其全部， 追随神圣之足迹者，便是蒙福之人。 此乃通往银色天国，沐浴那炫目圣光之极乐的唯一路途！」

—— 大主教 丹东·亚历山大·雷诺 ——

在费尔森（发音为FOAL‑senss），衡量每个人生命价值的首要标准，莫过于其对神圣律法的遵循程度。散布在起伏丘陵、肥沃农田与幽雅林地间的乡镇，看似宁静祥和，但一念之差便可能踏错银辉路途的恐惧，始终潜伏于人心。因为在这片行省的宏伟城市中——这些城市与那些状如石像鬼的石像种由同一种岩石雕琢而成——该信仰的狂热激进分子正搜寻着迷途与邪恶之魂，以便进行迅速而无情地裁决与清洗。

无论是穿行在拥挤的街道上，还是漫步于广袤的田野间，费尔森的民众都在竭力使自己的步伐不偏离正义之途，以期能获得擢升，沐浴于唯一真神那炫目的光辉之中。在费尔森的社会中，银辉路途高于邻里、亲族，甚至自我。人们必须时刻警惕地监视并举报任何违法或异端的行为，将之交由负责执行银辉裁决的审判官处置。任何非信仰所赐的魔法皆备受猜忌，在错误的时间施展错误的法术，只会招致烈焰焚身的下场。

行省逸闻

银辉路途

银辉路途不仅仅是一种宗教或神学理念，它本身就是神祇。这位神祇没有凡人通常赋予其神明的典型拟人化特征，而是以一种不可感知的神圣意志存在，并维系着五大圣诫：虔诚、节制、勤勉、团结与牺牲。任何亵渎这些美德的罪行或漠视都绝不被容忍。与其他行省相比，费尔森因子夜月影女巫会的巫术而遭受的苦难要深重得多，而这也愈加激起他们正义的怒火。

费尔森的大多数居民，包括众多石像种与本省其他种族，都是该信仰的虔诚信徒。他们会定期在各类礼拜场所（从小礼拜堂到巍峨的大教堂）举行仪式进行歌颂。整个地区几乎随时都能听到洪亮钟声的鸣响，信徒坚称那是银辉路途的神音，并试图从中辨析神意。然而，等级森严的教士阶层则坚称，只有他们才能真正解读其神祇的声音，于是他们自居为神旨与凡俗之间的传达者，权柄层层递进，直至教会之首——大主教雷诺。

银辉之锤

银辉之锤是一支由审判官与圣战士组成的骑士团，他们将纯洁奉为最高信条，游历全省，坚定不移地追猎着银辉路途所界定的一切邪恶。尽管骑士团的许多分会真心希望保护费尔森的无辜者免受子夜之母的阴谋诡计所害，但其中一些分会所采取的手段却极端且往往十分残酷，他们亦美其名曰这是清除省内巫术与邪恶的必要之举。一旦怀疑萌生，尤其是在发现诅咒恶果之时，公正的审判便极为罕见。

奥术或原初魔法的施法者备受银辉之锤猜忌，有时会与女巫之母的真正爪牙一起，遭到不分青红皂白的处置。然而，那些主动向骑士团申报并登记力量，立誓以善行驱动魔法者，通常可获得宽恕，甚至会被指派与骑士们并肩作战，以术伐术，投身对抗邪恶的战场。

名流志士

大主教 丹东·亚历山大·雷诺

这位费尔森的统治者，将他作为领主的职责与对新月王庭的忠诚，坚定地置于他对银辉路途的践行与遵从之下。大主教丹东·亚历山大·雷诺（发音为DAN‑tawn a‑lek‑SAN‑dur reh‑NOH）的外表是一位高挑瘦削，拥有银色皮肤以及天使般闪耀双眸的人类。他以统御教会的同一套信条来治理全省。他凡事力求完美，尤其是在雕琢石像种一事上；他将石像种与费尔森的其他种族，都视为自己的牧群。他也要求他的人民能达到同样的完美，但对于那些忏悔罪行并接受严酷苦修的人，他也时常给予宽恕。

然而，罪恶潜藏于这位大主教的内心深处。年复一年，他愈发沉溺于佳肴、美酒、肉欲与金钱，也愈发享受他在进行伴有酷刑的拷问审讯中，那与日俱增的施虐快感。纵然内心恶魔蚕食不止，大主教雷诺仍将该真相深埋于他那颗腐化之心，在他位于西里尔的银辉圣临大教堂的权力宝座上，发表着言辞激烈的布道。

子夜之母

在银辉路途的圣地光芒最为炽烈之处，子夜月影女巫会也因其主母子夜之母的压迫性存在而力量最为强大。她如巫术与邪恶的薄暮女神般笼罩整个省份，公然且直接地嘲弄着费尔森那刻板的神祇。
无人知晓这位巫母的来历，但有传言说，自菲利普·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德统治这片土地以来，她便一直存在。而正是凡人心底潜藏的罪孽。尽管她对自己的十二个女儿确实怀有真挚的母爱，但她却故意激化竞争，让她们互相争斗，以确保在执行各自的阴谋时冷酷无情。

她是通用型魔法技艺的大师，尤为擅长变形，腐化心智、肉体与灵魂，魔药酿制，以及魔宠的召唤与操纵。她在福森斯游走不休，引诱其人民堕入罪恶，使他们偏离银辉路途。她缓慢地从他们腐化的心中汲取玄秘能量，企图在某一夜引爆滔天罪潮，将全省都化为邪恶的炼狱景象，并以此作为她征服德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的跳板。

胜景名迹

西里尔

费尔森闪耀的银辉之心，正是其首府——西里尔（发音为SEER‑ull）。作为德鲁斯肯瓦尔德最辉煌的大都会之一，它的壮丽以及在建筑与石雕工艺上的成就，使得省内的其他定居点，甚至是其他城市，都相形见绌，如同简陋的边境棚户。纵使全省贫困、饥荒与疫病横行，这座城市却依然是一座由光洁石料与璀璨白银铸就的丰碑，城中遍布高耸的雕像与结构复杂的多层喷泉。城市中心坐落着宏伟的银辉圣临大教堂，其上数十口巨大银钟长鸣不息，钟声回荡整座城市，彻夜不绝。

这里同时也是银辉之锤的总部及其审判所监狱的所在地。最邪恶的异教徒——无论清白与否——都会被囚禁于此，遭受折磨。在城市近郊，坐落着德鲁斯肯瓦尔德最大的孤儿院——西里尔孤儿院。院中收容着数千名孤儿，他们的父母或死于审判，或殒于巫术，或因生活于城内过度拥挤且肮脏不堪的街区而丧命。城市的下方是绵延数里的地下墓穴，其名声之盛，甚至吸引了外省的访客前来探索——只不过，并非所有人都能活着回来。

费尔森的冒险

从冷酷的审判到如伤口般腐烂的诅咒，费尔森正呼唤着那些敢于挑战其狂热律法、挣脱其盲信枷锁之人。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.rQYho8CDvDkwpqDj]{费尔森任务引子}

Picco.name: Picco
Picco.text:
皮可

「你问我，为何布林斯基要在德鲁斯肯瓦尔德建造这最快乐的地方？ 原因很简单！世界苦不堪言，而且永远不会改变。 你懂，布林斯基也懂，而民众们对此更是心知肚明。 但如果布林斯基能带给他们一丝惊奇，让他们展露笑颜，哪怕只是帮他们忘却一夜的苦难， 他们或许就会相信，改变并非绝无可能。 我的朋友，这可是件真正特别的事情。 布林斯基建造此地，就是为了看到人们愿意相信时，脸上露出的神情。」

—— 布林斯基二世 ——

在皮可（发音为PEE‑koh），享乐不仅是一种生活方式，更是此地的律法。这是一个充满活力、永不停歇的地方，在这里，形形色色的玩乐不再是虚构，而是蓬勃的现实；最狂野的想象，则由伟大而强大的玩具匠布林斯基二世化为现实——他别无他求，只想实现每一个未能满足的童年愿望。在他的步行机械工坊里，他总是在创造着新玩具、游乐设施以及其他惊险刺激的发明，还有如同玩偶般的线偶种，而后者，正是他倾注了最多爱意去制作的造物

伴随着无处不在的刺耳汽笛风琴声，此地的人民在狂乱而轻浮的氛围中度日。他们周遭是由布料、饰品与道具搭建的人造景观，仿佛直接从校园戏剧的舞台上拆来一般。尽管这无尽的享乐令人兴奋愉悦，但也时常伴随着危险，其中的刺激偶尔会变得致命，而永不停歇的节奏，则让初来乍到者筋疲力尽，甚至心生恐惧。

行省逸闻

游乐券

在皮可，购买商品与服务所用的并非金币，而是此地的专属货币——游乐券。这些游乐券形似闪闪发亮的嘉年华门票，鲜艳的色彩代表着不同的用途——小到购买食物，大到换取搭乘巨大热气球、翱翔全省的资格。这些游乐券驱动着游乐邦的经济——按理说，这套经济体系根本就不该行得通——而获取它们的方式也多种多样，例如用钱币购买、通过工作赚取、赢得游戏奖品，或是作为完成惊人挑战的奖励。

通过完成某些九死一生的壮举所获得的稀有游乐券，其设计独特，并蕴含着特殊的魔法力量。狂热的收藏家们从德鲁斯肯瓦尔德各地赶来，希望能找到这些稀有而声名远扬的奖品。有传言说，某些专属的游乐设施与稀世奇物，必须用这些珍贵的游乐券才能进入或使用。

欢乐锵锵

布林斯基对快乐皮可的愿景，看似只是对居民们轻松愉快的期盼，但实际上，这是一道必须被严肃执行的强制命令。为此，这位玩具匠创造了欢乐锵锵——一只巨大的、会飞的敲钹猴子，它充当着皮可的守护者。它被赋予了一种能力，能够感知整个行省的总体情绪，并嗅出那些可能让别人扫兴的负面情感。

欢乐锵锵会飞遍这片行省，去探访那些正经历着长期悲伤、愤怒或其他类似不快情绪的人。它会先尝试用夸张的摔跤和滑稽的举动来逗他们开心，但如果对方的情绪仍未好转，它最终会采取手段，将当事人掳走。这些"扫兴的人"会被带到布林斯基的工坊接受"修补"，直到他们恢复那无拘无束的快乐为止。

名流志士

布林斯基二世

热情开朗的布林斯基二世（发音为BLIN‑skee）是皮可及其大部分居民的创造者，他以其洪亮而富有感染力的笑声闻名，并满怀着深厚的感情与关爱，亲手创造并修复着他的造物们。身为一名玩具大师，他本身也是一具自律人偶，身材敦实圆胖，想必是仿照了某个"布林斯基一世"的模样——尽管如今，除了这位二代化身，再也无人记得任何其他的玩具大师。他认为领主的繁文缛节枯燥至极，因而更喜欢驾着他那会行走的机械工坊巡游各地，与他的子民们一同玩乐，并为那些破损的造物提供免费修理。

在一个充满恐惧与苦难的永夜国度里，布林斯基相信，为这片黑暗带来欢乐、笑声与光明，既是他自己的责任，也是他子民的责任。尽管他是德鲁斯肯瓦尔德最年长的领主之一，但这份孩童般的天真与热情却使他成了其他贵族领主们操纵的目标。这偶尔会导致他犯下一些可疑、乃至灾难性的行径——尽管他行事时都怀着真正纯粹的意图，却并未完全理解其后果。

滑稽姊妹

作为子夜之母的女儿们中最疯癫、最变幻莫测的一位，滑稽姊妹是一个沉溺于施虐快感与妄想的癫狂女巫，她毕生所求唯有纯粹的混乱。滑稽的性格多姿多彩得无以复加，但她的整个形态，连同她所有的法术与物品，却都只有灰阶色调，仿佛由纸墨构成。她的身形比例怪异，圆润而修长，脸上挂着一抹永恒的咧嘴笑容。

滑稽姊妹能毫不费力地操纵周遭的现实，随意伸缩、重塑自己的身体与环境，并在一瞬间凭空变出想象中的任何事物。若这看似不可能的魔法落入一个意志坚定的女巫之手，足以让她成为世间最强大的存在之一。但混乱的滑稽从未将其全部潜力发挥出来，而是偏爱用它来营造喜剧或戏剧效果。她最有意识地运用巫术之处，在于制造魔法爆炸物。她希望通过炸毁足够多的建筑与人，最终能将德鲁斯肯瓦尔德带入一个纯粹无序的国度。

胜景名迹

游乐邦

尽管整个皮可地区就是一个大马戏团，但其首府游乐邦 (fun‑TOH‑pee‑uh) 才是所有庆典的核心。它既是嘉年华，也是游乐园，更是一座城市——这是魔法工程学的奇迹，让一个活体玩具社会得以在此繁荣昌盛。在这里，一夜的工作通常就是玩上数小时的游戏，以赚取游乐券。

游乐邦的食物虽然没什么营养，却极为可口，吸引着德鲁斯肯瓦尔德各地勇于尝鲜的食客前来品尝无穷无尽的创意美食，尤其是那传奇般的欢乐锵锵华夫饼。此地的交通系统由精心建造的游乐设施构成，它们以极快的速度载着通勤者穿梭于城镇，将他们送往城市里的各个主题街区，空气中则回荡着充满刺激与欣喜的尖叫声。

疯狂小丑地狱。这里保持着令人不适的高温，装饰着魔鬼、弄臣与地狱烈焰的图像，是整座城市的惊险刺激中心，所有最极端、最惊险的游乐设施都汇集于此。这里也是鸣鹅军团的总部——皮可地区无数小丑们的首屈一指的工会，由深受喜爱的小丑咕咕嘎嘎领导。

恐龙世界。在高耸的仿真丛林树木之间，构造精巧的机械恐龙让游客们惊叹不已，欣喜万分。这个街区鼓励探索与英雄冒险，同时也充当着大学区，此地的学校只教授有趣的科目。

施特拉达娅的疯堡嘉年华。这个阴森的街区笼罩在无尽的黑暗中，专注于通过鬼屋、黑暗游乐设施和其他恐怖景点来提供充满乐趣的惊吓。它也是这座城市的戏剧中心；每夜，城堡大小的鸭嗝剧场都会上演备受好评的舞台剧《施特拉达娅的诅咒》。

友善镇。这里是为孩子们以及童心未泯的成年人准备的健全娱乐中心。这个温馨柔软的街区里满是如枕头般舒适的小屋，还居住着大量惹人怜爱的、会动的毛绒动物，为所有来访者带来源源不断的爱与鼓励。此地由镇长奶油芝士——一只圆滚滚的毛绒羊驼——负责管理，同时也为本地那些迷失、破损与不合群的玩具们提供家园与支持。

骨头船长的潟湖。这个有着街区大小的海盗主题水上乐园全年开放水上游乐项目，例如造浪池、漂流河，以及臭名昭著、永无止境的骨头船长的狂野滑道。它也充当着游乐邦的港口，让来自德鲁斯肯瓦尔德各地的船只载着货物与乘客往来，以维持这座城市的繁荣。

霓虹都会。此地被五彩缤纷的璀璨灯光照亮，并绘有星辰宇宙的景象，是游乐邦的音乐区。每个角落都有音乐会场馆与舞厅，上演着各式各样的音乐表演。然而，霓虹都会的大部分区域仍在建设中，闪烁的招牌上承诺着：这座城市最伟大的景点，敬请期待。

皮可的冒险

欢迎来到皮可光怪陆离的奇迹嘉年华，冒险者们将在此体验惊险、感受战栗、直面杀机。

Syndramas.name: Syndramas
Syndramas.text:
辛卓拉穆斯

「当其他行省的目光落在辛卓拉穆斯的战士身上，他们会畏缩，正如绵羊窥见饿狼便会退却。 此地没有四季，他们身上却散发着盛夏的腐臭 ——青涩、柔软、温暖、软弱。 我们由无尽的寒冬所锻造， 因此他们视我们为怪物。 但他们所不知道的是，战争会将我们所有人都变成怪物。 他们应该卑躬屈膝， 庆幸北风尚未将战争带到他们家门口，* *尚未让他们直面那潜藏于每个人内心的怪物。」

—— 古龙女王 萨菲拉 ——

在德鲁斯肯瓦尔德遥远的冰封北境，是一个永恒征战的冰雪行省。在这里，亡者战斗、死亡，然后再次复生，将一场旷日持久的战争延续下去，久到已无人记得冲突的起因。然而，三大交战派系中的任何一方，都会对率先提议和平的想法嗤之以鼻。因此，战斗在冰雪覆盖的大地上肆虐不休，那里安息着早已逝去的巨龙骸骨，不计其数的坟墓中则诞生出食尸鬼般的霜墓种。

辛卓拉穆斯（发音为sin‑DRAH‑mus），一个曾联合了人类与龙类的伟大王国，如今只余下一具空洞残骸，成为一处蕴含着巨大死灵能量的地方。任何在其境内死去的生灵都会化作亡灵再度归来，加入由霜墓种及该省其他种族组成的无尽大军。这些不知疲倦的战士从金属堡垒和广阔的墓穴之城中涌出，用精工锻造的武器和盔甲相互厮杀，只为在他们的古龙女王萨菲拉眼中，为自己和所在的军团赢得荣耀。

行省逸闻

死陵军团

三个好战的军团在辛卓拉穆斯进行着永恒的战争，每个军团都有自己独特的文化、领土、首府和军事阶级，以及专门的战术、武器和神秘技艺。尽管各自由一位大将军领导，但所有三个派系都向古龙女王萨菲拉宣誓效忠。女王允许甚至鼓励冲突，只要战火不蔓延到该行省的边界之外。每个军团的胜利条件，就是彻底消灭另外两个军团，从而赢得他们龙族君主的唯一青睐，并为最终征服德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的其他地区做好准备。

霜影军团。该军团身披厚重的黯龙钢甲胄，手持冰冷的符文之刃，其战力依赖于其超群的军备储备。他们囤积的资源比另外两个军团的总和还要多，其军队装备着刻有霜与影之诡秘符文的卓越武器和盔甲，并与巨大的战争机器并肩作战。由远古魔法驱动的巨型浮空堡垒在天空中漂浮，使霜影军团能将其武库的强大力量投送到每一条战线。

沸血军团。这个派系的每一位战士都对军团和战友怀有绝对的忠诚，这种紧密的同袍情谊使这支军队能够以完美的同步性进行战斗。每名士兵都在狂热地追求战斗的极致，并通过血魔法仪式来辅助，这些仪式能赋予他们超自然的力量、精准和战斗本能。

噬髓军团。纯粹的数量优势和残暴的本性使这个派系得以在辛卓拉穆斯的战争中立足。无数的战士从龙骨筑成的巨大巢穴中涌出，如潮水般冲击敌人，每倒下一名士兵，就会有两名新的士兵来替代。该军团很少使用复杂的战术，但它频繁地释放该行省本身的邪恶死灵魔法，来使敌人枯萎和腐烂。

黯龙钢

在席卷辛卓拉穆斯、摧毁了曾经繁荣之废墟王国的巨大冲突中，无数强大的巨龙殒命，它们破碎的尸骸被冰封的荒原所覆盖。随着成千上万的巨龙大规模死亡，它们的龙之精华滲入了这片行省的土地之中，永久地改变了这片大地，并创造出一种被称为黯龙钢（发音为DRACK‑oh‑nite）的新金属矿石。

这种漆黑且异常冰冷的金属矿藏在辛卓拉穆斯各处都有大量分布。它以极致的锋锐、坚韧与轻盈著称，被广泛用于锻造武器、铠甲，甚至修造建筑。由于其备受追捧，甚至连辛卓拉穆斯以外的战士也趋之若鹜，许多最惨烈的战役皆因争夺黯龙钢矿井而展开。

名流志士

古龙女王萨菲拉

这条后来成为辛卓拉穆斯统治者的凛冬之龙，是那场摧毁曾经繁盛之王国的血腥内战中最后一个陨落的存在。她亲眼见证了小诸侯的争权夺利所引发的肆意毁灭，甚至见证了自己族群的灭绝，她生命的最后时刻被无尽的狂怒与仇恨所吞噬。这引发了一场死灵连锁反应，将整座行省都变成了一片亡者之地，并让萨菲拉（发音为suh‑FEER‑uh）以一名极度强大的死灵法师之姿重返世间。如今，她的形态是一头巨大的骸骨之龙，身上覆盖着干瘪的灰色血肉以及蓝白相间的片片鳞甲。

萨菲拉没有让她的龙类同胞承受如此的命运，而是复活了王国曾经的人类，将他们扭曲成食尸鬼般的霜墓种，并成为了他们的古龙女王。如今，她以傲慢与冷酷统治着他们以及她冰冷领地上的其他种族，以荣耀的承诺操纵着三个交战派系陷入无休止的冲突——部分是出于痛苦的复仇，但也是出于必要。这座行省饥渴的死灵怒焰已经超出了古龙女王的控制，她深知此地绝不可能容忍和平。一旦某个军团取得胜利，它便会将目光南移，吞噬整个德鲁斯肯瓦尔德。

呼嚎姊妹

呼嚎姊妹高大强壮，肌肉发达，是子夜之母的女儿中体格最威猛的一个。她长着剃刀般锋利的牙齿、长长的利爪、斑驳的毛皮以及其他野兽般的特征。呼嚎姊妹偏好近身搏杀的快感，释放出原始的本能和纯粹的狂怒，并通过一种被她大多数姐妹视为野蛮的自我强化巫术来增强自身力量。

尽管她对子夜月影女巫会更宏大的阴谋漠不关心，但呼嚎姊妹依旧随势而行，抓住任何借口去战斗和杀戮。她率领着一支不断壮大的凶猛野兽人部落，如雷霆般席卷冰封苔原，对三大死陵军团发动突袭与游击战。他们所到之处，兽性的嗜血诅咒不断蔓延，甚至能将最忠诚的战士扭曲为一群流着口水的嗜血兽群。她的最终野心，是将古龙女王本身变成一头无意识的毁灭巨兽，从而让她能凭借这股力量，摆脱家族的束缚，按自己的规则生存。

胜景名迹

塞普图拉

塞普图拉（发音为seh‑pull‑TUR‑uh）是一座巨大且固若金汤的亡者之城，矗立在辛卓拉穆斯的中心。这座宏伟的都城由墓碑与黯龙钢建造而成，作为一处中立领土，所有三个军团都同意在城墙之内及其外十里的范围内休战。违反这项互不侵犯条约被认为是一种极其恶劣且不光彩的禁忌，以至于即便是该省最奸诈、最渴望权力的人也认为此事不可想象。极少数在城内进行任何战争行为的阴谋家或暴徒，将由古龙女王萨菲拉亲自在她位于亡者之城心脏地带的宏伟黯龙钢城堡中处置。

塞普图拉被划分为四个区域——分别为霜影、沸血和噬髓军团所设的霜之区、血之区和骸之区，以及作为中立地带的龙之区。龙之区供敌对派系成员会面与交涉，并与萨菲拉的亲军，女王卫队，处理军事事务。虽然来自其他行省的访客十分罕见，但若能在此提供舒适的商品和服务，便能从这些鲜少体验生活乐趣的士兵身上赚取大笔财富。

龙之终末

辛卓拉穆斯最神圣的地点是位于该省最北端山脉中，一处隐秘山谷里的一片广阔的巨龙墓地。在龙之终末，绵延数里的雪景被成千上万的巨龙、龙兽及其他龙族生物的巨大骸骨所覆盖。这座山谷是那场导致凛冬之龙灭绝的内战中，最为血腥之战役的发生地，萨菲拉偶尔会来此朝圣，独自沉思——这是她唯一允许自己感受悲伤的时刻。

传说许多强大的战争神器在那场战斗中遗失，至今仍散落在骸骨之间，等待着被发现。但觊觎此处的盗墓贼必须面对重重危险，包括无情的自然环境、仍在以龙髓为食的巨型食腐野兽，以及那些曾助推一个文明走向终结的残留诅咒。

辛卓拉穆斯的冒险

在辛卓拉穆斯的冰封废土之上，冲突永无休止，不死军团为争夺统治权而战，彼此间被深刻的宿怨与铭刻于骸骨之上的不祥秘密所束缚。

Zulrogg.name: Zulrogg
Zulrogg.text:
祖尔罗格

「等等。你听见了吗？ 夜。生命之魂。它在呼唤你。孩子，不要害怕。 是那鸣唱的蛙。是你的祖父。是那淅沥的雨。是那古老的红树。 是你的母亲。是那天边的云。是这粒沙。是我。也是你。 凝视你的倒影，侧耳倾听。你，会回应吗？」

—— 塔兹莉·唤沼者 ——

尽管祖尔罗格（发音为ZULL‑rawg）的广袤热带沼泽位于死亡之异界，但此地却依旧生机盎然。在扭曲的树木与缠绕的藤蔓织成的厚密华盖之下，生、死、重生的循环周而复始，其中的每个阶段都与其他部分和谐共荣，这片行省中的动植物与各族人民亦是如此。原始精魂与先祖之灵在帷幕的两端来回漂泊，为探寻者献上自己的智慧与引导。

虽然这片沼泽危机四伏，遍布着各式各样的危险，但它也为其间的人民提供了生存所需的一切。这其中也包括了沼泽种, 他们自泥沼中重生，破土而出。他们与沼泽中的野兽，无论是自然的还是超自然的，建立起牢不可破的纽带，并在备受其社会敬仰的精魂祭司的智慧引领下，过着与荒野紧密交织、富足而充实的生活。

行省逸闻

灵兽

庇佑这片行省的是一群强大的荒野精魂，祂们深受当地人民的崇拜。祂们各自化身为祖尔罗格的沼泽、丛林与海岸线上的不同生物，据说每一位精魂都承载着所有尊崇祂的先祖们的智慧。尽管有些精魂比其他的更为仁慈，但从最平凡的渔夫到最智慧的精魂祭司，祂们都在指引祖尔罗格居民的生活中扮演着各自的角色。

祖尔罗格的社会建立在对这些灵兽的崇敬与交流之上，为不同的祈求而向不同的精魂献上祭品，已是此地生活的常态。然而，这种与凡人的深刻联系也使灵兽们有了弱点，心怀恶意的仪式师们试图捕捉祂们，并榨取其精华为己所用。有些甚至妄图杀死一头灵兽，并将祂们的力量据为己有。

不凋花

祖尔罗格的土地上，遍生着数不清的花卉、草药、果实和其他植物，它们每一株都能作为材料，被用于这片行省的仪式、祭祀和医学。任何难题，似乎都能在某个高脚屋聚落里找到可以解决它的合剂、药膏或酊剂。然而，其中最为罕见的不凋花，因其强大的魔法功效而备受推崇。

不凋花是一种优美而娇嫩的花朵，花瓣呈粉、紫、橙、金等色，散发着重生、新生与青春的原初气息。只有在特定的时间与状况下，才能于偏远之地寻获它们，而这一过程需要灵兽的指引。若能在采摘和保存时小心翼翼，不损伤其花瓣分毫，技艺最高超的精魂祭司便能用它调配出创造医疗奇迹、令死者复生、乃至赋予永恒青春的药剂。祖尔罗格的人民绝不会轻视这份力量，而这些药剂也只会授予那些得到了此地精魂认可的人。

名流志士

塔兹莉·唤沼者

虽然名为塔兹莉·唤沼者（发音为TAZ‑ree）的沼泽种精魂祭司是新月王庭的一员，但她摒弃了任何政治权力，仅靠以身作则与精神指引来领导祖尔罗格。她由伟大的多头蛇精魂亲自选定为代言人，从其众首中领受了非凡的智慧，因而被公认为德鲁斯肯瓦尔德最具洞察力的存在之一。尽管地位崇高，她仍将许多夜晚用于教导年轻人如何更好地与精魂交流，并寻找到他们应该尊崇的灵兽——这是祖尔罗格社会每位成员都必须经历的一道意义非凡的仪式。

塔兹莉已经活了数个世纪，她用不凋花药剂延续着生命，直到能找到合适的继任者，成为多头蛇精魂的下一位代言人。然而，当人们看着她时，却很难判断她的年龄，她时而显得年轻，时而又苍老无比。她那古怪的收藏癖好更使她平添了几分神秘。她深知沼泽的每次馈赠皆有其目的，所以她会将找到的任何小饰品或残骸都收进自己缝制的收藏袋中。据说，这些零零碎碎的杂物，最终都会成为她仪式中最强大的材料。

砂囊姊妹

在祖尔罗格最深、草木最为繁茂的沼泽中，扭曲的树枝间，坐落着砂囊姊妹那荆棘缠绕的巢穴。这位女巫满身赘肉、皮肤褶皱，长着羽毛和禽类的特征，外形酷似一只臃肿的秃鹫，贪婪地吞食着生腐的血肉，尤其钟爱那些有智慧的凡人种族。她对世间万物皆无爱意，唯独珍视她的"孩子们"——那些无数怪诞的食腐鸟，集聚成庞大的鸟群，飞越德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的天空。它们是子夜月影女巫会的眼线，能在数秒内便将受害者啃食得只剩白骨。

她的巫术专精于腐朽、衰败与疾病，能将任何生物——包括超自然存在、精魂乃至神祇——都完美地处理成她的食物。正是这种能力让砂囊为她所有的姐妹、甚至是她的母亲所畏惧，因为她能完全吸收并夺取被她吞食的任何实体的力量。在祖尔罗格，她饥渴的目光早已锁定在那些最强大的灵兽身上，并期望着最终能将祂们变为自己的盘中餐，从而将这片土地上全部的原初之力据为己有。

胜景名迹

古拉什'亚塔尔

尽管沼泽、丛林与水道间遍布着许多聚落，但其中最大的高脚屋城市是古拉什亚塔尔（发音为gur‑OSH uh‑TALL）。这座城市建于浑浊的水面之上，并穿插于苔藓丛生的林木之间，其木制的街道与建筑由一套错综复杂的步道与绳桥网络相连。这套网络对外来者而言或许令人望而生畏，但当地人却能驾轻就熟地穿行其间。长颈的爬行沼泽兽负责在城市各处摆渡旅人，而大型剑齿猫则充当坐骑，能够轻松地在城市的各个层级间攀上爬下，并在树顶平台之间跳跃。

古拉什亚塔尔各处都设有供奉着众多灵兽的神龛，人们可在此献上祭品以博取祂们的青睐，甚至得到神秘的祝福。沼泽行者小屋吸引着来自德鲁斯肯瓦尔德各地的访客，他们前来观赏祖尔罗格历代传奇猎人最引以为傲的战利品，并向大师们学习追踪、狩猎与设置陷阱的技巧。由神秘莫测的商人森杰经营的繁华贸易站里，拥有探险荒野所需的一切。

拉坎'札尔的神殿

拉坎札尔（发音为ruh‑KAHN ZAHL）的古老石制神殿由一个失落的文明于数千年前建造，它缓缓沉入沼泽，最终被一潭死水彻底吞没。然而，神殿内部的厅室并未被洪水淹没，找到其隐秘入口的人将会发现一个迷宫般的网络，其中遍布着走廊、祭仪室与岩洞，如今已被沼泽的动植物所占据。

这处蕴含着古老神秘力量的地方，也吸引了一个崇拜邪恶血蝠精魂的邪教的注意。他们在潮湿的石室中举行邪恶的仪式，并试图利用神殿的秘密知识，来帮助他们所尊奉的神祇成为统治所有灵兽的神明。他们正筹备着一场宏大的仪式，妄图榨干这片土地上所有人的鲜血与生命精粹，以此来启动并助推这场向神明之位的飞升。

祖尔罗格的冒险

深入祖尔罗格草木丛生的沼泽深处，精魂在此呼唤，古老的危险正等待着那些敢于挑战其原初之力的勇者。

Chapter 7: Spells.name: Chapter 7:  Spells
Chapter 7: Spells.text:
Chapter 7:

Spells

This chapter introduces forty spells steeped in the essence of Folk Horror. Outside of being granted these spells by features, the GM decides how player characters can learn them. For spellcasters who have access to their entire spell list, they might simply become aware of the magic of Druskenvald now available to them. Alternatively, a character might need to experience, research, or otherwise learn of a new spell before selecting it.

Spell Lists

This first section in this chapter presents additions to class spell lists. These spells can be organized by spell level and then alphabetized, and each spell’s school of magic is listed.

Spell Descriptions.name: 法术描述
Spell Descriptions.text:
Spell Descriptions

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.2sUtjrDJgq1ARKiB]{Ancestral Communion}

1st-level divination

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: Self

Components: V, S

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You invoke the wisdom of your ancestors to gain insight into your trials. When you cast the spell, and at the start of each of your turns for the duration, you gain inspiration if you don’t already have it.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.oBLCAqwF7Brze8Ic]{Blood Bolt}

Necromancy cantrip

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: 90 feet

Components: V, S

Duration: Instantaneous

You hurl a twisting bolt of blood at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 necrotic damage, and you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

The spell’s damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.WUcmHW2uAgDASy5t]{Blood Sacrifice}

2nd-level necromancy

Casting Time: 1 bonus action

Range: Self

Components: V, S, M (a drop of your own blood)

Duration: 1 minute

You sacrifice a portion of your life force to enhance your magical power. When you cast this spell, you take 1d6 necrotic damage, which can’t be reduced or prevented in any way. For the duration, when you cast a spell that deals damage, one target of the spell (your choice) takes an extra 1d6 damage of the same type as the spell’s normal damage type (your choice if there are multiple).

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage you take and the extra damage your spells deal both increase by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.J9EDcqSqGwjp2yF6]{Buried Alive}

4th-level transmutation

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: 60 feet

Components: V, S, M (a pinch of grave dirt)

Duration: Instantaneous

You send your enemies to their graves even if they aren’t dead yet. A creature that you can see within range that is standing on the ground must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the ground opens and swallows the target, burying it up to 10 feet deep. While buried, the target has total cover, has the restrained and blinded conditions, and can’t breathe. On a successful save, the target is knocked prone, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. A buried creature can dig out of the grave by using its action to make a DC 15 Strength (Athletics) check. On a success, it digs 5 feet closer to the surface. If it succeeds by 5 or more, it reaches the surface. When the creature reaches the surface, it exits the ground prone.

The target automatically succeeds on its saving throw if it’s standing on any thickness of stone or metal, or at least 2 inches of wood.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.5iXfTDu2kfwBO4g9]{Call of the Wild}

4th-level enchantment

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: Self

Components: V, S, M (a bit of animal fur or hide)

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You unleash a primal howl that calls lesser creatures to your command. Each Beast in a 100-foot sphere centered on you when you cast the spell must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target is charmed by you, it can understand your commands, and it follows them on its next turn to the best of its ability. On your subsequent turns, you can take an action to issue a new command. On a successful save, a target is charmed by you until the start of your next turn, but you have no additional ability to command it. The howl is audible within 300 feet.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.PQgh5g3rWzEPX75i]{Captivate Undead}

1st-level necromancy

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: 60 feet

Components: V, S, M (a pinch of bone dust)

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 hour

You usurp the negative energy animating an Undead creature that you can see within range, attempting to take control of it. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, for the duration, the target is charmed by you (ignoring any immunity to that condition), and it is friendly toward you. On a successful save, the target has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes against you before the start of your next turn. If you or any of your allies damage the target or force it to make a saving throw, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.Q6rJDktBlJQkD28a]{Chain of Conviction}

2nd-level conjuration

Casting Time: 1 bonus action

Range: 30 feet

Components: S

Duration: 1 minute

You hurl a spectral, barbed chain at a creature that you can see within range. The target makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d6 force damage, is pulled up to 30 feet toward you, and is bound by the chain. While bound by the chain, the creature is tethered to you and can’t move or teleport to a space more than 30 feet away from you, and you have advantage on attack rolls made against the creature.

On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only. The bound target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success. If you are ever more than 30 feet away from the target, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.R8ziI8frQqJwzly8]{Chorus of the Lost}

2nd-level necromancy

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: 60 feet

Components: V, S, M (a silver bell worth at least 10 gp)

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You summon the eerie song and wailing of lost souls from a point you can see within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered there must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d6 psychic damage, and it is frightened for the duration. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage, and it is frightened until the end of its next turn. A frightened target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.tWWtVIXKt2lFyr5y]{Consuming Pyre}

4th-level evocation

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: 90 feet

Components: V, S

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You cause a creature that you can see within range to burst into consuming, relentless flames. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d8 fire damage and 2d8 necrotic or radiant damage (choose when you cast the spell), and the radiant flames linger. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only.

While the flames linger, the creature takes the damage again at the start of each of its turns. The target, or another creature within reach of the target, can take an action to allow the target to repeat the saving throw, ending the spell on a success.

A creature killed by the damage from this spell is reduced to ash, along with any nonmagical equipment it is wearing or carrying.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.oEgsN210zqqfwCkz]{Creeping Rot}

3rd-level necromancy

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: 90 feet

Components: V, S

Duration: 1 minute

You send tendrils of black and gray rot toward a target that you can see within range. Three tendrils then leap from that target to as many as three other targets of your choice, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or a nonmagical plant that isn’t a creature, such as a tree or shrub. In either case, each can be targeted by only one of the tendrils.

A target that is a creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 3d8 necrotic damage and is poisoned for the duration. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only. A creature poisoned in this way takes 1d8 necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. A poisoned creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.

A Plant creature automatically fails the initial save, and a nonmagical plant that isn’t a creature simply withers and dies.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, one additional tendril leaps from the first target to another target for each slot level above 3rd.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.8Xc30AwWHKPbKhZ8]{Crimson Harvest}

3rd-level necromancy

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: Self

Components: V, S, M (a vial of blood)

Duration: Instantaneous

A wave of blood sweeps out from you. Each creature of your choice within 15 feet of you that isn’t behind total cover must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d10 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If you damage at least one Small or larger creature, one creature of your choice that you can see within the area regains a number of hit points equal to half the damage roll.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 3rd.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.lyl3IR7YIBA5bEKR]{Crooked Ward}

3rd-level abjuration

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: Touch

Components: V, S, M (a five-pointed wicker star)

Duration: Concentration, up to 10 minutes

You touch an immobile surface and mark a symbol that causes agony in twisted creatures. An invisible, 30-foot-radius sphere springs out from the point you touch. Each Aberration, Fey, Fiend, Monstrosity, or Undead in the sphere has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls. When an affected creature enters the sphere for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of its next turn.

At Higher Levels. You can maintain concentration on this spell for longer if you cast it using a spell slot of 4th level (up to 1 hour) or 5th level (up to 8 hours). If you use a 6th level spell slot or higher, the spell doesn’t require concentration, and the duration becomes 24 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.NuL3dTwIkqaLbZqr]{Culling Sickle}

3rd-level necromancy

Casting Time: 1 bonus action

Range: Self

Components: V, S

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You create a ghostly sickle that lasts for the duration and can strike out at your foes. The sickle appears hovering in your space and moves with you. When you cast this spell and as a bonus action on each of your turns, you can direct it to fly at and strike a creature within 30 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 necrotic damage, and you gain temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt. After the sickle hits or misses, it returns to hover in your space.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.dRtyWuPNnBXBmXfm]{Cursed Cacophony}

3rd-level enchantment (ritual)

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: Special

Components: S, M (a sheet of music)

Duration: Concentration, up to 10 minutes

You focus on a creature that you are familiar with that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be cursed for the duration. Once a target fails its saving throw against this spell, you can’t target it with a ritual casting of the spell for 24 hours.

While cursed, the target hears haunting, discordant music and has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The first time the target fails one of those rolls during a turn, it repeats the save against this spell with neither advantage nor disadvantage, ending the spell early on a success.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.ZHMnRSMpaLfFlJ58]{Devil’s Due}

1st-level necromancy

Casting Time: 1 reaction, which you take when another creature within range takes damage

Range: 30 feet

Components: S, M (a glob of pitch)

Duration: Instantaneous

You absorb a measure of a creature’s suffering and escaping vital essence. Expend and roll one Hit Die. You regain a number of hit points equal to the number rolled plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

If the creature took damage from a critical hit, double the number of hit points you regain.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can expend one additional Hit Die for each slot level above 1st.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.ywd6nCwrxbbgUyJD]{Dissolution}

Transmutation cantrip

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: Touch

Components: V, S

Duration: Instantaneous

You touch a creature or nonmagical object and break the target’s substance down into its most fundamental components. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 force damage, and its AC is reduced by 1 against the next attack roll made against it before the end of your next turn.

The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th-level (2d8), 11th-level (3d8), and 17th-level (4d8).

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.gWQaUO3ZW0IHErR9]{Eye Burn}

Transmutation cantrip

Casting Time: 1 reaction, which you take when a creature you can see within range targets you with an attack

Range: 30 feet

Components: V, S, M (a smear of camphor)

Duration: 1 round

You sting the eyes of a creature attacking you. The target must make a Constitution saving throw (a creature with blindsight or immunity to the blinded condition succeeds automatically). On a failed save, the target is blinded until the end of the turn. On a successful save, it must subtract 1d4 from the triggering attack roll. The target automatically succeeds on its saves against your subsequent casting of this spell for 24 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.vcFKBGkDQ6CZVeKT]{Field of Reaping}

5th-level necromancy

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: 90 feet

Components: V, S, M (a dried corn husk or wheat hull)

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You create a shadowy field that reaps escaping life force in a 30-foot cube originating from a point within range. A creature hostile to you in the field when it appears, or when it enters the field for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, is cursed until the end of its next turn. While cursed, the first time the creature takes damage during a turn, it takes an extra 1d6 necrotic damage, and a creature of your choice within the field that isn’t cursed by it regains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage taken.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.KfMuCODOEewASaPL]{Ghastly Charge}

6th-level necromancy

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: Self

Components: V, S, M (a scrap of a banner)

Duration: Instantaneous

You call forth the spirits of long-dead knights, which charge forward from you in a 90-foot long, 20-foot wide line, and then vanish. Each creature of your choice in the line must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 5d12 necrotic damage, is frightened of you until the start of your next turn, and must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as far as its speed allows away from you, using the safest route. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d12 for each slot level above 6th.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.RM6un0lAbTYWfT5h]{Harvest Moonglow}

3rd-level evocation

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: 60 feet

Components: V, S, M (a piece of moonstone)

Duration: 1 hour

You call upon the light of the harvest moon to illuminate a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The area is bathed in silvery dim light. Invisible creatures and objects in the light become visible as translucent, shimmering images. When one of your allies is within the light, it can use a bonus action to absorb some of the light and gain 2d6 temporary hit points.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.hEFJUCxqlcGHQnIQ]{Harrowing Ballad}

2nd-level enchantment

Casting Time: 1 bonus action

Range: 120 feet

Components: V, S

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You inflict a mind-eroding song on a creature that you can see within range. If the creature has an Intelligence score of 4 or higher, it must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or be charmed by you for the duration.

While charmed in this way, the target is struck with a rapidly repeating ballad that only it can hear; it takes 1d6 psychic damage at the start of each of its turns, and it has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on Constitution saving throws made to maintain its concentration. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.HjfdmIr99Ko677mi]{Hungering Blade}

1st-level necromancy

Casting Time: 1 bonus action

Range: Self

Components: V, S

Duration: 1 minute

You imbue a weapon you are holding, or your unarmed strikes, with ravenous negative energy. For the duration, when you hit a creature with an attack using the empowered weapon or unarmed strike for the first time on a turn, the target takes necrotic damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier, and you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.WNH6BsA0tB6S0DaO]{Intrusive Despair}

4th-level enchantment

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: 90 feet

Components: V, S, M (a devil’s trumpet blossom)

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You curse a creature within range, filling its mind with creeping paranoia and despair. When the target uses its action to attack or cast a spell, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or waste its action. Once the target succeeds on three saving throws against this spell, the spell ends.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.vYLH4NCWpJNWJ7lt]{Isolation}

3rd-level enchantment

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: 120 feet

Components: V, S, M (a small metal cube)

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have its mind shrouded in the dread of total isolation. For the duration, all other creatures are invisible toward the target, which the target can’t see through—even with blindsight, truesight, or magic such as the See Invisibility spell—and the target can’t perceive other creatures with any of its other senses. The target moves around other creatures, or otherwise rationalizes not moving through spaces occupied by them (such as perceiving a door as closed or as a wall if another creature is standing in the way). The target still feels pain but can’t identify the source of any injury caused by another creature. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.MVzM1hRdci2imGdJ]{Lucky Charm}

5th-level transmutation

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: Touch

Components: V, S, M (a four-leaf clover and a shard of broken mirror)

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 hour

You touch a Tiny, nonmagical object, infusing it with a portion of your own luck for the duration. While another creature carries the object, that creature has advantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws, and you have disadvantage on them.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.3CF4Y7IBf0A5vkAd]{Martyr}

3rd-level necromancy

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: Touch

Components: V, S, M (a dagger worth at least 1 cp)

Duration: Instantaneous

You touch a dead creature that died within the last minute and transfer your life essence into it. The target returns to life with hit points equal to your current hit point total. You immediately drop to 0 hit points (which nothing can prevent) with two failed death saving throws, and you must immediately make a death save. You can’t regain hit points or become stable until after you make this save.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.0U1lyCiEra5oGkzc]{Mirrored Agony}

5th-level abjuration

Casting Time: 1 reaction, which you take when a creature you can see within 60 feet of you damages your ally

Range: 60 feet

Components: V, S, M (a pin or needle)

Duration: Instantaneous

The triggering creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes an amount of psychic damage equal to the damage it dealt to your ally. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.DpxnZN4YBN7Kic2U]{Mist of Mourning}

3rd-level enchantment

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: 60 feet

Components: V, S, M (a vial of tears)

Duration: Concentration, up to 10 minutes

You summon a thin mist that saps joy and vigor in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. Each creature in the mist when it appears, or when it moves into the mist for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be filled with deep melancholy until the end of its next turn. An affected creature’s speed is halved, it has disadvantage on attack rolls, and it subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.MGQxVmPf3LdViY57]{Murder of Crows}4th-level conjuration

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: Self

Components: V, S, M (a crow feather)

Duration: Instantaneous

You summon and unleash a murder of deadly crows. Each creature of your choice in a 30-foot cone originating from you makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 5d6 force damage and is blinded. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only. A blinded creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The effect also ends if the creature regains any hit points. The crows disperse and vanish after they strike.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 4th.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.719BJ4HT4BjWoMGT]{Mysterious Presence}

Illusion cantrip

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: Touch

Components: V, S

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You touch a willing creature and shroud its presence. Until the spell ends, other creatures must subtract 1d4 from any Wisdom (Insight or Perception) checks made against the target.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.rsgkt9iEkQJxBye1]{Puppet Master}

4th-level enchantment

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: 60 feet

Components: V, S, M (a marionette string)

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for the duration.

Magical marionette strings attach to the charmed creature’s limbs or body, and it must use its action on its turn to make a melee attack against a creature other than itself that you mentally choose, moving to reach the target if necessary. The target can act normally on its turn if you don’t choose another creature, or if the creature isn’t within the target’s reach after it moves. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.

On your later turns, you must take a bonus action to maintain control of the target, or the spell ends.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.p8F4TmvLbtT9NuvL]{Sacrificial Siphon}

4th-level necromancy

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: Touch

Components: S

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You touch another creature and lay a curse that drains the target’s vitality and transfers it to you. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target is cursed for the duration. While cursed, the target must subtract 1d4 from its attack rolls and ability checks, and when the target takes damage, you can use your reaction to gain 10 temporary hit points. On a successful save, you gain 5 temporary hit points, and the target must subtract 1d4 from its ability checks until the start of your next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.iMk3WNtPvZsbuevo]{Sanctum of the Shepherd}

4th-level abjuration

Casting Time: 1 minute

Range: 5 feet

Components: V, S, M (adamantine or diamond powder worth at least 200 gp, which the spell consumes)

Duration: 24 hours

You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of faint, shimmering light centered on a point within range. You and a number of creatures of your choice up to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1 other creature) can absorb protective magic from the sphere. When any of the chosen creatures finish a long rest in the area, the sphere vanishes, and those creatures gain a +1 bonus to AC for the remainder of the duration. Chosen creatures who don’t finish a long rest in the sphere gain no benefit.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.u7QGf5juEDnPjt5p]{Sanctum of the Flock}

3rd-level transmutation

Casting Time: 1 minute

Range: 5 feet

Components: V, S, M (powdered silver worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes)

Duration: 24 hours

You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of faint, shimmering light centered on a point within range. You and a number of creatures of your choice up to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1 other creature) can absorb empowering magic from the sphere. When any of the chosen creatures finish a long rest in the area, the sphere vanishes, and those creatures gain 2d10 temporary hit points, and for the remainder of the duration, they have advantage on Charisma checks that use one of their skill proficiencies. Chosen creatures who don’t finish a long rest in the sphere gain no benefit.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.CQjxa8wBM95EWSAT]{Sanguine Secrets}

2nd-level divination

Casting Time: 1 bonus action

Range: 30 feet

Components: V, S, M (a drop of blood, which the spell consumes)

Duration: 1 round

You draw knowledge through the power of blood about a creature you can see within range. You learn the target’s species and creature type, its current hit points, and any conditions affecting it. You also learn if it has any of the following, and, if so, what they are: vulnerability, resistance, or immunity to damage or conditions.

Additionally, the next ability check or attack roll you make against the target before the end of your next turn has advantage.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.cThSLWq8wjJ0zAm0]{Scarlet Dawn}

3rd-level evocation

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: 120 feet

Components: V, S

Duration: Instantaneous

Crimson light shines down in a 20-foot-radius, 60-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. Each creature in that area that isn’t a Construct or Undead must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 4d10 necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Constructs and Undead in the area regain 4d10 hit points.

If any of this spell’s area overlaps with an area of darkness created by a spell of 3rd level or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 and the level of spell that can be dispelled increases by 1 for each slot level above 3rd.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.FlwXBHp7PQsCABi3]{Shadow Drain}

3rd-level necromancy

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: Self

Components: V, S

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

For the duration, you siphon away the vitality and sense of self through the shadows of creatures within 15 feet of you that aren’t behind total cover.

When you cast this spell, you can designate creatures to be unaffected by it. Whenever any other creature enters the area or starts its turn there, or when the area enters a creature’s space, the creature must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d6 necrotic damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.9lL8MubSoFtvf9jG]{Summer Winds}

2nd-level evocation

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: Self

Components: V, S

Duration: Instantaneous

You unleash a blast of light and wind in a 15-foot cone. Your allies in the cone regain 2d6 hit points. Undead within the cone that are hostile to you must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d6 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage and healing increase by 2d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.PdbfnbzeZtPo0n0P]{Unraveling Whisper}

2nd-level enchantment

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: 30 feet

Components: V, S

Duration: 1 round

Choose a creature you can see within range and whisper a frightful phrase that only the target can hear. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d6 psychic damage and is frightened until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

While frightened in this way, the creature has vulnerability to your choice of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.1oZ3vQnPhbMwT1of]{Veil of the Reaper}

2nd-level illusion

Casting Time: 1 bonus action

Range: Self

Components: V, S, M (a dried corn husk or wheat straw)

Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute

You wrap yourself in shadows that veil you between strikes. At the end of any turn in which you hit a creature with an attack roll, you become invisible until the start of your next turn.

Fabled Heirlooms.name: Fabled Heirlooms
Fabled Heirlooms.text:
Fabled Heirlooms

Ancient soul-binding magicks twist through the shrouded domain of Druskenvald, drawn to legendary beings with fate-touched souls. This spiritual energy weaves its way through the relics that these entities possess, imbuing them with their wielder’s essence and power. Once severed from the mythic figures that shaped them, Fabled Heirlooms can be taken up by new bearers, granting strange and fearsome abilities that continue to awaken as their keepers’ souls grow stronger.

Each Fabled Heirloom is a magic item that grows in strength as its attuned owner gains power. The rarity of each heirloom increases as the character grows in level, as shown on the Heirloom Rarity table. An heirloom’s description details the properties it always has, as well as the properties it gains as it increases in rarity. The heirloom has all the properties of its rarity and lower.

Heirloom Rarity

1st–6th Level7th–12th Level13th Level+
RareVery RareLegendary

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.LKfTErToFGGZOOFE]{Axe of the Galloping Headsman}

Weapon (battleaxe), rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This axe has a wickedly curved head, honed to a razor’s edge and limned with dark fire. Its handle is wrapped in cracked leather, and the entirety is etched with malevolent runes.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the axe’s rarity. You can also use the following properties.

Fiery Smite (Rare+). This axe deals an extra 1d6 fire damage on a hit. If the target is a creature that damaged you since the end of your last turn, the extra damage becomes 1d10.

Mark of Guilt (Very Rare+). When you hit a creature with the axe, you can mark it for punishment (no action required). You know the direction and distance to the creature. If it leaves this plane of existence, you know the destination plane and the mark ends. The mark otherwise ends when this property is used again, or when the target dies.

Sense Guilt (Very Rare+). You can take a bonus action to hold the blade of the axe to a creature’s neck (if it has one), and it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the axe’s bonus) or you learn something the creature feels guilty about. Once this property is used, the target is immune to it for 24 hours.

Dark Binding (Legendary). Once during your turn when you hit a creature with the axe, you can immediately take a bonus action to force the target to succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be paralyzed and prone until the start of your next turn. If its body shape allows it, the target kneels and presents its neck.

Executioner’s Blade (Legendary). When you attack a prone creature using the axe, you score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20. On a critical hit, the axe deals an extra 3d6 fire damage, and if the creature is left with 20 or fewer hit points after taking this damage, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or die.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.PG104KB6rnxYahnx]{Banjo of Ol’ Jericho Sticks}

Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

An old, weathered banjo inscribed with runes, this instrument once belonged to Ol’ Jericho Sticks, a scarecrow bard created by a hag coven.

While holding the banjo, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your spells; you gain a bonus determined by its rarity to spell attack rolls, your spell save DC, and Charisma (Performance) checks; and you can use the following properties.

Fiendish Lure (Rare+). As an action, choose one Fiend or Humanoid that you can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the banjo’s bonus) or be charmed (ignoring a demon’s immunity) for 1 minute. The charmed condition ends if you or your allies deal damage to the target or force it to make a saving throw. Once a creature is charmed in this way, this property can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Scarecrow’s Dance (Rare+). You can take a bonus action to strum the banjo and dance wildly to take the Disengage action. The music is audible within 120 feet.

Join in the Dance (Very Rare+). When you use Scarecrow’s Dance, one creature of your choice that you can see within 15 feet of you can use its reaction to move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Birdcage (Legendary). As an action, you can force a creature charmed by you to make a DC 19 Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the creature disappears, drawn into the banjo. The banjo can contain one creature at a time in this way for up to 24 hours. On a success, the charmed condition ends on the creature.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.GBTdiQWqNspqiCNX]{Bell of the Dusk Mother}

Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This heavy iron handbell is elaborately decorated with filigree. Its handle is a large ring, and its clapper hangs from a chain within. Its only sound is ever-mournful tolling.

While holding the bell, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by its rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Dolorous Tolling (Rare+). As an action, you can ring the bell, producing an ominous tolling. Creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the bell’s bonus). On a failed save, a target takes 3d10 psychic damage, and for 1 minute, when it makes an attack roll or saving throw, it must subtract 1d4 from the total. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Call of the Bell (Very Rare+). You can take a bonus action to create a doll (use the Animated Armor stat block) from a 5-foot cube of wood, clay, or stone within 10 feet. The doll obeys your commands and acts immediately after your turn on your initiative. It reverts to the materials used to create it after 10 minutes or when it dies. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Death Knell (Legendary). As an action, you can ring the bell, creating a loud clang. Each creature within 30 feet of you that has half its hit points or fewer must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 5d10 necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more drops to 0 hit points. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.sZvX99kRvdvtZt1C]{Blunderbuss of the Grinning Sinner}

Weapon (musket), rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This dark, ornate blunderbuss has a brass barrel and a wooden handle etched with arcane symbols. It was the Grinning Sinner’s weapon of choice, who imbued it with the power to shoot jinxes and hexes.

The blunderbuss functions as a musket: a martial ranged weapon with a normal range of 40 feet and a long range of 120 feet, and it has the ammunition (bullet) and two-handed properties. It can make its own ammunition that deals necrotic damage on a hit. You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it determined by the its rarity. While holding the blunderbuss, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your spells, and you can use the following properties.

Jinxshot (Rare+). When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a blast from the blunderbuss that forces each creature within a 30-foot cone to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 16 + the blunderbuss’s bonus), taking 2d4 necrotic damage (Rare) or 3d6 necrotic damage (Very Rare+) on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Sinner’s Jinx (Very Rare+). Once during your turn when you damage a creature with the blunderbuss, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the blunderbuss’s bonus) or be cursed for 1 minute. When it makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw while cursed, it subtracts 1d4 from the total. The curse ends if this property is used on another creature.

Luck Taker (Legendary). When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you that is cursed by this weapon makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw and rolls a 19 or 20 on the d20, you can use your reaction to mimic their luck. The next time you roll a d20 within 1 minute, change the number you roll to the triggering number.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.0dNAjhJtIgZ47fDY]{Cane of Phillip Druskenvald}

Rod, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This ornate cane is made from polished black wood and is topped with a silver goat-skull ornament. Even a glance at it sparks greed and envy in all but the truly humble.

While holding the cane, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the cane’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Eldritch Glutton (Rare+). When you succeed on a saving throw against a spell that targets only you, you can use your reaction to consume the spell and store its energy in the cane. The spell has no effect on you. You can take an action to absorb the stored energy to either regain an expended spell slot that is at least one level lower than the triggering spell or gain temporary hit points equal to three times the spell’s level. If you absorb a new spell while the cane holds spell energy, the previous energy is lost. Once the cane absorbs a spell, this property can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Allure of Sin (Very Rare+). You can cast Dominate Person (save DC = 16 + the cane’s bonus) from the cane. Once a creature is charmed by the spell, this property can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sin-Binder’s Call (Legendary). As an action, you can summon three Hell Hounds, one Incubus, or one Succubus. They appear in unoccupied spaces you can see within 30 feet of you, obey your commands, and take their turns immediately after yours on your initiative count. After 10 minutes, they no longer obey you, but if you treated them well, they are indifferent or friendly toward you. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.ewNarZMSfQvM4CXa]{Cauldron of the Vermintoll Coven}

Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

The tarnished cauldron bubbles with a strange, dark liquid. Even in transport, the liquid stays within the rune-emblazoned rim of the cauldron.

While you hold the cauldron, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your spells, you gain a bonus determined by the cauldron’s rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

Size Change (Rare+). You can perform a 1-minute ritual to change the cauldron’s size from Tiny to Medium, or from Medium to Tiny. It weighs 1 lb. when Tiny and 80 lb. when Medium. As a Medium object, its feet can move. It has a speed of 20 feet and moves when you command it during your turn (no action required).

Cookpot (Rare+). As part of a short or long rest, you can use the Medium cauldron to prepare food for up to ten creatures. At the end of the rest, each creature that eats gains 2d6 temporary hit points.

Vermincall (Rare+). As an action, you can spill liquid from the cauldron to cast Conjure Animals with it. The conjured spirits take the form of grotesque insects or rats. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Fortifying Gorge (Very Rare+). When you use the Cookpot property, one creature of your choice who eats gains a +2 bonus to AC until you finish a short or long rest. During this time, the creature’s skin is hardened and monstrous.

Coven Abomination (Legendary). As a bonus action, you can drink from the cauldron or administer a draught from it to a creature within 5 feet. For 1 hour, the drinker of the thick, sickly-sweet liquid becomes Large if it is currently smaller than that, its reach increases by 5 feet, and its melee attacks deal an extra 1d8 damage. When the effect ends, the creature becomes incapacitated for 1 minute from the agony of its bones shrinking slower than its flesh.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.xbrZG9oNY8aXv54H]{Crown of the Barrow King}

Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This crown of twisted iron has five sharp, tall spikes that are crusted with dried blood. None who see it doubt the malice and corruption that the Barrow King imbued into it.

While you wear the crown, you gain a bonus determined by the crown’s rarity to spell attack rolls and to your spell save DC for necromancy spells and spells that deal necrotic damage, and you can use the following properties.

Demand of the Dead (Rare+). You can cast Speak with Dead from the crown.

Grave Grasp (Rare+). You know the Chill Touch cantrip. Your spell attack bonus with it is +9 (rare), +10 (very rare), or +11 (legendary).

Necromancer’s Call (Rare+). You can cast Animate Dead from the crown. It can be used to cast this spell three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Master of Undeath (Very Rare+). Undead that you create or summon have twice as many hit points as normal and have advantage on saving throws.

Soul Transfer (Very Rare+). When you drop to 0 hit points or fail a death saving throw, you can transfer your soul into an Undead that you created and that is within 1 mile of you (no action required). Your previous body dies instantly. Your new body has none of your possessions except the crown. You use your game statistics, except the target Undead’s current hit points replace your current hit points. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Compel Undead (Legendary). As an action, you can choose an Undead within 30 feet of you. It must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed for 1 minute. It obeys your commands while charmed in this way, and the charmed condition ends early when the creature has half its hit points or fewer.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.E9n5vyzSl49xQCXC]{Cutlass of Briggsy Kratch}

Weapon (scimitar), rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

A fearsome weapon imbued with jinxcraft magic, this cutlass was once wielded by the notorious pirate captain, Briggsy “The Kutlass” Kratch. Its tarnished blade glimmers with a faint, otherworldly light. A skull and crossbones adorn the leather-wrapped hilt, and arcane symbols etched into the blade pulse with hidden power.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with the cutlass determined by its rarity. While holding the cutlass, you can use the following properties.

Raise the Stakes (Rare+). As a bonus action, choose a creature within 5 feet of you and mark it until the start of your next turn. Count the number of times you hit the target and the number of times it hits you while the mark lasts. If you hit the target more times, it takes 2d10 psychic damage. If it hits you more times, you take 2d10 psychic damage. If your hits are tied, you both take 2d10 psychic damage. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sea Legs (Rare+). When you take the Disengage action, difficult terrain doesn’t cost you extra movement until the end of that turn.

Double Down (Very Rare+). When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make one additional attack against a target marked by the Raise the Stakes property.

Psychic Storm (Legendary). You can take one extra reaction during a round, which you can only use to activate the Psychic Shock property.

Veiled Countenance (Legendary). When you are the target of a divination spell, the caster must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the caster takes 6d8 psychic damage and becomes incapacitated for 1 minute. At the end of each of the caster’s turns, it repeats the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.dEuSHdJfDo3ZSiQi]{Visage of the Old Ways}

Wondrous item, rare (+2), very rare (+4), legendary (+6) (requires attunement)

This wood-carved mask has a haunted expression and makes the wearer’s eyes look like empty shadows. Rabbit ears protrude over the head. While you wear the mask, you hear the whispers of an ancient forest archfey deep within your mind.

While wearing the mask, you gain a bonus to your damage rolls when you deal fire damage determined by the mask’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Cultic Mask (Rare+). You can’t be targeted by divination spells or perceived through scrying sensors. Ability checks made to discern your identity have a minimum DC of 25.

Fire Within (Rare+). You can take a bonus action to begin or stop burning. While you are burning in this way, your weapon attacks deal an extra 2d4 fire damage, and you take 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of your turns.

Strange Sight (Rare+). You have darkvision with a range of 60 feet, and you can see normally through areas obscured by smoke.

Mastery of Flame (Very Rare+). Fire damage you deal ignores resistance.

Sacrificial Flame (Very Rare+). As a bonus action, you can cause a creature you can see with 0 hit points that is within 30 feet of you to burst into flame. Its body burns to ash over the next minute, and when a creature hostile to you starts its turn within 10 feet of the body, it takes 2d8 fire damage. The flame is extinguished if the target regains any hit points.

Harvest Offering (Legendary). As an action, you can expend up to 5 Hit Dice to regain a spell slot of a level equal to the number of Hit Dice spent. Alternatively, you can touch a creature that is willing or is unconscious and force them to expend any number of these Hit Dice in your place. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.Zvf8sfcWHEAdSyWQ]{Whistle of the Vagrant}

Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This tarnished brass whistle belonged to the conductor of the Ghostlight Express, imbuing it with ghastly, mysterious powers. Its metal is cold to the touch, and its sound is an unnerving shriek.

While you hold or wear the whistle, you gain a bonus determined by the whistle’s rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

Call the Dead (Rare+). As an action, you can blow the whistle to cast Gentle Repose on all dead bodies within 30 feet of you. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sense the Undead (Rare+). As a bonus action, you can detect the presence and location of Undead within 60 feet of you, even through total cover of any material other than iron or lead.

Undaunted (Rare+). You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the frightened condition.

Call the Undead (Very Rare+). As an action, you can blow the whistle to cast Banishment against an Undead creature (save DC = 16 + the whistle’s bonus) from it. The target always appears in a harmless demiplane resembling the interior of a train. If you maintain the spell for its full duration, the target arrives in an appropriate afterlife. Creatures with legendary actions automatically succeed on the saving throw. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Steam Cloud (Very Rare+). You can blow the whistle to cast Fog Cloud (no concentration required) from it. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Touched by Death (Very Rare+). You have resistance to necrotic damage.

Afterlife Express (Legendary). You can blow the whistle to cast Ghastly Charge* (takes the form of a ghost train) from it. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Cursed Curios.name: Cursed Curios
Cursed Curios.text:
Cursed Curios

Some magic items carry the kind of curse that worms its way into the flesh, mind, or soul, digging deeper the longer you remain attuned to it. Power is never without cost and danger in Druskenvald, but once you grasp power, do you have the courage to relinquish it?

Lingering Curses. Ending your attunement to one of these items removes its curse, but the power of a Cursed Curio doesn’t release its hold on the user easily. If you attune to it again within 28 days, the progression of its curse returns to where it was before you ended your attunement.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.zhJuQ6LwVCDILePE]{Amber Birdcage}

Wondrous item, very rare (requires attunement)

This birdcage, shaped from amber, physically replaces your torso while you are attuned to it. When your attunement ends, it separates from you, and your torso returns to its previous state. The birdcage has the following properties.

Sense Fiends. As a bonus action, you can sense the location of Fiends or magical effects created by Fiends within 60 feet of yourself.

Capture Fiend. As an action, choose one Fiend with half its hit points or fewer that you can see within 60 feet of yourself. It must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be transformed into an amber songbird and trapped in the birdcage. The songbird is an inert object until removed from the cage and released. You can remove one songbird from the cage as a bonus action. If you stop holding the bird, the Fiend reverts to its true form with all its hit points, and it is hostile to you.

Consume Songbird. As an action, you can consume one amber songbird you are holding. The Fiend dies, and you can either regain one expended spell slot with a level up to half the Fiend’s CR, or you can gain temporary hit points equal to the Fiend’s CR.

Amber Curse. You have a −1 penalty to Wisdom saving throws. Each time you use the Capture Fiend or Consume Songbird properties, this penalty increases by 1.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.LpvyngYod1e8ppgj]{Black Candle}

Wondrous item, very rare (requires attunement)

This broad, black tallow candle is engraved with arcane symbols. When lit, its smoke is greasy and pungent, and its flame is pale gray, but it never burns down. The candle has the following properties.

Word of Flame and Darkness. As a bonus action, you can light or extinguish the candle by speaking a command word while within 60 feet of it. It sheds dim light in a 30-foot radius.

Witchlight. While you are in the candle’s light, you can cast a level 1 or 2 spell without expending a spell slot. When you cast a spell in this way, you can’t cast that spell using the candle again for 24 hours, and you must succeed on a DC 0 Constitution saving throw or take fire damage equal to 2d6 times the spell’s level.

Cursed Candle. After you succeed or fail on the saving throw of the Witchlight property, its save DC increases by 2. This increase can’t happen again until you finish a long rest. When the DC is 10 or higher, you also have vulnerability to necrotic damage.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.bZSQ7TmlvcGOMyZf]{Bloody Fiddle}

Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

This scarlet-lacquered fiddle is warm to the touch, like the heat of fresh blood. Though it looks like it has seen better days, its sound is clear and strong.

While you hold the fiddle, you gain a +2 bonus to Charisma (Performance) checks, and you can use the following properties.

Song of Stirred Blood. As an action, you can play a lively or stirring tune on the fiddle. Up to six creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you gain temporary hit points equal to 1d10 + your proficiency bonus, and if you have Bardic Inspiration dice, you can expend and roll one to add it to the total. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sanguine Curse. The first time that you play the fiddle after finishing a long rest, you take 1 slashing damage that ignores resistance. When you use the Song of Stirred Blood property, this slashing damage increases by 1.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.e1hocfTMHnGwFipv]{Chunk of Oozing Fungus}

Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

This fist-sized fungal growth is a pallid color, is oozy and lumpy, and frequently fills the air with spores. The fungus has the following properties.

Spore Cloud. As an action, you can throw the fungus up to 30 feet. The fungus is destroyed and explodes into a cloud of spores in a 30-foot sphere centered on that point. Each creature other than you in the area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 3d8 poison damage and is poisoned until the start of your next turn. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more becomes incapacitated. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage only.

Regrow. You can grow another Chunk of Oozing Fungus by coughing green-black spores into your hand as a bonus action. When you do so, you must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or your hit point maximum decreases by 5. This reduction lasts until you finish a long rest.

Fungal Curse. You have a −1 penalty to Constitution saving throws. This penalty increases by 1 immediately after you succeed or fail on the saving throw from the Regrow property.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.GHEsXd1LBimCC1Lx]{Devilbone Button}

Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

This bone button is found on an article of clothing, such as a shirt or coat, and is carved with the tiny image of a devil. It must be attached to clothing that you wear to attune to it. You gain a +1 bonus to saving throws, and it has the following properties.

Improbable Luck. When you fail a saving throw while wearing the button, you can choose to succeed instead. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Protective Bone. While wearing the button, your hit point maximum increases by 5 + your Constitution modifier.

Diabolic Curse. When you finish a long rest, there is a 1 percent chance the button is mysteriously missing and your attunement to it ends. A devil with a CR of your level + 3 or CR 20 (whichever is lower) then becomes your enemy and seeks to destroy you. The GM determines the devil’s details. When you use the Improbable Luck property, the chance the button disappears increases by 1.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.5lTSbAjGQrVWal9K]{Green Ribbon}

Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

This green satin ribbon is just long enough to fasten around a person’s neck comfortably. It’s hard to think why you’d even want to remove it. While you wear the ribbon, you have a +5 bonus to death saving throws, and it grants the following properties.

Instant Attunement. If the ribbon is wrapped around the neck of a dead creature that has been dead no longer than 10 days and wasn’t Undead when it died, the creature returns to life as if by a Raise Dead spell, and it instantly attunes to the ribbon. The creature dies immediately if its attunement to the ribbon ends or if the ribbon is removed.

Ribbon’s Mending. When you drop to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to immediately regain hit points equal to half your level (minimum 1). Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk or until you roll a 20 on the d20 for a death saving throw.

Curse of the Ribbon. Creatures other than you within 60 feet of you have a −1 penalty to death saving throws. This penalty increases by 1 each time you use the Ribbon’s Mending property.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.Dwa1bzUSGUo3khzI]{Hypnovulfen Figure}

Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

This carved wooden figurine depicts a crooked wolf with large, leering eyes and a wild, toothy maw. While holding the figure, you can use it as a spellcasting focus, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs. The figure has the following properties.

Hypnovulfen Bite. Your teeth become viciously sharp. You can bite as an unarmed strike that deals 1d6 piercing damage instead of bludgeoning damage.

Hypnovulfen Eye. While holding the figure, you can cast Confusion (save DC 14) with it. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Cursed Hunger. When you roll initiative, you must succeed on a DC 0 Wisdom saving throw or you can’t use your action except to use the figure’s properties until you hit a creature with a Hypnovulfen Bite attack. When you use the Hypnovulfen Eye property, the DC of this saving throw increases by 2.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.sDsDp82mGHeOhMnJ]{Jinxed Poker Chip}

Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

This ceramic poker chip is painted with a crocodile’s skull on one side. Hoarse laughter sounds when it flips. While you hold the chip, it grants the following properties.

Jinxed Luck. When you fail an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to flip the chip. Roll 1d6. On a 4–6, you succeed on the ability check, attack roll, or saving throw instead. After you use this property, roll 1d20. On a 1–5, this property can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sense Cheating. If you have proficiency with a gaming set, you automatically succeed on ability checks to know if someone in a game you are playing is cheating.

Cursed Coin. When you roll initiative, you must succeed on a DC 0 Charisma saving throw or become cursed until you finish a short or long rest. While cursed, you subtract 1d6 from ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. When you use the Jinxed Luck property, the saving throw DC increases by 1.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.jrT5pWIDCwVJrwBh]{Revelry Suit}

Armor (hide), rare (requires attunement)

This bulky suit is made from natural materials, including fur, canvas, and straw. Its mask is exceptionally oversized and shaped into a sun, smiling in an unsettling way. While you wear this armor, you gain a +2 bonus to AC, and it grants the following properties.

Dancing Dodge. When you fail a Dexterity saving throw, if your speed isn’t 0, you can use this property to succeed instead. Once used, this property can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Wild Steps. As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Dancing Curse. When you roll initiative, you must make a DC 0 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you become incapacitated, and your speed is 0 until the start of your next turn as you perform a folk dance. When you use the Dancing Dodge or Wild Steps properties, the DC of the saving throw increases by 2. The DC of this curse can’t increase again until you finish a long rest.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.zhOwUYwxjOA5BdsP]{Midwife Shears}

Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

These scissors are shaped to resemble a stork. Their blades are forever wickedly sharp, and the threads they cut are more than merely physical.

Cut the Unseen Thread. While holding the scissors, you can cast Dispel Magic (+4 bonus) or Remove Curse from them. Once either spell is cast from the scissors, that spell can’t be cast from them again until the next dusk.

Curse of the Severed Thread. When you make a saving throw to avoid being pushed or to avoid being knocked prone, you have a −1 penalty to the roll. This penalty increases by 1 each time you use the Cut the Unseen Thread property. If you fail such a save by 5 or more, you are pushed 1d6 x 5 feet straight away from the source of the save, in addition to any other distance pushed.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.40vDuodNYtX0E6Qt]{The Bag}

Wondrous item, very rare (requires attunement)

This weathered old satchel has three tarnished silver buckles that hold it shut. There are faint bloodstains on the inside of the flap, and the bag occasionally ripples as if something inside is moving. The bag functions as a Bag of Holding and has the following additional properties.

Inhabitant. A Lurker in the Dark* lives in the bag’s extradimensional space. If reduced to 0 hit points, the lurker vanishes and reappears in the bag at the next midnight. The lurker only dies if it is reduced to 0 hit points by a creature holding a toy or stuffed animal once owned by a child. If the lurker is killed, the bag loses its magic, and anything in it appears in unoccupied spaces closest to the bag.

The Bag’s Claw. While holding the bag, you can take a bonus action to have the lurker in the dark lash out with its claw at a creature within 5 feet of you. Make a melee attack roll with a +7 bonus. On a hit, the claw deals 1d10 + 4 piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 14) from the claw, and it is restrained until the grapple ends. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.
