Scorpion Sting. You have a tail stinger you can use to make unarmed strikes using your Strength or Dexterity (your choice) for attack and damage rolls. On a hit, you deal 1d4 piercing damage, and you can deal an extra 1d6 poison damage. You can deal this extra damage a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain one expended use when you finish a short rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

When you reach 10th level, this extra damage increases to 2d6.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.VZLwJfAOM5EerE1Y]{Azureborn}

Azureborn (A-zher-born) are a harpy-like species native to Astramar, often materializing from the bright blue night sky filled with twinkling stars and winds of arcane power. Bearing a connection to the aither that courses through the air and land of the province, they are an inherently prescient folk that can divine the future by looking to the cosmos. They have built a society of magical wonder through grand vision, endless curiosity, and dedication to study.

Sprouting feathers across their entire body and wings attached to each of their arms, this diverse folk can resemble all manner of avian creatures, from raptors with earthy tones to tropical birds of vibrant and colorful plumage. They typically live 100 years, although many of the wisest among them have lived up to 400.

As an azureborn, you have these special traits.

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.

Size. You are Medium (about 4–7 feet tall).

Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

Azure Legacy. You know the Guidance cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Augury spell with this trait without requiring a material component. Once you cast Augury with this trait, you can’t cast it in that way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select this species).

Darkvision. You have darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Glimpse Fate. When you roll initiative, if you aren’t surprised, you can choose a number of creatures that you can see equal to your proficiency bonus. The targets have advantage on their initiative rolls. Once you use this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Winds of Magic. As a bonus action, you can take the Dash action and increase your flying speed by 10 feet until the end of the turn. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.DY1QQhG2ZQQu8TQg]{Bogborn}

Bogborn are a troll-like species native to Zulrogg, usually rising from the still, dark waters of the swampy province. From the moment of rebirth, they have a symbiotic relationship with flora and fauna of the wild—and often treacherous—mire. Their ability to survive is further enhanced by the naturally regenerative biology often found in trolls.

Towering over most, these hearty folk can face any trial of nature, and they often utilize their athleticism in pursuits of hunting and survival. Bearing prominent noses and tusks, their tough hides are generally shades of green or blue. Bogborn typically live 100 years before moving on to the spirit world.

As a bogborn, you have these special traits.

Creature Type. You are a Giant.

Size. You are Medium (about 7–8 feet tall).

Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet.

Bog Bulk. You have advantage on any ability check or saving throw you make to avoid or end the grappled condition. You also count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity.

Darkvision. You have darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Guiding Bond. As a bonus action, you can magically place a mark on a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. The mark lasts for 1 minute, and takes the form of ephemeral plants, moss, fungus, or swamp animals that only you can see. For the duration, you can add 1d4 to ability checks and attack rolls you make against the marked creature. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Keen Senses. You have proficiency in the Perception or Survival skill.

Regeneration. As a bonus action, you can expend one of your Hit Dice, roll the die, and regain a number of hit points equal to the number rolled plus your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 hit point).

If you take acid or fire damage, this trait doesn’t function until the end of your next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.ju10PyvXzlyTo1Vt]{Curseborn}

Curseborn are a werewolf-like species native to Edwardia, often emerging from the dense, cursed fog that rolls across the province. Sharing a strong connection to a malediction called the Grey, which demands balance at the threat of certain doom, they have managed to build a civilization of advancement and progress, countered by rampant strife, pollution, and hunger.

Covered head to toe with thick fur and bearing sharp teeth and claws, this lupine species evokes the hallmarks and appearance of wolves but with clearly humanoid physiology. If not brought to an early grave by the Grey, they typically live for up to 100 years, although technological advancement has led to certain individuals approaching 200 years old.

As a curseborn, you have these special traits.

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.

Size. You are Medium (about 5–6 feet tall).

Speed. Your walking speed is 35 feet.

Cursed Claws. You have claws you can use to make unarmed strikes, which deal 1d6 slashing damage on a hit. You can use Strength or Dexterity for attack and damage rolls with your claws.

When you hit a creature with your claws, you can curse the target until the start of your next turn. While cursed, the target emits wisps of fog and has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. You can curse a creature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Darkvision. You have darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Grey Balance. When you fail a saving throw, you can use your reaction to succeed instead. When you do, you have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of your next turn. Once you use this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

Lupine Sense. You have proficiency in the Investigation, Perception, or Survival skill.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.DoXAGx9Veo3ucvKG]{Deepborn}

Deepborn are a fish-like species native to Olmarsh, typically rising up from the abyssal depths of the province’s black sea—home to terrors beyond imagining known as the Hungry Ones. Immersed in a near constant eldritch presence that emerges from the deep and descends from beyond the stars, these folk manage their state of paranoia by embracing and harnessing the uncanny and cosmic.

While they are primarily piscine in their anatomy, they can possess features found in a wide variety of sea creatures, including cephalopods and crustaceans. They typically live for around 150 years, but certain members of occult orders have been known to live for 600 years.

As a deepborn, you have these special traits.

Creature Type. You are an Aberration.

Size. You are Medium (about 5–7 feet tall).

Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

Amphibious. You can breathe air and water.

Darkvision. You have darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Eldritch Gibbering. Thanks to your eldritch connection to the Hungering Ones, you speak Deep Speech. As an action, you can gibber in that language. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 plus your proficiency bonus and Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier; choose the ability when you select this species) or roll a d6 and consult the table below. The effect lasts until the start of your next turn. Once any target fails its save against this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.jfnBxPvu7a3nIcR9]{Eldritch Gibbering}

Endless Hunger. As a bonus action, you can embrace your connection to the Hungering Ones. Until the start of your next turn, you know the location of any creatures that aren’t Constructs or Undead within 60 feet of yourself, and your attack rolls against those creatures can’t have disadvantage. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.arj7V5bfslIIlXet]{Gnarlborn}

Gnarlborn (NAR-ull-born) are a tree-like species native to Ardengloom, usually sprouting up from the soil of the twisted, dark forest. Their home is forever haunted by the souls of long-dead fey, which inhabit the enormous, face-bearing trees known as Elderwoods. These folk commune with these beings to receive primordial wisdom.

Resembling gnarled trees with glowing faces hollowed into the bark, their individual patterns of branches, moss, and lichen can result in a wide diversity of appearances. Most gnarlborn live for over 500 years, but those with the strongest connection to the Elderwoods have been said to live to be thousands of years old.

As a gnarlborn, you have these special traits.

Creature Type. You are a Plant.

Size. You are Medium (about 5–8 feet tall).

Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet.

Deep Roots. You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws against being moved against your will or to avoid being knocked prone.

Elderwood Whispers. You can draw on the memory of the Elderwood spirits. When you finish a long rest, you gain proficiency with a skill, a tool, or learn one language of your choice until you next finish a long rest.

Grasping Branches. As a bonus action, you can magically unleash the binding power of the dark wood. Choose a Large or smaller creature within 30 feet of yourself. The creature must make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the target is restrained for 1 minute as branches appear and ensnare it. On a successful save, its speed is halved until the end of its next turn. A restrained creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The branches vanish when the condition ends.

Once you use this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Root Sense. As a bonus action, you gain tremorsense with a range of 60 feet for 10 minutes. Once you use this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Towering Size. You have advantage on any ability check you make to escape a grapple. You also count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.pSSJeZPmkwK1inAJ]{Graveborn}

Graveborn are a ghoul-like species native to Syndramas, typically rising from one of the countless graves that mark the frozen battlefields of the province. They were first created in a kingdom-wide ritual that twisted countless humans into new Undead creatures that barely resembled who they once were. Graveborn now wage war endlessly and perpetuate a culture of martial prowess, relentlessness, and grave honor. These people are infused with the necrotic and draconic essence of the powerful Drakkonite metal found throughout the province, which has given them a strange taste for spoiled flesh of any variety.

Appearing as the corpses of twisted Humanoids, graveborn have powerful snouts and jaws with elongated teeth and tongues that assist in the devouring of flesh and bone. Their physiology is sturdy, as if magically designed to be perfected for war. If not killed in war, as befalls many of their kind, they can live up to 300 years before decaying away.

As a graveborn, you have these special traits.

Creature Type. You are an Undead.

Size. You are Medium (about 4–6 feet tall).

Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet.

Darkvision. You have darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Devour Corpse. You can eat spoiled and rotten food as if it were fresh. Additionally, if you spend 1 minute eating flesh from the corpse of a Small or larger creature that isn’t a Construct, roll one of your Hit Dice without expending it (even if you have none remaining). You regain a number of hit points equal to the number rolled plus your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 hit point). Once you regain hit points using this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Frozen Waste. You have resistance to cold damage.

Infused Drakkonite. When you damage a creature, you can ignore any resistances it has, and it takes extra necrotic damage equal to your proficiency bonus. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.Sh45ETNwW08XFEMe]{Harvestborn}

Harvestborn are a scarecrow-like species native to Enoch, most often crafted with great care by Methuselah, the lord of the province. Infused with the vital, green magic that surges through the immensely fertile land, they have a strong connection to the cycle of both the harvest and life, death, and rebirth. They feed much of Druskenvald with the crops they grow in a relatively peaceful society that puts a focus on community, family, and fellowship.

As a constructed species resembling any manner of scarecrow, their bodies are comprised of a mixture of wood, metal, straw, and other implements. Their glowing-eyed heads might be made from a burlap sack or a crop such as a pumpkin or turnip. Staying true to the cycle, they generally live 100 years before accepting the next step of death and becoming reborn once more.

As a harvestborn, you have these special traits.

Creature Type. You are a Construct.

Size. You are Medium (about 4–7 feet tall).

Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet.

Culling. When you damage a creature with half its hit points or fewer, you can deal an extra 1d12 necrotic damage to it. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Gift of the Green. As a bonus action, you can touch the ground and choose a creature also touching the ground within 30 feet of yourself. That creature can expend and roll one Hit Die, and it regains a number of hit points equal to the number rolled plus your proficiency bonus.

You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain one expended use when you finish a short rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Jack-O-Lantern. You know the Dancing Lights cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it (choose the ability when you select this species).

Scarecrow Nature. You don’t require air, food, or drink.

Watchful Rest. You don’t need to sleep, and magic can’t put you to sleep. Moreover, you can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in an inactive, motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.3Bu23eDLgz0eiMJ2]{Plagueborn}

Plagueborn are a rat-like species native to Bubonia, typically coalescing in the pestilent haze that hangs over the province. They are deeply connected to the virulent and deadly plague that afflicts and shapes their society, which persists through cunning, ruthlessness, and the sheer will to live. They are the most adaptable species of Druskenvald, quickly discovering the means to survive even the harshest environments.

Appearing as large plague rats with humanoid physiology, their short fur ranges from grays and browns to various shades of green. They bear jagged teeth and claws that all carry a strain of plague to which they are immune but can prove deadly to others. Their nimble tails can vary greatly in length and thickness, often reflecting their family, clan, or guild. Plagueborn usually live no longer than 100 years.

As a plagueborn, you have these special traits.

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.

Size. You are Medium (about 4–6 feet tall) or Small (about 2–4 feet tall). You choose the size when you select this species.

Speed. 30 feet, climbing speed equal to your walking speed

Born in Filth. You have advantage on saving throws against diseases, or to avoid or end the poisoned condition on yourself.

Darkvision. You have darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Infected Cunning. The plague you carry binds you to rats and imparts their cunning. You gain proficiency in the Deception or Stealth skill.

Plague Bearer. When you hit a creature with an attack roll, you can magically spread your plague to the target. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus your Constitution modifier and proficiency bonus) or become afflicted with your plague for 1 minute.

While afflicted, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks and takes 1d4 poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the plague on itself on a success.

Once you use this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.b1wAihxhJ6mO05Ul]{Relicborn}

Relicborn are a skeleton-like species native to Kalero, generally emerging from the numerous tombs and crypts that line the canyon walls of the province. They thrive in a culture of celebration and remembrance, which infuses the very essence of every member of the species. Dancing between the energy of a vivacious party and the serenity of peaceful reflection, this folk holds a deep appreciation for both the living and the dead.

They appear as skeletons decorated with a wide array of vibrant colors, patterns, and styles, and their bones are encased in a translucent, glowing substance that provides them with a similar mass and shape to other Humanoid species, allowing them to comfortably wear clothing and armor. Some relicborn can even grow hair from their skulls, which is often shaped into bombastic styles.

Relicborn typically live for 250 years before losing their form and collapsing into a pile of bones

As a relicborn, you have these special traits.

Creature Type. You are an Undead.

Size. You are Medium (about 4–6 feet tall).

Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet.

Dance of Death. As a bonus action, you can make a DC 15 Charisma (musical instrument or Performance) check. If you succeed, the next attack roll you make before the end of your turn has advantage. If you succeed on the check by 5 or more, you can roll one of your Hit Dice (without expending it) and gain temporary hit points equal to the number rolled.

Eternal Party. You don’t need to sleep, and you can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours enjoying revelry, such as telling stories or playing music.

Moment of Remembrance. When another creature you can see within 30 feet of you fails an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to let the target add 1d4 to the total, potentially causing it to succeed. Once this trait changes a failed roll into a success, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Soul of Revelry. You gain proficiency in the Performance skill or with one kind of musical instrument.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.rR68oQF36mfdEPuT]{Silkborn}

Silkborn are a spider-like species native to Nerukhet, typically emerging from silken cocoons amidst thick webbing that fills miles of tunnels throughout the subterranean province. They have a deep kinship and connection with the bejeweled arachnids and insects that have assisted them in building the grandest civilization in Druskenvald. This folk also channels the great gems that fill the caverns of the province with light and power, bringing them ever closer to the gods that spared their kind from an ancient calamity.

While this species has humanoid proportions, they have arachnid features—hardened carapace skin, numerous eyes, segmented limbs that grow from their backs, and mandibles that sprout from their mouths. They generally live for 250 years, but those at the higher echelons of their civilizations have been known to live nearly 800 years.

As a silkborn, you have these special traits.

Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.

Size. You are Medium (about 5–6 feet tall).

Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

Bejeweled Carapace. When you are hit with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss. Once you use this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Darkvision. You have darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Silken Legacy. You know the Thaumaturgy cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Find Familiar spell (the familiar takes the form of a jeweled insect or arachnid) using this trait, and starting at 5th level, you can cast the Web spell using this trait, both without material components. Once you cast Find Familiar or Web with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select this species).

Spider Climb. You can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing an ability check and while leaving your hands free.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.RJjqZR595zUxPVlR]{Stoneborn}

Stoneborn are a gargoyle-like species native to Pholsense, usually meticulously carved by the lord of the province, Archbishop Danton Alexandre Renault. Blessed by the divine power known as the Silver Path, these people can call upon the godliness that suffuses their construction. In a domain of darkness, they have looked to the light of their god to build a civilization that attempts to uphold what is good and lawful at all costs.

Their stony skin matches the same hue and pattern as the stone they were carved from. While all of their kind have broad wings that carry their dense, heavy bodies, their biology can evoke a wide variety of creatures—including bats, fiends, dragons, birds, angels, dogs, and lizards—often combining features into a chimeric blend. They usually live for 300 years before crumbling into rubble.

As a stoneborn, you have these special traits.

Creature Type. You are a Construct.

Size. You are Medium (about 4–7 feet tall) or Small (about 3–4 feet tall). You choose the size when you select this species.

Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a flying speed equal to half your walking speed.

Argent Gleam. As a bonus action, you can channel a mote of the Silver Path’s light with your choice of one of the following options:

Path’s Grace. You cast the Bless spell, requiring no material components.

Zealous Charge. You take the Dash action. The first time you make an attack roll before the end of your turn, on a hit or miss, the target takes an extra 2d6 radiant damage.

Once you use this trait’s bonus action, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

Silver Bulwark. You can call upon the Silver Path to protect you. When you take bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, you can use your reaction to gain resistance to those three damage types until the start of your next turn. Once you use this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Watchful Senses. You gain proficiency in the Insight, Perception, or Survival skill.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.Ia4yu4YSihh18JyK]{Threadborn}

Threadborn are a doll-like species native to Picco, most often built with love by Blinski II, the master toymaker and lord of the province. In a land that is mostly fabricated and constructed to maximize the fun of all who live there, the essence of joy, thrill, and friendship are woven into a threadborn’s very nature. They cherish the bonds made between loved ones and always maintain a childlike wonder and whimsy, no matter one’s age.

As living dolls, these folk are constructed with a variety of materials, including cloth, wood, metal, porcelain, stuffing, yarn, and anything else a toy might be made of. With the most varied body shapes of all Druskenvald’s species, each threadborn represents a unique representation of fun. They usually live for 100 years before falling apart and needing to be rebuilt.

As a threadborn, you have these special traits.

Creature Type. You are a Construct. 

Size. You are Medium (about 4–7 feet tall) or Small (about 2–4 feet tall). You choose the size when you select this species. 

Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet.

Ball-Jointed. You can move through a space as narrow as 1 foot wide as if it were difficult terrain.

Innocent Mind. You have resistance to psychic damage.

Sewn Nature. You don’t require air, food, or drink.

Soothing Heart. You know the Guidance cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Sanctuary spell using this trait, and starting at 5th level, you can cast the Calm Emotions spell using this trait without a material component. Once you cast Sanctuary or Calm Emotions with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. When you cast Calm Emotions in this way, it can target creatures of any type. You can also cast either spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select this species).

You’ve Got a Friend. When a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself fails an ability check using a skill, you can use your reaction to cast Guidance on the creature, ignoring the spell’s normal range. The creature can add the spell’s 1d4 to its ability check, potentially causing it to succeed. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Chapter 12: The Crooked House.name: Chapter 12: The Crooked House
Chapter 12: The Crooked House.text:
第十二章

歪 屋

「有个歪汉，住在歪屋，
娶一歪妻，养俩歪儿，
买把歪斧，嘴上歪笑，
死人歪堆，鲜血歪淌。」

——柳沼村童谣——

阴郁的山丘上坐落着一栋扭曲的房屋，数十年来失于修缮，四周疯长的畸形植物几乎要将它扼杀。这座废弃的庄园，其怪诞的结构中没有一个直角，仿佛是献给歪曲女王的一座诡异丰碑。她的爪牙在此地横行，而邪恶的黄鼬鬼婆——维斯拉·褐牙——正是此地的主要腐化源头。她扭曲着困于这歪斜墙垣之中的生者与死者的灵魂。唯有诛杀黄鼬鬼婆，方能终结歪屋的恐怖传说。

章节背景

歪屋是凯琳的远古之力的幽祟具象，其被扭曲，并充满了恶毒的能量。它会扭曲所有居于其中的人，撕裂并腐化他们的灵魂，为献祭做准备。

受害者破碎的灵魂与苦难滋养着这栋房屋，每当一轮的折磨结束，宅邸便会悄然重构，静候下一位注定丧命此地的住客。往复循环之间，恐怖仪式永无止境——它化作了一个永恒的容器，承载着歪曲女王对祭品永不餍足的渴求。

这座浸透了过往鲜血的歪屋，如今被称为德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园，正准备将其恐怖降临到那对不幸的夫妇身上，他们现在正把这里当作家。歪曲女王的影响萦绕不散，她污秽的能量滋养着房屋，而其中备受折磨的怨灵也已将目光投向了新的猎物。

章节概要

随着无助的德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇被困其中，歪屋开始弯曲变形，显露出其扭曲、破败且鬼影重重的真实形态。歪曲者、维斯拉·褐牙以及屋内那些令人作呕的生物，正等待着新的灵魂成为祭品。被本章节稍后出现的任务引子吸引而来的角色们，有以下几个目标：

  • 初次遭遇歪曲者后，进入歪屋寻找菲利普与阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的踪迹。

  • 举行降灵仪式，与约瑟夫·帕特里尼的鬼魂沟通，他能为角色们指出阁楼里鬼婆的位置。

  • 调查房屋，直面其中的怨灵，从被屠戮的洛克伍德一家的鬼魂处集齐全部六件信物。

  • 找到通往阁楼的密门，并使用这些信物进入坩埚室（区域H17）。

  • 消灭黄鼬鬼婆维斯拉·褐牙。

在主持本章节前，先熟悉歪屋的历史以及洛克伍德一家的悲惨遭遇，这将有助于你即兴扮演各种幽灵遭遇，包括与约瑟夫·帕特里尼的降神会。通读歪屋的各个地点，能让你为角色们的调查做好准备，无论他们选择以何种顺序进行。

本章节为四名3级角色设计。

A Haunted History.name: A Haunted History
A Haunted History.text:
一段鬼魅萦绕的历史

七十年前，洛克伍德一家离开了熙攘的西里尔城（见第一章），踏上了那趟前往柳条沼地山谷的宿命般的马车之旅。尤斯塔斯·洛克伍德深信，他正带领家人前往一个宁静的山谷，那里没有都市的劳碌，大自然会将他们拥入怀抱。

他们的新宅邸阴森地盘踞在山丘之巅，俯瞰着山下的古朴村落。这座在旧宅废墟上由当地工匠重建的庄园虽显宏伟，却处处透着诡谲。工匠们谁也没有对建筑图纸上莫名出现的隐秘阁楼起疑心。而这个阁楼很快就被维斯拉·褐牙、她的邪恶魔宠小邋遢贾斯珀以及她那群扭曲的黄鼬所占据。

这栋房屋建于凯琳一处太古力量汇集之地的废墟之上，使其成为腐化和禁锢灵魂的绝佳居所，而所有这些灵魂都将成为扭曲女王的力量食粮。而如此精巧又扭曲的构造，也为这个鬼婆在岁月长河中折磨无数住户提供了充足的机会。

在一段短暂的时间里，洛克伍德一家生活美满。尤斯塔斯、他的妻子佩特妮娅、孩子莎莉和亚瑟，以及佩妮年迈的母亲科齐娅都享受着庄园那虚假的温馨。他们的仆人帕特里尼一家也分享着这份幸福，包括他们的儿子弗朗西斯——他与莎莉同龄，是她最好的朋友。

但这份喜悦转瞬即逝。疾病与噩梦悄然而至——这正是维斯拉恶毒妖术的杰作。无论是药物，还是柳沼村里最高明的治疗师，都无法对抗这愈演愈烈的腐化。被噩梦幻象苦苦折磨的尤斯塔斯最终陷入了疯狂，屠杀了他的家人和帕特里尼一家。弗朗西斯的尸体始终未被找到。

此后，一户又一户的家庭慕村庄的恬静而来。然而，故事的结局总是以悲剧告终。最终，当再也无人敢于返回时，这座被诅咒的庄园看似遭到了遗弃，归村庄所有。然而，无论庄园是否有人居住，那扇位于房屋最高处的圆形窗户，总会在女巫时分闪烁着诡异的光芒。

镇长温德尔·索默顿对这些恐怖一无所知，将这处地产赠予了德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇——这一举动是由镇上诡计多端的理发师兼医生兰德尔·格雷厄姆提议的。格雷厄姆深知此宅的邪恶本质，并渴望看到德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇被其吞噬，因此他试图将房屋的恶意释放在这些新住户身上。

The Weasel Hag.name: The Weasel Hag
The Weasel Hag.text:
黄鼬鬼婆

维斯拉驱使着无数栖息在墙缝间的扭曲黄鼬，而歪屋本身亦游荡着众多幽魂与怪物——它们皆因歪曲女王的巫蛊邪力而复苏。

维斯拉·褐牙

维斯拉·褐牙（@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.JPnvn6b8xrDKst5e]{黄鼬鬼婆}）是组成秽鸣集会（见第八章）的三位鬼婆中最年轻的一个。她和她的姐妹们一样，是来自凯琳统治之下的太古时代的歪曲妖精，并且随着岁月流逝而愈发歪曲。她以那些为集会赢得其名的污秽害兽为乐，尤其偏爱在歪屋墙壁间四处窜行、抓挠不休的黄鼬。

维斯拉是三姐妹中最矮小、最刻薄的一个，她的鼻子和牙齿一样又长又尖，更不用说她身上其他诸多令人嫌恶的特征，让她简直与她豢养驱使的那些黄鼬一模一样。

维斯拉的巫术专精于腐蚀与汲取凡人之魂，其具象化表现为可怖梦魇与幽灵幻象。她囤积的人类牙齿能增强这种力量，这些牙齿由她忠诚的黄鼬和她心爱的魔宠小邋遢贾斯珀收集而来。

最近，她在菲利普和阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇住进庄园后俘获了他们，并开始举行一个复杂的仪式，为献祭他们的灵魂做准备。她所不知道的是，真正的祭品正是维斯拉自己——这是她的姐妹葛洛柏和斯托诺佳所策划的，也是歪曲女王长远阴谋的一部分。

小邋遢贾斯珀

小邋遢贾斯珀（@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.HKOXEFjHbucrRayC]{害兽魔宠} （黄鼬））是一头令人憎恶的怪物，外形像黄鼬，但其特征却令人不安地酷似人类，还有一双模仿人手的诡异前爪。作为维斯拉梦魇魔法的造物，他对她言听计从，并率领着成群的黄鼬穿行于歪屋和柳沼村。

小邋遢贾斯珀与他的创造者一样邪恶，以人类的苦难为乐，尤其是孩童的痛苦。他热衷于为维斯拉的仪式收集人类牙齿，并十分享受亲手将牙齿从颅骨上掰扯下来的过程。

NPCs of the Crooked House.name: NPCs of the Crooked House
NPCs of the Crooked House.text:
歪屋中的NPC们

歪屋之中，潜藏着的远不止黄鼬和巫婆。将此地称为家的住户们横跨了数代，而他们中的许多都已是亡者之列。

歪曲者

第一位@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.0KmT8pNN6lQ0fjH3]{歪曲者}的起源早已湮没在鲜为人知的低语中，而他如今的形态，正是七十年前屠戮全家的那位家主——尤斯塔斯·洛克伍德——的扭曲灵魂。在那场血洗之后，尤斯塔斯在维斯拉·褐牙的怂恿下上吊自尽。她将他支离破碎的尸体硬生生塞进了屋下的狭窄夹层，并为此折断了他身上几乎每一根骨头。

自那受诅咒的夜晚起，他的灵魂便屈从于歪曲女王的意志，其魂灵也正如他那蜷曲的残骸一般扭曲。如今的尤斯塔斯化作一个身着褴褛西装的歪曲幽魂，在庄园里徘徊，其形态早已扭曲得面目全非。即便他离开这栋房屋，他与此地及女王之间的联系也从未断绝。每当有一个灵魂被歪屋吞噬，女王对柳沼幽谷的掌控便加深一分。

歪曲者的目的，便是将歪曲女王从她的牢笼中解放出来，并恢复她对德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的统治。作为她忠诚的爪牙，他如魅影般在柳沼幽谷游荡，协助秽鸣集会与旧途邪教的阴谋，只为一步步将女王的恶意彻底释放。

洛克伍德一家

在尤斯塔斯·洛克伍德的血腥暴行之后，他所谋害的家人的灵魂都被困于歪屋之中，至今未得解脱。尽管这些年来房屋吞噬了许多灵魂，但这六位洛克伍德家受害者的鬼魂，其显现的强度远超其他亡魂。

佩特妮娅·洛克伍德

作为尤斯塔斯·洛克伍德那位性情阴郁但克尽本分的妻子，佩特妮娅一直期盼着能搬到一个乡间社区。照料各式各样的植物才是她真正的热爱，尤其是她钟爱的佛手柑树。她将洛克伍德庄园视为享受丈夫财富的大好机会——这也是她嫁给他的唯一理由。

莎莉·洛克伍德

莎莉是尤斯塔斯和佩妮的第一个孩子，但她从未得到父母太多的关注。由于时常遭受噩梦的折磨，莎莉在年幼时便患上了各种恐惧与多疑之症。只有当她被自己的洋娃娃和其他玩具包围时，她才会感到安全。

在谋杀发生的当晚，莎莉设法逃出了歪屋，但最终还是在下山的小路上因伤势过重而死。她的灵魂最终转生成为现在被称为小壳的那条狗（见下文“小壳”）。

亚瑟·洛克伍德

亚瑟出生于西里尔，但他短暂生命的大部分时间都在柳条沼地村度过。他是个体弱多病的婴儿，但洛克伍德家聘请的所有医生都未能找出其根本病因。他时常啼哭，导致夜里的大部分时间都被独自留在育儿室里。

科齐娅·恩迪科特

科齐娅是佩妮年迈的母亲，她年纪轻轻就守了寡，之后便搬来与洛克伍德一家同住。她出身于一个富有而古怪的家庭，在漫长的一生中培养了许多爱好——画风景画、剥制动物标本以及饲养白化孔雀。她活跃的社交生活吸引了镇上许多怪人，他们都对旧途怀有强烈的敬畏之心。

约瑟夫·帕特里尼

约瑟夫出身于一个管家世家，对这份职业极为认真，因此他毫不犹豫地跟随雇主来到了柳沼村。他带来了他的妻子、儿子，以及他对音乐的热爱。尽管洛克伍德一家背弃了弗尔森斯的银辉路途信仰（见第一章），约瑟夫却从未动摇，他相信神明会在这片陌生新家园里庇佑着他。

盖尔·帕特里尼

与丈夫不同，盖尔并未在管家这份工作中找到太多乐趣，但她十分享受作为一位母亲。她从未信任过她的雇主，并觉得科齐娅那些古怪的爱好尤其令人不安。在她殒命的那一晚，她的直觉让她救下了儿子，她牺牲了自己，才让弗朗西斯得以幸存。

弗朗西斯·帕特里尼

弗朗西斯聪明、风趣、少年老成，是约瑟夫和盖尔·帕特里尼的独生子。他是莎莉·洛克伍德最好的朋友，他会试着拉这个天生胆怯的女孩一同进行小小的冒险，却屡试屡败。

他被母亲从疯狂杀戮的尤斯塔斯·洛克伍德手下救出，却因这次经历而受到了严重的精神创伤。他从此无法连贯地说话，过往人生的记忆也变得支离破碎，最终，他成了柳沼村里人尽皆知的“老锈”（见第十一章）。

詹金一家

詹金一家在德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇逗留期间担任管家，他们长期以来一直照料着柳沼上流人士的宅邸。三年前，索默顿镇长指派他们去旧洛克伍德庄园，这是一份夹杂着恐惧的荣誉。和村民们一样，他们也听说过关于这座被诅咒房子的低语传闻。尽管如此，他们还是搬了进去，为德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇的到来做准备。

沃尔特·詹金

沃尔特·詹金（守序中立，人类@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmCommoner000000]{平民}）是个英俊和蔼的人，但他在来到这里几周后就失去了声音。没有治疗师能解释这种突如其来的失语症。现在，他通过书写和手语来交流，他的家人也懂手语并能进行翻译。进入庄园让他感到紧张，他能感觉到庄园的恶意，但他对自己的恐惧闭口不言。

沃尔特以忠诚和尽职尽责著称，他对镇长温德尔·索默顿和其他前雇主怀有近乎虔诚的敬意。在这个新职位上，尽管才刚认识德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇，他就已经对他们忠心耿耿。

吉莉·詹金

吉莉·詹金（守序中立，人类@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmCommoner000000]{平民}）和沃尔特从小相识，彼此的爱意也同样长久。她不像丈夫那样对德鲁斯肯瓦尔德一家忠心；她更关心他们的女儿。十多年前他们初次受雇于索默顿镇长时，她正怀着丹妮，因此她对这个女孩过度保护。吉莉感觉到了柳沼村中存在的诡异力量，她担心女儿丹妮与这些力量有着某种强烈的联系。

丹妮·詹金

丹妮（绝对中立，人类非战斗@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmCommoner000000]{平民}）是在沃尔特和吉莉搬进镇长宅邸为索默顿镇长一家服务后的几周内出生的。如今她十岁了，能感知周围的幽灵和令人不安的力量，知晓着孩子不该知道的事情。虽然她还无法控制自己的能力，但她与旧途之力的联系正在增强。

小壳

小壳（中立善良，@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWolf0000000000]{狼}）是一只从未离开过丹妮身边的红毛狗，在被詹金一家收养前是一只流浪狗。詹金家并不知道，小壳是莎莉·洛克伍德的亡魂转世，而莎莉是歪屋的受害者，在临死之际逃脱了。小壳凶猛地守护着丹妮。如果角色中有任何人是邪恶阵营的，或者使用了任何与歪曲女王有关的超自然能力，只要他们靠近丹妮，小壳就会对他们咆哮。

小缕

庄园里的这只灰猫赢得了沃尔特的喜爱，却让丹妮感到恐惧。这只猫并非普通的猫，它是一只变形的@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.N6ttfwgb1ckMzfST]{窃语猫妖}，也是一只为维斯拉·褐牙效力的妖精。正是小缕偷走了沃尔特的声音，并在独处时对丹妮说话来折磨她。小壳厌恶小缕，因为它感知到了这只猫的真实本性，并时刻紧跟丹妮，保护她免受潜伏邪恶的侵害。如果窃语猫妖的真身被揭露并被杀死，沃尔特的说话能力就会恢复。

Quest Hooks.name: Quest Hooks
Quest Hooks.text:
任务引子

尽管从名义上讲，温德尔·索默顿镇长已将其改名为德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园，但柳沼村的所有村民仍习惯称其为歪屋。它是当地传说与疑云的具象化身，因此有许多理由值得去一探究竟。

与德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇共进晚餐

如果角色在抵达柳沼村后接受了菲利普·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的晚宴邀请，这对夫妇此时正等候着他们，准备享用由詹金一家烹制的丰盛佳肴。本章内容基于角色已跟随这一任务引子造访德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园。

鬼祟黄鼬

在探索柳沼村时，角色们会注意到镇上四处乱窜的黄鼬数量多得惊人，最终还会看到小邋遢贾斯珀抓着一颗人类牙齿匆忙溜走。理发师兼外科医生兰道尔·格雷厄姆会找上角色们，告诉他们，他曾目睹这些生物从他的店里偷走拔下的牙齿，然后窜上山坡跑向歪屋。他恳请角色们伸出援手，彻底根除这些成灾的祸害。

A Trip Up the Hill.name: A Trip Up the Hill
A Trip Up the Hill.text:
上山之行

当角色们离开村庄，朝西北方向前往坐落着德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园的山丘时，村里的广场管理员老锈找上了他们。朗读或转述以下内容：

一个头发灰红、乱如杂草，衣衫褴褛的老人跌跌撞撞地向你们冲来。他的眼神疯狂游移，伴着粗重的喘息，艰难地挤出几个字。

“死亡。毁灭。痛苦。歪曲者。歪屋。歪曲女王。他们在吃。他们在笑。每一步都在迎向他的归来。它的归来。她的归来。崩溃。毁灭。”

角色们可以尝试安抚老锈，但即便让他平静下来，他也无法提供任何有逻辑的信息。老锈的真实身份是弗朗西斯·帕特里尼。七十年前，当歪屋夺走他的家人时，他还只是个孩子，那场创伤性的经历彻底改变了他的一生。

了解更多

如果角色们试图深入了解关于歪屋及其历史的更多信息——无论是在此刻，还是在柳沼村的其他时间点——都不会有什么实质性的进展。绝大多数迷信的当地人都深恐招惹祸端，甚至不敢将此事宣之于口。

即便是那些以理性自居的新来者，也将关于凶宅的谈论斥为无稽之谈，不愿相信超自然力量竟然近在咫尺。

他们声称，虽然住在那里的某些家庭确实遭遇了厄运，但也可能只是把那里当作临时的度假居所，随后便搬离了。无论其名称和名声多么阴森可怖，他们都真心相信——或者说，希望——歪屋仅仅只是一座普通的房子。

旧途信众中最险恶的成员（见第8章和第11章）知晓那段真实的历史，并极力散布这座房子绝对安全的论调。他们需要这所房子吞噬尽可能多的灵魂，以加速歪曲女王的归来。

Meet the Jenkins.name: Meet the Jenkins
Meet the Jenkins.text:
遇见詹金一家

当角色们登上前往德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园的路时，朗读或转述以下内容：

山顶有一圈栅栏，大门敞开着，其后是一座维护良好的庄园，有池塘、两座谷仓和一座气派的三层庄园大宅，带有一圈环绕式门廊。

虽然状况并非完美，但它比村里的许多建筑都要大，维护得也更好。三个人从最近的谷仓里走出来，向你们挥手致意。

这些人是詹金一家：沃尔特、吉莉和丹妮。一只名叫小壳的红毛狗在丹妮身边。

与詹金一家的对话

詹金一家上前迎接角色们，因为他们知道德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇邀请了角色们共进晚餐。使用以下细节来引导对话。请记住，沃尔特·詹金不能说话，但他用手语与能翻译的妻子和女儿交流。当家人不在身边时，他会掏出口袋里的一本破旧小笔记本，通过书写来交流。

  • 詹金一家正准备进城去买些生活必需品和一本给丹妮的书——这可是难得的出门，因为他们在庄园里自己种植食物。

  • 这家子已经见过昨夜刚搬进来的德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇，但今夜还没见到菲利普和阿黛拉露面。

  • 他们对德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇的到来感到惊讶——他们原本不确定菲利普和阿黛拉是否会来造访——但很高兴终于见到了他们。

  • 詹金一家对柳沼村的村民，特别是索默顿镇长，抱有积极的看法。

对话结束后，詹金一家祝愿角色们在德鲁斯肯瓦尔德家做客愉快，然后穿过大门，沿着山路朝柳沼村走去。

他们刚一分开，那只灰猫小缕就从灌木丛中悠闲地踱步出来，盯着每个角色看了一秒钟，发出一声长长且带着嘲讽意味的“喵呜——”，然后走开了。

There Was a Crooked Man.name: There Was a Crooked Man
There Was a Crooked Man.text:
有个歪汉

当角色们靠近德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园主宅时，朗读或转述以下内容：

当你们走近那座巨大的庄园宅邸时，一阵恶心感猛地袭来。在你们眼前，这座建筑原本令人愉悦却又有些诡异的外观发生了变化。房子的外观变得阴暗斑驳，墙壁上长满了霉菌和腐烂的痕迹。墙壁、屋檐、窗户和屋顶的角度与线条扭曲成刺眼且违背常理的角度。这座房子仿佛只有在噩梦中才存在。

离房子最近的、井井有条的花园迅速长满了杂草和蓟花。几秒钟前还鲜艳盛开的花瓣瞬间枯萎凋落。这所房子现在显露出几十年破败失修的模样。

一个扭曲的身影凭空出现在门廊上向你们挥手。它大声喊道：“欢迎来到歪屋，朋友们。我们一直在等你们。”

当角色们走近时，向他们描述@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.0KmT8pNN6lQ0fjH3]{歪曲者}的模样：一个高瘦、细长、极度扭曲的人形。他的四肢以怪异的角度伸出，脖子像被绞死的尸体一样歪向一边。他身穿一套破烂的西装，戴着一顶遮住眼睛的弯顶礼帽，露出一张大得不可思议的笑脸，以及满口参差不齐的黄牙。

歪言曲语

如果角色们开始与歪曲者攀谈，则注意不要过早透露太多冒险情节。让暗示和伏笔以模糊且令人不安的方式展开。对于那些询问关于他信息的人，他可能会给出以下回答：

  • “我是谁并不重要。我是什么，需要你们去发现。我是你们的命运。你们也会变得歪曲。”

  • “菲利普和阿黛拉在里面等你们。他们正在熟悉这所房子。或者，更准确地说，这所房子正在熟悉他们。”

  • “菲利普、阿黛拉、你们，以及你们这一类人，都是这片曾经美丽的土地上的诅咒。你们将在血与火中回归你们的来处。”

  • “进去吧，享用我为你们准备的点心。菲利普和阿黛拉很快就会来陪你们。”

暂别……

如果角色试图以任何方式攻击歪曲者，他会唤起歪屋的力量并直接消失。否则，当歪曲者说完他想说的一切后，他会向角色们脱帽致意，做出一个嘲弄般的鞠躬，然后消失。仿佛是听到了号令，一声震耳欲聋的雷鸣撼动了房子，一场猛烈的风暴席卷而来。天空仿佛裂开了口子，暴雨倾盆，狂风呼啸。

歪曲者会在每一层楼至少向角色们出现一次（参见本章稍后的“一楼”、“二楼”和“三楼”部分），但无论角色们做什么，在他们调查歪屋的整个过程中，他都不会攻击他们。此外，你可以自行决定让他出现和消失，以在整章中维持紧张和恐惧的氛围。

The Crooked House Features.name: The Crooked House Features
The Crooked House Features.text:
歪屋特征

除非另有说明，否则歪屋具有以下特征：

天花板。天花板高10尺。

歪牙。歪屋里到处都是人类的牙齿，它们要么是从无数受害者口中撬下来的，要么是黄鼬从枕头底下偷来的。当生物在感知（察觉）或智力（调查）检定中失败时，即便他们原本可能什么都找不到，此刻也会发现一颗人类牙齿，无论他们正在寻找什么。

门。锁上的（DC15）或卡住的门（如区域描述中所注）可以通过执行操作动作进行一次成功的[[/check ATH DC 20]]检定来强行破开。

走廊。歪屋内的走廊宽5尺。

坚不可摧。歪屋的建筑结构和窗户对所有伤害免疫。

照明。房屋内部没有照明。区域描述是基于角色拥有光源或具备其他在黑暗中视物的手段这一前提。

信物。进入坩埚室（H17）所需的信物对所有伤害免疫。

立足不稳。极其歪曲的地板使得在屋内进行快速移动变得困难。除房屋原本的居住者外，任何执行疾走动作的生物都必须进行一次[[/save DEX DC 10]]豁免，豁免失败则直至该回合结束，整座房屋对其而言均视为困难地形。

窗户。窗户已被封死，无法通过任何手段打开。此外，窗户上的魔法会遮蔽屋内景象，从外面向内看时，只能看到一片漆黑。

The First Floor.name: The First Floor
The First Floor.text:
一 楼

歪屋的一楼是角色们初次遭遇庄园闹鬼事件的地方，也是他们开始发现曾发生在此处的恐怖事件的起点。

在客厅（区域H3）的降灵会结束后，@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.0KmT8pNN6lQ0fjH3]{歪曲者}会出现在走廊里，挥舞着一把斧头向角色们疯狂乱砍。然而，他的攻击永远不会命中。在大喊着“我把他们一个个砍倒了！”之后，他便消失了。

First Floor Locations.name: First Floor Locations
First Floor Locations.text:
一楼地点

以下是歪屋一楼的房间，对应地图12.1。

H1: Porch.name: H1: Porch
H1: Porch.text:
H1：门廊

一楼

一声震耳欲聋的雷鸣滚过古老的木梁，震得房子的骨架都在颤抖。闪电撕裂长空，劈落在距门廊仅几尺的地方，激得空气噼啪作响。狂风呼啸，暴雨如幕帘般无情抽打，似乎要把你们淋个透心凉。

门廊已无法提供庇护。这场风暴仿佛有了生命，从四面八方向你们扑来。无路可去之时，歪屋发出了召唤。前门自行吱呀开启，那低沉的呻吟既是邀请，也是警告，引诱你们入内一探究竟。

无处可逃。任何踏出门廊范围的生物都会受到[[/damage 1d6 lightning]]{3 (1d6)}闪电伤害和[[/damage 1d6 thunder]]{3 (1d6)}雷鸣伤害，并被传送回它试图离开时所在的门廊位置。

H2: Foyer.name: H2: Foyer
H2: Foyer.text:
H2：门厅

一楼

这座破败门厅的设计或许曾宏伟一时，如今却因数十年的荒废而陷于腐朽凋零之中。头顶上，一盏歪斜的枝形吊灯轻轻摇晃，将闪烁不定的阴影投射在碎裂地砖上，地砖一路延伸至三扇紧闭的大门。一道楼梯沿墙壁极不自然地扭曲向上，通往隐没于黑暗中的二楼回廊。满墙皆是画像——一个个家庭，栩栩如生却透着诡异，画中人双眼圆睁，满是恐惧，仿佛紧盯着你们的一举一动。

门厅的天花板高达20尺。

被诅咒的画作。这些画作让几个世纪以来在歪屋中被献祭的家庭成为了永恒。大多数名牌已经磨损脱落，但通过仔细观察，角色们可以从下面描述的几幅值得注意的肖像中揭开那段悲惨的历史。

洛克伍德一家。画像中的一家之主与歪曲者有着令人不安的相似之处。名牌虽经历风化，仍依稀可辨：尤斯塔斯·洛克伍德，其妻佩特妮娅，其女莎莉，幼子亚瑟，以及佩特妮娅体弱的母亲科齐娅。侍立一旁的是仆人——约瑟夫与盖尔·帕特里尼，以及他们的儿子弗朗西斯。

德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇。 这幅画像中的熟悉面孔被描绘在一种令人胆寒的光影下。虽然角色们尚不知情，但这幅画预示了德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇的厄运。阿黛拉一反常态地神情坚忍，戴着一条编织的柳条项圈，头发上别着鲜艳的红色和橙色花朵。菲利普正在哭泣，头戴一顶黑色的六尖王冠，右翻领上一枚新月别针闪闪发光。

角色们。最令人震惊的是最后一幅画像——画的正是角色们自己。画框中的他们咧嘴大笑，口中却空空如也，不见一颗牙齿，那空洞笑容正如不祥之兆，令人毛骨悚然。

维斯拉·褐牙诅咒了这些画像。检查画作的角色必须进行一次[[/save CHA DC 10]]豁免，豁免失败则受到[[/damage 1d6 psychic]]{3 (1d6)}心灵伤害并被诅咒。当受诅咒角色在D20检定中掷出1时，一伙@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.u5pKJAtHzkur3ciJ]{牙牙妖群}便会从墙壁裂缝或孔洞涌出，即刻发起攻击。直至完成一次短休或长休，该角色才能再次触发诅咒效应。此诅咒持续24小时，或直至角色离开歪屋。

H3: Parlor.name: H3: Parlor
H3: Parlor.text:
H3：客厅

一楼

当角色们进入客厅时，朗读或转述以下内容：

客厅里的家具软装曾经尽显优雅，如今却蒙着厚厚的灰尘。在布满蛛网的壁炉旁，一张圆桌上放着一块做工精湛的木制通灵板。板上放着一枚心形的小乩板，上面刻着缩写“A.D.”。

这块通灵板显然属于阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德，角色们可以用它来举行降灵会，从而获取解开歪屋谜团的关键信息。角色若成功进行[[/check ARC DC 10]]检定，便会知晓：要开始降灵会，必须有两名或两名以上的角色将手放在乩板上，并询问房间内是否有幽灵存在。

如果有两名或两名以上的角色同意使用通灵板，将会召唤出约瑟夫·帕特里尼的灵魂，他是70年前被尤斯塔斯·洛克伍德谋杀的仆人。壁炉里忽然燃起一团令人舒适的、噼啪作响的火焰，乩板随之移动到了“你好HELLO”的位置。

通灵板上印有数字、字母，以及“是YES”、“否NO”、“你好HELLO”和“再见GOODBYE”等单词。如果正在使用通灵板的角色提出问题，约瑟夫·帕特里尼的灵魂会尽其所能地回答。

他的记忆混乱不清，被岁月以及他所目睹的恐怖景象所蒙蔽。虽然他远非无所不知，但他对尤斯塔斯·洛克伍德疯狂杀戮的那晚却有着残酷而清晰的记忆。他知道阁楼里潜伏着那个鬼婆，也知道那六件受诅咒的信物可以打开她藏身的密室。

你可以决定提供哪些信息以及保留哪些信息，但如果问出了巧妙的问题，请务必奖励角色们有用的情报。利用这个机会提供线索、埋下伏笔，并加剧紧张感。以下是一些可能的问题和答案，可供你在主持游戏时参考：

你是谁？ 帕特里尼

菲利普和阿黛拉在这儿吗？ 是

他们在哪里？ 楼上

你是怎么死的？ 谋杀

谁杀了你？ 尤斯塔斯·洛克伍德

这是谁的责任？ 鬼婆

鬼婆在哪里？ 阁楼

我们怎么去阁楼？ 六件信物

信物是什么？ GEM KEY CUP DOLL BEAR PIN

它们在哪里？ 每一层楼

每次角色提问时，掷出一次[[/r 1d10]]。如果结果为1，所有正在使用通灵板的角色都会受到[[/damage 1d4 psychic]]{2 (1d4)}心灵伤害。第一次伤害掷骰之后，后续每次触发伤害时，伤害骰按如下顺序递增：[[/damage 1d6 psychic]]{1d6}，[[/damage 1d8 psychic]]{1d8}，[[/damage 1d10 psychic]]{1d10}，最高至[[/damage 1d12 psychic]]{1d12}。

随着降灵会接近尾声，帕特里尼会传达最后一条紧急讯息。这是你向角色揭示他们可能忽略的任何关键信息的机会。如果他们已经收集了所有必要的线索，帕特里尼的遗言将清晰得令人胆寒：“找到我的儿子他还活着FIND MY SON HE LIVES”。 这指的是柳沼村的广场管理员老锈（见第11章）。

乩板缓慢地自行拖动到“再见GOODBYE”的位置，壁炉里的火焰伴随着嘶嘶声熄灭，让房间陷入令人窒息的黑暗中。任何试图重启降灵会的尝试都只能得到冰冷死寂的回应。

信物。关于打破屏障以找到维斯拉·褐牙所需的六件信物的位置列表，已包含在区域H16中。

H4: Gallery.name: H4: Gallery
H4: Gallery.text:
H4：画廊

一楼

当角色们进入画廊时，朗读或转述以下内容：

这个圆形房间建在庄园塔楼的底部，里面布置着一个小型画廊。这里挂满了描绘广阔风景的画作，摆放着被遗忘的历史人物那神情阴郁的半身像，其说明牌因数十年的荒废而彻底褪色。这批藏品中最显眼的一件位于房间尽头的壁龛里。那是一座用风化大理石雕刻而成的、比实物还要巨大的白化孔雀雕像。它的一只眼窝空空如也，另一只则镶嵌着一颗暗红色的血石。

房间里的风景画都是科齐娅·恩迪科特在生命的最后一年里，受她在歪屋的梦境启发，狂热地绘制而成的。作为一个研究动作，角色可以检查画作并进行一次[[/check INV DC 15]]检定，检定成功便会发现她的签名，并且每幅画中都隐藏着模样怪诞的黄鼬、蜈蚣和鸽子。

当有生物试图取下血石时，孔雀雕像会活化并发起攻击（使用@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmBasilisk000000]{石化蜥蜴}的数据卡，但其生物类型为构装）。在每轮先攻值到20时，科齐娅扭曲的怨灵会出现并随机选择一名角色。该角色必须成功进行一次[[/save CHA DC 10]]豁免，豁免失败则会凭空消失，被吸入风景画中的半位面。身处风景画中期间，角色陷入失能状态，且无法被攻击、法术或其他效应选为目标。角色在其下一回合结束时，会被弹出画作，落在距离画作5尺范围内的未占据空间，并陷入倒地状态。当孔雀被击败时，它会崩解成碎片，科齐娅的阴魂也会伴随着令人不安的咯咯笑声消失。

宝藏。孔雀雕像那颗红色的血石宝石GEM眼睛是打破屏障进入阁楼所需的六件信物之一。

H5: Music Room.name: H5: Music Room
H5: Music Room.text:
H5：音乐室

一楼

房间中央的木制舞池周围散落着各式腐朽的乐器，地板因岁月侵蚀而发黑，被时光的无情之手撕裂出无数木刺。墙上挂着一面巨大的椭圆形镜子，其上长长的锯齿状裂缝将房间的倒影扭成怪诞的嘲弄；透过破碎的玻璃，一切都变得拉长、扭曲。在房间尽头矗立着一架大键琴，琴盖像一口打着哈欠的棺材般撑开；锈蚀的琴弦拉伸着，宛若某具被遗忘尸骸上脆弱的筋腱。发黄的象牙琴键暴露在外，缠满了蛛网。

当角色踏进舞池时，大键琴会开始弹奏一首刺耳且不协和旋律，声音回荡在歪屋的整个一楼。伴随着乐曲，镜中倒映出的房间，挤满了扭曲的幽灵舞者。这些都是多年来在歪屋中被献祭者的灵魂。

掷先攻！任何能听到音乐的生物都必须进行一次[[/save WIS DC 10]]豁免，豁免失败则陷入&reference[charmed apply=false]状态，持续1分钟。处于这种魅惑状态期间，生物必须在自己的回合内使用所有移动力，在原地疯狂乱舞，并受到[[/damage 1d6 psychic]]{3 (1d6)}心灵伤害。生物可以在其回合结束时重掷该豁免，豁免成功则终止自身该效应。如果一个生物连续以此方式跳舞三个回合，它将获得1级力竭。

黄鼬。掷先攻时，[[/r 3d4]]{7 (3d4)}只@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWeasel00000000]{鼬}会从墙里窜出来发起攻击，并异口同声地说道：“维斯拉·褐牙要献祭你们的灵魂！”

大键琴。大键琴对所有伤害免疫。要停止这刺耳的音乐，一名角色必须坐在大键琴前尝试弹奏一首不同的曲子。该角色必须进行一次DC 15 魅力（表演）检定。检定成功则音乐停止，由音乐引起的魅惑状态也会随之终止。如果该角色不熟练于任何类型的乐器，那么在约瑟夫·帕特里尼——那个角色们可以在客厅（区域H3）与之交流的善良灵魂——的协助下，他们会体验到一种能够弹奏这架大键琴的超自然能力。

当刺耳的旋律结束时，帕特里尼那闪烁着微光的蓝色精魂会出现在大键琴旁，弹奏一首忧郁的挽歌，伤感地吟唱着往昔的美好时光与洛克伍德家族的衰落。歌词如下：

我多么渴望，窗前重见那炉火暖光。
她曾那般温柔驱散长夜，让琥珀微芒盈满心房。
辉煌岁月渐已凋零，被夺走的时光，
唯余冰冷孤寂流淌。
死神尖啸，剔去枯骨生机；
这曾是家的地方，如今光芒已尽数消亡。
愿风起兮，引光入室；
愿生命归兮，重回我家园荡漾。

随后，帕特里尼的灵魂渐渐消散，一枚黑色的象牙琴键从大键琴中弹出，当啷一声落在地板上。

宝藏。这枚黑色的象牙大键琴琴键KEY是打破屏障进入阁楼所需的六件信物之一。

H6: Dining Room.name: H6: Dining Room
H6: Dining Room.text:
H6：餐厅

一楼

当角色们进入餐厅时，朗读或转述以下内容：

一张宏伟的餐桌占据了房间的中心，与周围那堆积着厚重灰尘、久无人问津的椅子、餐具柜和橱柜相比，它的表面干净得令人不安。

但最让人心里发毛的是摆在桌上的盛宴——闪闪发光的银盘里盛满了烤野猪、家禽、鱼和其他肉类，显得俗艳而铺张。煸炒蔬菜的盘子、浓香肉汁的碗盏与装着甜点的托盘，构成了这顿宴席的全部，香气袭人，完美得近乎虚假。空气中弥漫着盛宴的香味，但在诱人的美味之下，却暗藏着一种令人发怵的不祥之感，仿佛这顿饭在等待的不仅仅是被享用那么简单。

当角色们靠近餐桌时，食物和桌布会突然活过来，扭曲成散发着腐臭味的怪物和一条令人窒息的布料。一只@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmOchreJelly0000]{赭果冻} 和一张@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmAnimatedRugOfS]{活化闷人毯} 会攻击角色，直到它们被消灭。

暴怒盛宴。在先攻轮到20（先攻相同则视为后手）时，其中一样污秽的食物会向餐厅内的一名随机角色飞去，并发动一次远程攻击。在幻影盛宴表中掷骰，以确定是哪种食物或器具发起攻击。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.jGixzNosOjibbNlc]{幻影盛宴}

宝藏。作为一个搜索动作，角色可以翻找食物并进行一次[[/check PRC DC 10]]检定，检定成功便能发现一颗浑浊的@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgPearlOfPower0]{法力再生珍珠}和一枚价值[[/award 75gp]]的金戒指。

H7: Kitchen.name: H7: Kitchen
H7: Kitchen.text:
H7：厨房

一楼

厨房已彻底沦为废墟，地板上散落着破碎的陶片和锈迹斑斑的餐具。一架沉重的金属架倾塌下来，扯落墙上的大片灰泥，也压碎了底下的一张桌子。旁边，一座巨大的砖砌烤炉阴森地矗立着，其铁门被一把生锈的重锁紧紧锁住。

突然，一股焦肉的油腻恶臭弥漫在空气中，黑烟从炉门周围的缝隙里渗了出来。沉闷的尖叫声和疯狂的敲击声从里面传出，仿佛有什么东西——或者什么人——被困在里面。

这不是普通的火灾，而是被束缚在歪屋中的恶灵精心设计的残酷陷阱。那痛苦的声音引诱着角色采取行动，诱使他们去开锁或强行破门。一旦他们尝试这么做，陷阱就会被触发。铁门伴随着雷鸣般的巨响猛然炸开，露出里面尖叫着、燃烧着的灵魂。一股令人窒息且无情的灼热气浪和刺鼻浓烟瞬间淹没了厨房，被困的灵魂在空中尖啸着诉说它们的折磨。

厨房里的每个生物都必须进行一次[[/save CON DC 13]]豁免，豁免失败则受到[[/damage 1d6 fire]]{3 (1d6)}火焰伤害和[[/damage 1d6 acid]]{3 (1d6)}强酸伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。随后，燃烧的灵魂消失，烤炉也冷却了。

作为一个搜索动作，如果生物在互动前检查那把锁，则可以进行一次[[/check PRC DC 15]]检定，检定成功便能发现一个微弱发光的铭文。该铭文可以通过使用操作动作并进行一次成功的[[/check ARC DC 15]]检定来解除。检定失败且差值为5或更高时，则会触发陷阱。

H8: Conservatory.name: H8: Conservatory
H8: Conservatory.text:
H8：温室

一楼

雨点猛烈地敲击着温室的玻璃墙面与天顶，枯萎的藤蔓与干死的灌木密密匝匝，几乎占据了整个空间。几张长椅散落在这片残破之地，其中一张正对着一棵意外鲜活的树——其青绿的果实是这腐朽房间中唯一仍存的生命迹象。长椅上坐着一名面色苍白的女人，身着黑色丧服，颈间系着一条褪色的绿色丝带。她双手捧着一只精致的瓷茶杯，里面盛满了深色的液体，目光沉溺在遥远记忆之中。

这是佩特妮娅·洛克伍德显现的灵魂。她使用@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWight000000000]{尸妖}的数据卡，但阵营为中立，且仅拥有吸取生命动作。她怅然望着那株茁壮的佛手柑树——那是她生前亲手照料的树，其果实便是她手中茶水的风味来源。除非角色们说话或直接走近她，否则佩特妮娅不会注意到他们。

佩特妮娅支离破碎的记忆仅停留在她曾经熟知的生活上；对于降临在她家人身上的恐怖惨剧，她一无所知。歪曲者的扭曲本质、维斯拉·褐牙以及歪屋的原始力量，都超出了她的理解范围。角色们需要她的茶杯——一件珍贵的传家宝——作为打破屏障进入阁楼所需的六件信物之一，但佩特妮娅不会轻易交出它。

作为一个影响动作，角色可以通过一次成功的[[/check PER DC 15]]检定来说服她交出茶杯；如果角色利用她对孩子莎莉和亚瑟的爱来进行劝说，则该检定具有优势。若佩特妮娅交出了茶杯，她会恳求角色们去救救她的孩子，随后安详地消散在阴影中。如果角色们向佩特妮娅同时展示来自区域H10的木制洋娃娃和来自区域H13的蓝色泰迪熊，检定自动成功。

然而，如果角色们试图恐吓佩特妮娅或强行夺取茶杯，她的悲伤会扭曲成愤怒。她会发起攻击，将哀恸化为狂怒，试图把角色们也拖入她永恒的哀悼之中。

绿丝带。如果佩特妮娅的生命值降至0，或者有角色强行摘下它，她佩戴的绿丝带就会脱落。要强行摘下丝带，佩特妮娅必须处于受擒、失能或束缚状态，且角色必须执行操作动作并成功进行一次[[/check STR DC 15]]或[[/check DEX DC 15]]检定（由角色选择）。当丝带松开时，她的头颅会从身体上滚落，鲜血瞬间喷溅到整个房间。源自她的30尺光环区域内的生物都会被她的鲜血淋透，并且必须进行一次[[/save CON DC 13]]豁免，豁免失败则受到[[/damage 1d6 necrotic]]{3 (1d6)}暗蚀伤害。一旦头颅滚落，她便被摧毁并消散。

宝藏。佩特妮娅的@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.5lTSbAjGQrVWal9K]{绿丝带}都会落在地上，被留在原处。而那只白色瓷茶杯CUP，则是打破屏障进入阁楼所需的六件信物之一。

The Second Floor.name: The Second Floor
The Second Floor.text:
二 楼

二楼是角色们继续进行调查并收集信物的地方，唯有集齐这些物品，他们最终才能找到维斯拉·褐牙。

在探索完主卧（区域H12）后， @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.0KmT8pNN6lQ0fjH3]{歪曲者}会出现在走廊里，脖子上套着绞索，挂在天花板上晃荡。他的身体猛烈撞击着墙壁，震得整座房子都在颤抖，在消失前大喊道“我无法带着这罪恶苟活！”

Second Floor Locations.name: Second Floor Locations
Second Floor Locations.text:
二楼地点

以下是歪屋一楼的房间，对应地图12.2。可以通过门厅（区域H2）的楼梯到达此楼层。

H9: Sitting Room.name: H9: Sitting Room
H9: Sitting Room.text:
H9：起居室

二楼

这间正式的起居室越过开裂的木栏杆俯瞰着门厅，可以直视那盏歪斜且积满灰尘的吊灯。做工精细的家具如今已被蛛网笼罩，窗户两侧的架子上摆满了各式古董。一座古老的落地钟仍在滴答作响，全然无视这数十年的荒废。

当角色们开始调查这个房间时，钟表的指针会疯狂旋转，随后骤然停在12点的位置。钟声敲响，当第十二下钟声响起时，位于一楼或二楼的每名角色都必须进行一次[[/save INT DC 10]]豁免，豁免失败的角色会陷入&reference[frightened apply=false]状态，持续1分钟。以此方式陷入恐慌且身处起居室的角色，无法通过任何手段离开该房间。与此同时，一个浑身爬满正在撕咬的黄鼬、尖叫着的幽灵从钟里冲了出来。这伙@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.u5pKJAtHzkur3ciJ]{牙牙妖群}瞬间将幽灵吞噬殆尽，随即转而扑向角色们。

钟上的分针再次飞速转回12点。在先攻计数到20时，钟声敲响，示警即将发生之事。当第五下钟声敲响时，另一个被新的一伙牙牙妖群啃噬的幽灵也会出现。只要角色们还在房间里，钟声就会持续不断。

作为一个操作动作，角色可以使用盗贼工具并进行一次[[/check SLT DC 10]]检定，检定成功便能破坏钟表的齿轮。该钟表拥有AC15，HP5，且具有毒素和心灵伤害免疫。破坏齿轮或摧毁钟表均可阻止更多的幽灵和黄鼬出现。

宝藏。被吞噬的幽灵只留下一块价值[[/award 100gp]]的金怀表，背面刻着“铭记第三个Remember the Third”的字样。

H10: Children’s Room.name: H10: Children’s Room
H10: Children’s Room.text:
H10：儿童房

二楼

这间儿童卧室内，两张小床分列于一扇漆黑的窗户两侧。玩具随意散落在地板上。一只陈旧的大玩具箱靠在墙边，正对着一个儿童衣柜；角落里，壁橱的门微微敞开。

突然，一个小木偶从那一堆字母积木中爬了出来，它彩绘的面庞斑驳掉漆，毛线做的头发也已磨损散乱。它因恐惧而瑟瑟发抖，向你们举起细小的手臂，用轻柔而稚嫩的声音央求道：“求求你们！求求你们检查一下有没有怪物！”

这个洋娃娃寄宿着莎莉·洛克伍德的灵魂残片，尽管她曾成功逃脱并最终转世成了小壳，但这部分灵魂却被永远束缚在了歪屋。它极度恐惧那个它认为正伺机吞噬它的怪物。确实有一只@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.IUQV4JufNAkxzlqW]{暗影潜妖}藏匿在房间的阴影之中，必须将其消灭，莎莉的灵魂残片才能得到安抚。

潜妖可能藏身于六个地点之一。作为一个搜索动作，角色可以检查其中一个地点并进行一次[[/check PRC DC 15]]检定。若成功，则在潜伏之影表中掷骰。如果结果与正在检查的地点一致，角色便发现了潜妖，它会发起攻击直到被消灭。如果结果不匹配，则角色什么也没发现，但会听到从掷骰结果对应的位置传来刮擦声。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.6MD0TbD49MCv1CIK]{潜伏之影}

如果在窗外发现了潜妖，它会使用黑暗传送出现在发现它的角色身旁并开始战斗。如果在六次尝试内未能使其现身，潜妖会从天花板上对角色们发起突袭。一旦潜妖被消灭，木制洋娃娃会爬上左边的床，舒适地躺好，随即变回死物，其中的灵魂残片也随之安息。

宝藏。这个木制洋娃娃DOLL是打破屏障进入阁楼所需的六件信物之一。因让莎莉得到安息，角色们获得英雄激励。

作为一个研究动作，若角色查看壁橱并进行一次[[/check INV DC 15]]检定，检定成功便会注意到挂在积灰童装后面的一只挎包（@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.40vDuodNYtX0E6Qt]{挎包}）上有一只眼睛动了一下。第一个触碰这只挎包的角色会自动与其同调。如果该角色已同调了三件魔法物品，则必须选择结束其中一件的同调。

H11: Bathroom.name: H11: Bathroom
H11: Bathroom.text:
H11：浴室

二楼

这间浴室异常温热潮湿，弥漫的水蒸气几乎完全遮蔽了那破损的水槽和带兽爪底座的开裂浴缸。瓷砖墙面和地板上布满霉痕，散发着一股刺鼻的气味。

当角色们调查浴缸时，发现其内壁染着鲜红的污渍，鲜血开始从浴缸的排水口汩汩涌出。随着房间迅速被腐臭的血液填满，房门猛地关上并锁死。

血潮高涨。掷先攻！在先攻轮到20（先攻相同则视为后手）时，血位会急剧上升，并在第四轮完全填满房间。一旦房间被灌满，浴室里的每个生物都必须屏息，否则就会窒息。

排水口无法堵住，唯一的逃生之路就是原路返回。房门已锁（DC20）。开锁或破门会让污秽的血液喷涌地流向走廊，房间内的任何生物都会被冲到走廊上并陷入倒地状态。

黄鼬。掷先攻时，[[/r 3d4]]{7 (3d4)}只@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWeasel00000000]{鼬}会从墙里窜出来发起攻击，并异口同声地说道：“维斯拉·褐牙要喝干你们的血！”这些黄鼬不受血液的阻碍。

宝藏。一个黄鸭形状的木制洗澡玩具随血水冲了出来。它的作用相当于@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgFwpSilverRave]{异能塑像（白银渡鸦）}，但变出的是鸭子而非渡鸦。

H12: Master Bedroom.name: H12: Master Bedroom
H12: Master Bedroom.text:
H12：主卧

二楼

一张挂着破损帷幔的大床占据了房间的中心，周围摆放着一个歪斜的衣柜、几张坑坑洼洼的床头柜和一个裂开的梳妆台。房间尽头有一扇双开门，通往二楼的阳台。门边立着一张积灰的写字台，上面放着一本精美的黑色皮革日记本，封面饰有银色的浮雕首字母缩写“P.D.”。

在主卧大床那褪色的被单下，一个人形轮廓正在疯狂地蠕动，仿佛正陷于可怕的梦魇之中。

被单下的生物是维斯拉·褐牙的魔宠小邋遢贾斯珀（@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.HKOXEFjHbucrRayC]{害兽魔宠} （黄鼬）），它正和十二只@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWeasel00000000]{鼬}一起，钻在菲利普·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的一套西装里扭动翻滚。当被单被掀开，或者在此之前受到某种攻击时，它们就会发起攻击。贾斯珀和黄鼬们异口同声地喊道：“维斯拉·褐牙将活在你们的噩梦里！”数十颗人类牙齿散落在寝具各处。

当小邋遢贾斯珀浴血时，他会试图通过窗户、阳台门或墙上的洞逃离房间。如果他能跑到那里，就能轻易穿过去。

日记。菲利普·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的日记已上锁（DC10），或者可以通过执行操作动作轻易将其破坏。

阅读日记会揭示，菲利普自踏入柳沼幽谷的那一刻，便失去了他在德鲁斯肯瓦尔德其他地方所拥有的、作为死亡领主的恐怖力量。他对发生这种事的原因毫无头绪，且内心的恐惧感每晚都在加剧。阿黛拉曾恳求他在幽灯特快返程前离开柳沼幽谷，但菲利普说服了她留下来，希望两人能共同面对恐惧，最终变得更加坚强。

菲利普虽心存疑虑，但仍愿尝试揭开自己失去力量的原因。他还从詹金一家那里得知，柳沼幽谷的生活是多么危险致命，尤其是远离村庄的地方。他希望能帮助山谷里的居民，并挽回因长期忽视这个偏远行省而失去的信任。

你可以利用这个机会，加入任何你想传达的关于德鲁斯肯瓦尔德、菲利普与阿黛拉，以及新月王庭的额外信息（见第1章和第10章）。

阳台。通往二楼阳台的双开门已上锁（DC15）。

无处可逃。任何跳下或爬出阳台的角色都会受到[[/damage 1d6 lightning]]{3 (1d6)}闪电伤害外加[[/damage 1d6 thunder]]{3 (1d6)}雷鸣伤害，并被传送回阳台。

The Third Floor.name: The Third Floor
The Third Floor.text:
三 楼

三楼是角色们最终发现通往阁楼暗门的地方。

在探索完育儿室（区域H13）后， @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.0KmT8pNN6lQ0fjH3]{歪曲者}会出现在走廊里，身躯被诡异地折叠成近乎矩形的模样。伴随着一连串令人毛骨悚然的骨骼脆响，他在地板上拖行挪动，消失前嘶喊道 “她把我塞进了地基的裂缝里！”

Third Floor Locations.name: Third Floor Locations
Third Floor Locations.text:
三楼地点

以下是歪屋三楼的房间分布，如地图12.3所示。可以通过儿童房（区域H10）附近二楼大厅的楼梯到达此楼层。

H13: Nursery.name: H13: Nursery
H13: Nursery.text:
H13：育儿室

三楼

门吱呀开启的瞬间，一声婴儿的啼哭划破空气，尖锐而无情，疯狂撕扯着你们的神经。房内是一间陈设寻常的育儿室，然而中央那张红木婴儿床与摇篮上，却密密麻麻地布满了无数细小孔洞，令人触目惊心。摇篮剧烈摇晃，其间一个蠕动尖叫的婴儿闪烁着幽魅蓝光，那哭声让整个房间充斥着铺天盖地的恐惧。

这是被困于摇篮中的亚瑟·洛克伍德的灵魂，他幽魂般的身躯因痛苦而剧烈扭动。无论角色们如何尝试，亚瑟始终无法被抚慰——他的哭声永无休止，在空间中回荡，犹如沉重压抑的负担。唯有婴儿床里那只他心爱的蓝色泰迪熊，方能平复他的躁动。

毛绒玩具。当角色们调查婴儿床时，会发现四个破旧的毛绒玩具：一只黑色的山羊、一只长角的兔子和一只圆滚滚的乌鸦，它们都围着一只蓝色的泰迪熊。若其中任何一个被移动、触碰或受到干扰，山羊、兔子和乌鸦便会活化并发起攻击。这三个毛绒玩具使用@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmQuasit00000000]{小恶魔}的数据卡。被击败后，它们将变回死物，其上附身的恶灵亦会被驱散。

在先攻轮到20（先攻相同则视为后手）时，亚瑟的啼哭将响彻整座歪屋，所有生物都能听到。除房屋原本的居住者外，任何能听到哭声的生物都必须通过[[/save WIS DC 10]]豁免，否则陷入&reference[stunned apply=false]状态，直至其下一回合结束。

一旦亚瑟拿到了他的熊，作为一个影响动作，角色可以进行一次成功的[[/check PER DC 15]]检定来对他轻声安抚，或进行一次[[/check PRF DC 15]]检定来为他吟唱一首舒缓的摇篮曲。

当亚瑟终于止住哭泣，他会向成功安抚他的角色伸出双手，索求抱抱。一旦将这幽灵婴儿抱入怀中，他便会沉沉睡去，继而安详消散。

宝藏。这只蓝色泰迪熊BEAR是打破屏障进入阁楼所需的六件信物之一。角色们会帮助亚瑟安息而获得英雄激励。

H14: Library.name: H14: Library
H14: Library.text:
H14：图书馆

三楼

这座杂乱的图书馆里挤满了书架，架子上塞满了积满灰尘的厚重典籍，已被压得向下凹陷。地板上铺着一块脏污的地毯，上面也散落着更多的书籍。房间中央放着一张书桌，它一度十分坚固，但现在却有一辆挂满蛛网的酒水推车摇摇欲坠地倚靠在上面。

书桌上放着一摞歪斜的旧书，一只灰猫正蹲坐在这摞书的顶上，用它那对大大的金色眼眸观察着你们。它张开嘴，用一个男人的声音说道：“给我讲个故事吧。”

这只猫叫小缕，是詹金家收养的猫，但它的真实身份其实是一只变形而成的、混乱邪恶的@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.N6ttfwgb1ckMzfST]{窃语猫妖}。他说话的声音是窃取自沃尔特·詹金的，不过角色们无从得知这一点。很明显，他是个活物，而非鬼魂。

小缕是维斯拉·褐牙的手下，他希望能诱骗角色们将自己的故事写进一本书里，从而让这只窃语猫妖与他们的灵魂建立起一道联结。小缕会表现得和蔼可亲，并尽可能地撒谎，以此来怂恿角色们与他分享一个故事。一次成功的[[/check INS DC 15]]检定可以揭示出这只猫的邪恶意图。

如果角色们攻击、威胁小缕或对他表现出敌意，他就会变回自己的原形，并试图从窗户逃走——他可以毫不费力地穿过这扇窗户。

编个故事。只要角色成功进行一次[[/check PRF DC 10]]或[[/check HIS DC 10]]检定，小缕就会认为这个故事可以接受。每当有角色讲故事时，桌上的一本书就会自动翻开，书页上会自行浮现出文字和插图，其内容与角色分享的故事完全一致。当三本书被写满后，小缕会向角色们道谢，对他们眨眨眼，然后便消失不见。

在这只猫消失的同时，一阵奇妙的魔法之感笼罩了角色们。他们可以立即消耗生命骰，如同刚完成了一次短休一样，并且每枚消耗的生命骰都能获得+4的加值。

圈套。在小缕离开图书馆5分钟后，任何分享了故事并被记录在书里的角色都必须进行一次[[/save CHA DC 20]]豁免，豁免失败则陷入&reference[charmed apply=false]状态，持续1分钟。以这种方式被魅惑期间，该角色会在1分钟内用自己最强大的攻击或法术来攻击离他最近的生物。被魅惑的角色可以在其每个回合结束时进行一次[[/save CHA DC 10]]豁免，豁免成功则终止自身该效应。

宝藏。酒水推车上有四瓶是药用补剂（@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgPotionOfHeali]{治疗药水}）。

H15: Trophy Room.name: H15: Trophy Room
H15: Trophy Room.text:
H15：战利品陈列室

三楼

这座散发着霉腐气息的战利品陈列室里挤满了各式各样的动物标本——它们有的立在地板上，有的摆在桌子上，有的放在陈列柜里，还有的则被挂在墙壁上。这些标本中的每一个都透着一种令人恐惧的诡异感，它们的姿势很不自然，眼珠是巨大的玻璃球，皮毛也奇怪地鼓胀着。

这里就是通往秘密阁楼活板门的地方，那扇门隐藏在层层阴影之下，并被一道强大的魔法屏障封印着。如果角色们触碰活板门，这些动物标本就会开始保卫通往阁楼的入口。

秘密活板门。作为一个搜索动作，若角色成功进行一次[[/check PRC DC 10]]检定，便能发现隐藏在天花板上的活板门。活板门是向下打开的，打开后会放下一架通往区域H16的可折叠木梯。

当有角色触碰活板门时，朗读或转述以下内容：

毫无征兆地，你周围的动物标本开始抽搐扭动——嘶嘶作响、汪汪吠叫、凄厉嚎哭、拍打翅膀、短促尖叫——所有声音汇成了一片令人发狂的嘈杂噪音，仿佛要撕裂你的心智。在这片狂乱之中，你感到一股力量钻入你的心灵深处——而引发这场疯狂爆发的源头，正隐藏在这片狂舞的肢体与咆哮声中。

心灵咆哮。掷先攻！在先攻轮到20（先攻相同则视为后手）时，房间里的棕熊标本会发出一道心灵能量脉冲，每个角色都必须进行一次[[/save INT DC 10]]豁免，豁免失败则受到[[/damage 1 psychic]]{1}心灵伤害。

第二轮，豁免DC提升至[[/save INT DC 11]]{11}，伤害增至[[/damage 1d4 psychic]]{2 (1d4)}。第三轮，DC为[[/save INT DC 12]]{12}，伤害为[[/damage 1d6 psychic]]{3 (1d6)}。从第四轮开始，直至脉冲被阻止，豁免DC为[[/save INT DC 13]]{13}，伤害为[[/damage 1d8 psychic]]{4 (1d8)}。

角色们可以通过各种属性检定来找到并摧毁引发心灵脉冲的标本。总计成功进行三次检定即可让角色们定位到这股力量的焦点：位于房间东北角的棕熊标本。每成功一次检定，都能帮助角色们进一步缩小范围。检定的DC为14，但在一次成功的属性检定之后，再次使用同种检定的DC会增加3。

举个例子，如果第一个角色成功通过了一次DC14的感知（察觉）检定，那么下一次感知（察觉）检定的DC就变成了17，第三次则是DC20。但是，如果第二次尝试的检定是智力（奥秘）检定，那么DC就仍然只是14，而不是17。因此，将不同的策略结合起来，会比重复使用同一种策略更加有效。

你可以使用下列检定作为角色可能尝试的行动的参考——并灵活处理：

  • 感知（察觉），用来注意到哪个方位的噪音最大、动作最明显。

  • 智力（调查），用来辨别噪音和动作中的规律与方向。

  • 智力（奥秘），用来专注于奥秘能量及其最可能的源头。

  • 感知（洞悉或医药），可以观察房间里的其他角色，并根据他们所在的位置判断他们对脉冲的反应。

  • 像@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{侦测魔法}这样的法术无法找到确切的源头，但可以缩小搜寻焦点，并算作一次自动成功。同一种法术无法产生另一次成功。

在成功进行三次检定，或通过任何你认为有效的替代方案后，角色们便能找到那只棕熊标本。

黄鼬。掷先攻时，[[/r 3d4]]{7 (3d4)}只@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWeasel00000000]{鼬}会从墙里窜出来发起攻击，并异口同声地说道：“维斯拉·褐牙要吃尽你们的肉！”

内在灵魂。当角色们辨认出那只引发这一切的熊标本时，他们还会发现一个女人的脸正从熊标本歪斜口鼻下方的脖颈处露出来——她竟被缝在了标本里面。这是盖尔·帕特里尼的灵魂，她用自己的吼叫声加入了这场野兽的合唱。

作为一个操作动作，一个生物可以撕开这具熊标本，释放出其中的灵魂和大量的锯末。盖尔看起来很困惑，一言不发，但她会自行挣脱熊皮。然后，她从头发上取下一枚银发夹，将其刺入熊的鼻子，接着便伴随着一声困惑而又异常野性的咕哝声消失了。

宝藏。这枚银发夹hairpin是打破屏障进入阁楼所需的六件信物之一。

The Attic.name: The Attic
The Attic.text:
阁 楼

维斯拉·褐牙就住在这里，施行着她那邪恶的魔法。她抓住了菲利普和阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德，使他们昏睡不醒，备受狂热噩梦的煎熬。她一直在她的坩埚室（区域H17）中举行一场仪式，为献祭室内的菲利普和阿黛拉做准备。那些在墙壁间穿行的黄鼬已经将角色们的到来告知了她，而她也为他们设下了一个陷阱。

Attic Locations.name: Attic Locations
Attic Locations.text:
阁楼地点

以下是歪屋阁楼中的房间，如地图12.4所示。这一层可以通过战利品陈列室（区域H15）的活板门进入。

H16: Secret Landing.name: H16: Secret Landing
H16: Secret Landing.text:
H16：秘密平台

阁楼

梯子顶端的狭小空间沐浴在一片阴森的血红色光芒中，光芒由蚀刻在木制墙壁、地板和天花板上的符文印记投射而出。每一个标记都伴随着邪恶的能量而脉动，仿佛被某种古老而恶毒的力量赋予了生命。在活板门对面的墙上，一扇小门闪烁着同样诡异的光芒，那光芒如同无声而亵渎的邀请，引诱着人们进入其后那未知的黑暗。

这里是进入维斯拉的坩埚室（区域H17）之前的最后一间阁楼密室。这扇门及其所在的墙壁都被一道完全无法通过的魔法屏障所守护。

信物。检查这些符文的角色会发现，在符文印记中有六个空着的圆圈，其尺寸与角色们在歪屋各处收集到的六件信物完美契合：

宝石。科齐娅·恩迪科特的血石，在画廊（区域H4）找到的。

琴键。约瑟夫·帕特里尼的大键琴琴键，在音乐室（区域H5）找到的。

茶杯。佩特妮娅·洛克伍德的茶杯，在温室（区域H8）找到的。

玩偶。莎莉·洛克伍德的玩偶，在儿童房（区域H10）找到的。

玩具熊。亚瑟·洛克伍德的玩具熊，在育儿室（区域H13）找到的。

发夹。盖尔·帕特里尼的发夹，在战利品陈列室（区域H15）找到的。

当这六件信物被小心地放入发光的符文圆环内的空槽中时，房间里会充满一股不断升腾的奥术能量。空气中迸发出噼啪声，你们面前的屏障闪烁不定，仿佛在做最后的抵抗，最终伴随着一阵轻柔而诡异的嘶嘶声消散于无形。如今房门已然解锁，伴随着吱呀一声自行开启，露出一条黑暗的通道。

这条通道通往坩埚室——维斯拉·褐牙正在那里等候。最终的对决已迫在眉睫，她的气息早已弥漫在空气之中，召唤着角色们走向那场决定一切的最终决战。

H17: Cauldron Room.name: H17: Cauldron Room
H17: Cauldron Room.text:
H17：坩埚室

阁楼

这间秘密阁楼房间的地板上铺满了人类的牙齿，踩在脚下嘎吱作响。密室中央赫然立着一口巨大的坩埚，釜中翻滚的液体散发着阴森的红光，在墙壁上投下摇曳的暗影。菲利普和阿黛拉被绑在坩埚的两侧，瘫软在地，几乎不省人事，他们的手腕已被捆绑的绳索磨得血肉模糊。

在坩埚的另一边，一个披着斗篷的身影正摇摇晃晃，以一种奇怪而不稳定的姿态抽动着，仿佛她的关节无法正常弯曲。她背对着你们，对你们的到来浑然不觉。

坩埚发出了剧烈的汩汩声，里面污秽的红色脓液翻腾着溢出了釜边。每一滴溅落的脓液都在地板上发出嘶嘶的声响，像强酸一样腐蚀着木头，让空气中弥漫着一股恶臭。时间分秒流逝，鬼婆维斯拉·褐牙离完成她那亵渎的仪式仅有片刻之遥。

维斯拉·褐牙（@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.JPnvn6b8xrDKst5e]{黄鼬鬼婆}）就潜伏在这里，她已被自己宝贵的黄鼬们警告过，正伺机而动。那个披着斗篷的身影其实是阿黛拉，她正深陷于恐怖的噩梦幻象之中。她处于&reference[blinded apply=false]和&reference[incapacitated apply=false]状态，且移动速度为0。鬼婆维斯拉则变成了阿黛拉的模样，正躺在地板上假装昏迷。

作为一个搜索动作，位于假的阿黛拉或那个披着斗篷的身影10尺范围内的一名角色可以检查其中之一或两者，并进行一次[[/check INV DC 15]]或[[/check INS DC 15]]检定，检定成功便能识破这个诡计。

突袭！如果有角色在未能成功识破伪装的情况下接近了化作阿黛拉模样的维斯拉，那么鬼婆在发起攻击时就能对角色们发动突袭。在她首次用啃咬攻击命中一个尚未在本次战斗中行动过的生物时，她还能将该生物的头颅按进滚烫的坩埚之中。目标会额外受到[[/damage 1d10 acid]]{5 (1d10)}强酸伤害。

无论维斯拉是否成功突袭了角色们，一旦战斗开始，便朗读或转述以下内容：

这只像黄鼬一般的鬼婆发出嘶嘶的声响，猛地向前扑去，同时用尖利的声音尖啸道：“你们的灵魂也来当祭品吧！你们的下场，就是永生永世都在这歪屋里徘徊，不得安息！”

小邋遢贾斯珀。如果小邋遢贾斯珀（@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.HKOXEFjHbucrRayC]{害兽魔宠} （黄鼬））之前在区域H12逃脱了，那么这只魔宠现在会在这里协助它的主人战斗。他此前受到的任何伤害都依然存在。

命运塔罗占卜。如果在第9章的“命运塔罗占卜”中抽到了月亮牌，那么抽到这张牌的角色会在击败维斯拉·褐牙后获得三次命运逆转。每回合一次，当该角色能看见的一个生物进行d20检定时，该角色可以消耗一次命运逆转，将这次[[/r 1d20]]{d20}的掷骰结果替换为1或20。当三次逆转全部用尽后，这份恩惠便会消失。

等级提升。当角色们击败维斯拉·褐牙后，若他们仍为3级，则将提升至4级。

Conclusion: Haunted No More.name: Conclusion: Haunted No More
Conclusion: Haunted No More.text:
结局：
不再闹鬼

在角色们击败维斯拉·褐牙后，朗读或复述以下内容：

当维斯拉·褐牙咽下最后一口气时，她的眼中充满了恍然大悟，其中还夹杂着恐惧与狂怒。她轻声咕哝着“姐姐……”，随后便轰然坍缩，化为一堆人类的牙齿。

突然，歪屋开始摇晃并发出嘎吱声。伴随着木头断裂的可怕碎裂声和钉子松动的吱呀声，整座房屋呈现出一种新的形态——它依然有些歪斜，但远不像之前那般扭曲。多年失修的痕迹逐渐褪去，它如今的样貌已是一座配得上德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇的庄园宅邸。

鬼婆被击败后，菲利普和阿黛拉恢复了神智，他们对自己能幸存下来感到无比激动，并向角色们表达了感谢。他们只记得准备享用晚餐，然后便失去了意识，直到获救前都一直经历着恐怖的噩梦。

维斯拉在坩埚室里的大部分布置都随着房屋恢复原貌而消失了，但阁楼里留下的刮痕却揭示出：这个鬼婆只是秽鸣集会三姐妹的头一个。刮痕中还留有她姐妹的名字：斯托诺佳·黑刺和葛洛 柏·灰喉。数百枚的人类牙齿仍然散落在地板上。

尽管角色们在歪屋中目睹了种种恐怖，菲利普还是决定在柳沼村逗留期间住在这座宅邸里。菲利普满怀希望，认为一直折磨着他的诅咒如今将被解除。他付给每位角色[[/award 75gp]]以感谢他们的帮助。菲利普和阿黛拉坚持要角色们好好休息，并花些时间探索柳沼村。

当詹金一家回到德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园时，他们对所发生的一切感到惊骇不已，但同时也为闹鬼事件的终结而松了一口气。如果角色们提到在图书馆与小缕的相遇，这家人会觉得难以置信，而且从那以后他们再也找不到那只猫了。

重返柳沼村

回到村子里，一切如常，没有一个村民注意到德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园发生了任何异样。

歪曲者拜访了旧途信众中那些心怀不轨的成员，并告知他们最终计划已在进行中，歪曲女王的回归近在咫尺（见第8章）。这些秘密邪教徒会试图在镇上与角色们“不期而遇”，并想方设法博取他们的信任。

维斯拉·褐牙死后，曾居住在歪屋墙壁里的那些黄鼬四散奔逃，涌入了柳沼村。它们仍受其主人的灵魂影响，而那灵魂已被束缚在柳沼幽谷。人们可以发现它们在后巷和镇上的墙壁里乱窜，尤其喜欢在兰道尔的理发店周围徘徊，偷窃被拔掉的牙齿。

Chapter 16: Skitterdeep Mine.name: Chapter 16: Skitterdeep Mine
Chapter 16: Skitterdeep Mine.text:
Chapter 16:

Skitterdeep Mine

“I can’t go no further. It’s the mines. The hills ‘round here are snaked full of tunnels, and she’s down in there. I hear her. She was never ‘round these parts until the big cave-in ‘bout seventy years back. My pa used to tell me about it.

Fifty men got trapped down there, and from the twilight hour to the witching hour, the hills were full of her centipedes, big as hounds, all skittering down into that mine. Pa said there was some screaming down there for a while, then nothing. She’s a special kind of evil.”

- Mrs. Oakum -

A skittering infestation scrapes beneath the soil, burrowing ever deeper into the heart of Wickermoor Hollow and its people. From the depths of what was once Glitterdeep Mine, rich with veins of gold, silver, and iron, the contamination spreads. Seventy years ago, a suspicious cave-in occurred, and the few rescuers who returned spoke of terrors before they condemned the mine, leaving it abandoned.

Now called Skitterdeep Mine after its many-legged inhabitants, it is mentioned only in hushed tones, with wary glances over shoulders in fear of the crawling minions and the hag rumored to have brought ruin upon its darkened tunnels.

Chapter Background

A trio of ancient hags known as the Vermintoll Coven has long wrought their wicked magic upon the fields, forests, and villages of Wickermoor Hollow. Seventy years ago, the centipede hag Stonoga Blackstinger corrupted Skitterdeep Mine—a once thriving source of precious ores.

Using illusion, hearty food, and strong drink, she wormed her way into the miners’ trust. Then, she poisoned and twisted them all into grotesque abominations and collapsed the tunnels, trapping the wretched souls within. A cadre of knights attempted a rescue, but they too fell to Stonoga’s influence as she warped their flesh to create new minions.

Over the years, fear and superstition shrouded the Skitterdeep Mine. Travelers still vanish near its entrance, taken as material for her pestilent experiments. The infestation has now spread beyond the mine, skittering throughout the walls, beneath the earth, and within the bodies of Wickermoor Village.

Chapter Summary

Wickermoor Hollow is infested with countless centipedes that devour foodstuffs, spread disease, and even burrow into the bodies of the townsfolk. The source of the infestation is the centipede hag Stonoga Blackstinger, who seeks a new supply of human flesh for her twisted experiments deep within her abandoned mine. With each passing night, the vermin that have taken over town claim more victims and devour more food stores, threatening widespread death and famine. Characters drawn to the mine by the Quest Hooks later in this chapter have these goals:

  • Discover and trace the source of the tunneling vermin to Skitterdeep Mine, and face the horrors within.

  • Destroy Stonoga Blackstinger and end the Skitter Plague.

Before running this chapter, familiarize yourself with the centipede hag Stonoga Blackstinger, the key NPC. Review the Quest Hooks to provide a compelling reason for the characters to venture to the abandoned mine. Finally, read through the locations of Skitterdeep Mine so you are ready to improvise encounters as the characters explore.

This chapter is designed for four level 7 characters.

The Centipede Hag.name: The Centipede Hag
The Centipede Hag.text:
The Centipede Hag

Stonoga Blackstinger (stoh-NOH-guh) commands countless swarms of large, squirming centipedes that skitter throughout the mine. Hideously misshapen miners, knights, and other victims of her fleshcrafting also wander the tunnels and serve their maker without question.

Stonoga Blackstinger

Stonoga Blackstinger (@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.dNjGVwXYioTw7396]{Centipede Hag}*) is the middle sister of the Vermintoll Coven. Her unnaturally tall and lanky body has morphed over the years to more closely resemble the centipedes she favors, losing her nose and most of her toes and stretching her neck out by several feet.

Just as it was her sister Vessla’s role in the coven to twist souls in preparation for sacrifice to the Crooked Queen, Stonoga is tasked with corrupting bodies. She cares not for the matters of mind and spirit, as all life to her is simply meat to be molded beneath her jagged fingers. But despite this, she has a jovial disposition, taking glee in savoring the suffering of her victims.

Unlike her sisters, she prefers to hide away in the deepest, darkest holes in the earth where she can be embraced by the squirming swarms of her beloved centipedes. It is in these places that never see the light of the moon where she conducts her alchemy, witchcraft, and fleshcrafting.

Stonoga has been waiting for the night that her younger sister Vessla is slain, a moment foreseen and deemed a necessary sacrifice by her older sister Golub. The two older hags conspired to allow the weasel hag to be butchered in the Crooked House, but Stonoga has no idea that she herself was deceived. Golub Graygullet believed the middle sister needed to die too, as whispered by the Crooked Queen with the promise of being elevated within the inevitable crooked court of Kehlenn. Golub will aid the characters in hunting down Stonoga if she can.

Slippery Oswald

Slippery Oswald (@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.HKOXEFjHbucrRayC]{Vermin Familiar} (Centipede)*) is a rough approximation of a centipede the size of a hound, with grotesquely human-like hands at the end of each appendage and an unsettling human grin. The familiar of Stonoga Blackstinger, he shares his mistress’s glee in the horrid reshaping of flesh into new forms. He can command the squirming hordes of centipedes that crawl throughout Wickermoor Hollow.

Rather than being a collector of body parts like his weasel counterpart Filthy Jasper, Oswald prefers to create grotesque homes out of his master's victims. He burrows deep into Humanoid carcasses and rearranges the rotting innards to his liking, often lurking within for weeks at a time. Sometimes, he even digs into a healthy person to corrupt and prime their body for flesh shaping while they still live.

Quest Hooks.name: Quest Hooks
Quest Hooks.text:
Quest Hooks

Wickermoor Village is crawling with centipedes as a sudden illness rips through its people. The sick only have a few nights to live before succumbing to the affliction. A solution must be found before it’s too late.

Infestation

The village is infested with thousands of centipedes sent by Stonoga Blackstinger. These vermin consume food stores, burrow into the flesh of the living, and spread a magical contagion that afflicts those bitten by the creatures (see “Skitter Plague” below).

After the characters finish a long rest in Wickermoor Village, four @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.tJfa26b7QkIdtyhY]{Skitterswarms}* emerge from the walls and floor of wherever they are staying and attack. Creatures hit by the swarms’ attacks must succeed on a [[/save CON DC 15]] saving throw or be afflicted with Skitter Plague. Dozens of small mundane centipedes crawl throughout the floorboards as well.

When the characters step out into the streets of Wickermoor Village after dispatching the skitterswarms, many people are gathered here having fled their homes from centipede infestations. When asked about what’s going on, the plight is consistent across the townsfolk’s stories:

  • They awoke with dozens of centipedes crawling in their beds, many having been bitten.

  • Their stored food is infested with centipedes, and much of it has been eaten.

  • Some larger, more grotesque, and especially vicious centipedes have dug into certain people’s skin.

  • People quickly started falling ill, coming down with fever, breaking out into mauve-colored pustules, and vomiting black bile.

Over the next few hours, ten more villagers succumb to the unknown malady, all with similar stories. If nothing is done, the Skitter Plague will become an epidemic.

Skitter Plague

Magical Contagion

Skitter Plague was created by the hag Stonoga Blackstinger, and it spreads through the bites of her grotesque centipedes. A creature bitten by any kind of centipede under Stonoga’s control must succeed on a [[/save CON DC 12]] saving throw or suffer the following effects [[/r 1d4]] hours after infection:

Fever. The creature gains 1 &reference[exhaustion apply=false] level that can’t be removed until the contagion ends on the creature.

Crawling Blisters. Blisters that feel like crawling centipedes form on the creature’s skin. When the creature finishes a Long Rest, it takes [[/damage 1d4 necrotic]]{2 (1d4)} Necrotic damage, and its Hit Point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The creature dies if this effect reduces its Hit Point maximum to 0. The reduction can’t be removed until the contagion ends on the creature. A Humanoid that dies from this contagion explodes into a @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.tJfa26b7QkIdtyhY]{Skitterswarm}* at the next Midnight Hour, the corpse’s flesh and bones turning into a malleable putty-like substance that can be split apart and carried by centipedes back to Skitterdeep Mine.

Fighting the Plague. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration} spell suppresses the effect of the contagion for 24 hours. Nightly at the Twilight Hour, an infected creature makes a [[/save CON DC 15]] saving throw. After the creature succeeds on three of these saves, the contagion ends for it.

Trail of Corruption

The characters can investigate the town to find where the centipedes are coming from by succeeding on a group [[/check INV DC 15]] or [[/check SUR DC 15]] check, discovering a sprawling network of tiny tunnels in the earth that seem to be coming from the northwest of Wickermoor Village.

After deducing the direction from which the centipedes are burrowing into town, the characters are approached by Mrs. Oakum (see chapter 11), who works for Siv Harga at the butcher shop. She tells the characters that the centipede infestation perfectly matched stories that her father used to tell her about the old abandoned mine in the wooded hills northwest of Wickermoor Village. Use the details below to guide the conversation with her:

  • Her family used to live in a small community of hill-folk that worked in mining, logging, and trapping.

  • Decades ago, the old Glitterdeep Mine had a terrible cave-in that trapped dozens of miners within.

  • Thousands of huge, monstrous centipedes were seen skittering in the hills and into the mine.

  • A large rescue party was organized, but those who went into the mine never returned.

  • The rumor among the community was that it was a hag that caused the tragedy.

  • Swearing vengeance, a posse of riders was rallied to kill the hag and her minions, but they were never heard from again.

  • Fear of vile magic and the loss of work in the mine caused the community to dwindle.

  • Folks who know the old story have called the abandoned mine Skitterdeep for years.

Mrs. Oakum offers to guide the characters through the hills but says she won’t get too close to the mine, fearing the hag that lurks in the depths. If the characters accept her help, the journey to the mine is the ideal opportunity to have her true identity as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWerewolf000000]{Werewolf} be revealed through an inadvertent transformation, whether it be through danger that the characters experience or hunger triggered by a forest creature.

If the characters don’t take it upon themselves to investigate the mine, Morgan the apothecary (see chapter 11) requests their assistance. They stress that if nothing is done, the sickness will overwhelm the town, and there will not be enough healers to tend to the ill—made worse by the indifference of the de facto surgeon Randall Graham, who believes the situation will resolve itself without taking drastic action. If necessary, Morgan offers the characters a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgGreaterPotion]{Potion of Healing (greater)} each to find the cause of the sickness and eliminate it.

Characters who monitor the health of afflicted villagers over the course of the night, or Morgan the apothecary if the characters don’t think to, realize that the illness is likely fatal over the course of several nights.

Sisterly “Love”

If the characters are not in Wickermoor Village when you wish to initiate the events of this chapter, a carrier pigeon finds them wherever they are, delivering a letter from postmaster Theodora Mayville. She informs them of the town’s infestation and her own suspicion that the centipedes were coming from Skitterdeep Mine.

She claims that she sent out a rider, who normally delivers large parcels, to investigate the mine, but he never returned. Theodora implores the characters to head to the mine themselves and put an end to the infestation, offering [[/award 50gp]] to each character once the plague is halted.

This is a ruse by Golub Graygullet (see chapter 8) to lure the characters into finding and killing her sister Stonoga as a sacrifice in honor of the Crooked Queen. If the characters follow this quest hook, they are confronted by a lone @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.CgbJgAILFFyH25Oi]{Fleshdobbin}* when they are three miles out from the mine—the flesh-crafted parcel rider that Theodora had sent to his doom.

Skitterdeep Mine.name: Skitterdeep Mine
Skitterdeep Mine.text:
Skitterdeep Mine

Skitterdeep Mine is about 8 hours of travel away from the village at a fast pace through the wooded hills northwest of town. It once provided gold, silver, and iron for the people of Wickermoor Village, but has become a place of death and decay. When the characters arrive at the mine, read or paraphrase the following:

Old, weathered buildings sit beside a large hole dug into the earth, the darkness within an inky black. A wooden beam extends from one of the structures, which holds a heavy chain lowered into the abyss. Not far from the shaft, broken iron minecart rails lead to a lumber-reinforced tunnel entrance built into a wooden ridge. The stench of rotting meat and sweat hangs in the air.

Skitterdeep Mine Features.name: Skitterdeep Mine Features
Skitterdeep Mine Features.text:
Skitterdeep Mine Features

Unless otherwise noted, Skitterdeep Mine has the following features:

Ceilings. Ceilings are 10 feet high in mine shafts and tunnels, and 15 feet high in rooms and chambers.

Lighting. The mine’s interior locations are unlit unless otherwise noted.

Hag Mark. Stonoga has marked all the denizens of the mine (the mark is a cluster of blisters that resembles a centipede), which makes them immune to the Oppressive Gloom feature as well as the Putrid Miasma in areas S6.

Oppressive Gloom. Thanks to Stonoga’s magical tampering, all light sources have their radius halved. Furthermore, darkvision’s range is reduced to 15 feet. Stonoga and creatures she has marked can see normally.

Skitter Plague. When a creature in the mine is hit by an attack from a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGiantCentipede]{Giant Centipede} or @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.tJfa26b7QkIdtyhY]{Skitterswarm}*, it must succeed on a [[/save CON DC 12]] saving throw or be afflicted with Skitter Plague (see "Skitter Plague" above).

Skitterdeep Mine Locations.name: Skitterdeep Mine Locations
Skitterdeep Mine Locations.text:
Skitterdeep Mine Locations

The following locations are keyed to maps 16.1 through 16.5.

S1: Warehouse.name: S1: Warehouse
S1: Warehouse.text:
S1: Warehouse

A broken sign hangs on the door to the warehouse. The faded letters once read “Glitterdeep Mine,” but the first two letters have been painted over by a vandal, so it now reads “Skitterdeep Mine” in weathered writing. The door hangs mostly open in the frame, revealing a long aisle filled with damaged shelves and scattered rubble.

The room stinks of sweat and sewage, and a thin, greenish haze hangs in the air. You hear the sound of guttural snoring and wet lip smacking and see their source. Four humanoid figures sleep on sheets of rusted metal, horribly mutated and warped with distended bellies, mole-like claws, huge bulging eyes, and stringy wispy hair.

Broken shelves line the warehouse interior, and debris clutters nearly every possible space.

Debris. The warehouse is Difficult Terrain due to the great piles of detritus.

Creatures. There are four @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.tg7gMT759ls9CqOG]{Deepdreck}* asleep amidst the broken items here at any given time. These flesh-crafted abominations are what remain of the lost miners. Resting deepdrecks have no interest in fighting and will flee to warn Stonoga of intruders if awoken—though they will defend themselves if cornered.

Treasure. A character who spends 10 minutes searching the debris finds two trinkets lost in the rubble, and with a successful [[/check PRC DC 14]] check, also finds a metal lockbox. The lock is rusted through and can be opened with light effort. The box contains three citrines ([[/award 50gp]] each) and a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgGreaterPotion]{Potion of Healing (greater)} labeled “Emergency.”

S2: Machine Shop.name: S2: Machine Shop
S2: Machine Shop.text:
S2: Machine Shop

Areas S2a, S2b, and S2c are all part of one larger building. The following description is for the whole shop:

The smell of oxidized metal emanates from this rusted ramshackle building. Warped gaps in wall planks and molded holes in the roof seem to belch thin green gas. A heavy chain runs from inside the southern portion of the building to a scaffold over a mineshaft before it descends into darkness.

The chain runs from the Winch House (area S2c) and into the Main Shaft (area S3).

Doors. Each of the locked doors in this building can be unlocked with the iron key around the neck of the fleshdobbin on the lift in area S3.

S2a: Tool Storage.name: S2a: Tool Storage
S2a: Tool Storage.text:
S2a: Tool Storage

This room contains dozens of old mining implements and scattered refuse. Most of the visible floor is covered in smudged, filthy handprints, which have disrupted the dust and dirt that cling to every inch of this area.The mining implements here are mostly useless, ruined by decades of exposure.

Handprints. As a Search action, a character who examines the area and succeeds on a [[/check SUR DC 14]] check learns that the handprints lead to and from the door to the southern room (area S2b), as if a creature were walking on its hands. If the characters have already seen a fleshdobbin, they can easily deduce that more such creatures lurk in the next room.

South Door. The south door is locked (DC 15).

Treasure. As a Search action, a character who looks through the debris and succeeds on a [[/check PRC DC 20]] check finds a Maul, as well as a Dungeoneer’s Pack with a flask of Alchemist’s Fire and a flask of Oil strapped to the side. A character who spends 5 minutes thoroughly searching succeeds on the check automatically.

S2b: Fleshdobbin Lair.name: S2b: Fleshdobbin Lair
S2b: Fleshdobbin Lair.text:
S2b: Fleshdobbin Laie

This filthy room stinks of mold and stale sweat. Four piles of rubbish are draped in rotten blankets and old cloth. You hear a squelching whinny as two large abominable creatures stir. They have the silhouette of horses but seem to have the flesh and loose anatomy of humans. They hobble about the room on four limbs, drooling large drops of putrid saliva onto the stained floor.

The piles are fleshdobbin beds, covered with the horse blankets and rotten wine-red surcoats of the horses and knights these creatures once were.

Creatures. Two @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.CgbJgAILFFyH25Oi]{Fleshdobbins}* are presently inside the lair. They are Hostile to intruders and attack without hesitation.

Doors. Both doors here are locked (DC 15).

S2c: Winch House.name: S2c: Winch House
S2c: Winch House.text:
S2c: Winch house

The door leading into this room is locked (DC 15).

A heavy chain winds around a massive winch and runs out through a port in the wall. A control box with a lever stands next to the machinery.

A Small creature can wriggle through the chain port with a successful [[/check ACR DC 15]] check, and a Tiny creature can squeeze through the port without a check.

Winch. The controls for the winch are simple enough to operate, but doing so causes it to emit a loud groan and series of shrieks that alert all other creatures in the mine to the presence of intruders. For the next 2 hours, denizens of the mine are alert and watching. Stonoga, Slippery Oswald, and the deepdrecks attempt to hide and set ambushes during that time. Fleshdobbins can’t be bothered to hide, as they delight in brashness.

The winch can be disabled using @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbtulThievesToo]{Thieves' Tools} with a successful [[/check SLT DC 15]] check, and it has AC 17, HP10 , and Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage.

If the platform is brought up to the ground level, the creatures on the lift of the Main Shaft (see area S3) ride the platform up and investigate, attacking any intruders on sight.

As a Study action, a character who examines the winch and succeeds on a [[/check INV DC 14]] check realizes the danger of operating it, and that a flask of oil poured on the mechanism will prevent it from making noise.

S3: Main Shaft.name: S3: Main Shaft
S3: Main Shaft.text:
S3: Main Shaft

A rusted chain extends from a ramshackle building to a scaffold over a square mineshaft, then descends into the darkness. The hole in the earth belches a foul-smelling gas of a greenish hue.

The chain runs from the winch mechanism (area S2c) and suspends a lift platform. The shaft is a 15-foot square tunnel cut straight down into the rock. It drops 100 feet from the surface to the rough bottom just below area S6.

Chain. A creature can climb the chain with relative ease (no ability check required).

Creatures. One @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.CgbJgAILFFyH25Oi]{Fleshdobbin}*, two @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.tg7gMT759ls9CqOG]{Deepdrecks}*, and ten @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGiantCentipede]{Giant Centipedes} lurk on or around the lift.

Lift. The lift is 30 feet below the surface, at area S5. It’s a platform composed of a series of wooden planks bolted to the top of three iron beams, and it is controlled from the winch house (area S2c).

If more than 2,500 pounds of weight is placed on the lift and chain, the winch breaks and spins free, sending the lift, any creatures on it, and the chain hurtling to the bottom of the shaft. If the centipedes are on the lift, they scuttle off onto the walls of the shaft. If the lift falls, it is smashed into splinters and alerts the denizens of the mine as described in area S2c. The winch is destroyed and useless.

Any creatures on the lift when it falls also fall and take damage from the fall if they hit the bottom of the shaft.

Rotting Stench. Characters smell a noxious odor from below, radiating from area S6, where a Putrid Miasma has entirely consumed the tunnels.

Treasure. The fleshdobbin wears an iron key to the doors in the Machine Shop (area S2) on a leather cord around its neck.

S4: Old Drift.name: S4: Old Drift
S4: Old Drift.text:
S4: Old Drift

If the characters enter the Old Drift from the surface, read the following:

Overturned minecarts litter the entrance of this tunnel bored into the ridge. The timber scaffolding built around the opening is discolored, rotten, and termite-eaten. Vegetation has grown over much of the start of the drift that has been unused for some time. An especially foul stink wafts up from the tunnel.

This was once the main working drift of the mine long ago, before the terrible cave-in that doomed so many miners. An exit from the drift was cut as a secondary air source and access for minecarts. Stonoga and her minions haven’t bothered concealing the old entrance further.

Rotting Stench. An odor of decay lingers faintly throughout and wafts from the far entrance, radiating up from area S6 where Stonoga’s miasma has consumed the tunnels.

Creatures.
